statement: This gene encodes a protein kinase containing SH2 and SH3 (src homology) domains which has been shown to activate the RAS and JUN kinase signaling pathways and transform fibroblasts in a RAS-dependent fashion. It is a substrate of the BCR-ABL tyrosine kinase, plays a role in fibroblast transformation by BCR-ABL, and may be oncogenic.[provided by RefSeq, Jan 2009].
May mediate the transduction of intracellular signals

This gene encodes a protein kinase containing SH2 and SH3 (src homology) domains which has been shown to activate the RAS and JUN kinase signaling pathways and transform fibroblasts in a RAS-dependent fashion. It is a substrate of the BCR-ABL tyrosine kinase, plays a role in fibroblast transformation by BCR-ABL, and may be oncogenic.[provided by RefSeq, Jan 2009].
Oncogene
CRKL

This gene is a member of the BORIS + CTCF gene family and encodes a transcriptional regulator protein with 11 highly conserved zinc finger (ZF) domains. This nuclear protein is able to use different combinations of the ZF domains to bind different DNA target sequences and proteins. Depending upon the context of the site, the protein can bind a histone acetyltransferase (HAT)-containing complex and function as a transcriptional activator or bind a histone deacetylase (HDAC)-containing complex and function as a transcriptional repressor. If the protein is bound to a transcriptional insulator element, it can block communication between enhancers and upstream promoters, thereby regulating imprinted expression. Mutations in this gene have been associated with invasive breast cancers, prostate cancers, and Wilms' tumors. Alternatively spliced transcript variants encoding different isoforms have been found for this gene. [provided by RefSeq, Jul 2010].

CDKN2C, cyclin-dependent kinase 4 inhibitor 2C, interacts with CDK6 and CDK4, and inhibits cell growth and proliferation with a correlated dependence on endogenous RB1 (PMID: 19147556). CDKN2C loss has been observed in sporadic medullary thyroid carcinoma patients with decreased survival (PMID: 27610696, PMID: 31648931) and decreased expression has been observed in acute promyelocytic leukemia (PMID: 27888400).

AKT3, AKT serine/threonine kinase 3, is a serine-threonine protein kinase, has restricted tissue distribution being most highly expressed in the brain and testes (PMID: 21620960). AKT3 regulates cell proliferation and survival through PI3K signaling (PMID: 18955974).

APC, adenomatous polyposis coli, is a tumor suppressor that is generally localized within the cytoplasm of healthy cells  (PMID: 30562755). APC is a multi-domain protein regulating numerous cellular functions through interaction with beta-catenin and subsequent inhibition of Wnt signalling (PMID: 10959075).

ATP11B (ATPase Phospholipid Transporting 11B (Putative)) is a P-type ATPase and is a preferential translocate phosphatidylserine of cell membrane (PMID: 28674800). ATPases are known to drive uphill transport of ions across cellular membranes (PMID: 19265666). Several subfamilies of P-type ATPases have been identified. One subfamily transports heavy metal ions, such as Cu(2+) or Cd(2+). Another subfamily transports non-heavy metal ions, such as H(+), Na(+), K(+), or Ca(+). A third subfamily transports amphipaths, such as phosphatidylserine.[supplied by OMIM, Feb 2005].

KIT, mast/stem cell growth factor receptor Kit, is a receptor tyrosine kinase (RTK) that binds the stem cell factor (SCF) ligand and triggers autophosphorylation and dimerization of KIT (PMID: 23181448). Upon activation, downstream signalling by PI3K, JAK/STAT, and MAPK pathways promote cell survival and proliferation (PMID: 23181448, PMID: 29704617).

ARID1B, AT-rich interactive domain-containing protein 1B, is a member of the SWI/SNF chromatin remodeling complex and is involved in cell-cycle activation (PMID: 15170388). ARID1B has shown to rescue ARID1A mediated transcription and plays a role in neurodevelopment (PMID: 25674384; PMID: 31731647)

SMAD4, mothers against decapentaplegic homolog 4, is a tumor suppressor gene (PMID: 30562755) that translocates to the nucleus upon TGF-beta signaling to form a protein complex that regulates gene transcription and cell growth (PMID: 28452926; PMID: 11074002).
Tumor Suppressor

ERBB2 (HER2), erb-b2 receptor tyrosine kinase 2, is an EGFR receptor tyrosine kinase family and an oncogene through heterodimerization with other EGFR family members (PMID: 29209536). ERBB2 activates PI3K-AKT-mTOR and RAS-RAF-MEK-ERK pathways, therefore regulating growth and transformation (PMID: 17471238).

PIK3CD, phosphatidylinositol 4,5-bisphosphate 3-kinase catalytic subunit delta isoform, is predominantly expressed in leukocytes and regulates leukocyte proliferation and differentiation (PMID: 23330955).

DOT1L, DOT1-like histone H3K79 methyltransferase, mediates histone H3 methylation at lysine 79, a methylation state associated with active gene transcription, and is associated with pathogenesis of mixed lineage leukemia (MLL)-rearranged leukemia (PMID: 24854991). DOT1L amplification and increased protein expression has been reported in pancreatic adenocarcinoma (PMID: 28529740).

CDK9, cyclin-dependent kinase 9, interacts with cyclin-T1 (CCNT1) to form the positive transcription elongation factor B (P-TEFb) complex, which regulates transcription and mRNA processing (PMID: 28722178). Overexpression of Cdk9 in osteosarcoma correlates with poor prognosis (PMID: 30579871) and may also play a role in mTOR driven acute myeloid leukemia (PMID: 30587525) and AKT2 driven cervical cancer (PMID: 30536701).

Catalytic subunit of the oligosaccharyl transferase (OST) complex that catalyzes the initial transfer of a defined glycan (Glc(3)Man(9)GlcNAc(2) in eukaryotes) from the lipid carrier dolichol-pyrophosphate to an asparagine residue within an Asn-X-Ser/Thr consensus motif in nascent polypeptide chains, the first step in protein N-glycosylation. N-glycosylation occurs cotranslationally and the complex associates with the Sec61 complex at the channel-forming translocon complex that mediates protein translocation across the endoplasmic reticulum (ER). All subunits are required for a maximal enzyme activity. This subunit contains the active site and the acceptor peptide and donor lipid-linked oligosaccharide (LLO) binding pockets (By similarity). STT3A is present in the majority of OST complexes and mediates cotranslational N-glycosylation of most sites on target proteins, while STT3B-containing complexes are required for efficient post-translational glycosylation and mediate glycosylation of sites that have been skipped by STT3A (PubMed:19167329)

FAM175A, Abraxas 1, BRCA1 A Complex Subunit that binds BRCA1 forming a complex with with BACH1 and CTIP. Abraxas recruits ibiquitin interacting motif (UIM) containing Rap80 , both of which are required for DNA damage resistance (PMID: 17525340; PMID:17643122).
CD79B, CD79b molecule, encodes for a membrane protein forms a heterodimer with CD79a and IgM to form the B-cell receptor complex (BCR), which once formed, induces B cell activation (PMID: 24146823).

HIST1H1C, or H1.2 linker histone, that is a member of the lysine-rich proteins that associate with DNA that enters and exits the nucleosome (PMID: 15911621) H1.2 is the most abundant nuclear histone in most cell types, and has shown an important role for the induction of apoptosis following DNA double-strand breaks (PMID: 15911621; PMID: 14505568)
AURKA, Aurora kinase A, is part of the aurora serine-threonine kinase family and plays a role in mitosis (PMID: 22864622).

BRCA1, BRCA1 DNA repair associated, is a tumor suppressor gene (PMID: 30562755) involved in the DNA damage response and DNA repair (PMID: 21203981). BRCA1 is recruited to DNA damaged sites and forms a nuclear foci where it is essential for triggering DNA-damage induced cell cycle activation where it can promote DNA damage repair by arresting the cell cycle (PMID: 30562755; PMID: 21203981).

KDM5A, lysine demethylase 5A, is a Jumonji domain histone demethylase, transcriptional repressor, and epigenetic modifier (PMID: 29602065), that regulates gene transcription through chromatin remodeling to promote cell growth and differentiation (PMID: 30650517). KDM5A overexpression has been reported in a number of cancers including breast cancer (PMID: 22937203) and decreased expression may be prognostic for glioma (PMID: 29324315).

CCNJ, cyclin-J, is a putative regulator of the cell-cycle (PMID: 25672416). CCNJ promoter hypermethylation and subsequent decreased expression have been associated with worse overall survival in hepatocellular carcinoma (PMID: 25672416).

AURKB, aurora B kinase, is a serine-threonine protein kinase, which plays a role in the separation of daughter chromatids during cell division. AURKB also has functions in regulation of genomic stability (PMID: 28095398).

STK11, serine/threonine kinase 11, is a tumor suppressor (PMID: 30562755) involved in cell metabolism, growth, polarity. STK11 phosphorylates AMP-activated protein kinase (AMPK) which results in a negative regulation of cancer cell proliferation and metabolism (PMID: 26398719; PMID: 21892142).

BRAF, serine/threonine-protein kinase B-raf, is a member of the Raf family of serine/threonine protein kinases, which signals through the MAP kinase pathway to regulate cell proliferation and cell growth (PMID: 24737949, PMID: 29540830). When mutated, BRAF can act as an oncogene and also confer drug resistance (PMID: 27478040).

PTCH1, patched 1, is a main target gene for the Hh signaling pathway (PMID: 29274272). PTCH1 is a multi-drug transporter that contributes to chemotherapy resistance by effluxing chemotherapeutic agents (PMID: 30110910).

BCL10, BCL10 immune signaling adaptor, acts to link CARD and MALT1 proteins during immune responses, playing a critical role in the activation of nuclear factor-kappaB (NF-kappaB) (PMID: 30022982, PMID: 30814996). Additionally, the BCL10-CARD-MALT complex activates T-regs and controls conversion to effector T-regs through the NF-κB activation (PMID: 31138793).

BCOR, BCL6 corepressor, functions with B-cell CLL/lymphoma 6 (BCL6) as a transcriptional silencer (PMID: 10898795, PMID: 16943429) and also suppresses MLLT3 (AF9) transcriptional activity (PMID: 12776190). BCOR transciptional silencing is mediated through epigenetic modifications and is involved in the specification of cell differentiation and body structure development (PMID: 31150281, PMID: 16943429).

CDC73, cell division cycle 73, also know as parafibromin, is a tumor supressor and is a component of the polymerase II associated factor (PAF) complex and functions in the regulation of gene expression (PMID: 29621547). CDC73 is involved in both transcriptional and post-transcriptional pathways, and overexpression of CDC73 has been shown to inhibit cellular proliferation and induce cell cycle arrest in G1 phase (PMID: 16989776; PMID: 29621547).

CDK8, cyclin dependent kinase 8, encodes for a member of the mediator complex that binds cyclin-C (CCNC) to regulate gene expression (PMID: 24043446, PMID: 32071145, PMID: 31248103). CDK8 can both repress and activate gene transcription, modulate transcriptional elongation, and directly interact with transcription factors to regulate signaling pathways such as NOTCH, TGF-β, and STAT signalling pathways (PMID: 31248103).

CDKN2B (p15), cyclin-dependent kinase 4 inhibitor B, regulates G1-S phase cell cycle arrest via specific inhibition of CDK4 and CDK6 kinases to function as a cell growth regulator and tumor suppressor (PMID: 27030077; PMID: 29420051).

CDKN2C (p18), cyclin-dependent kinase 4 inhibitor 2C, interacts with CDK6 and CDK4, and inhibits cell growth and proliferation with a correlated dependence on endogenous retinoblastoma protein (RB1)(PMID: 19147556).

CUX1, cut like homeobox 1, is a transcription factor required for cell motility (PMID: 22306263) and plays a role in cell cycle progression, cell proliferation, and DNA repair (PMID: 28147323). CUX1 fusions with BRAF have been observed in solid tumors (PMID: 25190083, PMID: 26314551), with FGFR1 in hematological tumors (PMID: 21330321), and with ALK in NSCLC (PMID: 30010043), and altered Cux1 expression may play a role in castrate resistant prostate cancer (PMID: 32180898).

EIF1AX, eukaryotic translation initiation factor 1A X-linked, encodes a protein that stimulates 43S ternary complex formation, which initiates protein translation (PMID: 24499181). EIF1AX is essential for cell proliferation and involved in cell cycle progression by supporting the G2/M phase of the cell cycle (PMID: 30420357).

The androgen receptor gene is more than 90 kb long and codes for a protein that has 3 major functional domains: the N-terminal domain, DNA-binding domain, and androgen-binding domain. The protein functions as a steroid-hormone activated transcription factor. Upon binding the hormone ligand, the receptor dissociates from accessory proteins, translocates into the nucleus, dimerizes, and then stimulates transcription of androgen responsive genes. This gene contains 2 polymorphic trinucleotide repeat segments that encode polyglutamine and polyglycine tracts in the N-terminal transactivation domain of its protein. Expansion of the polyglutamine tract from the normal 9-34 repeats to the pathogenic 38-62 repeats causes spinal bulbar muscular atrophy (SBMA, also known as Kennedy's disease). Mutations in this gene are also associated with complete androgen insensitivity (CAIS). Alternative splicing results in multiple transcript variants encoding different isoforms. [provided by RefSeq, Jan 2017].

Steroid hormone receptors are ligand-activated transcription factors that regulate eukaryotic gene expression and affect cellular proliferation and differentiation in target tissues. Transcription factor activity is modulated by bound coactivator and corepressor proteins like ZBTB7A that recruits NCOR1 and NCOR2 to the androgen response elements/ARE on target genes, negatively regulating androgen receptor signaling and androgen-induced cell proliferation (PubMed:20812024). Transcription activation is also down-regulated by NR0B2. Activated, but not phosphorylated, by HIPK3 and ZIPK/DAPK3

The androgen receptor gene is more than 90 kb long and codes for a protein that has 3 major functional domains: the N-terminal domain, DNA-binding domain, and androgen-binding domain. The protein functions as a steroid-hormone activated transcription factor. Upon binding the hormone ligand, the receptor dissociates from accessory proteins, translocates into the nucleus, dimerizes, and then stimulates transcription of androgen responsive genes. This gene contains 2 polymorphic trinucleotide repeat segments that encode polyglutamine and polyglycine tracts in the N-terminal transactivation domain of its protein. Expansion of the polyglutamine tract from the normal 9-34 repeats to the pathogenic 38-62 repeats causes spinal bulbar muscular atrophy (SBMA, also known as Kennedy's disease). Mutations in this gene are also associated with complete androgen insensitivity (CAIS). Alternative splicing results in multiple transcript variants encoding different isoforms. [provided by RefSeq, Jan 2017].
Oncogene
AR

This gene is similar to the Drosophila additional sex combs gene, which encodes a chromatin-binding protein required for normal determination of segment identity in the developing embryo. The protein is a member of the Polycomb group of proteins, which are necessary for the maintenance of stable repression of homeotic and other loci. The protein is thought to disrupt chromatin in localized areas, enhancing transcription of certain genes while repressing the transcription of other genes. The protein encoded by this gene functions as a ligand-dependent co-activator for retinoic acid receptor in cooperation with nuclear receptor coactivator 1. Mutations in this gene are associated with myelodysplastic syndromes and chronic myelomonocytic leukemia. Alternative splicing results in multiple transcript variants. [provided by RefSeq, Sep 2009].

H3F3A is an H3.3 variant histone that is expressed throughout the cell cycle (PMID: 15776021). H3.3 interacts with the HIRA histone chaperone that is necessary to mediate DNA-synthesis independet nuclosome assembly respectively (PMID: 14718166; PMID: 15776021

The protein encoded by this gene is a catalytic subunit of the N-oligosaccharyltransferase (OST) complex, which functions in the endoplasmic reticulum to transfer glycan chains to asparagine residues of target proteins. A separate complex containing a similar catalytic subunit with an overlapping function also exists. Multiple transcript variants encoding different isoforms have been found for this gene. [provided by RefSeq, Aug 2015].

Catalytic subunit of the oligosaccharyl transferase (OST) complex that catalyzes the initial transfer of a defined glycan (Glc(3)Man(9)GlcNAc(2) in eukaryotes) from the lipid carrier dolichol-pyrophosphate to an asparagine residue within an Asn-X-Ser/Thr consensus motif in nascent polypeptide chains, the first step in protein N-glycosylation. N-glycosylation occurs cotranslationally and the complex associates with the Sec61 complex at the channel-forming translocon complex that mediates protein translocation across the endoplasmic reticulum (ER). All subunits are required for a maximal enzyme activity. This subunit contains the active site and the acceptor peptide and donor lipid-linked oligosaccharide (LLO) binding pockets (By similarity). STT3A is present in the majority of OST complexes and mediates cotranslational N-glycosylation of most sites on target proteins, while STT3B-containing complexes are required for efficient post-translational glycosylation and mediate glycosylation of sites that have been skipped by STT3A (PubMed:19167329)

BCL2L11, BCL2-like 11, is a member of the Bcl2 family of programed cell death regulators that activates apoptosis (PMID: 26405162). Toxic stimuli result in BCL2L11 inducing apoptosis by inactivating anti-apoptotic BCL2 proteins and by activating BAX-BAK1 (PMID: 23064249). Additionally, BCL2L11 inhibits autophagy (PMID: 23064249).

CALR, calreticulin, is a multi-compartmental and a Ca2+ binding chaperone protein that plays a role in multiple biological processes. CALR roles include protein folding and quality control, calcium homeostasis, immune response, cell adhesion and migration, and cell signaling (PMID: 19940256, PMID: 28470469, PMID: 22959412).

H3C7, H3 clustered histone 7, encodes a member of the canonical histone 3 family that may play a role in nucleosome assembly, DNA replication, repair, and cell differentiation (PMID: 21263457; PMID: 25003966).

KMT2B, lysine methyltransferase 2B, is responsible for the methylation of H3K4, a post-translational modification that leads to the regulation of gene expression, the cell cycle, and embryonic development (PMID: 27839873, PMID: 25998713).

MSH3, mutS homolog 3, encodes for one of the DNA mismatch repair proteins, which forms a stable heterodimer with MSH2 in order to recognize and function in double-strand-break repair, transcription-coupled repair, and base excision repair (PMID: 8942985; PMID: 27546332).

JAK3, tyrosine-protein kinase JAK3, is a non-receptor protein tyrosine kinase involved in the interferon-alpha/beta/gamma pathway and is a member of the JAK/STAT signaling pathway (PMID: 15575979). JAK3 is primarily expressed in hematopoietic cells, and deficiency in JAK3 results in decreased T-cell development and proliferation (PMID: 19290934).

RET, ret proto-oncogene, is a receptor tyrosine kinase that activates MAPK and PI3K/AKT pathways and regulates cell growth and differentiation (PMID: 24561444, PMID: 29134959). RET contributes to  inflammation and growth in the tumor microenvironment by increasing levels of cytokines and chemokines (PMID: 24561444).

BCL9, BCL9 transcription coactivator, is a nuclear transcriptional regulator that regulates the Wnt/beta-catenin (CTNNB1) signaling pathway (PMID: 29786110). Induction of Wnt target gene transcription by BCL9 is cell-type-specific and dependent on the cellular context (PMID: 31911584).

SKP2, S-phase kinase-associated protein 2, is an F-box protein which acts as the substrate recognition component of the SCF ubiquitin E3 ligase complex (PMID: 12435635). Upregulation of Skp2 has been identified in numerous cancer types (PMID: 23911321; PMID: 28514182; PMID: 28624440; PMID: 27160538).
Both

EPHA3, Ephrin type-A receptor 3, is an ephrin receptor tyrosine kinase involved in cell adhesion, migration, and epithelial-to-mesenchymal transition (PMID: 23410976). Additionally, EPHA3 is positively associated with VEGF and microvessel density expression (PMID: 30066881).

FGF6, fibroblast growth factor 6, is a member of the fibroblast growth factor family that drives oncogenic transformation (PMID: 1549352). Additionally, FGF6 has shown dual function in muscle regeneration, stimulating myoblast proliferation/migration and muscle differentiation/hypertrophy (PMID: 16875743).

AGO4, argonaute RISC catalytic component 4, is a regulator of RNA mediated gene silencing (RNAi) in cells (PMID: 18771919). AGO4 has been demonstrated to be downregulated in hepatocellular cancer (PMID: 23398123).

STK19, serine/threonine kinase 19, localizes to the nucleus and plays a role in transcription via phosphorylation of RNA-binding proteins and may be involved in transcription upon DNA damage (PMID: 27184836, PMID: 9812991). STK19 mutations are associated with basal cell carcinoma (PMID: 26950094) and melanoma (PMID: 22817889).

ATIC, 5-aminoimidazole-4-carboxamide ribonucleotide formyltransferase/IMP cyclohydrolase, is part of the purine biosynthetic pathway that catalyzes the two steps in de novo inosine 5'-monophosphate synthesis (PMID: 11948179, PMID: 30337562). ATIC fusions with ALK have been observed in anaplastic large cell lymphoma (PMID: 10702393).

This gene belongs to the SMC3 subfamily of SMC proteins. The encoded protein occurs in certain cell types as either an intracellular, nuclear protein or a secreted protein. The nuclear form, known as structural maintenance of chromosomes 3, is a component of the multimeric cohesin complex that holds together sister chromatids during mitosis, enabling proper chromosome segregation. Post-translational modification of the encoded protein by the addition of chondroitin sulfate chains gives rise to the secreted proteoglycan bamacan, an abundant basement membrane protein. [provided by RefSeq, Jul 2008].

Central component of cohesin, a complex required for chromosome cohesion during the cell cycle. The cohesin complex may form a large proteinaceous ring within which sister chromatids can be trapped. At anaphase, the complex is cleaved and dissociates from chromatin, allowing sister chromatids to segregate. Cohesion is coupled to DNA replication and is involved in DNA repair. The cohesin complex plays also an important role in spindle pole assembly during mitosis and in chromosomes movement

This gene belongs to the SMC3 subfamily of SMC proteins. The encoded protein occurs in certain cell types as either an intracellular, nuclear protein or a secreted protein. The nuclear form, known as structural maintenance of chromosomes 3, is a component of the multimeric cohesin complex that holds together sister chromatids during mitosis, enabling proper chromosome segregation. Post-translational modification of the encoded protein by the addition of chondroitin sulfate chains gives rise to the secreted proteoglycan bamacan, an abundant basement membrane protein. [provided by RefSeq, Jul 2008].
Neither
SMC3

This gene encodes a member of the SOX (SRY-related HMG-box) family of transcription factors involved in the regulation of embryonic development and in the determination of the cell fate. The encoded protein may act as a transcriptional activator after forming a protein complex with other proteins. This protein acts as a nucleocytoplasmic shuttle protein and is important for neural crest and peripheral nervous system development. Mutations in this gene are associated with Waardenburg-Shah and Waardenburg-Hirschsprung disease. [provided by RefSeq, Jul 2008].

Transcription factor that plays a central role in developing and mature glia (By similarity). Specifically activates expression of myelin genes, during oligodendrocyte (OL) maturation, such as DUSP15 and MYRF, thereby playing a central role in oligodendrocyte maturation and CNS myelination (By similarity). Once induced, MYRF cooperates with SOX10 to implement the myelination program (By similarity). Transcriptional activator of MITF, acting synergistically with PAX3 (PubMed:21965087). Transcriptional activator of MBP, via binding to the gene promoter (By similarity)

This gene encodes a member of the SOX (SRY-related HMG-box) family of transcription factors involved in the regulation of embryonic development and in the determination of the cell fate. The encoded protein may act as a transcriptional activator after forming a protein complex with other proteins. This protein acts as a nucleocytoplasmic shuttle protein and is important for neural crest and peripheral nervous system development. Mutations in this gene are associated with Waardenburg-Shah and Waardenburg-Hirschsprung disease. [provided by RefSeq, Jul 2008].
Neither
SOX10

BCR, BCR activator of RhoGEF and GTPase, is a serine-threonine protein kinase, which may be involved in cell regulation and signaling (PMID: 15494376).overexpression of Bcr itself inhibits cell proliferation 15494376

FYN, FYN proto-oncogene, Src family tyrosine kinase (SFK), is a non-receptor tyrosine kinase that plays a role in cell growth, signaling, proliferation, differentiation, migration, apoptosis, and motility (PMID: 26305432, PMID: 18991062).

GRM3, glutamate metabotropic receptor 3, is a Group II G-coupled glutamate receptor that antagonizes TGFβ-mediated activation of protein kinase A and inhibition of Protein kinase B (AKT) and functions in regulation of glutamatergic signaling (PMID: 16417579, PMID: 22564439; PMID: 28114282).

INHA, inhibin subunit alpha, encodes a member of the transforming growth factor-beta (TGF-B) superfamily of proteins, which plays a role in reproductive and endocrine function and has been demonstrated to negatively regulate the synthesis of follicle-stimulating hormone (PMID: 20005735).

BRAF, serine/threonine-protein kinase B-raf, is a member of the Raf family of serine/threonine protein kinases, which signals through the MAP kinase pathway to regulate cell proliferation and cell growth (PMID: 24737949, PMID: 29540830). BRAF mutations have been identified in a variety of cancers, including, colorectal (PMID: 30122982), lung (PMID: 29729495), thyroid (PMID: 12970315), and melanoma (PMID: 24737949), and a number of mutations have also been demonstrated to confer drug resistance (PMID: 27478040).

HNRNPUL1, heterogeneous nuclear ribonucleoprotein U-like protein 1, is a member of the hnRNP family that regulates RNA metabolism and may play a role in DNA damage repair (PMID: 15907477, PMID: 23577092). Downregulation of HNRNPUL1 has been observed in renal cell carcinoma (PMID: 24595077).

The B lymphocyte antigen receptor is a multimeric complex that includes the antigen-specific component, surface immunoglobulin (Ig). Surface Ig non-covalently associates with two other proteins, Ig-alpha and Ig-beta, which are necessary for expression and function of the B-cell antigen receptor. This gene encodes the Ig-beta protein of the B-cell antigen component. Alternatively spliced transcript variants encoding different isoforms have been described. [provided by RefSeq, Jul 2008].

Required in cooperation with CD79A for initiation of the signal transduction cascade activated by the B-cell antigen receptor complex (BCR) which leads to internalization of the complex, trafficking to late endosomes and antigen presentation. Enhances phosphorylation of CD79A, possibly by recruiting kinases which phosphorylate CD79A or by recruiting proteins which bind to CD79A and protect it from dephosphorylation

The B lymphocyte antigen receptor is a multimeric complex that includes the antigen-specific component, surface immunoglobulin (Ig). Surface Ig non-covalently associates with two other proteins, Ig-alpha and Ig-beta, which are necessary for expression and function of the B-cell antigen receptor. This gene encodes the Ig-beta protein of the B-cell antigen component. Alternatively spliced transcript variants encoding different isoforms have been described. [provided by RefSeq, Jul 2008].
Oncogene
CD79B

The CD8 antigen is a cell surface glycoprotein found on most cytotoxic T lymphocytes that mediates efficient cell-cell interactions within the immune system. The CD8 antigen, acting as a coreceptor, and the T-cell receptor on the T lymphocyte recognize antigens displayed by an antigen presenting cell (APC) in the context of class I MHC molecules. The functional coreceptor is either a homodimer composed of two alpha chains, or a heterodimer composed of one alpha and one beta chain. Both alpha and beta chains share significant homology to immunoglobulin variable light chains. This gene encodes the CD8 beta chain isoforms. Multiple alternatively spliced transcript variants encoding distinct membrane associated or secreted isoforms have been described. A pseudogene, also located on chromosome 2, has been identified. [provided by RefSeq, May 2010].

Integral membrane glycoprotein that plays an essential role in the immune response and serves multiple functions in responses against both external and internal offenses. In T-cells, functions primarily as a coreceptor for MHC class I molecule:peptide complex. The antigens presented by class I peptides are derived from cytosolic proteins while class II derived from extracellular proteins. Interacts simultaneously with the T-cell receptor (TCR) and the MHC class I proteins presented by antigen presenting cells (APCs). In turn, recruits the Src kinase LCK to the vicinity of the TCR-CD3 complex. A palmitoylation site in the cytoplasmic tail of CD8B chain contributes to partitioning of CD8 into the plasma membrane lipid rafts where signaling proteins are enriched. Once LCK recruited, it initiates different intracellular signaling pathways by phosphorylating various substrates ultimately leading to lymphokine production, motility, adhesion and activation of cytotoxic T-lymphocytes (CTLs). Additionally, plays a critical role in thymic selection of CD8+ T-cells

NOTCH1, neurogenic locus notch homolog protein 1, is a member of the canonical Notch pathway (PMID: 25388163). NOTCH1 is an transmembrane receptor, which plays a role in cell fate determination, differentiation, growth, survival (PMID: 25388163) and chemoresistance (PMID: 29998084).

KDR (VEGFR2), kinase insert domain receptor, is also known as vascular endothelial growth factor receptor 2 and is an endothelial cell surface receptor tyrosine kinase. KDR is a member of the vascular endothelial growth factor family of proteins that plays a role in angiogenesis and cell proliferation through activation of RAF-MEK-MAP and PI3K-AKT pathways (PMID: 25568876, PMID: 29093528, PMID: 26578684)

EPHA7, EPH receptor A7, encodes a receptor, which upon interaction with cell surface bound ephrin ligands, reduces Akt signaling, increases apoptotic signaling, and plays a role in cell-cell repulsion and adhesion (PMID: 24003208, PMID: 15928710, PMID: 29022918).

ERCC1, ERCC excision repair 1, endonuclease non-catalytic subunit, forms part of an endonuclease complex with ERCC4 (XPF) that functions in DNA repair by removing DNA covalent helix-distorting adducts caused by platinum compounds (PMID: 26074087; PMID: 29187510). Additionally ERCC1-XPF is involved in chromosomal stability (PMID: 26074087).

FOXO1, forkhead box O1, encodes for a protein belonging to the family of forkhead box O transcription factors, which plays a role in multiple cellular processes including cell cycle arrest, apoptosis, autophagy, metabolic dysregulation and and prevention of reactive oxygen species (PMID: 18715783; PMID: 29158051).

IFNGR1, interferon gamma receptor 1, is the ligand binding subunit that forms a dimer with IFNGR2 to form a cytokine receptor for IFNG, which activates the JAK/STAT signaling pathway (PMID: 24453034).
NBN, nibrin, functions as part of the MRN complex, which plays a role in DNA double-strand break repair, maintenance of chromosome integrity, and cell cycle control (PMID: 24396275; PMID: 19862546).
PBRM1, polybromo 1, is a subunit of the PBAF complex, which functions in chromatin remodeling and DNA damage repair to modulate gene expression (PMID: 23867514; PMID: 31077944).

ADORA2A, adenosine A2a receptor, is a G-protein coupled receptor that binds adenosine to regulate a number of physiological functions and is expressed by a variety of cells, including dendritic cells (DCs), T-cells and NK-cells (PMID: 23856527). ADORA2A in the tumor microenvironment evades immune surveillance by inhibiting T-cell receptor function (PMID: 23856527, PMID: 25377469) and therapeutic blockade may restore the anti-tumor response (PMID: 28174424).

CCR2, chemokine (C-C motif) receptor 2, is expressed on dendritc cells, monocytes, and macrophages (PMID: 23938203). CCR2 is activated by its chemokine ligands (CCL2, CCL8, CCL7, and CCL13) and it stimulates monocyte migration from peripheral circulation to inflammed tissue through the vascular wall (PMID: 23408426; PMID: 15995708)

CD3 chains make up the T-cell antigen receptor complex that transmits signals received from antigen-presenting cells (PMID: 26507128). CD3e is required in both types of T-cell antigen receptor complexes and plays a central role in CD3 core assembly and full complex expression (PMID:8490660)

CD40LG, CD40 Ligand, is a type II transmembrane protein in which interaction with CD40 on B-cells triggers B-cell differentiation, maturation and apoptosis (PMID: 15067037). The CD40L-CD40 interaction is necessary for priming of Th1-T-cells by promiting cell matruation and cytokine production (PMID: 15067037; PMID: 8627184)

CD86 is surface glycoprotein and a member of the immunoglobulin superfamily (IgSF) and is expressed on APCs (along with CD80) and functions as a ligand for CTLA-4 and CD28 (PMID: 23911524). The affinity for CTLA-4 is higher than CD28 leading to inhibiting co-stimulatory signals (PMID: 31102428; PMID:16920215)

CTAG2, cancer/testis antigen 2, encodes for a cancer testis antigen that is normally expressed on male germ cells and may play a role in the regulation of gene expression (PMID: 15715909). CTAG2 is expressed by many human tumors, not not normal tissues except for testis and placenta and is immunogenic inducing both natural cellular and humoral responses (PMID: 14559844)

GATA3, trans-acting T-cell-specific transcription factor, is a zinc-finger transcription factor that regulates development and differentiation (PMID: 7550312) and plays a vital role in immune function (PMID: 21924928; PMID: 28320875)

ICOSLG, inducible T cell costimulator ligand, encodes a member of the B7 family of ligands, which triggers T cell proliferation and cytokine production upon binding to the T cell receptor, ICOS (PMID: 11973139, PMID: 10549624). Expression of ISOSLG is implicated in diesase progression due to regulation of antitumor adaptive immunity (PMID: 31634400)

IFNG, interferon-gamma is a  pleiotropic cytokine produced by a variety of immune cells including T-helper 1 (TH1) cells and natural killer cells (PMID: 16728393). IFNG is recognized for its role in antitumor host immuniity and activation of cytotoxic T-cells and dendritic cells, particularly through the activation of macrophages (PMID: 30336781; PMID: 30402328)

PDCD1, programmed cell death 1, encodes the receptor PD-1, which is expressed on immune cells and has an inhibitory effect on immune response upon interaction with its ligands, PD-L1 and PD-L2 (PMID: 26681673, PMID: 24403232). PDCD1 (PD-1) inhibition in cancer therapy may relieve suppression of anti-tumor immune response (PMID: 26325035, PMID: 26681673, PMID: 26320063, PMID: 24403232).

STAT1, signal transducer and activator of transcription 1-alpha/beta, is a STAT family transcription factor that plays a role in innate immunity and response to growth factors via transcription of anti-viral and cell cycle regulatory genes (PMID: 24058806).STAT1 mediates cellular IFNgamma responses and key functions such as host defence, and modulation of immune and inflammatory responses (PMID: 29921905)

TLR8, toll like receptor 8, is part of a family of receptors in innate immunity that play an important role in the initiation of host defense. TLR8 recognizes single stranded RNA and self RNA from dead or dying cells (PMID: 23520111: PMID: 17932028)

PDCD1, programmed cell death 1, encodes the receptor PD-1, which is expressed on immune cells and has an inhibitory effect on immune response upon interaction with its ligands, PD-L1 and PD-L2 (PMID: 26681673, PMID: 24403232). PDCD1 (PD-1) inhibition in cancer therapy may relieve suppression of anti-tumor immune response (PMID: 26325035, PMID: 26681673, PMID: 26320063, PMID: 24403232).

STAT1, signal transducer and activator of transcription 1-alpha/beta, is a STAT family transcription factor that plays a role in innate immunity and response to growth factors via transcription of anti-viral and cell cycle regulatory genes (PMID: 24058806).STAT1 mediates cellular IFNgamma responses and key functions such as host defence, and modulation of immune and inflammatory responses (PMID: 29921905)

The protein encoded by this gene is a member of the Toll-like receptor (TLR) family which plays a fundamental role in pathogen recognition and activation of innate immunity. TLRs are highly conserved from Drosophila to humans and share structural and functional similarities. They recognize pathogen-associated molecular patterns (PAMPs) that are expressed on infectious agents, and mediate the production of cytokines necessary for the development of effective immunity. The various TLRs exhibit different patterns of expression. This gene is predominantly expressed in lung, placenta, and spleen, and lies in close proximity to another family member, TLR8, on chromosome X. [provided by RefSeq, Jul 2008].

Endosomal receptor that plays a key role in innate and adaptive immunity (PubMed:14976261). Controls host immune response against pathogens through recognition of uridine-containing single strand RNAs (ssRNAs) of viral origin or guanosine analogs (PubMed:31608988, PubMed:27742543, PubMed:12738885). Upon binding to agonists, undergoes dimerization that brings TIR domains from the two molecules into direct contact, leading to the recruitment of TIR-containing downstream adapter MYD88 through homotypic interaction (PubMed:27742543). In turn, the Myddosome signaling complex is formed involving IRAK4, IRAK1, TRAF6, TRAF3 leading to activation of downstream transcription factors NF-kappa-B and IRF7 to induce proinflammatory cytokines and interferons, respectively (PubMed:27742543)

MET (c-MET), hepatocyte growth factor receptor, is an oncogene and a member of the receptor tyrosine kinase family. MET autophosphorylates and activates MAPK, PI3K/AKT, SRC, and STAT pathways to promote cell growth, motility, invasion and angiogenesis (PMID: 22128285).

CCNH, cyclin H, interacts with CDK7 to regulate the cell cycle (PMID: 7533895, PMID: 23393140). Increased expression of Ccnh has been reported in esophageal squamous cell carcinoma, where it aids in the epithelial-mesenchymal transition (PMID: 25820824) and overexpression has been observed in estrogen receptor-positive breast cancer (PMID: 27301701).

ALK, anaplastic lymphoma kinase, is a receptor in the insulin receptor superfamily and is a key regulator of neuronal development (PMID: 21502284) and also promotes cell proliferation through activation of MAPK and PI3K signaling pathways (PMID: 27573755). Numerous mutations in ALK confer resistance in the context of Alk fusions (PMID: 25749034, PMID: 21948233).

PTEN, phosphatidylinositol 3,4,5-trisphosphate 3-phosphatase and dual-specificity protein phosphatase PTEN, is a tumor suppressor gene (PMID: 30562755) that blocks PI3K signalling (PMID: 24656806). The block in cell signaling results in inhibition of cell survival, growth and proliferation leading to inhibition of oncogenesis (PMID: 24656806; PMID: 30145641).

IDH1, isocitrate dehydrogenase (NADP(+)) 1, cytosolic, is an enzyme that catalyzes the conversion of isocitrate to alpha-ketoglutarate (alpha-KG), and is involved in the tricarboxylic acid cycle (PMID: 23999441, PMID: 28711227). Mutations in IDH1 are associated with aberrant conversion of alpha-KG to 2-HG, which is an oncogenic metabolite (PMID: 23999441, PMID: 28711227).

CDK4, cyclin-dependent kinase 4, is a member of the cyclin-dependent kinases which regulate the cell cycle. CDK4, along with CDK6 are critical regulators of the G1-S cell-cycle transition, and inhibits cell senescence and apoptosis (PMID: 24089445; PMID: 30061045).

U2AF1, U2 small nuclear RNA auxiliary factor 1, is a 35 kDa subunit splicing factor, that functions in 3' splice site recognition to regulate expression of genes involved in hematological and solid tumor development (PMID: 2963698; PMID: 28986033). U2AF is a heterodimer consisting of U2AF1 and U2AF2, where mature RNA is bound to the cytoplasm and acts as a translational repressor (PMID: 30842218).

SPOP, speckle type BTB/POZ protein, is a substrate recognition subunit of the cullin-RING E3 ligase complex. SPOP regulates degradation of proteins involved in hormone signaling, epigenetic regulation, gene transcription, cell cycle, and metastasis, thus plays dual roles in carcinogenesis (PMID: 31495053, PMID: 31901237).
MDM4, MDM4, p53 regulator, inhibits TP53 activity through interaction with the transcriptional activation domain of TP53, and regulates TP53 degradation together with MDM2 (PMID: 23303139).

EZH2, enhancer of zeste 2 polycomb repressive complex 2 subunit, encodes the catalytic subunit of the polycomb repressive complex 2, which methylates histone H3 to represses gene transcription, including a number of tumor suppressor genes (PMID: 24362326, PMID: 30112706). Additionally, functional links have been observed between EZH2, DNA methyltransferases (DNMTs), and histone deacetylases (HDACs) (PMID: 24362326).

AR, androgen receptor, belongs to the nuclear hormone receptor family, which acts as a transcription factor, resulting in either transcription or repression of specific genes (PMID: 24909511, PMID: 21784131). AR regulates multiple cellular events such proliferation, apoptosis, migration, invasion and differentiation (PMID: 24384911)

ERBB3 encodes HER3, an EGFR receptor tyrosine kinase, which activates PI3K-AKT-mTOR and RAS-RAF-MEK-ERK pathways to promote cell survival and proliferation (PMID: 17471238). ERBB3 has been thought to have limited to no kinase activity (PMID: 25326665)

B2M, beta-2-microglobulin, forms the light chain of the class I major histocompatibility complex (MHC) (PMID: 3312414) and is required for antigen presentation during the immune response (PMID: 27433843). B2M is elevated with increasing age which promotes age-related cognitive dysfunction and impaired neurogenesis (PMID: 26147761).

FLCN, folliculin, plays a role in cell-cycle regulation and functions as a tumor suppressor (PMID: 23874397). FLCN has roles in numerous metabolic and cellular processes such as mTOR pathways, mitochondiral biogenesis, cell-cell adhesion, and Rho A signaling (PMID: 28970150).

GRIN2A, glutamate ionotropic receptor NMDA type subunit 2A, is a subunit of the NMDA receptor, glutamate-gated ion channel (PMID: 22291485, PMID: 30544257). GRIN2A is a critical determinant of the physiological and pathological contributions of NMDAR activation (PMID: 26875626).

PIK3CA, phosphatidylinositol 4,5-bisphosphate 3-kinase catalytic subunit alpha isoform, activates AKT/mTOR signaling upon extracellular signalling stimulation of cell surface receptor tyrosine kinases (PMID: 26593112) PIK3CA plays a critical role in cell growth and cell proliferation leading to involvement in oncogenesis (PMID: 23411347; PMID: 26593112).

AXIN1, axis inhibition protein 1, is a scaffold protein that regulates the Wnt signaling pathway and also p53, Myc, TGF-beta, and Jun pathways (PMID: 30166345). Loss of AXIN1 function leads to increased cellular beta-catenin (CTNNB1), potentially promoting cell proliferation (PMID: 10700176).

FUNCTION: Multi-isomeric modular protein which forms a linking network between organelles and the actin cytoskeleton to maintain the subcellular spatial organization. As a component of the LINC (LInker of Nucleoskeleton and Cytoskeleton) complex involved in the connection between the nuclear lamina and the cytoskeleton. The nucleocytoplasmic interactions established by the LINC complex play an important role in the transmission of mechanical forces across the nuclear envelope and in nuclear movement and positioning. May be involved in nucleus-centrosome attachment and nuclear migration in neural progenitors implicating LINC complex association with SUN1/2 and probably association with cytoplasmic dynein-dynactin motor complexes; SYNE1 and SYNE2 may act redundantly. Required for centrosome migration to the apical cell surface during early ciliogenesis. May be involved in nuclear remodeling during sperm head formation in spermatogenenis; a probable SUN3:SYNE1/KASH1 LINC complex may tether spermatid nuclei to posterior cytoskeletal structures such as the manchette.(PubMed:11792814, PubMed:18396275).

BAP1, BRCA1 associated protein 1, belongs to the ubiquitin C-terminal hydrolase subfamily and interacts with the RING finger domain of the BRCA1 protein, resulting in deubiquitylation of BARD1 (PMID: 23550303) and is associated with double strand break repair and genomic stability (PMID: 31747945; PMID: 24347639).

BCL2, BCL2, apoptosis regulator, belongs to the BCL-2 family of proteins, and plays a role in the regulation of cell death, specifically preventing apoptosis and some processes related to necrosis (PMID: 9990505).
CARD11,CARMA1,BIMP3

E2F3, E2F transcription factor 3, is a member of the activator subclass of E2F transcription factors, and drives expression of genes involved in cell-cycle progression and proliferation upon dissociation from the retinoblastoma protein (Rb) (PMID: 19851314, PMID: 28855541). Additionally E2F3 is involved in DNA damage response and apoptosis (PMID: 31423109).

EIF4A2, eukaryotic translation initiation factor 4A2, encodes an RNA helicase that is required for initiation of protein translation (PMID: 21427765), and plays a role in microRNA-mediated gene silencing (PMID: 23559250). EIF4A unwinds RNA secondary structures in the 5'-UTR  to facilitate 40S ribosome scanning for the initiator codon (PMID: 31791371).

GEN1, Flap endonuclease GEN homolog 1, is a member of the Rad2/XPG endonuclease family and a structure-specific endonuclease. GEN1 cleaves Holliday junction recombination intermediates during double-stranded DNA repair events within mitosis and meiosis (PMID: 28327556; PMID: 29458773).

PARK2, Parkin RBR E3 Ubiquitin Protein Ligase (PRKN) is localized in the nuclues (PMID: 19801972). Upon activation PARK2 ubiquitinates various proteins leading to the recruitment of autophagy receptors to promote the removal of the mitochondria (PMID: 29172924; PMID: 25621951)

ARID2, AT-rich interactive domain-containing protein 2, is a subunit of the  polybromo-associated BRG1-associated factor (PBAF), the SWI/SNF chromatin remodeling complex (PMID: 28238438; PMID: 26238514). ARID2 plays tumor suppressor roles in carcinogenesis and may be involved in DNA damage response (PMID: 28238438)

AXL, AXL Receptor Tyrosine Kinase, is a receptor tyrosine kinase that when activated regulates tumor cell survival, proliferation, migration and invasion, angiogenesis, and tumor-host interactions (PMID: 28251492; PMID: 28072762). Activation and inhibition of AXL modulate proliferation in various tissue and tumor types via its downstream effectors including AKT, MAPK and NF-kB (PMID: 28072762)

KRAS, KRAS proto-oncogene, GTPase, is a member of the small GTPase superfamily that when bound to GTP interacts with signaling molecules that regulate cell activities such as proliferation, differentiation, apoptosis and cell migration (PMID: 23622131). KRAS is also a key regulator of the MAPK, PI3K/AKT/mTOR pathways (PMID: 23622131; PMID: 31649840).

BIRC2, baculoviral IAP repeat containing 2, belongs to the IAP family, and is involved in regulating TNF and NF-kB activated signaling pathways (PMID: 21653699). BIRC2 is also involved in the development of the immune system and immune responses, cellular differentiation, cell division, signal transduction, and cell response to damage (PMID: 32322338; PMID: 25065885).
ZNF217, zinc finger protein 217, is a transcription repressor that regulates the expression of genes involved in cell proliferation, survival, and epithelial mesenchymal transition (PMID: 26431164).

XPO1, exportin 1, encodes for an export protein that is responsible for transporting large molecules from the nucleus to the cytoplasm (PMID: 22773955). Additionally XPO1 plays a role in centrosome duplication and spindle assembly in response to DNA damage (PMID: 22773955).

DCUN1D1, defective in cullin neddylation 1 domain containing 1, encodes a component of the E3 ubiquitin ligase complex, which binds to Ubc12 and cullin, thereby resulting in increased neddylation activity and subsequent assembly of the cullin-RING ligase complexes (PMID: 18826954, PMID: 21247897).

PAK7, p21 activated kinase 5 (PAK5) is a member of the Rac/Cdc42-associated Ser/Thr protein kinases that is primarily expressed in neuronal tissues (PMID: 12897128). PAK5 induces resistance to apoptosis by phosphorylating BAD and prevents localization of BAD to mitochondria (PMID: 12897128; PMID: 18465753)

SDHAF2, Succinate Dehydrogenase Complex Assembly Factor 2, is required for the assembly of succinate dehydrogenase (SDH). SDH is a component of the tricarboxylic acid (TCA) cycle and the mitochondrial electron transport chain (ETC) (PMID: 29930107; PMID: 19628817)

TCEB1, Transcription Elongation Factor B (SIII), Polypeptide 1 or ELOC, contributes to the VHL complex to ubiquitinate hypoxia-inducible factor (HIF) and its subsequent degradation (PMID: 25676555; PMID: 31813809). Mutations within TCEB1 can impair the VHL complex leading to HIF1a overexpression (PMID: 31813809)

NF2, neurofibromin 2, is a tumor suppressor that produces the protein product Merlin (PMID: 23666797). Merlin is known to regulate cellular processes such as cell proliferation, motility, survival and signaling pathways through regulating cell-cell contact and gene expression (PMID: 22482125; PMID: 23666797).

CDH1, cadherin 1, type 1, encodes E-Cadherin and is a tumor suppressor (PMID: 30562755) involved in epithelial cell-cell adhesion, cell signaling, differentiation, and polarity (PMID: 18726070, PMID: 26674224).

BCL6, BCL6 transcription repressor,  is a member of the Broad-Complex, Tramtrack and Bric-a-brac/Pox virus and Zinc Finger (BTB/POZ) family and functions as a transcriptional repressor in germinal center B cells. BCL6 plays a role in B-lymphocyte development, a cell cycle checkpoint repressor and is critical for cell survival and proliferation (PMID: 20498019, PMID: 31788471).

BCOR, BCL6 corepressor, functions with B-cell CLL/lymphoma 6 (BCL6) as a transcriptional silencer (PMID: 10898795, PMID: 16943429) and also suppresses MLLT3 (AF9) transcriptional activity (PMID: 12776190).

ALOX12B, arachidonate 12-lipoxygenase, 12R type, encodes the 12R-LOX enzyme and is required for epidermal barrier function (PMID: 23954555, PMID: 24021977). ALOX12B helps wild-type P53 evade cytotoxicity and apoptosis by promoting ALOX12B and catalyzing the dioxygenation and breakdown of arachidonic acid (PMID: 30258081).

SMARCB1, SWI/SNF related, matrix associated, actin dependent regulator of chromatin, subfamily b, member 1, is a member of the SWI/SNF chromatin remodeling complex (PMID: 23095836). SMARCB1 regulates transcription of several genes involved in cell proliferation, can induce the accumulation of cells in the G0/G1 phase and in some cases, induce cell senescence or apoptosis (PMID: 23095836; PMID: 28109176)

VHL, von Hippel-Lindau tumor suppressor, is part of an E3 ubiquitin protein ligase complex, which promotes degradation of HIF-alpha and other protein targets required for cellular growth and angiogenesis (PMID: 24583008, PMID: 30194449), and plays a role in genomic stability (PMID: 31747945).

CBL, Cbl proto-oncogene C, is an E3 ubiquitin-protein ligase involved in cell signaling and ubiquitination of tyrosine kinases and regulates many receptor and transcription signals. (PMID: 23085373; PMID: 31402498). The CBL family is involved in immune regulation of lymphoid and non‐lymphoid hematopoietic precursors to the effector functions of T, B, and myeloid cells (PMID: 31402498).

RAF1, Raf-1 proto-oncogene, serine/threonine kinase, is a member of the Raf family of serine/threonine protein kinases and is activated by Ras to stimulate Mek/Erk to promote cell proliferation (PMID: 21577205, PMID: 31285551). Additionally, RAF1 plays a role in metabolism, motility, and differentiation (PMID: 28978120).

MED12, mediator complex subunit 12, is a subunit of Mediator, a complex involved in regulating expression of most RNA polymerase II transcripts (PMID: 24123922). Additionally, MED12 regulates signals involved in cell growth, development, differentiation and acts in Gli3-dependent Sonic hedgehog signaling and epigenetic silencing of genes (PMID: 24123922).

IDH2, isocitrate dehydrogenase (NADP(+)) 2, mitochondrial, is an enzyme that catalyzes the conversion of isocitrate to alpha-ketoglutarate (alpha-KG), and is involved in the tricarboxylic acid cycle (PMID: 28711227, PMID: 28980701).

MAP3K1, mitogen-activated protein kinase kinase kinase 1, is a E3 ubiquitin protein ligase and serine/threonine kinase that is activated by a variety of stimuli and cell stresses in which it regulates JNK and ERK signaling (PMID: 29765551). MAP3K1 protein functions in cell migration and cell survival, while the caspase-cleaved C-terminal MAP3K1 fragment acts to promote apoptosis (PMID: 24386504; PMID: 29765551).

PTPRS, protein tyrosine phosphatase receptor type S, plays a role in regulation of intestinal epithelial permeability and autophagy, and has a putative role in regulation of RAS signaling (PMID: 24385580; PMID: 21303930; PMID: 29915291).

CBL, Cbl proto-oncogene C, is an E3 ubiquitin-protein ligase involved in cell signaling and ubiquitination of tyrosine kinases (PMID: 23085373). CBL mutations, often resulting in a loss of function, have been identified primarily in myeloid neoplasms, including myelodysplastic syndrome, acute myeloid leukemia, chronic myeloid leukemia, myelofibrosis, and juvenile myelomonocytic leukemia (PMID: 25477533).

EZH2, enhancer of zeste 2 polycomb repressive complex 2 subunit, encodes the catalytic subunit of the polycomb repressive complex 2, which methylates histone H3 to represses gene transcription, including a number of tumor suppressor genes (PMID: 24362326, PMID: 30112706). EZH2 mutations and overexpression has been observed in a variety of tumor types, including non-Hodgkin lymphoma (PMID: 30112706), leukemia (PMID: 29289837), and ovarian cancer (PMID: 29726819).

FOXO4, forkhead box O4, is a member of the FOXO family of transcription factors that promotes apoptosis, inhibits angiogenesis and tumor cell metastasis through regulation of gene expression (PMID: 30515801). FOXO4 fusions have been identified in acute leukemias (PMID: 9010221) and Ewing-like sarcoma (PMID: 25007147), decreased Foxo4 expression has been identified in nasopharyngeal carcinoma (PMID: 23707940), non-small cell lung cancer (PMID: 24935588), colorectal cancer (PMID: 22125836), and gastric cancer (PMID: 24886657).

UBE2R2, ubiquitin-conjugating enzyme E2R 2, selectively ubiquinates lysine 48-linked chains to target proteins for degradation (PMID: 27044868). A fusion of UBE2R2 with NTRK3 has been reported in multiple myeloma (PMID: 29920189).

ABL2, ABL proto-oncogene 2, non-receptor tyrosine kinase, serves as a liaison between upstream receptors and regulates biological processes ssuch as cell survival, apoptosis, response to genotoxic stress and cell motility (PMID: 28086240; PMID: 23842646). In addition knockdown of ABL2 can decrease cancer cell invasion and intravasation (PMID: 26729027)

FAM175A, Abraxas 1, BRCA1 A Complex Subunit that binds BRCA1 forming a complex with with BACH1 and CTIP. Abraxas recruits ibiquitin interacting motif (UIM) containing Rap80 , both of which are required for DNA damage resistance (PMID: 17525340; PMID:17643122)

FAM175A, Abraxas 1, BRCA1 A Complex Subunit that binds BRCA1 forming a complex with with BACH1 and CTIP. Abraxas recruits ibiquitin interacting motif (UIM) containing Rap80 , both of which are required for DNA damage resistance (PMID: 17525340; PMID:17643122).

MYD88, myeloid differentiation primary response protein, is a cytosolic adapter protein involved in Toll-like receptor and IL-1 signaling cytokine secretion, and inflammatory response (PMID: 19506249, PMID: 30086464). Additionally, MYD88 regulates innate immunity by regulating immune responses against viral and bacterial infections (PMID: 30086464).

BARD1, BRCA1 associated RING domain 1, forms a heterodimer with BRCA1, which functions as an E3 ubiquitin ligase and mediator of DNA repair through homology-directed repair (HDR) (PMID: 8944023, PMID: 30925164) and centrosome regulation (PMID: 29858377). Additionally, the BARD1-BRCA1 complex and RAD51 is associated with replication fork protection, leading to genomic stability (PMID: 31270457)

COP1, constitutive photomorphogenesis protein 1, is a COP-DET-FUS family member and an ubiquitously expressed E3 ubiquitin-protein ligase that mediates substrate ubiquitinylation, and functions both as a tumor suppressor and an oncogene (PMID: 22673153, PMID: 21572435, PMID: 21403399).

EED, embryonic ectoderm development, is a core subunit of polycomb repressive complex 2, which is involved in transcriptional regulation and the maintenance of transcriptional repression during development (PMID: 30951652, PMID: 27449971). Additionally, members of the polycomb group proteins such as EED are critical for chromatin remodeling and epigenetic gene silencing (PMID: 31527584).

ERCC3, TFIIH basal transcription factor complex helicase XPB subunit, is an ATP-dependent 5-3 DNA helicase that plays a role in nucleotide excision repair and RNA transcription (PMID: 8157004; PMID: 30894545). Additionally, the ATP-dependent helicase activity of ERCC3 is required for promoter opening and promoter escape (PMID: 11818577).

FANCE, Fanconi anemia, complementation group E, is a member of the Fanconi anemia core complex, which plays a role in DNA repair (PMID: 27145721, PMID: 17308347). FANCE is essential for FANCC accumulation in the nucleus and represents the essential link between the FA core complex and FANCD2 (PMID: 17308347).

FANCF, Fanconi anemia, complementation group F, is a member of the Fanconi anemia (FA) core complex, which plays a role in DNA damage response (PMID: 24910428). FANCF functions as a key protein in the assembly of the FA core complex bringing together the subcomplexes (PMID: 16675878).

FGF4, fibroblast growth factor 4, is a paracrine member of the fibroblast growth factor family required for cellular events during embryogenesis (PMID: 23967228). FGF4 plays a role in cell proliferation, differentiation, and survival (PMID: 20940169, PMID: 23967228).
GABRA6, gamma-aminobutyric acid type A receptor alpha6 subunit, encodes a protein that plays a role in physiological stress response (PMID: 15197399, PMID: 20109491).

PMS2, PMS1 homolog 2, mismatch repair system component, interacts with MLH1 to form the MutL-alpha complex, which functions in DNA mismatch repair and is associated with microsatellite instability (MSI) and genomic stability (PMID: 18157157; PMID: 24333356; PMID: 30121009; PMID: 31747945).

EDNRB, endothelin receptor type B, encodes for a G-protein coupled receptor that binds to endothelins, and plays a role in the development of the neural crest (PMID: 24326135). Elevated expression of EDNRB has been observed in esophageal squamous cell carcinoma (PMID: 24357795), breast cancer (PMID: 15073116), and vulvar cancer (PMID: 17611649).

SDCBP, syntenin-1, is an adapter protein at the adherens junction that plays a role in cell adhesion, ubiquitination, synaptic development, immune regulation, exosome biogenesis, and metastasis (PMID: 26291527). Expression of Sdcbp has been observed to promote metastasis in a variety of tumor types, including TNBC (PMID: 29845474), HNSCC (PMID: 27811365), prostate (PMID: 29572229), and glioma (PMID: 29118922).

CAPZA2, capping actin protein of muscle Z-line subunit alpha 2, is a member of the F-actin capping protein alpha subunit family that regulates the growth of barbed ends of actin filaments (PMID: 7665558). CAPZA1 is frequently amplified in melanoma, ovarian, esophageal, lung, and stomach cancer (PMID: 29190909).

LEO1, LEO1 homolog, Paf1/RNA polymerase II complex component, is a Paf1 complex component involved in transcription regulation (PMID: 20060942). A LEO1 fusion to SLC12A1 has been detected in glioma (PMID: 20196086), and LEO1 gene dysregulation is thought to affect tumor development through Wnt signaling regulation (PMID: 17599057).

HDAC6, histone deacetylase 6, is a member of the class IIb HDAC family that functions in deacetylation of histone and non-histone proteins to repress transcription (PMID: 30472601) and plays a role in cell migration, angiogenesis, and modification of the immune response (PMID: 30430228, PMID: 30096875). Overexpression of Hdac6 has been observed in oral squamous cell carcinoma, ovarian carcinoma, and primary acute myeloid leukemia (PMID: 30425065).

RNF130, ring finger protein 130, is an E3 ligase protein that belongs to the superfamily of GRAIL transmembrane proteins and plays a role in ubiquitination (PMID: 16549277). Elevated expression of RNF130 has been observed in Barrett esophagus and esophageal adenocarcinoma and a fusion with BRAF was identified in pilocytic astrocytoma (PMID: 25228972, PMID: 25040262).

GPBP1, GC-rich promoter binding protein 1, encodes for a transcription factor likely involved in the regulation of homologous repair genes (PMID: 29669295). Loss of GPBP1 in ovarian cancer has been associated with decreased benefit and potential resistance to platinum therapies and PARP inhibitors (PMID: 29669295).

TNFAIP3, TNF alpha induced protein 3, encodes an anti-inflammatory protein, acting as a ubiquitin-modifying enzyme, which plays a role in the regulation of multiple signaling pathways including NF-kappaB, Wnt, and interferon regulatory factor (IRF) (PMID: 24246475). Loss of function mutations in TNFAIP3 have been identified in multiple types of lymphomas (PMID: 23134590).

DLL4, delta-like protein 4, is a member of the Notch family of ligands, which regulates activity of Notch receptors and may play a role in tumor angiogenesis (PMID: 27891816, PMID: 28288569). Overexpression of Dll4 has been observed in gastric cancer (PMID: 27891816) and pancreatic cancer (PMID: 27755532, PMID: 27919854).

FOXL2, forkhead box L2, encodes for a transcription factor that is a member of the forked-winged helix family and plays a role in ovary development (PMID: 21640373). FOXL2 transcriptional targets include granulosa cell differentiation, signal transduction, and apoptosis related genes. Additionally, FOXL2 potentially influences cell cycle and stress response related genes (PMID: 31221094).

CHD2, chromodomain helicase DNA binding protein 2, is a chromatin remodeling protein that regulates gene expression and plays a role in neuronal development (PMID: 29962935, PMID: 30521773). Additionally, CHD2 plays roles in proliferation, differentiation, and DNA repair (PMID: 29962935).

CUL3, cullin 3, acts as a scaffold in Cullin-RING E3 ubiquitin ligase complexes, and is involved in multiple intracellular pathways such Wnt/β-catenin, Hedgehog/Gli, NF-kB, NOTCH11, Keap1/Nrf2 and cell cycle proteins (PMID: 30872636). Additionally CUL3 is involved in cell differentiation and vesicle trafficking (PMID: 29249570).

EGFL7, EGF like domain multiple 7, is an endothelial cell-derived secreted factor that regulates vascular tube formation (PMID: 29970668). EGFL7 encodes a secreted growth factor that is primarily expressed in endothelial cells, promotes angiogenesis, and plays a role in the regulation of NOTCH signaling (PMID: 22160377).

INPP4A, inositol polyphosphate-4-phosphatase type I A, encodes a lipid phosphatase that dephosphorylates phosphatidylinositol-3,4-bisphosphate (PtdIns(3,4)P2) PIP2 into phosphatidylinositol-3,4,5-trisphosphate (PIP3), resulting in negative PI3K pathway signaling degrading PI(3,4)P2 (PMID: 26022180).

PACSIN2, protein kinase C and casein kinase substrate in neurons 2, is a member of the F-BAR protein family that negatively regulates receptor-mediated endocytosis and growth factor mediated signaling, and plays a role in cell-cell adhesion (PMID: 23129763, PMID: 27417273, PMID: 11082044). A fusion of PACSIN2 with BRAF has been observed in pediatric langerhans cell histiocytosis (PMID: 28748614).

MOS, v-mos Moloney murine sarcoma viral oncogene homolog, is a serine/threonine kinase regulates meiosis through Mek phosphorylation (PMID: 8384311). MOS activity has been demonstrated to facilitate cellular transformation (PMID: 7588633, PMID: 8972231).

EPHA3, Ephrin type-A receptor 3, is an ephrin receptor tyrosine kinase involved in cell adhesion, migration, and epithelial-to-mesenchymal transition (PMID: 23410976). Overexpression of Epha3 maintains tumor cells in a less differentiated state (PMID: 23410976), may be prognostic for gastric cancer progression (PMID: 28465671, PMID: 30066881, PMID: 24908114, PMID: 22350700), and Epha3 somatic mutations have been frequently observed in lung cancer (PMID: 22242939).

UGT1A1, UDP-glucuronosyltransferase 1-1, is an enzyme that catalyzes the glucuronidation of substances to soluble metabolites for excretion (PMID: 28520360). Genetic polymorphisms in UGT1A1 may alter the metabolism of chemotherapy drugs such as irinotecan, resulting in severe toxicity (PMID: 28494109, PMID: 28502040, PMID: 28585035, PMID: 30645764).

SDHB, succinate dehydrogenase [ubiquinone] iron-sulfur subunit, mitochondrial, is the iron-sulfur catalytic subunit in mitochondrial complex II that catalyzes electron transfer from succinate to ubiquinone (PMID: 21771581). SDHB mutations are frequently found in pheochromocytomas, aggressive extra-adrenal paragangliomas (PMID: 23457139, PMID: 21771581), and pituitary carcinomas (PMID: 28284009).

PRRX1, paired related homeobox 1, is a transcription factor that induces EMT during development and tumor invasion, and overexpression is associated with metastasis and poor prognosis in colorectal cancer (PMID: 23201163, PMID: 23807160). Downregulation of PRRX1 also results in increased stemness, and is associated with poor prognosis in several tumor types (PMID: 23201163, PMID: 25404478).

SLFN11, schlafen family member 11, encodes for a protein that plays a role in inhibiting the DNA damage response by binding to and destabilizing replication protein A1, a component of the single-stranded DNA binding protein complex (PMID: 26658330). SLFN11 expression is variable among tumor types; however, SLFN11 overexpression is associated with increased sensitivity to DNA damaging agents while decreased expression is linked to resistance (PMID: 22927417, PMID: 26658330, PMID: 27708213).

NECTIN4 (PVRL4), nectin cell adhesion molecule 4, is a member of the nectin family of immunoglobulin-like adhesion molecules, which plays a role in the mediation of cell to cell adhesion thereby affecting cell movement and proliferation (PMID: 25888293). Over expression of NECTIN4 has been observed in a variety of cancer types (PMID: 25888293).

KCNH2, potassium voltage-gated channel subfamily H member 2, is a voltage-gate potassium ion channel that is involved in regulation of cell membrane potential and plays a role in cell proliferation (PMID: 21850047, PMID: 23459091). KCNH2 expression is associated with several tumor types, including ovarian and colorectal cancers (PMID: 21190577).

STAT6, signal transducer and activator of transcription 6, is a STAT family transcription factor that mediates IL-4/13 signaling and differentiation of Th2 immune cells (PMID: 24470978). Loss of STAT6 in mouse models of colitis-associated colon cancer resulted in reduced tumor formation, inflammation, nuclear beta-catenin, and proliferation in the colon relative to wild-type mice (PMID: 28385737).

PDE4DIP, phosphodiesterase 4D interacting protein, anchors phosphodiesterase 4D to the Golgi/centrosome region of the cell, thus is involved in cAMP signaling (PMID: 23055623, PMID: 26562185). PDE4DIP-NTRK1 fusion has been identified in soft tissue sarcoma (PMID: 29606586).

SIRT6, sirtuin 6, is a member of the sirtuin family of proteins that acts as both deacetylase and mono-ADP ribosyltransferase, and is involved in diverse cellular processes including DNA repair, inflammation, apoptosis, proliferation, metabolism, and aging (PMID: 26717993). Dysregulation of Sirt6 expression has been identified in a variety of solid tumors and hematological cancers (PMID: 26717993).

PTPRB, protein tyrosine phosphatase, receptor type B, is primarily expressed in endothelial cells and plays a role in cell spreading and migration (PMID: 24451369). Recurrent mutations in PTPRB have been linked to angiosarcoma (PMID: 24633157).
DCTN1, dynactin subunit 1, interacts with dynein in vesicle and organelle transport along microtubules (UniProt.org). DCTN1 fusions are observed with ALK in solid tumors (PMID: 24445538).

TRAF2, TNF receptor associated factor 2, is an adaptor protein that functions in activation of NF-kappaB and JNK signaling, and plays a role in regulation of apoptosis (PMID: 11875461, PMID: 24362534). TRAF2 amplification has been observed in several tumor types including colorectal, breast, and lung cancers (PMID: 24362534).

ARFRP1, ADP ribosylation factor related protein 1, encodes a small GTPase that functions upstream of ARL1 and ARL5 to promote recruitment of golgins (Golgin-97 and Golgin-245) and GARP to the trans-golgi network (PMID: 31575603; PMID: 16129887).

JAK2, tyrosine-protein kinase JAK2, is a non-receptor protein tyrosine kinase that binds cytokine receptors to activate the interferon-alpha/beta/gamma pathway and is a member of the JAK/STAT signaling pathway (PMID: 15575979, PMID: 30092288). Since JAK2 serves as a downstream signal transmitter of cytokine receptors it is linked to inflammatory processes (PMID: 31398915).

BTK, Bruton tyrosine kinase, is a non-receptor tyrosine kinase involved in B-cell activation, signaling, and development (PMID: 24658273). Additionally, BTK is an important regulator in the developmental progression of pre-B cells, of cell proliferation in mature B-cells and cell survival (PMID: 24658273; PMID: 26341110).

BBC3, BCL2 binding component 3 or PUMA, and is a member of the BH3-only BCL2 protein family that promotes both TP53 dependent and independent apoptosis through inhibition of antiapoptotic BCL2 family members (PMID: 19641508, PMID: 14585351). BBC3 apoptosis can be induced by many stimuli including genotoxic stress, deregulated oncogene expression, toxins, altered redox status, growth factor/cytokine withdrawal and infection (PMID: 19641508).

FANCD2, Fanconi anemia, complementation group D2, is activated by monoubiquitination by the Fanconi anemia core complex, and is a platform for the recruitment of additional proteins that coordinate DNA repair (PMID: 24905007, PMID: 27145721). Additionally FANCD2, has a crucial role in replication fork protection and cytokinesis (PMID: 27145721).

H3C1, H3 clustered histone 1, encodes a member of the histone H3 family, which is a replication-dependent histone, and plays a role in nucleosome assembly and cell division (PMID: 25288118, PMID: 14718166, PMID: 11420717).
H3C6, H3 clustered histone 6, encodes a member of the histone H3 family that plays a role in DNA repair and replication, and differentiation (PMID: 25003966, PMID: 27698205).

HLA-A, HLA class I histocompatibility antigen, and is in complex with beta-2 microglobulin. HLA-A plays a role in the presentation of foreign antigens and tumor-derived peptides to the immune system to eliminate infected or transformed cells (PMID: 17326240; PMID: 7504010).

LATS1, serine/threonine-protein kinase LATS1, is a negative regulator of YAP1 in the Hippo signaling pathway, which plays a role in organ size control and tumor suppression by restricting proliferation and promoting apoptosis (PMID: 24026096; PMID: 28068668).

PARP1, poly (ADP-ribose) polymerase 1, is an enzyme that catalyzes poly (ADP-ribosyl)ation of proteins, which initiates cellular response to DNA damage (PMID: 15743666). Additionally, PARP1 plays a role in the catalysis of initiation, elongation and branching during PAR synthesis (PMID: 30799503).

FGF10, fibroblast growth factor 10, encodes for a member of the fibroblast growth factor family, which plays a role in signaling pathways related to cell proliferation, survival, and growth (PMID: 20094046). FGF10 expression has been associated with colorectal cancer (PMID: 11598623), pancreatic cancer (PMID: 18594526), prostate cancer, and breast cancer (PMID: 30405704).

CDKN2A, cyclin-dependent kinase inhibitor 2A, is a tumor suppressor (PMID: 30562755) that encodes p16 and p14ARF from alternate reading frames, which function to inhibit Cdk4 and Cdk6 and regulate Tp53 activity to promote cell-cycle arrest (PMID: 23875803, PMID: 17055429, PMID: 27428416). CDKN2A germline mutations are associated with familial atypical multiple mole melanoma and somatic mutations are highest in pancreatic, HNSCC, NSCLC, and melanoma (PMID: 27283171).

PDGFA, platelet-derived growth factor alpha polypeptide, is a growth factor that signals through the receptor-tyrosine kinase PDGFR-alpha, which plays a role in development, cell proliferation, and cell migration (PMID: 18483217). Overexpression of PDGFA is associated with several tumor types (PMID: 24359404).

JAK1, janus kinase 1, is a non-receptor protein tyrosine kinase involved in the interferon-alpha/beta/gamma pathway and is a member of the JAK/STAT signaling pathway (PMID: 15575979). JAK1 gain of function mutations have been identified in T-cell neoplasms (PMID: 30079384) and loss of function mutations are associated with high mutational burden and microsatellite instability (PMID: 29121062).

CCND2, cyclin D2, encodes for the D2-type cyclin protein, which regulates CDK kinases in order to promote the transition phases of the cell cycle (PMID: 10416984). CCND2 amplification has been observed in malignant glioma (PMID: 10416984) and glioblastoma (PMID: 31568682), while loss of Ccnd2 expression has been associated with promoter hypermethylation in renal cell cancer (PMID: 27583477) and in breast and lung cancer (PMID: 30308939), and mutations have been reported in AML (PMID: 27843138).

DDX21, DExD-box helicase 21, is a member of the DExD/H box family of proteins that regulates RNA metabolism (PMID: 16935882). A DDX21 fusion with FGFR2 has been identified in cholangiocarcinoma (PMID: 30745300).

RPGR, retinitis pigmentosa GTPase regulator, is a ciliary protein, which acts as a guanine exchange factor for RAB8A and plays a role in protein trafficking in photoreceptors (PMID: 22563985). Germline RPGR mutations are associated with X-linked retinitis pigmentosa (PMID: 32094925) and mutations in RPGR have been reported in breast cancer (PMID: 26474971).

HSBP1, heat shock factor binding protein 1, regulates the activity of HSF1 in stress response and is involved in early embryonic development (PMID: 24380799, PMID: 9649501). Expression levels of HSBP1 have been correlated with prognosis in breast cancer (PMID: 18987994) and overexpression has been reported in oral squamous epithelial carcinoma (PMID: 24816843).

ANXA5, annexin A5, encodes a phospholipid-binding protein in the�Annexin family and is involved in cell membrane repair (PMID: 27286750, PMID: 25701430). Overexpression of ANXA5 has been observed�in hepatocellular carcinoma (PMID: 29802377) and colorectal cancer (PMID: 19461527), and a fusion of ANXA5 with CCNA2 has been identified in endometrioid�ovarian�carcinoma (PMID: 29633253).

FAM175A, Abraxas 1, BRCA1 A Complex Subunit that binds BRCA1 forming a complex with with BACH1 and CTIP. Abraxas recruits ibiquitin interacting motif (UIM) containing Rap80 , both of which are required for DNA damage resistance (PMID: 17525340; PMID:17643122).

TSC2, TSC complex subunit 2 or tuberin, is a tumor supressor that forms a complex with TSC1 (also known as hamartin). The TSC complex inhibits mTOR pathway signaling, thus regulating cell growth, proliferation, and metabolism (PMID: 27226234). Mutations in TSC2 are more common than mutations in TSC1 leading to more frequent and severe TSC associated diseases (PMID: 27226234)

SF3B1, splicing factor 3b, subunit 1, is a core member of the U2 small nuclear ribonucleoprotein complex of the spliceosome and is involved in early stages of splicing (PMID: 25510282, PMID: 26842708). Knockdown of SF3B1 can lead to apoptosis, cell cycle arrest, and delayed erythroid differentiation (PMID: 29433555).

RAF1, Raf-1 proto-oncogene, serine/threonine kinase, is a member of the Raf family of serine/threonine protein kinases and is activated by Ras to stimulate Mek/Erk to promote cell proliferation (PMID: 21577205, PMID: 31285551) and plays a role in metabolism, motility, and differentiation (PMID: 28978120). Raf1 fusion proteins have been identify in several tumor types, including pilocytic astrocytoma (PMID: 27810072), soft tissue sarcoma (PMID: 30314519), breast cancer (PMID: 29203461), and melanoma (PMID: 30835257) and Raf1 missene mutations have been observed in lung cancer (PMID: 31285551).

PIM1, Pim-1 proto-oncogene, serine/threonine kinase, is a member of the constitutively active PIM kinase family and involved in the regulation of B lymphocytes (PMID: 23495171). PIM1 overexpression and amplification have been linked to tumorigenesis in solid tumor and hematological malignancies (PMID: 21993851).

CSTF3, cleavage stimulation factor subunit 3, is a component of the active cleavage stimulation factor, which mediates mRNA precursor polyadenylation (PMID: 7984242). CSTF3 fusion has been identified in melanoma (PMID: 28539463).

THBS1, thrombospondin 1, is an extracellular matrix glycoprotein induced by TGFB1 (PMID: 26850833) and plays a role in negative regulation of angiogenesis (PMID: 26075074). Decreased expression of Thbs1 has been associated with poor outcomes in lung adenocarcinoma (PMID: 27513329) and the THBS1 promoter is commonly hypermethylated in male ductal carcinoma in situ (PMID: 30921768), however in oral squamous cell carcinoma, Thbs1 promotes cell migration and invasion (PMID: 26850833).

SOAT1, sterol O-acyltransferase 1, catalyzes the formation of fatty acid-cholesterol esters (PMID: 29567472) and thereby is a cholesterol regulator (PMID: 28595267). Overexpression of Soat1 in a hepatocellular carcinoma patient-derived xenograft model was responsive to Avasimibe treatment (PMID: 30814741).
