H2AX, histone H2AX, encodes a member of the histone H2A family and plays a role in transcription regulation, DNA repair, DNA replication, and chromosomal stability (PMID: 27813335). H2AX phosphorylation is a biomarker for DNA double-strand break in human cancer progression (PMID: 24206133; PMID: 24164298, PMID: 27813335).

FANCL, Fanconi anemia, complementation group L, is a member of the Fanconi anemia core complex, which plays a role in DNA repair (PMID: 27145721, PMID: 24905007). Germline FANCL mutations are associated with Fanconi anemia, which involves predisposition to various cancers, and are associated with hereditary breast cancer (PMID: 25237197, PMID: 26822949).

KDM4B, lysine (K)-specific demethylase 4B, is a Jumonji domain histone demethylase, regulating gene transcription through chromatin remodeling to affect cell growth and differentiation (PMID: 24349617). KDM4B expression may play a role in prostate cancer, ER-positive breast cancer (PMID: 24349617) and amplifies p53-dependent growth of colon cancer cells (PMID: 28073943).

HLA-B, major histocompatibility complex, class I, B, is a highly polymorphic and ubiquitously expressed gene that plays a role in the presentation of antigens to immune system (PMID: 17326240). Loss of HLA-B antigen specificity has been demonstrated in colon carcinoma (PMID: 2462591).

SVOPL, SVOP like, is a member of the solute carrier family 22 (SLC22) family of transporter proteins with uncharacterized biological function (PMID: 17714910). SVOPL has been identified in a fusion with BRAF in uterus endometrial adenocarcinoma (PMID: 26314551).

MAGEA3, melanoma-associated antigen 3, is a member of the cancer testis antigen (CTA) family that has normal, restricted expression in the testis (PMID: 30588194). Abnormal expression of Magea3 has been reported in a number of solid tumor types including, melanoma, breast cancer, head and neck cancer, lung cancer, gastric cancer, skin squamous cell carcinoma, colorectal cancer (PMID: 30588194), and urothelial bladder cancer (PMID: 30384365, PMID: 29058301), and is often correlated with poor prognosis and resistance to immune checkpoint blockade (PMID: 29656892).

XRCC1, X-ray repair cross complementing 1, is a member of the XRCC genes that is involved in DNA base excision repair and single-strand breaks repair (PMID: 25795425). XRCC1 polymorphism may be associated with reduced risk in various cancers (PMID:12496039).

GID4, GID complex subunit 4 homolog, encodes a subunit of the C-terminal to LisH complex, which is homologous to the yeast GID E3 ubiquitin ligase complex (PMID: 28659384, PMID: 29911972). Increased GID4 expression has been identified in undifferentiated sarcoma (PMID: 30889380).

TNS1, tensin 1, encodes for a focal adhesion molecule that links the actin cytoskeleton to integrins, and comprises a SH2 domain rendering it capable of binding phosphotyrosines such as PI3 kinase and FAK (PMID: 28486112). The FGFR2-TNS1 fusion has been identified in triple-receptor negative breast cancer (PMID: 29203461).

HSF1, heat shock factor protein 1, is a heat shock responsive transcription factor that upon stress, induces transcription of a number of genes in the HSP family (PMID: 25465722, PMID: 26754925).  Hsf1 overexpression and altered phosphorylation status has been observed in several tumor types, including hepatocellular (PMID: 25199534), osteosarcoma (PMID: 28370690), ccRCC (PMID: 28617974), ovarian (PMID: 28487934), breast (PMID: 28598816), and ESCC (PMID: 28454329).

SSTR4, somatostatin receptor 4, is a member of the somatostatin family of G protein-coupled receptors that regulates endocrine and exocrine secretions (PMID: 16625838). Aberrant Sstr4 expression has been identified in a variety of tumors including breast, gallbladder , and prostate cancer (PMID: 25075022, PMID: 23991955, PMID: 20646346).

MAP3K9, mitogen-activated protein kinase kinase kinase 9, is a mixed-lineage kinase family member that plays a role in the activation the Jnk and Mek/Erk pathways (PMID: 30290304, PMID: 11416147). MAP3K9 has been shown to be frequently mutated in melanoma (PMID: 23836671, PMID: 22197930).

AGO2, protein argonaute-2, is a regulator of RNA mediated gene silencing (RNAi) in cells. AGO2 expression has been demonstrated to be reduced in some melanomas (PMID: 24169347) and upregulated in some epithelial cancers such as HNSCC (PMID: 22025453, PMID: 28591738).

BIRC5, baculoviral IAP repeat containing 5, belongs to the Inhibitor of Apoptosis (IAP) gene family, and thus, plays a role in preventing apoptosis. BIRC5 is often overexpressed in many different types of cancers (PMID: 18075512).

FAT3, FAT atypical cadherin 3, is a transmembrane receptor that functions in cell-cell adhesion and interacts with the actin cytoskeleton (PMID: 27942226, PMID: 23493187). Decreased Fat3 expression has been observed in advanced lung adenocarcinoma (PMID: 19812696) and somatic mutations in pancreatic acinar cell carcinoma (PMID: 25743105).

ITGB3, integrin subunit beta 3, forms heterodimers with alpha chain integrin subunits to regulate cell adhesion (PMID: 29342970), cytoskeletal remodeling, and signaling through Src and Fak kinases (PMID: 29439184). Overexpression of Itgb3 in cancer cell lines suggests a role in chemoresistance (PMID: 30563517), metastasis (PMID: 29449539, PMID: 29151962), and epithelial-mesenchymal transition (PMID: 30563517) and Itgb3 overexpression has been observed in acute myeloid leukemia (PMID: 29342970).

CCNI2, cyclin-I2, interacts and activates Cdk5 in the cytoplasm and cell membrane, and likely plays a role in cell cycle progression and cell proliferation (PMID: 28112194). Decreased expression of Ccni2 decreases cell proliferation in cell culture (PMID: 28112194).

AFAP1L2, actin filament associated protein 1 like 2, is an adapter protein that binds to actin and activates Src signaling, thus regulates cell survival, motility, and morphology (PMID: 26998266). AFAP1L2 expression has been identified in esophageal, gastric, pancreatic, breast, prostate cancer and osteosarcoma (PMID: 22805860, PMID: 22927913, PMID: 24581082, PMID: 26191231, PMID: 26045762, PMID: 27509056).

CEP43, centrosomal protein 43, is an FGFR1 oncogene partner and a centrosomal protein required to anchor microtubules to centrosomes (PMID: 16314388). A meta-analysis identified a SNP within CEP43 that associated with lung cancer risk (PMID: 26905588) and fusions with FGFR1 have been observed in myeloproliferative disorders (PMID: 11689702).

MAPK9, mitogen-activated protein kinase 9, is a serine/threonine c-Jun NH2-terminal kinase (JNK) that acts in signaling cascades to regulate gene expression, cell proliferation, differentiation and development and apoptosis (PMID: 15077147). MAP kinase signaling cascades are often dysregulated in cancer (PMID: 15077147).

TCF12, transcription factor 12, belongs to the bHLH family of transcription factors and plays a role in regulation of several biological processes, including T-cell development and neuronal and myogenic differentiation (PMID: 29163030, PMID: 22577461, PMID: 16847330). TCF12 mutations have been observed in anaplastic oligodendroglioma (PMID: 26068201), and a fusion between TCF12 and NR4A3 has been demonstrated in extraskeletal myxoid chondrosarcoma (PMID: 24746215).

SSBP1, single stranded DNA binding protein 1, is a mitochondrial DNA binding protein that plays a role in mitochondrial DNA replication and repair (PMID: 26676758, PMID: 28486639). SSBP1 overexpression has been observed in colorectal cancer (PMID: 31819642), and decreased SSBP1 expression has been identified in several tumor types including breast carcinoma, glioblastoma, and renal carcinoma (PMID: 26676758).

TEAD2, TEA domain family member 2, is a transcription factor which functions through the Hippo pathway to regulate cell proliferation and apoptosis (PMID: 18579750). Abnormal expression of Tead2 has been reported in gastric and colorectal cancers (PMID: 25557945).

APC, adenomatous polyposis coli, is a tumor suppressor (PMID: 30562755) and multi-domain protein regulating numerous cellular functions through interaction with beta-catenin and subsequent inhibition of Wnt signalling (PMID: 10959075). APC germline mutations are associated with familial adenomatous polyposis (PMID: 30562755) and somatic mutations with colon, endometrial, NSCLC, and breast cancers (PMID: 27283171).

NFKB1, nuclear factor kappa B subunit 1, encodes for a member of the NF-kappa B transcription factor family and plays a regulatory role in a number of cellular processes including stress responses, immunity, cell proliferation and apoptosis, and inflammation (PMID: 19519322, PMID: 26663363). NFKB1 acts as an oncogene or tumor suppressor, depending on context (PMID: 30205516), and increased NFKB1 activity has been associated with a variety of cancer types (PMID: 23915189) and somatic NFKB1 mutations have been observed in breast cancer (PMID: 22302350).

DDX3X, DEAD-box helicase 3, X-linked, is a member of the DEAD-box RNA helicase family, and plays a role in several cellular processes including translation initiation, cell-cycle regulation, and cell survival (PMID: 26541825, PMID: 27180681). DDX3X mutations have been demonstrated in several tumor types, including leukemias and medulloblastoma (PMID: 26541825, PMID: 27180681).

TOP2A, DNA topoisomerase II alpha, is one of the isozymes of DNA topoisomerase II that resolves topological problems during DNA replication, transcription and chromosome segregation (PMID: 19377505). Altered TOP2A copy number and expression have been identified in breast (PMID: 22612507), ovarian (PMID: 19270648), gall bladder (PMID: 18204862), and nasopharyngeal cancer (PMID: 23897556).

COX2, cytochrome c oxidase subunit 2, is one of 13 subunits that form Complex IV (CIV) in the mitochondrial respiratory chain (PMID: 28521807). Decreased expression of COX2 has been observed in prostate cancer (PMID: 18409190) and somatic variants have been identified in MUTYH-associated polyposis (PMID: 26138249).

TXN, thioredoxin, encodes for an antioxidant protein and plays a role in a variety of cellular functions including cell growth, survival, and apoptosis (PMID: 21453190). TXN over expression has been observed in several tumor types such as hepatocellular carcinoma, osteosarcoma, and melanoma (PMID: 28011619).

SOX2, SRY-box transcription factor 2, plays a significant role in the determination and reprogramming of cell fate via gene expression regulation, which often requires cofactors such as OCT4, KLF4, and cMYC  (PMID: 31477842). SOX2 enables the derivation of human induced pluripotent stem cells (iPSCs) from terminally differentiated somatic cells (PMID: 24083387; PMID: 31477842).

NTRK3 (TRKC), neurotrophic receptor tyrosine kinase 3, is a  membrane receptor tyrosine kinase and is a tumor suppressor or oncogene, depending on context (PMID: 23396845). NTRK3 binds neurotrophins, initiating signaling cascades that lead to cell growth and differentiation. Additionally, NTRK3 has been described as a dependence receptor that induces apoptosis when ligand-free (PMID: 23396845).

MEF2B, myocyte enhancer factor 2B, encodes a transcription factor that targets genes involved in cell movement, growth, proliferation, differentiation, metabolism and apoptosis (PMID: 26506234). Additionally, MEF2 has roles in tissue development such as the differentiation of vascular smooth cells and cardiac muscle (PMID: 26245647; PMID: 26506234, PMID: 17003108, PMID: 25550204).

MEN1, multiple endocrine neoplasia I, encodes for menin and is a scaffold protein that can function with various partners to control gene transcription, signal transduction, and genome integrity (PMID: 23850066).

MUTYH, mutY DNA glycosylase, encodes for an enzyme that is part of the base excision pathway, which is responsible for excising an adenine that was inserted into the DNA to pair with the oxidation base lesion, 8-Oxoguanine (PMID: 21235684).

ERG, v-ets avian erythroblastosis virus E26 oncogene homolog, encodes for a transcription factor that is a member of the ETS family and plays a role in developmental processes, apoptosis, cell proliferation, angiogenesis and differentiation in endothelial and hematopoietic cells (PMID: 22279422). Fusions of TMPRSS2-ERG are common in prostate cancer (PMID: 22279422, PMID: 28849022).

PIK3R5, phosphoinositide 3-kinase regulatory subunit 5, encodes the regulatory subunit of the PI3K gamma complex that is activated downstream of GPCRs to affect cell signaling, chemotaxis and transformation (PMID: 24190998). PIK3R5 missense mutations have been identified in metastatic melanoma patients (PMID: 22912864).

EBF1, early B-cell factor 1, is a transcription factor that regulates development of B lymphocytes, bone, adipose tissue, and neuronal progenitor cells (PMID: 19996307). Loss of EBF1 has been found in acute lymphoblastic leukemia and pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma (PMID: 19996307).

MACF1, microtubule actin crosslinking factor 1, is a member of the spectraplakin family of cytoskeletal linkers that plays diverse roles in cell proliferation, migration, and development (PMID: 28577926). MACF1 aberrations have been identified in glioblastoma, breast, lung, and colon cancer (PMID: 28782898).

TFEB, transcription factor EB, is a transcription factor that regulates lysosomal function and biogenesis, thus involves in cellular response to stress conditions (PMID: 27298091). TFEB fusions have been identified in a subset of renal cell carcinoma (PMID:  27298091).

CEACAM5, carcinoembryonic antigen-related cell adhesion molecule 5, is a tumor associated antigen with limited expression in normal tissue (PMID: 29736411). Overexpression of Ceacam5 has been observed in metastatic lesions from breast cancer patients (PMID: 29736411) and may be prognostic for early gastric cancer (PMID: 26374829).

PTK2B, protein tyrosine kinase 2 beta, is a focal adhesion kinase family member that plays a role in regulation of cellular signaling pathways involved in cell adhesion, migration, immune cell development and function, and bone remodeling (PMID: 21482413, PMID: 20001213). Overexpression of PTK2B is associated with progression of several tumor types (PMID: 20001213) and PTK2B missense mutations have been observed in uveal melanoma (PMID: 31671564).

PIK3C2G, phosphatidylinositol-4-phosphate 3-kinase catalytic subunit type 2 gamma, is a class II PI3K that plays a role in metabolism and regulation of insulin-dependent signaling (PMID: 30691999, PMID: 30884740). PIK3C2G mutations have been identified in intrahepatic cholangiocarcinoma (PMID: 26717940).

LRP1B, LDL receptor related protein 1B, is a  tumor repressor (PMID: 20095042) and a cell surface receptor (PMID: 11384978) that may negatively regulate urokinase plasminogen activator receptor regeneration and cell migration (PMID: 12194987). Mutations in LRP1B are frequently observed in melanoma, lung cancer, esophageal squamous-cell carcinoma, head and neck squamous cancer, and gastric cancer (PMID: 31164891) and may be associated with high tumor mutational burden (PMID: 31164891, PMID: 31493933).

RAD18, RAD18, E3 ubiquitin protein ligase, encodes for a ubiquitin ligase protein that forms a complex with RAD6 and is involved in the DNA repair pathway (PMID: 10884424). A RAD18 fusion with BRAF was identified in a patient with melanoma (PMID: 26314551).

BRD4, bromodomain containing protein 4, is a member of the bromodomain and extraterminal (BET) protein family and functions in chromatin remodeling and regulation of c-MYC. BRD4 fusions with NUTM1 (t15;19) are commonly found in the NUT midline subset of squamous cell carcinomas (PMID: 24736545).

BCOR, BCL6 corepressor, functions with B-cell CLL/lymphoma 6 (BCL6) as a transcriptional silencer (PMID: 10898795, PMID: 16943429) and also suppresses MLLT3 (AF9) transcriptional activity (PMID: 12776190). BCOR mutations from internal tandem duplication (ITD; PMID: 28687574) and loss of function mutations are commonly found in hematological cancers (PMID: 28827447) and are also found in retinoblastoma and sarcomas of the bone and kidney (PMID: 28827447).

APLNR, apelin receptor, is a G-protein coupled receptor that plays a role in a variety of physiological processes related to maintaining homeostasis including angiogenesis, cardiovascular function, fluid homeostasis, and metabolism (PMID: 23943882). Loss of function APLNR mutations, which are associated with reduced T-cell function, have been identified in lung cancer and melanoma (PMID: 28783722).

NFASC, neurofascin, is a cell adhesion protein, which plays a role in neurite out-growth, synaptogenesis, and axonal guidance (PMID: 22306302). NFASC fusions have been identified in glioblastoma multiforme (PMID: 24647444).

MALAT1, metastasis associated lung adenocarcinoma transcript 1, is a long non-coding RNA that regulates gene expression and signaling pathways (PMID: 29928382). Upregulation of MALAT1 has been identified in a variety of human cancers (PMID: 29928382) and MALAT1 fusions have been observed in TNBC and high-grade serous ovarian cancer (PMID: 31745703).

LAMTOR1, late endosomal/lysosomal adaptor, MAPK and MTOR activator 1, acts as the anchor protein for a complex that functions to tether mTORC1 to lysosomes, which plays a role in activation of mTORC1 and in T-cell function (PMID: 29158492, PMID: 28768723, PMID: 24377928). A fusion between LAMTOR1 and AKT1 has been identified in an indeterminate epithelioid neoplasm (PMID: 30877085), and a fusion with PRKCD has been identified in benign fibrous histocytoma (PMID: 24721208, PMID: 26432191).

SUPT16H, SPT16 homolog facilitates chromatin remodeling subunit, is a component of the FACT (facilitates chromatin transcription) complex, which regulates nucleosome organization (PMID: 21969370) and has histone chaperone activity (PMID: 26841762). Overexpression of Supt16h has been observed in pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma cell lines (PMID: 25402820).

FGFR2, fibroblast growth factor receptor 2, is a receptor tyrosine kinase activated upon binding of the FGF ligand, which activates RAS-MAPK and PI3K-AKT pathways (PMID: 22508544).  Altered function of FGFR2 through activating mutations, fusions, and amplification increases cell proliferation and tumorigenesis (PMID: 22508544) and is observed in prostate (PMID: 30761180), breast, lung, uterine, and ovarian cancers (PMID: 29104507), while FGFR2 amplification (PMID: 31076567) and overexpression (PMID: 30662521) is commonly observed in gastric cancer.

RUFY2, RUN and FYVE domain containing 2, is a downstream effector of Etk, which upon phosphorylation localizes to the endosome (PMID: 11877430). A RUFY2 fusion with RET was identified in lung cancer (PMID: 25384085).

DIS3, DIS3 homolog, exosome endoribonuclease and 3'-5' exoribonuclease, encodes a catalytic subunit of the endosome, which is involved in the processing of small RNAs, regulation of gene expression, and mRNA quality control (PMID: 26193331). DIS3 mutations have been identified in multiple myeloma (PMID: 25521164), and altered expression has been identified in multiple cancers (PMID: 26193331), including overexpression in colorectal carcinoma (PMID: 24478024), and decreased expression in chronic lymphocytic leukemia (PMID: 17047154).

DUSP22, dual specificity phosphatase 22, regulates diverse signaling pathways including MAPK, JNK, and STAT3 pathways, thus may play a role in inflammation and cell proliferation (PMID: 19228121). DUSP22 rearrangement is common in ALK-negative anaplastic large cell lymphoma (PMID: 21030553, PMID: 26379151, PMID: 31278738).

DNMT3B, DNA (cytosine-5-)-methyltransferase 3 beta, is a de novo DNA methyltransferase involved in establishing methylation state during development (PMID: 24822169). DNMT3B is overexpressed in several tumor types, and is associated with hypermethylation in tumor pathogenesis  (PMID: 24822169).

GNAQ, G protein subunit alpha q, is a guanine-binding protein (G protein) subunit, which is activated following ligand binding to G-protein coupled receptors and functions in cell signaling (PMID: 27148356). GNAQ hotspot mutations impair intrinsic GTPase activity, resulting in constitutive pathway activation and are common in uveal melanoma (PMID: 23640210, PMID: 27148356).

SP3, Sp3 transcription factor, is a member of the Specificity Protein/Kruppel-like Factor (SP/KLF) family of transcription factors and plays a role in regulation of cell division and differentiation (PMID: 20810260, PMID: 26967243). SP3 over expression has been demonstrated in rhabdomyosarcoma and hepatocellular carcinoma (PMID: 26352013, PMID: 22815231).

BARD1, BRCA1 associated RING domain 1, forms a heterodimer with Brca1, which functions as an E3 ubiquitin ligase and mediator of DNA repair through homology-directed repair (HDR) (PMID: 8944023, PMID: 30925164) and centrosome regulation (PMID: 29858377). Germline mutations in BARD1 are associated with increased susceptibility to breast and ovarian cancers (PMID: 21344236) and somatic mutations are highest in colon and endometrial cancers (PMID: 27283171).

SMAD3, SMAD family member 3, is a transcription factor (PMID: 30589983) and mediator of TGF beta signaling (PMID: 23139211) that plays a role in inflammation (PMID: 30659096). A fusion of SMAD3 with EWSR1 has been identified in spindle cell tumors (PMID: 29309308) and somatic mutations have been identified in colorectal cancer (PMID: 23139211).

DYRK1A, dual specificity tyrosine-(Y)-phosphorylation regulated kinase 1A, encodes for a protein kinase known to target genes involved in growth, development, cell proliferation, and apoptosis (PMID: 20167603). Overexpression of DYRK1A has been associated with cancer, but it also exhibits tumor suppressor characteristics, which is dependent on the cellular context (PMID: 25795597).

TNF, tumor necrosis factor, is a cytokine member of the TNF superfamily (PMID: 29484738) and is mainly produced by macrophages in response to inflammation (PMID: 30585274). Due to the potent anti-tumor effects of Tnf, its role in immunotherapy is under  rapid investigation, but has been hampered, to date, due to high toxicity associated with administration of systemic Tnf (PMID: 30170620, PMID: 29484738).

MSH3, mutS homolog 3, encodes for one of the DNA mismatch repair proteins, which forms a stable heterodimer with MSH2 in order to recognize and repair mismatched DNA (PMID: 8942985). Somatic MSH3 mutations have been identified in colon, lung, and breast cancers, and oral squamous cell carcinoma while MSH3 polymorphisms, which may be associated with increased risk, have been observed in ovarian and prostate cancers, and non-small cell lung carcinoma (PMID: 25966119).

BCL2, BCL2, apoptosis regulator, belongs to the BCL-2 family of proteins, and plays a role in the regulation of cell death, specifically preventing apoptosis and some processes related to necrosis (PMID: 9990505). Overexpression of BCL2 has been observed in a variety of solid tumors, including lung, ovary, and breast, and amplification has been identified in DLBCL (PMID: 26556430, PMID: 9242549).

GATA3, trans-acting T-cell-specific transcription factor, is a zinc-finger transcription factor that regulates development and differentiation (PMID: 7550312) and plays a vital role in immune function (PMID: 21924928). GATA3 regulates tumor differentiation in breast cancer (PMID: 20189993, PMID: 28703335) and suppresses neoplastic transformation of urothelial cells (PMID: 25232488).

LYN, LYN proto-oncogene, Src family tyrosine kinase, is a non-receptor tyrosine kinase that plays a role in regulation of cell signaling and immune function (PMID: 25173936). Activating mutations in LYN are associated with drug resistance in breast cancer, and a LYN fusion with ETV6 has been observed in leukemia (PMID: 21492125, PMID: 25401474).

IKZF1, IKAROS family zinc finger 1, is a zinc finger transcription factor that regulates hematopoietic differentiation and immune system development, and functions as a tumor suppressor (PMID: 24659638, PMID: 22150303). Mutations in IKZF1 are associated with acute lymphoblastic leukemia (PMID: 24659638, PMID: 22150303) and IKZF1 deletions have been observed in pediatric precursor B-cell ALL (PMID: 31076445).
CACNA1S, calcium voltage-gated channel subunit alpha1 S, encodes the alpha-1 subunit of an L-type voltage-dependent skeletal muscle calcium channel (PMID: 11260227).

NADK, NAD kinase, is a kinase that convert NAD to NADP, therefore regulates cellular redox homeostasis (PMID: 2987053). Overexpression and mutation of Nadk has been identified in a variety of tumors (PMID: 27582489).

MED23, mediator complex subunit 23, is a subunit of mediator, a complex involved in regulating expression of most RNA polymerase II transcripts. MED23 acts in several complexes that integrate signaling and has been demonstrated necessary for Ras-active lung cancer (PMID: 22988093), but protective against esophageal squamous cell carcinoma (PMID: 23625751).

NUTM2A, NUT family member 2A, is a member of the NUT family gene with unknown function (PMID: 28622181). NUTM2A fusions have been identified in uterine sarcoma (PMID: 28622181), including uterine angiosarcoma (PMID: 26352549) and also in endometrial uterine sarcoma (PMID: 26990025).

SMG6, telomerase-binding protein EST1A, is a subunit of the telomerase ribonucleoprotein (RNP) complex and may play a role in regulation of telomere length (PMID: 12699629) and nonsense-mediated mRNA decay (PMID: 20930030). A SMG6?ALK fusion has been observed in lung adenocarcinoma (PMID: 29667179).

CDH11, cadherin 11, is a cell adhesion molecule and type II cadherin, which regulates mesenchymal stem cell differentiation and tissue morphogenesis, and plays a role in inflammatory response (PMID: 23657489, PMID: 25771201). Overexpression of Cdh11 is associated with poor recurrence-free survival in breast cancer patients (PMID: 24810778), and hypermethylation of CDH11 promoter is commonly observed in many cancers, including breast, hepatocellular, and gastric carcinomas (PMID: 22139084).

NRF1, nuclear respiratory factor 1, is a transcription factor that regulates expression of genes involved in mitochondrial biogenesis and functions in cell-cycle progression (PMID: 30486409) and cellular homeostasis (PMID: 30267745). Overexpression of Nrf1 has been observed in breast cancer (PMID: 30486409) and an NRF1-BRAF fusion has been reported in pleomorphic xanthoastrocytoma (PMID: 27624885).

PDS5B, PDS5 cohesin associated factor B, is a member of the cohesin complex, which plays a key role in centromere and sister chromatid cohesion, and regulates chromosome segregation, homologous recombination, and differentiation of stem cells (PMID: 15855230, PMID: 20383194, PMID: 24141881, PMID: 24854081, PMID: 27924011). Mutations in PDS5B and loss of Pds5b expression have been demonstrated in gastric and colorectal cancer with microsatellite instability (PMID: 23850494).

RPS6KA5, ribosomal protein S6 kinase alpha-5, is a mitogen and stress activated kinase (MSK) that phosphorylates a number of transcription factors including, CREB1 and ATF1, to promote cell proliferation and may regulate the immune system (PMID: 29327245). Overexpression of Rps6ka5 has been observed with increased survival in breast cancer patients (PMID: 29327245) and poor prognosis in colorectal cancer (PMID: 28314603) and glioma (PMID: 30020192).

MSLN, mesothelin, is a cell surface antigen that is highly expressed in tumor cells and mesothelium (PMID: 8552591). Overexpression of Msln has been identified in a variety of cancers (PMID: 27863199).

BCL9, BCL9 transcription coactivator, is a nuclear transcriptional regulator that regulates the Wnt/beta-catenin (CTNNB1) signaling pathway (PMID: 29786110). Overexpression of BCL9 has been observed in adrenocortical carcinoma (PMID: 29428231), hepatocellular carcinoma (PMID: 28074862), and colon cancer (PMID: 30009824) and a MEF2D - BCL9 fusion has been identified in acute B-Cell precursor lymphoblastic leukemia (PMID: 27019113).

NR4A3, nuclear receptor subfamily 4 group A member 3, is a ligand-independent nuclear receptor that plays a role in the transcriptional activation of genes involved in inflammation, proliferation, differentiation, and survival (PMID: 20631354). Alterations in NR4A3 expression levels and NR4A3 fusions have been linked to a variety of cancer types (PMID: 22566377).
CRB3, crumbs 3, cell polarity complex component, regulates and maintains epithelial polarity, therefore is involved in epithelial-mesenchymal transition and cancer development (PMID: 25552927).

SLC66A1, solute carrier family 66 member 1, encodes lysosomal amino acid transporter 1 homolog, which functions in transport of lysine, arginine, and histidine to maintain amino acid homeostasis (PMID: 23169667, PMID: 22822152).

IFIT2, interferon-induced protein with tetratricopeptide repeats 2, is a member of the IRF-inducible gene family that plays a role in the immune defense against RNA viruses and promotes apoptosis (PMID: 30234477). Decreased expression of Ifit2 in gastric cancer has been associated with tumor progression and poor prognosis (PMID: 29316541).

CDK20, cyclin-dependent kinase 20, also known as cell cycle-related kinase (CCRK), plays a role in the regulation of cell proliferation and growth (PMID: 28534518). Overexpression of Cdk20 has been reported in a variety of solid tumor types, including glioblastoma, liver ovarian, lung, and colorectal cancers (PMID: 28534518) and Cdk20 inhibition may enhance efficacy of immunotherapies (PMID: 29360538).

ARAF, A-Raf proto-oncogene, serine/threonine kinase, is a member of the raf family of serine/threonine protein kinases, which plays a role in cell proliferation and growth (PMID: 17535970). ARAF mutations have been observed in lung adenocarcinoma (PMID: 24569458).

RPS6KC1, ribosomal protein S6 kinase C1, encodes for a protein that binds to sphingosine kinase-1, thereby potentially playing a role in sphingosine 1 phosphate signaling, which may lead to various cellular activities including cell growth, survival, and motility (PMID: 12077123). RPS6KC1 fused to AKT3 has been identified in breast cancer (PMID: 29242214).

H3-4, H3.4 histone, encodes a member of the histone H3 family that is highly expressed in testis, and potentially plays a role in nucleosome assembly in germ cells (PMID: 8986613). Mutations in H3-4 have been identified in colon cancer (PMID: 22895193).

SLC16A7, solute carrier family 16 member 7, is transmembrane protein that catalyzes proton-linked monocarboxylate transport, which plays a role in cellular metabolism (PMID: 23506875, PMID: 22131303). Hyper and hypomethylation of SLC16A7 promoter regions have been observed in prostate cancer (PMID: 26035357).

CCNC, cyclin-C, forms a mediator complex with Ckd8 to mediate transcription of RNA polymerase II-dependent genes (PMID: 28357211, PMID: 22035865). CCNC amplification and overexpression have been observed in breast cancer (PMID: 26452386) and CCNC gene deletion has been reported in T-cell acute lymphoblastic leukemia (PMID: 25344755).

GLI3, GLI family zinc finger 3, is a transcription factor acting in the Sonic Hedgehog signaling pathway in developmental regulation (PMID: 11001584) and functions as a transcriptional repressor or activator depending on downstream processing of the GLI3 mRNA or protein (PMID: 30272273). GLI3 overexpression is associated with resistance to cyclopamine in pancreatic adenocarcinoma (PMID: 20814245), while knockdown of GLI3 expression in oral squamous cell carcinoma cells promotes proliferation (PMID: 30272273) and decreased GLI3 expression has been observed in acute myeloid leukemia (PMID: 28487292).

RYR1, ryanodine receptor 1, is a calcium channel protein that regulates calcium signaling through cycling calcium between cytoplasm and intracellular caicium storage (PMID: 27855725). RYR1 mutations have been identified in non-small cell lung cancer (PMID: 31290993).

FRS2, fibroblast growth factor receptor substrate 2, is an adaptor protein required for FGFR signaling, which is involved in cell proliferation, differentiation, and survival (PMID: 23393200). Amplification of FRS2 has been demonstrated in liposarcoma and ovarian cancer (PMID: 23393200, PMID: 25368431).

FXR1, FMR1 autosomal homolog 1, is an RNA-binding protein that regulates expression of genes involved in cell differentiation, development, and immune response (PMID: 27458872). Elevated expression of Fxr1 has been detected in head and neck squamous cell cancer, colorectal cancer, and lung cancer (PMID: 30755307, PMID: 26404134, PMID: 25733852).

CXCL8, C-X-C motif chemokine ligand 8, also know as interleukin-8, is a member of the CXC chemokine family that regulates the inflammatory response by attracting neutrophils, basophils, and T-cells and also plays a role in angiogenesis (PMID: 28026024, PMID: 30200105, PMID: 28866366). Overexpression of Cxcl8 has been observed in a number of tumor types including, melanoma, breast, ovarian, renal, prostate, pancreatic, gastric, colorectal, bladder, and prostate (PMID: 30200105).
STAT3, signal transducer and activator of transcription 3, is a transcription factor that is frequently activated in tumors (PMID: 26478441).

RAD54L, RAD54-like, is a member of the SWI2/SNF2 family of dsDNA-dependent ATPases, which functions in homologous recombination in DNA repair (PMID: 20089461, PMID: 21704205). Overexpression of RAD54L has been demonstrated in non-small cell lung cancer (PMID: 21412013).

TNFRSF8 (CD30), TNF receptor superfamily member 8, encodes for a receptor found on activated T- and B-cells (PMID: 28521633) and stimulation results in NF-kappaB induction, thereby playing a role in cell survival (PMID: 9032281, PMID: 31758531). Overexpression of TNFRSF8 (CD30) has been observed in various types of lymphoma including Hodgkin's lymphoma and anaplastic large cell lymphoma (PMID: 23904233).

PRKAR1A, protein kinase cAMP-dependent type I regulatory subunit alpha, is a major component of Pka which mediates cAMP-dependent signaling (PMID: 26042218). Inactivation of PRKAR1A is associated with Carney complex (PMID: 20301463) and adrenocortical tumors (PMID: 26042218).

DNM3, dynamin 3, encodes for a member of the GTPase family and plays a role in endocytic vesicle formation by the facilitation of fission via GTP hydrolysis (PMID: 22233676). Promoter methylation of DNM3, resulting in decreased expression, has been observed in hepatocellular carcinoma (PMID: 28599479, PMID: 24143113), and DNM3 has been identified as the second gene partner in a fusion with FGFR2 in triple-receptor negative breast cancer (PMID: 29203461).

DSPP, dentin sialophosphoprotein, belongs to the SIBLING family of glycophosphoproteins and is involved in mineralization of dentin and bone (PMID: 18292776). Upregulation of DSPP is associated with oral squamous cell carcinoma and prostate cancer (PMID: 21103065, PMID: 16108038, PMID: 27331624).

INHBA, inhibin subunit beta A, is a TGF-beta superfamily member that encodes the beta A subunit of Activin and has roles in development, cell self-renewal, and differentiation (PMID: 23787160, PMID: 24085226). Overexpression of INHBA is associated with several tumor types, including head and neck squamous cell carcinoma (PMID: 31586103) and gastric cancer (PMID: 30718100), and has been correlated with poor prognosis (PMID: 24085226, PMID: 19308293, PMID: 29950896).

GLI2, GLI family zinc finger 2, is a transcription factor acting in the Sonic Hedgehog signaling pathway of developmental regulation and is also induced by TGF-beta independently of hedgehog. Crosstalk from hedgehog and TGF-beta may create a cycle that amplifies GLI2-dependent metastasis (PMID: 21862631).

PVT1, Pvt1 oncogene (non-protein coding), is a long non-coding RNA containing four miRNAs, 1204-1207, (PMID: 22832581), which may play a role in the regulation of the TGF-beta/Smad pathway (PMID: 29845201) and the Pvt1 promoter competes with Myc for enhancer binding, thereby regulating Myc expression (PMID: 29731168). Overexpression of Pvt1 has been observed in pancreatic cancer (PMID: 29845201), hepatocellular carcinoma (PMID: 29975928), and colorectal cancer (PMID: 29512788) and a fusion with Myc has been observed in medulloblastoma (PMID: 22832581).

FGF14, fibroblast growth factor 14, is a fibroblast growth factor that plays a role in neural development and function through interaction with Ib2 and sodium channels (PMID: 19621416, PMID: 26687232). Hypermethylation and downregulation of FGF14 has been identified in cervical cancer (PMID: 27347167).

TRIM11, tripartite motif containing 11, is an E3 ubiquitin ligase, which activates the proteasome complex and regulates proteolysis, cell proliferation, migration, invasion, and promotes tumorigenesis (PMID: 29581427, PMID: 28244856, PMID: 27329103, PMID: 23178488). A TRIM11 fusion with CRTC1 has been observed in cutaneous melanocytoma (PMID: 29240581).

ASXL2, additional sex combs like 2, transcriptional regulator, plays a role in the differentiation of adipocytes and is necessary for hematopoiesis, specifically the self-renewal of stem cells (PMID: 21047783, PMID: 28516957). ASXL2 mutations have been identified in acute myeloid leukemia (PMID: 28516957).

TACC1, transforming acidic coiled-coil containing protein 1, is a member of the taxin family and may play a role in cell division through regulation of transition out of M-phase during mitosis (PMID: 15064709). FGFR1-TACC1 fusions have been observed in glioma (PMID: 27852792), brain extraventricular neurocytomas (PMID: 29978331), and gastrointestinal stromal tumors (PMID: 27974047) and overexpression of Tacc1 has been reported in gastric cancer (PMID: 24358147).

RPA4, replication protein A4, is a subunit of an alternative version of the heterotrimeric RPA protein, which plays a role in DNA metabolism and DNA damage response (PMID: 19996105, PMID: 19942684). Decreased expression of RPA4 has been observed in several tumor types, including cervical, colon, kidney, and liver cancer (PMID: 19996105).

SLC7A11, solute carrier family 7 member 11, plays a role in managing the intracellular levels of glutathione and in preventing stress-induced cell death via oxidative stress (PMID: 28630042, PMID: 29764521). Decreased expression of SLC7A11 has been observed in ARID1A-deficient cancers, such as ovarian cancer, but overexpression has also been identified in other tumor types, including lung cancer, and may contribute to tumor progression (PMID: 29789716, PMID: 30686770).

TENT5C, terminal nucleotidyltransferase 5C, plays a role in the polyadenylation of messenger RNA (PMID: 30397099). TENT5C mutations and deletions are frequent in multiple myeloma (PMID: 28619709, PMID: 26456599).

RBBP8, DNA endonuclease RBBP8, plays a role in transcription, DNA replication, cell-cylce transition, and DNA repair through homologous recombination repair with Brca1 (PMID: 26713604). RBBP8 expression is decreased in breast cancer and loss may be associated with sensitivity to PARP inhibitors (PMID: 26713604) and increased mutation rate in colorectal cancer (PMID: 12414815).

AMER1, APC membrane recruitment protein 1, is a scaffold protein that promotes beta-catenin degradation through recruiting and stabilizing components of the beta-catenin degradation complex to the membrane, thus inhibits Wnt/beta-catenin signaling (PMID: 17925383, PMID: 17510365, PMID: 21498506). AMER1 is frequently mutated in colorectal cancer (PMID: 26071483) and Wilms tumor (PMID: 28825729, PMID: 28326956).

CCR2, chemokine (C-C motif) receptor 2, is a transmembrane receptor for the chemokines CCL2, CCL8, CCL7 and CCL13 (PMID: 23408426) and is also an alternative coreceptor for HIV-1 infection (PMID: 12192431). CCL2 expression from tumor cells facilitates metastasis by activating CCR2 in the endothelium, increasing vascular permeability (PMID: 22789541) and other studies have shown inhibition of Ccr2 prevents CCCL2 induced cell invasion and viability (PMID: 28424406).

TADA2A, transcriptional adaptor 2A, functions as part of the GCN5, PCAF, and STAGA histone acetyltransferase complexes, and is involved in regulation of beta-catenin signaling (PMID: 18059173). TADA2A fusions have been identified in breast carcinoma (PMID: 22101766), and in a colon cancer cell line (PMID: 29181107).

BIRC7, baculoviral IAP repeat containing 7, is a member of the inhibitors of apoptosis protein (IAPs) family that regulates apoptosis (PMID: 11084335). Birc7 is highly over expressed in melanoma (PMID: 11084335, PMID: 23070005).

TCF7L2, transcription factor 7 like 2, is a HMG box-containing transcription factor which regulates the Wnt signaling pathway and modulates MYC expression (PMID: 18177486, PMID: 9727977). Mutations in Tcf7l2 have been found in colorectal cancers (PMID: 10919662) and premalignant colorectal neoplasia (PMID: 31781186).

SCGB1C1, secretoglobin, family 1C, member 1, is a small secreted protein with uncharacterized physiological function, and has been demonstrated to be overexpressed in ovarian carcinoma (PMID: 21385388, PMID: 23819652).

CYP19A1, aromatase, is a member of the cytochrome P450 gene superfamily, which catalyzes the rate-limiting step in the conversion of androgens to estrogens (PMID: 29363090). CYP19A1 amplification and overexpression has been observed in estrogen receptor positive breast cancer (PMID: 29363090, PMID: 28112739).

ERCC6, ERCC excision repair 6, chromatin remodeling factor, is a DNA-dependent ATPase that participates in DNA repair and transcription (PMID: 23562425). Mutations in ERCC6 have been associated with increased risks of developing gastric and lung cancers (PMID: 24289633, PMID: 18789574, PMID: 17854076).

ARHGAP26, Rho GTPase activating protein 26, encodes for a protein that negatively regulates the Rho family by converting RhoA and Cdc42 to their inactive forms via GDP binding, and is necessary for muscle development (PMID: 24067935). The fusion, CLDN18-ARHGAP26, has been identified in gastric cancer, primarily including those of the diffuse-type (PMID: 30034621).

PPFIBP1, PTPRF interacting protein, binding protein 1 (liprin beta 1), encodes for liprin beta 1 and plays a role in regulating the leukocyte common antigen-related protein (PMID: 21430068). Fusion proteins involving PPFIBP1 have been been reported in cancer (PMID: 21430068).

ATN1, atrophin 1, is a transcriptional co-repressor that functions in gene regulation (PMID: 10973986). A decrease in ATN1 expression is associated with decreased response to EGFR therapy in patients with metastatic colorectal cancer (PMID: 23098991).

FUBP1, far upstream element-binding protein 1, is a DNA and RNA binding protein (PMID: 30343319) that regulates MYC gene transcription through binding to the far upstream element (FUSE) in the promoter region and has demonstrated effects in cell proliferation, migration, and cell death (PMID: 22926519, PMID: 31553912). Overexpression of FUBP1 has been observed in hepatocellular carcinoma patients with poor prognosis (PMID: 31587040) and has been associated with neuroblastoma (PMID: 31511046) and leukemia (PMID: 30635626).

RASGRF2, Ras protein-specific guanine nucleotide-releasing factor 2, is a guanine exchange factor that mediates activation of Ras and Rho family members, and plays a role in T-cell response and proliferation (PMID: 21111786). Aberrant methylation of RASGFR2 has been reported in NSCLC (PMID: 16596198), decreased expression has been reported in several tumor types, and mutations in RASGRF2 have identified in breast cancer (PMID: 21111786).

NFATC2, nuclear factor of activated T-cells 2, is a transcription factor that belongs to the NFAT family, primarily playing a role in the regulation of T cell function (PMID: 12975316). Constitutive activation of NFATC2 has been observed in breast cancer development (PMID: 20725108) and fusions with EWSR1 and FUS have been observed in mesenchymal tumors (PMID: 31049020).

FOXP1, forkhead box P1, is a member of the Fox family of transcription factors that functions as a transcriptional repressor, regulating genes involved in several cellular processes, including cell proliferation, migration, and differentiation (PMID: 17614763, PMID: 26654944). Altered FOXP1 expression has been observed in lymphomas and multiple solid tumor types including colon, pancreatic, and stomach cancer (PMID: 17614763), and non-small cell lung cancer (PMID: 22904134).

ACVRL1, activin receptor like kinase 1 encodes ALK1 and is a type I cell-surface receptor for the TGF-beta superfamily (PMID: 8640225; PMID: 26176610). ACVRL1 is involved in the regulation of cell proliferation, differentiation, migration and extracellular matrix formation and plays a role in the development of blood vessels (PMID: 26176610)

NF1, neurofibromin 1, is a tumor suppressor gene (PMID: 30562755). The function of the NF1 gene product neurofibromin is to downregulate RAS by stimulating GTPase activity and converting active RAS-GTP state to the inactive RAS-GDP state decreasing cellular proliferation (PMID: 28637487).

FAM175A, Abraxas 1, BRCA1 A Complex Subunit that binds BRCA1 forming a complex with with BACH1 and CTIP. Abraxas recruits ibiquitin interacting motif (UIM) containing Rap80 , both of which are required for DNA damage resistance (PMID: 17525340; PMID:17643122)

BRIP1, BRCA1 interacting protein C-terminal helicase 1, is necessary for efficient double-strand break repair, for cell cycly checkpoint functions, and aids the tumor suppressor function of BRCA1 (PMID: 14983014; PMID: 16116421).

BTG1, BTG anti-proliferation factor 1, is a member of the B-cell translocation gene family, and take part in the regulation of key cellular processes such as differentiation and apoptosis. BTG1 is a negative regulator of cell cycle progression, activates ATF4 in response to cellular stress, and is required for neuronal and hematopoietic cell differentiation (PMID: 30350856).

CD74, CD74 molecule, encodes for an integral membrane protein that acts as an MHC class II chaperone that prevents peptide binding in the endoplasmic reticulum and contributes to peptide editing in the MHC class II compartment (PMID: 16484589). Additionally, CD74 is a high affininty binding protein for the macrophage migration-inhibitory factor (MIF) cytokine and plays a role in the signal transduction of pathways related to cell survival and proliferation (PMID: 16484589; PMID: 29476963).

MMP14, matrix metallopeptidase 14, also referred to as MT1-MMP, is a member of the membrane-type matrix metalloproteinases family that is involved in degradation of extracellular matrices, therefore contributes to tumor cell metastasis (PMID: 25794647). Elevated Mmp14 expression has been identified in a variety of cancers, particularly in cancers of mesenchymal origin (PMID: 28390905).
KIF13B, kinesin family member 13B, is a motor protein that regulates microtubule dynamic (PMID: 16988025). KIF13B fusion is identified in lung cancer (PMID: 28391773).

SLX4, SLX4 structure-specific endonuclease subunit, is a component of the endonuclease complexes response to DNA interstrand crosslink repair and replication fork failure (PMID: 21527828). SLX4 mutations have been identified in breast and ovarian cancers (PMID: 28423363, PMID: 21805310).

HAUS5, HAUS augmin-like complex subunit 5, is a subunit of HAUS, the human augmin complex, and regulates centrosome and spindle integrity (PMID: 19427217, PMID: 28596487). HAUS5 may play a role in glioblastoma (PMID: 28596487).

CCN6, cellular communication network factor 6, encodes a secreted matrix-associated protein that binds to multiple receptors and regulates signaling pathways governing development and epithelial-mesenchymal transition (PMID: 29357008). CCN6 mutations and decreased Ccn6 expression has been identified in hepatocellular carcinoma (PMID: 30793395), gastric (PMID: 26997449), colon (PMID: 9843955), and breast cancer (PMID: 10499627).

ZC3HAV1, zinc finger CCCH-type containing, antiviral 1, is an RNA-binding protein involved in RNA posttranscriptional regulation and antiviral immunity (PMID: 25851173, PMID: 22531498). A fusion between ZC3HAV1 and BRAF has been identified in esophageal carcinoma (PMID: 26314551).

H3C14, H3 clustered histone 14, encodes a member of the histone H3 family that may play a role in nucleosome assembly during DNA replication (PMID: 30165676). Mutations in H3C14 have been identified in pediatric diffuse intrinsic pontine glioma (PMID: 29352018), and overexpression has been demonstrated in endocrine-resistant breast cancer (PMID: 26113056).

A1CF, APOBEC1 complementation factor, is an RNA binding protein and part of a complex which edits the mRNA of apolipoprotein B (PMID: 11871661). Deletion of an eight amino acid motif in the nuclear localization domain of A1cf has been demonstrated to promote breast cancer proliferation in culture (PMID: 27231908) and decreased expression increased apoptosis of breast cancer cells in culture (PMID: 28639893).

FANCG, Fanconi anemia, complementation group G, is a member of the Fanconi anemia core complex, which plays a role in DNA repair (PMID: 27145721, PMID: 21118969). Germline FANCG mutations are associated with Fanconi anemia, which involves predisposition to various cancers (PMID: 25237197).
GOLGA5, golgin A5, is involved in the assembly and maintenance of Golgi structure (PMID: 12538640). GOLGA5 fusions with RET have been identified in tumors (PMID: 10741739).

ATRIP, ATR-interacting protein, forms a heterodimer with ATR to regulate DNA repair and the cell-cycle upon activation by DNA damage and cellular replication stress (PMID: 24990965, PMID: 27861980). ATRIP may be regulated by Fanconi Anemia/BRCA pathway micro-RNAs, which could influence response to imatinib in CML (PMID: 28544907).

H3C10, H3 clustered histone 10, encodes a member of the canonical histone 3 family that may play a role in nucleosome assembly, and DNA replication and repair (PMID: 21263457). Mutations in H3C10 have been identified in acute myeloid leukemia (PMID: 31253791).

POLD4, polymerase (DNA-directed), delta 4, accessory subunit, is a subunit of DNA polymerase delta, which mediates DNA replication (PMID: 27320729). POLD4 mutations are identified in colorectal and lung cancers (PMID: 25529843, PMID: 20861182).

APOBEC2, apolipoprotein B mRNA editing enzyme, catalytic polypeptide-like 2, is a member of the cytidine deaminase family and plays a role in negative regulation of muscle regeneration (PMID: 20022958, PMID: 22001110, PMID: 28215905). APOBEC2 may act as a DNA mutator, potentially contributing to onset and progression of cancer (PMID: 21469143).

MYO18A, myosin XVIIIA, encodes a myosin protein that interacts with LURAP1, thereby playing a role in cell migration and protrusion, and binds to GOLPH3, which allows for Golgi trafficking and morphology (PMID: 27824130). MYO18A fusions have been identified in myeloproliferative disorders (PMID: 15800673, PMID: 19006078), and MYO18A overexpression has been observed in metastatic prostate cancer cells (PMID: 26670045).

H3C12, H3 clustered histone 12, encodes a member of the canonical histone 3 family that may play a role in nucleosome assembly, and DNA replication and repair (PMID: 21263457). Mutations in H3C12 have been identified in colon cancer (PMID: 22895193), and hypermethylation has been demonstrated in hepatocellular carcinoma (PMID: 28514750).

CALR, calreticulin, is a Ca2+ binding chaperone protein that plays a role in multiple biological processes, including protein folding and quality control, calcium homeostasis, immune response, cell adhesion and migration, and cell signaling (PMID: 19940256, PMID: 28470469, PMID: 22959412). CALR frameshift mutations have been identified in myeloproliferative neoplasms, including essential thrombocytothemia and myelofibrosis (PMID: 24365789, PMID: 28470469).

STK33, serine/threonine kinase 33, is a serine/threonine kinase that may regulate intermediate filament dynamics through phosphorylation of vimentin (PMID: 18811945). STK33 is involved in tumorigenesis in various human cancers (PMID: 25398772, PMID: 25603720, PMID: 25662617).

DEPDC5, DEP domain containing 5, GATOR1 subcomplex subunit, is involved in the regulation of cell growth and metabolism through inhibition of mTORC1 signaling under amino acid-deficient conditions (PMID: 23723238, PMID: 31548394). Mutations in DEPDC5 have been identified in gastrointestinal stromal tumors (PMID: 31636198), glioblastoma, ovarian tumors (PMID: 23723238), pancreatic neuroendocrine tumors (PMID: 29486199), uterine leiomyomas (PMID: 25964426), and hepatocellular carcinoma (PMID: 22339805).

CARD11, caspase recruitment domain family, member 11, is a component of a scaffold complex that regulates NFKB activity (PMID: 23149938). Activating mutations in the CARD11 coiled-coil domain activate NFKB and have been identified in hematological cancers, including diffuse large B cell lymphoma and may confer resistance to ibrutinib (PMID: 23149938, PMID: 18323416, PMID: 27224912).

HSP90AB1, heat shock protein 90 alpha family class B member 1, is a member of the HSP chaperone protein family that supports folding and stability of a variety of proteins (PMID: 26358502). Upregulation of Hsp90ab1 expression has been identified in a variety of cancer cells (PMID: 26358502).
KIF5B, kinesin family member 5B, is a microtubule motor protein involved in cargo transportation (PMID: 12743033). KIF5B fusions have been identified in lung cancer (PMID: 22327623).

PRKN, parkin RBR E3 ubiquitin protein ligase, binds to E2 ubiquitin-conjugating enzymes thereby playing a role in protein degradation via ubiquitination and subsequently regulating various cellular processes, including mitochondrial homeostasis, anti-oxidative stress, and mitophagy (PMID: 10973942, PMID: 29529199). Loss of PRKN has been associated with colorectal carcinoma (PMID: 20696900) and loss of function mutations in PRKN have been associated with glioma (PMID: 25877876).

PTCH2, patched 2, encodes for a protein that is a member of the resistance nodulation division family, and is a minor component of the hedgehog signalling pathway (PMID: 25448692). PTCH2 splice variants have been observed in both familial and sporadic basal cell carcinoma (PMID: 10029063).

IPO7, importin 7, encodes for a member of the importin beta superfamily and plays a role in transporting proteins, including histones and ribosomal proteins, to the nucleus (PMID: 24586428). IPO7 mutations have been associated with breast cancer (PMID: 23762276).

BST2, bone marrow stromal antigen 2, is a membrane protein and antiviral factor induced by interferon (PMID: 26172439) and may play a role in cell proliferation and metastasis (PMID: 26172439, PMID: 30114595). Overexpression of Bst2 has been observed in ovarian cancer (PMID: 14695211), bladder cancer (PMID: 28693265), and in bone metastases in breast cancer (PMID: 19338666).

CCAR2, cell cycle and apoptosis regulator 2, plays a role in cellular processes including DNA damage response, cell proliferation, and hormone receptor signaling, and has putative tumor suppressor function (PMID: 27809307, PMID: 27725203, PMID: 25732823). CCAR2 over expression is associated with several tumor types, including breast and gastric cancers (PMID: 25732823).

FANCF, Fanconi anemia, complementation group F, is a member of the Fanconi anemia core complex, which plays a role in DNA damage response (PMID: 24910428). FANCF mutations are associated with Fanconi anemia, and aberrant FANCF promoter methylation has been demonstrated in ovarian cancer (PMID: 26507869, PMID: 16675878).

RB1, retinoblastoma-associated protein, is a key negative regulator of the G1 to S transition during cell division (PMID: 15084261) and also plays a role in cell differentiation, survival, senescence, epigenetic regulation, and genome stability (PMID: 21295686, PMID: 23359405, PMID: 22293180). Inactivation of Rb1 and loss of Rb1 tumor suppressor function has been identified in many early stage cancers (PMID: 26160835).

NSD1, nuclear receptor binding SET domain protein 1, is a histone methyltransferase that regulates gene expression through methylation of histone H3 lysine 36 (PMID: 21196496) and lysine 37 (H3K27me3) (PMID: 31727171) and is also a coregulator of steroid receptors (PMID: 11733144, PMID: 11509567). Overexpression of Nsd1 has been observed in metastatic pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma (PMID: 31060750) and in hepatocellular carcinoma  patients with poor prognosis (PMID: 31727171), while loss of function Nsd1 mutations may increase sensitivity to cisplatin in HPV-negative head and neck squamous cell carcinoma (PMID: 29636367).

PDK1, pyruvate dehydrogenase kinase 1, plays a role in metabolism regulation through phosphorylation of pyruvate dehydrogenase, resulting in inhibition of the pyruvate dehydrogenase complex, which functions in conversion of pyruvate to acetyl-CoA (PMID: 18541534, PMID: 24904893, PMID:  25868605). PDK1 over expression has been demonstrated in several tumor types, including ovarian cancer and retinoblastoma (PMID: 28617852, PMID: 28505181).

NFATC1, nuclear factor of activated T-cells 1, is a transcription factor that belongs to the NFAT family, primarily playing a role in the regulation of T cell function (PMID: 15928679). NFATC1 has been shown to be overexpressed in pancreatic cancers and has been observed in a fusion with EWSR1 in hemangioma (PMID: 23480895, PMID: 22950383).

EWSR1, RNA-binding protein EWS, belongs to the TET family of RNA and DNA binding proteins and is involved in multiple cellular functions including gene expression and RNA processing (PMID: 21816343). EWSR1 fusions are frequently observed in sarcomas (PMID: 23329308, PMID: 27740934).

ENG, endoglin, is a membrane receptor preferentially expressed in proliferating endothelial cells (PMID: 18381930). Expression of Eng has been identified in multiple tumors and is associated with poor clinical outcome (PMID: 18381930).

JMJD6, jumonji domain containing 6, arginine demethylase and lysine hydroxylase, encodes a nuclear protein with a JmjC domain and has bifunctional histone arginine demethylation and lysyl oxidase activity (PMID: 17947579; PMID: 19574390) and plays a role in inflammation and the immune response (PMID: 31637004). Overexpression of JMJD6 is associated with various cancer types (PMID: 22621393; PMID: 23595221; PMID: 24667498), including breast, hepatocellular carcinoma, oral squamous cell carcinoma (PMID: 31788057), ovarian cancer (PMID: 31637004), and neuroblastoma (PMID: 31346162).

LRIG3, leucine-rich repeats and immunoglobulin-like domains 3, is a transmembrane protein that may be involved in regulating receptor signaling (PMID: 25183430). LRIG3 expression has been associated with favorable prognosis in a variety of cancer types (PMID: 25180912).

CUL1, cullin 1 is an E3 ubiquitin ligase that controls cell cycle progression (PMID: 16633365). CUL1 expression is associated with poor prognosis and a CUL1 fusion with BRAF is observed in ovarian cancer (PMID: 26324360, PMID: 23592700).

MAST2, microtubule associated serine/threonine kinase 2, is a serine/threonine kinase that potentially functions as a scaffolding protein and interacts with syntrophin and utrophin (PMID: 18206861, PMID: 10404183). MAST2 fusions are recurrent in breast cancer (PMID: 22101766, PMID: 24140425).

FZR1, fizzy and cell division cycle 20 related 1, is a coactivator of the anaphase-promoting complex/cyclosome (APC/C) that is involved in regulating the onset of DNA replication (PMID: 19861496). Overexpression of FZR1 has been identified in multiple myeloma (PMID: 27655696) and B-cell acute leukemia (PMID: 28143883), and FZR1 mutations have been identified in male breast cancer (PMID: 31203460).

MLLT10, myeloid/lymphoid or mixed-lineage leukemia; translocated to, 10, is predicted to encode for a transcription factor, possibly playing a role in hematopoietic differentiation, however, its function role is unknown (PMID: 18094714, PMID: 23284727). MLLT10 fusions with various gene partners have been identified in leukemia (PMID: 23673860, PMID: 23852159).

BIRC2, baculoviral IAP repeat containing 2, belongs to the IAP family, and is involved in regulating TNF and NF-kB activated signaling pathways (PMID: 21653699). BIRC2 mutations have been observed in lymphoid and epithelial tumors, loss of BIRC2 has been demonstrated in multiple myeloma (PMID: 26094954), and BIRC2 amplification has been detected in cervix carcinoma (PMID: 22733500).

AGK, acylglycerol kinase, is a mitochondrial membrane lipid kinase (PMID: 25082432). AGK fusions are observed with BRAF in radiation-induced thyroid cancer and in melanoma (PMID: 24162670, PMID: 23890088).

EXO1, exonuclease 1, is a member of the Rad2/XPG nuclease family that plays a role in DNA replication, checkpoint progression, and DNA repair (PMID: 27098756, PMID: 30585186, PMID: 25956862). EXO1 overexpression has been observed in hepatocellular carcinoma (PMID: 30328366), and EXO1 mutations have been identified in breast cancer (PMID: 30947698) and pancreatic cancer (PMID: 29940740).

KIAA1217, KIAA1217, is the human homolog of murine Skt and has been associated with lumbar disc development (PMID: 19338451). KIAA1217 fusions with RET have been observed in lung adenocarcinoma (PMID: 27150058) and KIAA1217 fusions with FGFR2 have been reported in cholangiocarcinoma (PMID: 30745300).

VMP1, vacuole membrane protein 1, encodes for a transmembrane protein that plays a role in autophagy, specifically in autophagosome formation and via interaction with Beclin 1 (PMID: 17940279). A fusion with VMP1 and RPS6KB1 has been identified in esophageal adenocarcinoma and breast cancer (PMID: 27503924, PMID: 21467264).

POU5F1, POU domain, class 5, transcription factor 1, is a transcription factor involved in development and stem cell pluripotency (PMID: 18338330). POU5F1 fusions have been observed with EWSR1 in soft tissue tumors (PMID: 18338330, PMID: 21962892) and high expression of Pou5f1 has been associated with poor prognosis in colorectal cancer (PMID: 29488015).

SSX4, SSX family member 4, is a cancer-testis antigen protein with uncharacterized biological function (PMID: 20981248, PMID: 21880588). SS18-SSX4 fusions have been identified in synovial sarcoma (PMID: 17334349).

SQSTM1, sequestosome 1, also referred to as p62, partners with several other proteins to regulate cell growth and survival (PMID: 22841931, PMID: 22424619). SQSTM1 is overexpressed in several tumor types, including breast and prostate cancers (PMID: 26426686) and fusions with ALK (PMID: 21134980, PMID: 25413595), FGFR1 (PMID: 25501022), NTRK1 (PMID: 26565381), and NTRK2 (PMID: 28512244) have been observed.

RABGAP1L, RAB GTPase activating protein 1 like, is a Rab GTPase binding protein and gene rearrangements have been identified in cholangiocarcinoma (PMID: 24563076) and acute myeloid leukemia (PMID: 19184099).

SCYL3, SCY1-like 3 protein, is an ubiquitously expressed member of SCY1-like family of pseudokinases that regulates motor neuron viability (PMID: 29437892). A fusion of MIR548F1 with NTRK1 has been observed in colorectal cancer (PMID: 28903424).

XRCC4, X-ray repair cross complementing 4, is a family member of the XRCC genes that is involved in DNA non-homologous end joining (PMID: 15279796). Alterations of the XRCC4 gene has been associated with increased risk of various cancers (PMID: 18991789).

CDK15, cyclin-dependent kinase 15, is a member of the serine/threonine protein kinase (STK) family and may play a role in attenuating the apoptotic response (PMID: 24866247). Overexpression of Cdk15 has been demonstrated to prevent tumor necrosis factor-related apoptosis-inducing ligand (TRAIL)-mediated apoptosis in cancer cell lines (PMID: 24866247).

SRSF2, serine and arginine rich splicing factor 2, functions in exon recognition as part of the spiceosome protein complex during pre-mRNA splicing, therefore regulates the expression of EZH2 and other genes involved in cell survival (PMID: 28986033). SRSFR2 mutations that disrupt mRNA splicing (PMID: 29858584) have been identified in myelodysplastic syndrome and other myeloid malignancies (PMID: 24523246, PMID: 25510282, PMID: 30275952).

OFD1, oral-facial-digital syndrome 1, is a cilia type protein that associates with the centrosome and plays a role a sensory role during development (PMID: 27196396). An FGFR2-OFD1 fusion has been observed in thyroid cancer (PMID: 23558953).

ERC1, ELKS/RAB6-interacting/CAST family member 1, is a regulatory subunit of the IKK complex (PMID: 15218148). ERC1 fusions with ROS1 and RET have been observed in solid tumors (PMID: 24445538, PMID: 12203787).

ROS1, ROS proto-oncogene 1, receptor tyrosine kinase, is an orphan receptor tyrosine kinase that may activates multiple pathways involved in cell survival and transformation (PMID: 23719267). ROS1 fusion proteins frequently lead to constitutive activation of Ros1 signaling and have been identified in glioblastoma, non-small cell lung cancer, cholangiocarcinoma, ovarian cancer, gastric adenocarcinoma, colorectal cancer, inflammatory myofibroblastic tumor, angiosarcoma, glioma, and epithelioid hemangioendothelioma (PMID: 23719267, PMID: 30262706, PMID: 30171048, PMID: 3004937).

TMEM82, transmembrane protein 82, is a transmembrane-domain containing protein with uncharacterized physiological function, which has been identified as a potential biomarker for hepatocellular carcinoma (PMID: 24141781).

DDR1, discoidin domain receptor tyrosine kinase 1, encodes for a tyrosine kinase receptor that is activated by collagen and plays a necessary role in the development of mammary glands (PMID: 24671415). DDR1 overexpression and DDR1 mutations have been associated with a variety of cancers including lung, leukemia (PMID: 21398698), melanoma (PMID: 31271515), and ER-positive breast cancer (PMID: 30181556).

CDK8, cyclin-dependent kinase 8, encodes for a member of the mediator complex, which is involved in transcriptional regulation (PMID: 24043446). Overexpression and/or amplification of CDK8 has been associated with beta-catenin activity in colorectal cancer (PMID: 18794900).

ADARB1, double-stranded RNA-specific editase 1, post-transcriptionally converts adenosine to inosine in RNA and aberrant Adarb1 function has been associated with certain types of cancer (PMID: 24289319, PMID: 19139135, PMID: 23737728). Recent evidence suggests that Adarb1 may play a roll in suppressing tumor growth in ESCC (PMID: 28035363).

MAGEC1, MAGE family member C1, encodes for a member of the cancer testis antigen family, in which normal expression is restricted to germ cells (PMID: 17607369). Overexpression of MAGEC1 has been observed in a variety of tumor types, including breast cancer, ovarian cancer, non-small cell lung cancer, and melanoma (PMID: 12115486).

TMEM127, transmembrane protein 127, acts as part of a lysosomal complex that plays a role in regulation of mTORC1 signaling (PMID: 21447639, PMID: 29547888). TMEM127 germline mutations are associated with pheochromocytoma and paraganglioma (PMID: 20154675, PMID: 20923864, PMID: 22419703), and have also been identified in renal cell carcinoma (PMID: 24334765).

CRLF2, cytokine receptor-like factor 2, acts as a cell membrane receptor for thymic stromal lymphopoietin (TSLP), resulting in downstream activation of JAK2, STAT3 and STAT5 pathways (PMID: 22685175). Mutations and rearrangements of Crlf2 are associated with acute lymphoblastic leukemeia (PMID: 22685175, PMID: 31318944, PMID: 30487598).

IL13RA2, interleukin 13 receptor subunit alpha 2, is a subunit of the interleukin 13 receptor complex that mediates signal transduction through IL13, and promotes tumor invasion and metastasis (PMID: 21858811, PMID: 19887609, PMID: 30572904). Overexpression of IL13RA2 has been observed in various solid tumors, including glioblastoma and medulloblastoma (PMID: 30572904, PMID: 19887609).

EPAS1, endothelial PAS domain-containing protein 1, is an alpha subunit member of the hypoxia-inducible factor (HIF), which is an oxygen sensitive transcription complex that when dysregulated can promote tumor progression (PMID: 29032465, PMID: 22931260, PMID: 28322821). EPAS1 mutations have been identified in paraganglioma (PMID: 22931260, PMID: 23533246), pheochromocytoma (PMID: 23533246), and hemangioblastoma (PMID: 26514359).

COL14A1, collagen, type XIV, alpha 1, encodes for a molecule associated with the extracellular matrix and plays a role in quiescence and cellular differentiation (PMID: 16129687). COL14A1 has been shown to form a fusion with FGFR2, which has been observed in cholangiocarcinoma (PMID: 24122810).

WNT1, proto-oncogene Wnt-1, is a secreted cytokine that binds the receptors, frizzled (Fz) and low density lipoprotein receptor-related protein (LRP), to activate beta-catenin (CTNNB1; PMID: 27197202, PMID: 28528193) and functions in bone development and cell migration (PMID: 27626678). Overexpression of WNT1 has been observed in a variety of tumors, resulting in cell proliferation and metastasis (PMID: 27626678).

CEP85L, centrosomal protein 85kDa-like, plays a role in maintenance of centrosome integrity through regulation of Nek2a activity (PMID: 26220856). Fusions of Cep85l and Ros1 have been observed in central nervous system tumors (PMID: 30171048) and with Pdgfrb in myeloproliferative neoplasms (PMID: 23186533).

FUS, RNA-binding protein FUS, is a DNA/RNA-binding protein that plays a role in transcription, DNA repair, and RNA splicing (PMID: 26822113, PMID: 25289647). FUS fusions with DDIT3 are commonly observed in myxoid/round cell liposarcomas (PMID: 28447036).

PRMT2, protein arginine methyltransferase 2, functions as a coactivator for nuclear receptors including estrogen receptor-alpha, progestrone receptor, and retinoic acid receptor-alpha. Expression of alternative splice variants of PRMT2 have been associated with breast cancer (PMID: 24921003).

CD27, CD27 molecule, encodes for a member of the TNF receptor family, which binds to CD70, thereby, co-stimulating T and B cells, inducing cell survival, and activating the NF-kappaB pathway (PMID: 15886117, PMID: 23264908). CD27 expression in lymphoma and leukemia cells has been associted with increased cell proliferation and differentiation (PMID: 23264908).

RHOA, ras homolog family member A, is a Rho small GTPase that is involved in regulation of actin cytoskeleton dynamics, cell migration, and cell-cycle progression (PMID: 19327386, PMID: 24467208, PMID: 26103434). RHOA mutations are recurrent in diffuse-type gastric cancer and subtypes of lymphomas (PMID: 27693615, PMID: 26103434, PMID: 27991930).

PCMTD1, protein-L-isoaspartate O-methyltransferase domain-containing protein 1, is a putative methyltransferase (PMID: 29633253). A PCMTD1-CCNL2 fusion has been observed more commonly in endometrioid ovarian carcinomas than in other ovarian cancer subtypes (PMID: 29633253).

CRKL, CRK like proto-oncogene, adaptor protein, encodes an adaptor protein that plays a signaling role in a number of cellular processes including cell adhesion, cell migration, and immune function (PMID: 11607838). CRKL amplification and overexpression has been observed in gastric and lung cancers (PMID: 22591714, PMID:     22586683).

STAT4, signal transducer and activator of transcription 4, is a STAT family transcription factor that mediates IL-12 signaling during cellular-mediated immune responses (PMID: 25798064). Stat4 protein is overexpressed in epithelial cells of ovarian cancer and is associated with poor prognosis and metastasis (PMID: 28114283).

MMP9, matrix metalloproteinase-9, plays a role in modeling of the extracellular matrix and in angiogenesis (PMID: 30013825) and therefore, may be involved in tumor metastasis (PMID: 29137230). MMP9 overexpression has been observed in a variety of solid tumor types including, clear cell renal carcinoma (PMID: 30013825), papillary thyroid cancer (PMID: 29632659), lung adenocarcinoma (PMID: 29443542), and ovarian cancer (PMID: 22832979).

DDX11, DEAD/H-box helicase 11, is a DNA helicase required for chromatid cohesion and proper chromosome segregation during mitosis, and has been demonstrated to be upregulated in melanoma (PMID: 23116066, PMID: 24487782).

KMT2C, lysine methyltransferase 2C, is a H3K4 histone methyltransferase (PMID: 31128216) that is involved in transcriptional coactivation and functions in chromatin modification (PMID: 31337554) and epigenetic gene regulation (PMID: 31128216). KMT2C mutations are associated with various tumor types (PMID: 24965397; PMID: 23429989; PMID: 24670651), including breast cancer (PMID: 31128216), diffuse-type gastric adenocarcinoma (PMID: 30108106), and urothelial carcinoma (PMID: 30665945).

NUMBL, NUMB like, endocytic adaptor protein, is a homologue of Numb that is involved in various cellular processes including adhesion and ubiquitination, through regulation of Notch, Wnt, and Hedgehog signaling (PMID: 29507685, PMID: 27613838). Downregulation of Numbl expression contributes to tumorigenicity and chemoresistance in tumor cells (PMID:  27613838).

SP1, Sp1 transcription factor, is a ubiquitously expressed C2H2-type zinc finger protein that binds DNA and regulates transcription of its downstream targets, thereby playing a role in cell growth, apoptosis, and differentiation (PMID: 19273606, PMID: 12620113). Overexpression of Sp1 has been demonstrated in many tumor types, including pancreatic, gastric and lung cancers (PMID: 25393971).

PDGFRB, platelet-derived growth factor receptor, beta polypeptide, is a receptor tyrosine kinase that plays a role in blood vessel development, cell proliferation, and migration (PMID: 18483217, PMID: 20529858). PDGFRB fusions are associated with several tumor types (PMID: 24703957).

BCL2A1, BCL2-related protein A1, is a member of the Bcl2 family of cell death regulators that promotes survival of hematopoietic cells (PMID: 22075983). Over expression of Bcl2a1 has been identified in a variety of cancers and is associated with chemotherapy resistance (PMID: 22075983).

TLR7, toll like receptor 7, is an endosomal receptor that recognizes single-stranded RNA and functions in activation of the inflammatory response (PMID: 28620298, PMID: 28374903). Overexpression of Tlr7 has been demonstrated in pancreatic cancer (PMID: 26134824), esophageal squamous cell carcinoma, and gastroesophageal junction adenocarcinoma (PMID: 29968427, PMID: 21990957).

CCR4, C-C motif chemokine receptor 4, is a transmembrane receptor that interacts with chemokines, and potentially plays a role in homeostasis and inflammatory response (PMID: 29099057, PMID: 25087232). Overexpression of CCR4 has been identified in mycosis fungoides (PMID: 29030090), and is associated with poor survival in hepatocellular carcinoma (PMID: 28959024).

GATA2, GATA binding protein 2, is a zinc-finger transcription factor that plays a central role in regulating the proliferation and survival of hematopoietic stem cells (PMID: 22192845). Mutations in GATA2 are associated with myelodysplastic syndrome and leukemia (PMID: 22192845) and decreased expression has been associated with melanoma progression (PMID: 29156497).

GREM1, gremlin 1, DAN family BMP antagonist, regulates limb and kidney development through antagonizing BMP signaling (PMID: 25592806), and is involved in cell proliferation (PMID: 23394397) and epithelial-mesenchymal transition (PMID: 23548835). Increased expression of Grem1 has been identified in breast (PMID: 31694641), pancreatic (PMID: 30272371), colorectal (PMID: 28041973), cervical (PMID: 26530461), and non-small cell lung cancer (PMID: 26392110).
CRTC2, CREB regulated transcription coactivator 2, encodes for a transcription co-factor that activates CREB (PMID: 19098422). CRTC2 mutations have been observed in lung cancer (PMID: 24484648).
HCFC1R1, host cell factor C1 regulator 1, regulates HCFC1 activity by modulating its subcellular localization (PMID: 12235138).

BAK1, Bcl-2 homologous antagonist/killer, promotes apoptosis by binding and inhibiting Bcl-2 and Bcl-xL (PMID: 15248898, PMID:     8521816). Decreased expression of Bak1 has been observed in gastric cancer (PMID: 15248898) and Bak1 expression may be regulated by a number of micro-RNA's (PMID: 27177325, PMID: 24643683, PMID: 24532468).

SMAD4, mothers against decapentaplegic homolog 4, is a tumor suppressor (PMID: 30562755) that translocates to the nucleus upon TGF-beta signaling to form a protein complex that regulates gene transcription and cell growth (PMID: 28452926). SMAD4 germline mutations are associated with juvenile polyposis syndrome (PMID: 18559331) and Smad4 loss of function or inactivation is common in prostate, colorectal (PMID: 29720405), and pancreatic cancer, which may be a marker for poor prognosis (PMID: 28067794).

ERLIN2, ER lipid raft associated 2, is an ER protein that mediates ER stress response and mediates de novo lipogenesis (PMID: 22681620, PMID: 22690709). ERLIN2 has been identified as a possible oncogene within amplified 8p11-8p12 in breast cancer, regulates lipogenesis in cancer cells (PMID: 22681620, PMID: 22690709) and a fusion with FGFR1 has been identified in breast cancer (PMID: 23558953).

EZR, ezrin, is an ERM family protein that links the cytoplasm to the actin cytoskeleton (PMID: 24924175). EZR plays a role in metastasis in a number of cancer types and mislocalisation of ERM proteins alters signal transduction from receptors to cellular targets (PMID: 24924175, PMID: 24421310).

TACSTD2, tumor-associated calcium signal transducer 2, (also referred to as TROP2) is a transmembrane protein with roles in calcium signaling, cell-cell adhesion, and tissue regeneration (PMID: 21551320, PMID: 26059528, PMID: 26773504). Increased TACSTD2 (TROP2) expression is associated with several carcinomas, including pancreatic, gastric, and lung carcinomas (PMID: 26059528, PMID: 26773504).

KIF11, kinesin family member 11, is a motor protein essential for bipolar spindle formation (PMID: 22825217). Overexpression of Kif11 are frequently detected in leukemia and solid tumors (PMID: 23434636).

BAX, BCL2-associated X protein, apoptosis regulator, forms heterodimer with Bcl2 and promotes apoptosis (PMID: 8358790). Altered Bax expression level has been identified in esophageal, breast, colorectal, gastric, and soft tissue sarcomas (PMID: 17634542, PMID: 21861179, PMID: 24574804, PMID: 18074738, PMID: 25906122).

MSH2, mutS homolog 2, is a tumor suppressor (PMID: 30562755) that functions as part of the DNA mismatch repair system (PMID: 9024626, PMID: 18157157) and is associated with microsatellite instability (MSI) (PMID: 30121009) and genomic stability (PMID: 31747945). Mutations in MSH2 are associated with susceptibility to colon cancer and endometrial cancer (PMID: 23255516), and germline MSH2 mutations are associated with Lynch (Hereditary Nonpolyposis Colorectal Cancer) syndrome (HNPCC1) (PMID: 15528792).

GCNT3, beta-1,3-galactosyl-O-glycosyl-glycoprotein beta-1,6-N-acetylglucosaminyltransferase 3, is a glycosyltransferase enzyme that produces mucin beta 6 N-acetylglucosaminides (PMID: 9915862, PMID: 28039261). Overexpression of Gcnt3 has been correlated with tumor-node-metastasis in NSCLC (PMID: 30355927) and with response to chemotherapy in colon and ovarian cancers (PMID: 29855486).

AURKB, aurora B kinase, is a serine-threonine protein kinase, which plays a role in the separation of daughter chromatids during cell division and functions in regulation of genomic stability (PMID: 28095398). Overexpression of Aurkb has been associated with poor prognosis in solid tumors, such as non-small cell lung cancer (PMID: 28095398), and in leukemia (PMID: 22940834, PMID: 26199132).
