SUZ12, SUZ12 polycomb repressive complex 2 subunit, is a zinc finger protein required for the histone methyltransferase activity of polycomb repressive complex 2 (PRC2), involved in mediating H3K27 tri-methylation and subsequent repression of PRC2 target genes, including genes involved in cell proliferation and differentiation (PMID: 15225548, PMID: 27449971, PMID: 26497635). Mutations in SUZ12 have been identified in malignant peripheral nerve sheath tumors (PMID: 29118384), and myelodysplastic/myeloproliferative neoplasms (PMID: 22053108), and JAZF1-SUZ12 fusions are associated with endometrial stromal sarcomas (PMID: 16049311).

GNRHR, gonadotropin-releasing hormone receptor, is a G-protein coupled receptor for gonadotropin releasing hormone (GnRH), which regulates reproductive functions (PMID: 22778172). Aberrant expression of Gnrhr has been observed in ovarian (PMID: 28122595, PMID: 27139372), breast, and prostate cancers (PMID: 30400009) and decreased Gnrhr expression has been associated with poor prognosis in gastric cancer (PMID: 26550267).

BAZ2A, bromodomain adjacent to zinc finger domain 2A, is a component of the nucleolar remodeling complex (UniProt.org). Non-functional BAZ2A fusions are observed with ETV6 in leukemias PMID: 16643428).

DNMT3A, DNA methyltransferase 3 alpha, mediates DNA methylation and functions in modification of gene expression, and plays a role in hematopoietic differentiation (PMID: 28286768, PMID: 25693834), DNMT3A mutations are frequent in acute myeloid leukemia, and are recurrent in myelodysplastic syndromes (PMID: 28286768, PMID: 28003281).

SND1, staphylococcal nuclease and tudor domain containing 1, has several cellular functions including transcriptional co-activation and regulation of RNA splicing and editing (PMID: 24918049, PMID: 25405367). SND1 over expression has been demonstrated in several tumor types, including colon, hepatocellular, and prostate cancers (PMID: 17909068, PMID: 19435788, PMID: 24918049).

SLC12A2, solute carrier family 12 member 2, encodes NKCC1, which is a Na+K+Cl- co-transporter that plays a role epithelial cell function and in regulating cellular homeostasis and volume, and is important for inner ear function (PMID: 24097229, PMID: 25620102). A fusion between SLC12A2 and INSR has been identified in MSI-high colorectal cancer (PMID: 30279230).

MBNL1, muscleblind-like splicing regulator 1, is involved in the metabolic regulation of precursor and mature mRNA. The fusion gene, MBNL1-RAF1, has been reported in cancer cell lines (PMID: 25485619).

TFRC, transferrin receptor, is a membrane receptor that mediates iron uptake in cells (PMID: 15313461). TFRC expression level has been suggested as a prognostic biomarker in breast cancer (PMID: 22335577, PMID: 21875943).

MSMB, microseminoprotein beta, is a protein secreted by the prostate that has putative tumor suppressor activity (PMID: 26939004, PMID: 28930560). A fusion of MSMB and NCOA4 has been detected in prostate cancer (PMID: 26939004), and MSMB overexpression has been demonstrated in ovarian cancer patients (PMID: 25188517).

PRMT5, protein arginine methyltransferase 5, is a type II arginine methyltransferase that mediates methylation of histones and other cellular proteins, and plays a role in regulation of cell proliferation, growth, and differentiation (PMID: 21975038). Overexpression of PMRT5 is associated with several tumor types (PMID: 21966347, PMID: 25263650).

EPHA10, EPH receptor A10, is a kinase-inactive member of the Eph receptor tyrosine kinase family (PMID: 25152371). Overexpression of EphA10 is associated with prostate cancer (PMID: 24924629) and is correlated with progression and metastasis in breast cancer (PMID: 24403271, PMID: 28427223).

KLF5, Kruppel-like factor 5, is a transcription factor that activates or represses gene transcription, depending on cellular context, thereby, inhibiting or promoting cell survival (PMID: 24323942). Amplification and overexpression of Klf5 has been observed in a variety of tumor types, including intestinal, bladder, gastric, and breast (PMID: 28963353).
CNTRL, centriolin, is a centrosomal protein associated with centrosomal maturation (PMID: 11956314). CNTRL fusions with FGFR1 have been observed in myeloproliferative disorders (PMID: 10688839).

WDCP (also known as C2orf44), WD repeat and coiled coil containing, is a protein with a dimerization domain, but without a clear biological function (UniProt.org). WDCP fusions with ALK have been observed in solid tumors (PMID: 22327622).

PIK3C3, phosphatidylinositol 3-kinase catalytic subunit type 3, also known as Vps34, is the class III PI3K catalytic subunit and plays a role in endosomal trafficking and autophagy (PMID: 29222162, PMID: 24587488).

PROM1 (CD133), prominin-1, is a transmembrane glycoprotein that plays a role in retinal development, cell growth and is highly enriched on cancer stem cell membranes (PMID: 30399449, PMID: 20818439). Overexpression of Prom1 (Cd133) has been observed in a variety of tumor types, including, ovarian (PMID: 2916866), colorectal (PMID: 30061254), prostate (PMID: 29104488), rectal, lung, neuroblastoma (PMID: 29322842), and glioblastoma, where it may correlate with poor outcomes and resistance to chemotherapy and radiation therapy (PMID: 30399449).

PRAME, preferentially expressed antigen in melanoma, is a germinal tissue-specific gene that may inhibit retinoic acid signalling (PMID: 16179254) and regulate transcription via interaction with a Cullin2-based E3 ubiquitin ligase (PMID: 21822215). PRAME is expressed in hematological malignancies and various solid tumors (PMID: 20799951), and elevated Prame expression has been associated with poor clinical outcome in melanoma (PMID: 15833814), neuroblastoma (PMID: 15240516), serous ovarian adenocarcinoma (PMID: 18709641), and breast cancer (PMID: 18648365).

HES1, transcription factor HES-1, is a transcriptional repressor of genes that require a bHLH protein for their transcription and is a downstream target of Notch signaling and plays a role in T-cell development (PMID: 27066918). Hes1 overexpression has been observed in a variety of solid tumor types (PMID: 25139105; PMID: 25234168; PMID: 24492635, PMID: 27066918).

FAH, fumarylacetoacetase, is an enzyme in the L-phenylalanine and tyrosine degradation pathway that synthesizes fumarate and acetoacetate from 4-fumarylacetoacetate (PMID: 29371990). FAH expression has been observed in melanoma (PMID: 29371990).

KRAS, KRAS proto-oncogene, GTPase, is a member of the small GTPase superfamily and a key regulator of the MAPK, PI3K/AKT/mTOR pathways (PMID: 23622131). KRAS mutations are identified in a wide range of cancers (PMID: 28666118).

FBXO4, F-box protein 4, is a component of a SCF (SKP1-CUL1-F-box protein) E3 ubiquitin-protein ligase complex that mediates the ubiquitination and subsequent proteasomal degradation of target proteins (PMID: 18598945), cyclin D1 (CCND1) and telomeric-repeat factor 1 (TRF1) (PMID: 29142209). FBXO4 is the E3 ligase for CCND1 and inactivating mutations in FBXO4 may cause CCND1 overexpression, leading to oncogenic transformation (PMID: 18598945) in esophageal squamous cell carcinoma and melanoma (PMID: 29142209).

LRFN4 (SALM3), leucine rich repeat and fibronectin type III domain containing 4, is upregulated when monocytes differentiate into macrophages and plays a role in in monocyte/macrophage morphological changes and migration (PMID: 21704618). Overexpression of LRFN4 (SALM3) has been observed in gastric cancer and is correlated with decreased survival (PMID: 31089399).

NRG4, neuregulin 4, is a ligand that binds Erbb4 (Her4),�potentially leading�to activation of downstream signaling (PMID: 10880430),�and acts as an endocrine signal that plays a role in lipid and glucose metabolism (PMID: 29106384, PMID: 25565202, PMID: 25401691). Decreased NRG4 expression has been observed In gastric cancer (PMID: 24728052) and in bladder cancer during progression (PMID: 15583696), increased expression of NRG4 has been�demonstrated in advanced prostate cancer�(PMID: 17545517), and a fusion of NRG4 with CCNY has�been identified in ovarian�clear cell carcinoma (PMID: 29633253).

NKAIN2, sodium/potassium transporting ATPase interacting 2, is also known as T-cell lymphoma breakpoint associated target 1 and is a transmembrane protein that interacts with the sodium/potassium-transporting ATPase and may play a role in nervous system development (PMID: 26770299). Somatic mutations and NKAIN2 deletion truncations have been observed in prostate cancer (PMID: 27588475) and fusions has been identified in lymphoma (PMID: 11979551).

SMARCA4, SWI/SNF related, matrix associated, actin dependent regulator of chromatin, subfamily a, member 4, is a member of the SWI/SNF family, which regulates transcription through chromatin remodeling. Mutations in Smarca4 have been linked to rhabdoid tumors as well as breast, prostate, lung, pancreas, and colon cancers (PMID: 18437052, PMID: 24145903, PMID: 19234488).

TGFB1, transforming growth factor beta 1, is a secreted cytokine that regulates cell growth, proliferation, differentiation, and apoptosis (PMID: 3861940). Altered Tgfb1 expression has been demonstrated in a variety of tumor types (PMID: 20001556).

ODC1, ornithine decarboxylase 1, encodes an enzyme that regulates polyamine metabolism, which plays a role in a number of normal cellular and tissue functions (PMID: 30181570, PMID: 29767087). Overexpression of ODC1 has been observed in a variety of tumor types including endometrial cancer (PMID: 29240775), esophageal squamous cell carcinoma (PMID: 29872701), and neuroblastoma (PMID: 19047152).

NBN, nibrin, functions as part of the MRN complex, which plays a role in DNA double-strand break repair (PMID: 24396275). Mutations in NBN are associated with increased susceptibility to cancer (PMID: 24396275, PMID: 15279809).

ASPSCR1, alveolar soft part sarcoma chromosome region, candidate 1 encodes a protein involved in insulin-stimulated glucose transport (PMID: 25078495). Translocation t(X;17)(p11;q25) resulting in a fusion protein of ASPSCR1 and TFE3 is a defining characteristic of alveolar soft part sarcoma (PMID: 11438465).

SRC, SRC proto-oncogene, non-receptor tyrosine kinase, is a member of mutliple signaling pathways, playing a role in a variety of cellular processes including proliferation, differentiation, survival, motility, and angiogenesis (PMID: 19581523). Activation and/or overexpression of SRC has been observed in many cancers (PMID: 24788409), and SRC activating mutations, although rare, have been identified in colon cancer (PMID: 9988270, PMID: 19581523).

PTTG1, securin, is also known as pituitary tumor transforming gene-1 and plays a role in chromosome stability (PMID: 10411507), angiogenesis through Fgf2, and signal transduction downstream of Src kinase (PMID: 27766744). Overexpression of Pttg1 has been observed in several tumor types, including laryngeal cancer (PMID: 30061937), meningioma (PMID: 29575197), NSCLC (PMID: 27829547), pituitary tumors (PMID: 9092795), and ovarian carcinoma, where it may promote tumor progression and metastasis (PMID: 27766744).

PTK6, protein tyrosine kinase 6, (also known as BRK) is a non-receptor tyrosine kinase that plays a role in several cellular processes including cell proliferation, differentiation, and migration (PMID: 25999240, PMID: 20832360). PTK6 over expression is associated with breast cancer, and has been identified in several additional tumor types (PMID: 25999240, PMID: 20832360).

RXRA, retinoid X receptor alpha, is a nuclear receptor that activates gene transcription upon ligand binding and is involved in development and differentiation (PMID: 22020178). RXRA mutations have been identified in bladder cancer (PMID: 29143738), including the luminal subtype (PMID: 30651555).

BAIAP2L1, BAI1 associated protein 2 like 1, is a substrate for insulin receptor tyrosine kinase and is involved in signal transduction pathways from plasma membrane modulation to actin reorganization associated with cytoskeletal remodeling (PMID: 23693078, PMID: 18215522). BAIAP2L1 fusions with FGFR3 have been observed in bladder cancer (PMID: 23175443).

HOXB13, homeobox B13, encodes a member of the HOX gene family and is a transcription factor involved in vertebrate embryonic development, particularly playing a role in the development of body segments along the anterior/posterior axes (PMID: 12668621, PMID: 31137568). Germline HOXB13 mutations have been associated with prostate cancer (PMID: 28798948, PMID: 25206306) and aberrant expression of HOXB13 has been identified in a variety of tumor types, including endometrial cancer, ovarian cancer, colorectal cancer, and thyroid cancer (PMID: 28798948).

FES, tyrosine-protein kinase Fes/Fps, is a tyrosine-protein kinase and plays a role in the maintenance of cellular transformation and demonstrates both oncogenic and tumor suppressive roles in cancer (PMID: 22202072). Decreased expression of Fes in melanoma has been commonly observed (PMID: 28463229).

CD40, CD40 molecule, encodes for a member of the tumor necrosis factor receptor family, which is expressed in a variety of cell types such as B cells, dendritic cells, monocytes, and platelets, and its signaling plays a role in multiple immune processes (PMID: 19426221). CD40 is expressed in many types of tumor cells, including breast, ovary, bladder, lung, colon, prostate, and melanoma (PMID: 11929824).

KDM6B, lysine demethylase 6B, is a Jumonji domain histone demethylase and epigenetic regulator (PMID: 30633952), that regulates gene transcription through chromatin remodeling to control cell growth and differentiation (PMID: 28725537). Aberrant expression of KDM6B has been observed in a variety of tumor types including, HNSCC, pancreatic cancer (PMID: 25275298, PMID: 24947179), renal cell carcinoma (PMID: 28725537), and glioma, where it may inhibit or promote tumorigenesis, depending on the context (PMID: 27151432, PMID: 30633952).

FAT4, FAT atypical cadherin 4, is a transmembrane receptor that regulates cell proliferation, motility, differentiation (PMID: 31217854), planar cell polarity, and the Hippo signaling pathway (PMID: 29435168). Recurrent, somatic mutations in FAT4 have been reported in various human cancers (PMID: 25151357, PMID: 24951259, PMID: 24744582), including HBV-associated hepatocellular carcinoma, colon, gastric (PMID: 31312661), esophageal (PMID: 31395065), melanoma, pancreatic, and head and neck squamous cell carcinoma (PMID: 31217854).

NONO, non-POU domain containing,octamer-binding, encodes for an RNA binding protein that plays a role in the regulation of transcription and RNA splicing (PMID: 12417296). Elevated expression levels of NONO has been observed in a variety of tumor types including prostate cancer, melanoma, and neuroblastoma (PMID: 26148231) and may play a role in promoting breast cancer proliferation (PMID: 31733123).

NFKB2, nuclear factor kappa B subunit 2, is a component of the NF-kappa-B complex that is involved in transcriptional regulation of a number of cellular processes including inflammation, immunity, and apoptosis (PMID: 29874793), and plays a role in inhibiting the canonical NF-kB signaling pathway (PMID: 25349408). NFKB2 overexpression has been observed in multiple myeloma (PMID: 17692805), prostate (PMID: 20388792), breast (PMID: 27404455), and pancreatic cancers (PMID: 25473891), NFKB2 mutations have been associated with non-small cell lung cancer (PMID: 29588475), and a fusion of NFKB2 and TYK2 has been identified in anaplastic large cell lymphoma.
B4GALNT1, beta-1,4-N-acetyl-galactosaminyl transferase 1, is a glycosyltransferase essential for the synthesis of complex gangliosides, which are potential tumor-associated antigens (PMID: 27102283).

CTNNBL1, catenin beta like 1, is a nuclear protein that interacts with RNA splicing components via binding to nuclear localization signals (PMID: 21385873, PMID: 24269683). CTNNBL1 fused with RAF1 has been observed in breast cancer and elevated levels of CTNNBL1 has been linked to poor prognosis in ovarian cancer (PMID: 29242214, PMID: 28501461).

CCNL1, cyclin-L1, is involved in the regulation of pre-mRNA splicing and may be involved in transition of the cell-cycle from G0 to G1 (PMID: 15700036). Overexpression and/or amplification of Ccnl1 has been observed in head and neck squamous cell carcinoma (PMID: 16598186, PMID: 15700036).

KIR3DL2, killer cell immunoglobulin-like receptor 3DL2, is a member of the KIR-L family of inhibitory receptors that binds human leukocyte antigens and CpG oligodeoxynucleotides, and may play a role in cellular immune response, and apoptosis (PMID: 28912774, PMID: 25414436, PMID: 20147700). Overexpression of KIR3DL2 has been observed in cutaneous T-cell lymphoma and Sezary syndrome (PMID: 29089310, PMID: 17703174).

MAPK11 (p38beta), mitogen-activated protein kinase 11, is an evolutionarily conserved serine/threonine kinase in the MAPK pathway that is involved in various cellular processes in response to extracellular stimuli (PMID: 21673068). MAPK11 (p38beta) is expressed in breast cancer cell lines and is associated with breast cancer cell-mediated osteolytic bone destruction (PMID: 25066918).

TRIM27, zinc finger protein RFP, is a member of the tripartite motif (TRIM) protein family (PMID: 29767249) and an E3 ubiquitin-protein ligase (PMID: 23419514) that regulates transcriptional repression, apoptosis, and the cell-cycle (PMID: 22829933). Fusions of TRIM27 with RET have been identified in salivary gland intraductal carcinoma (PMID: 30045065) and papillary thyroid carcinoma (PMID: 12787916).

DROSHA, drosha ribonuclease type III, functions as part of the microprocessor complex to initiate microRNA maturation (PMID: 25027649). Mutations in DROSHA are associated with Wilms tumor (PMID: 24909261), downregulation of DROSHA is associated with poor prognosis in several tumor types (PMID: 25351346), and decreased mRNA expression has been observed in breast carcinoma (PMID: 28598829).

UBE2H, ubiquitin conjugating enzyme E2 H, catalyzes the association between ubiquitin and other proteins thus targets proteins for degradation (PMID: 8132613). UBE2H fusion has been identified in lung cancer (PMID: 30244854).

IGF2BP3, insulin-like growth factor 2 mRNA binding protein 3, regulates post-transcriptional expression of genes involved in tumor cell survival, metastasis, and resistance (PMID: 25068994). Upregulation of Igf2bp3 expression has been identified in a variety of cancers and is often associated with poor prognosis (PMID: 25068994).

CPSF6, cleavage and polyadenylation specificity factor subunit 6, is a component of the cleavage factor I (CFIm), which is a multisubunit complex that plays a role in the processing of RNA (PMID: 28673861). A RARG-CPSF6 fusion has been observed in AML (PMID: 29891591), a CPSF6-FGFR1 fusion in myeloproliferative syndrome (PMID: 18205209), and Cpsf6 may play a role in the aggressiveness of breast cancer (PMID: 28673861).

BRIP1, BRCA1 interacting protein C-terminal helicase 1, is involved in DNA repair and aids the tumor suppressor function of Brca1 (PMID: 14983014). BRIP1 germline mutations are associated with breast and ovarian cancers and somatic mutations are highest in endometrial, colon, and NSCLC (PMID: 27283171).

XPO1, exportin 1, encodes for an export protein that is responsible for transporting large molecules from the nucleus to the cytoplasm (PMID: 22773955). XPO1 over expression has been observed in multiple types of cancer including, but not limited to ovarian, pancreatic, and lymphoma (PMID: 22209898).

HLA-C, major histocompatibility complex, class I, C, is a highly polymorphic gene, which plays a role in the presentation of antigens to the immune system (PMID: 17326240, PMID: 21355865). HLA-C loss of heterozygosity has been identified in lung adenocarcinoma (PMID: 29107330).

CCDC170, coiled-coil domain containing 170, plays a role in the positioning of the golgi near the nucleus, a process that is directly dependent on the microtubules (PMID: 28687497). Fusions with ESR1 and CCDC170 have been identified in breast cancer (PMID: 25099679).

CLTC, clathrin heavy chain 1, is a component of membrane vesicles and is involved in trafficking intracellular proteins (PMID: 1765375). CLTC fusions with ALK and TFE3 have been identified in several cancer types (PMID: 12750159, PMID: 24142740, PMID: 12917640).

AXL is a receptor tyrosine kinase, which promotes growth, migration, and survival of tumor cells through activation of Mapk signaling (PMID: 28072762). Activation and overexpression of AXL has been associated with resistance to chemotherapeutic agents and targeted therapies (PMID: 28251492).

HBEGF, proheparin-binding EGF-like growth factor, is regulated by pro-inflammatory cytokines, is a ligand for the EGFR receptor (PMID: 22641673), and plays a role in cell differentiation (PMID: 28174207). HBEGF overexpression has been identified in ovarian cancer (PMID: 28668900), glioblastoma (PMID: 28368403), colorectal cancer (PMID: 29361822), gastric cancer (PMID: 25717241), and cervical cancer (PMID: 28498437).

TET1, tet methylcytosine dioxygenase 1, plays a critical role in DNA demethylation, supports DNA repair, and is involved in regulation of gene expression (PMID: 29556496, PMID: 28555658). TET1 mutations have been identified in colon cancer (PMID: 22895193), fusions between TET1 and KMT2A have been identified in acute myeloid leukemia (PMID: 12124344, PMID: 23100278), and TET1 promoter methylation and downregulation has been identified in multiple tumor types including lung, gastric, colorectal, breast, and renal cancers (PMID: 27225590).

FOLH1, folate hydrolase 1, encodes prostate-specific membrane antigen (PSMA), which acts as a glutamate carboxypeptidase resulting in folate hydrolase activity as well as NAALADase activity (PMID: 9816319, PMID: 8570628). Over expression of FOLH1 (PMSA) has been observed in prostate cancer (PMID: 16985927).

SSTR5, somatostatin receptor 5, is a member of the somatostatin family of G protein-coupled receptors that regulates endocrine and exocrine secretions (PMID: 16625838). Aberrant Sstr5 expression has been identified in a variety of tumors including cholangiocellular carcinoma, neuroendocrine tumors, and meningioma (PMID: 29282035, PMID: 27875519, PMID: 26722517).

MLH1, mutL homolog 1, is a tumor suppressor (PMID: 30562755) that dimerizes with Pms2 to form a component of the DNA mismatch repair (MMR) system (PMID: 16873062), and is associated with microsatellite instability (MSI) (PMID: 30121009) and genomic stability (PMID: 31747945). MLH1 promoter hypermethylation, resulting in Mlh1 deficiency, is frequently associated with sporadic colorectal, gastric, and esophageal cancers (PMID: 23555617, PMID: 21988782, PMID: 28224663, PMID: 28454461), and germline MLH1 mutations are associated with Lynch (Hereditary Nonpolyposis Colorectal Cancer) syndrome (PMID: 15528792).

MAGEA4, melanoma-associated antigen 4, is a member of the cancer testis antigen (CTA) family (PMID: 28300603), and regulates cell growth (PMID: 22842486). Overexpression of MAGEA4 has been observed in several tumor types, including head and neck squamous cell carcinoma (PMID: 22842486), bladder cancer (PMID: 19533752), lung, breast, ovarian, colon, and esophageal cancers (PMID: 30881511).

GPR107, G protein-coupled receptor 107, is involved in protein retrograde trafficking in the trans-Golgi network (PMID: 25031321). Increased expression of Gpr107 has been demonstrated in AML (PMID: 27258612).

PRKDC, protein kinase, DNA-activated, catalytic polypeptide, is the catalytic component of the DNA-PK complex, which functions in DNA repair by non-homologous end-joining (PMID: 14726021, PMID: 24680878). PRKDC overexpression has been demonstrated in colorectal and prostate cancers (PMID: 26992638, PMID: 27856181).

EGFL7, EGF like domain multiple 7, encodes a secreted growth factor that is primarily expressed in endothelial cells, promotes angiogenesis, and plays a role in the regulation of Notch signaling (PMID: 22160377). EGFL7 mutations have been observed in acute myeloid leukemia (PMID: 27798625), and overexpression has been identified in hepatocellular carcinoma (PMID: 29970668) and acute myeloid leukemia (PMID: 28533390).

SIRPA, tyrosine-protein phosphatase non-receptor type substrate 1, is predominately expressed on the cell surface of macrophages and is a receptor for CD47, which upon binding inhibits phagocytosis (PMID: 29930800). Sirpa altered expression has been reported in a variety of tumor types and therapeutic disruption of binding of CD47 to the Sirpa receptor on macrophages may stimulate phagocytosis of tumor cells (PMID: 28286286, PMID: 28258703).

FGF9, fibroblast growth factor 9, encodes for a member of the fibroblast growth factor family, playing a role in cell development processes including proliferation (PMID: 16982695). Aberrant expression of FGF9 has been associated with several tumor types including glioma, prostate, and ovarian endometrioid adenocarcinomas (PMID: 16982695).

RSPO2, R-spondin 2, encodes for one of the secreted proteins in the TSR1-containing protein family, which plays a role in canonical Wnt signaling due to its furin repeat domains (PMID: 24980904). RSPO2 fusions with EIF3E (PMID: 22895193), PRR15L (PMID: 31209633), and PIEZO1 (PMID: 30916365) have been identified in colorectal traditional serrated adenomas.

PIK3CD, phosphatidylinositol 4,5-bisphosphate 3-kinase catalytic subunit delta isoform, is predominantly expressed in leukocytes and regulates leukocyte proliferation and differentiation (PMID: 23330955).

TRAF3, TNF receptor-associated factor 3, is a key regulator of NF-KappaB signaling through ubiquitin-dependent degradation, therefore regulates lymphocytes function and survival, and tumorigenesis (PMID: 26085207). Inactivation of TRAF3 has been identified in multiple myeloma and lymphoma (PMID: 26085207).

TMPRSS2, transmembrane protease, serine 2, encodes for a serine protease and is regulated by androgen. TMPRSS2 fusions frequently occur with ETS transcription factors, including ERG and ETV1, and are commonly observed in prostate cancer (PMID: 20478527).

LAMP1, lysosomal associated membrane protein 1, encodes for a type-1 transmembrane protein, which makes up a large portion of the lysosomal membrane and plays a role in preventing lysosomal membrane degradation (PMID: 12628346). Overexpression of LAMP1 has been observed in glioblastoma (PMID: 23826410) and laryngeal squamous cell carcinoma (PMID: 27788920).
TBC1D3G, TBC1 domain family, member 3G, is a paralogue of TBC1D3, a putative oncogene (PMID: 16863688).

GOT1, glutamic-oxaloacetic transaminase 1, is a key enzyme in carbon and nitrogen metabolism (PMID: 26003525). GOT1 fusions with ETV6 have been identified in myelodysplastic syndrome (PMID: 16757412).

RNF217-AS1, RNF217 antisense RNA 1 (head to head), is also referred to as STL and is a putative long non-coding RNA that has uncharacterized biological function (PMID: 25298122). A STL fusion with ETV6 has been observed in leukemia (PMID: 25298122).

EGF, epidermal growth factor, is a peptide that binds to EGFR and activates downstream signaling, which regulates cell growth and differentiation (PMID: 3015991). Elevated serum Egf level has been identified in lung cancer and head and neck cancer (PMID: 17453000).

EPHA4, EPH receptor A4, is an ephrin receptor tyrosine kinase that binds to A-type and most B-type ephrin ligands, and is involved in cell morphology, adhesion, and migration (PMID: 23738943, PMID: 12094214). EPHA4 overexpression has been associated with poor outcomes in gastric cancers (PMID: 23738943, PMID: 18837080, PMID: 31966851), and has been observed in the progression of renal (PMID: 31966534), pancreatic (PMID: 24932309), and colorectal (PMID: 18695888) cancers, however, decreased expression has been observed in breast cancer (PMID: 27478038) and acute myeloid leukemia (PMID: 24764074).

WWTR1, WW domain containing transcription regulator 1, is a transcriptional co-factor, which is associated with organ development and cell differentiation (PMID: 18227151). Elevated expression of WWTR1 has been observed in embryonal rhabdomyosarcoma (PMID: 27184972) and fusions with WWTR1 have been identified in epithelioid hemangioendothelioma and ossifying fibromyxoid tumors (PMID: 25961935, PMID: 27537276).

GHR, growth hormone receptor, mediates the activation of multiple signaling pathways leading to body growth (PMID: 17308965). Upregulation of GHR has been detected in a variety of cancers (PMID: 23807602).

COL18A1, collagen alpha-1(XVIII) chain, may play a major role in determining retinal structure and neural tube closure. COL18A1 encodes the endostatin chain which can inhibit endothelial cell proliferation and angiogenesis and endostatin is implicated in the prognosis of human cancer (PMID: 20361288; PMID: 21815140).

DLC1, DLC1 Rho GTPase activating protein, is also known as deleted in liver cancer 1 (PMID: 29785050) and converts Rho proteins to the inactive state, thereby regulating cellular processes of cell proliferation and cytoskeleton organization (PMID: 29785050). Decreased expression and Dlc1 missense mutations have been observed in gastric cancer (PMID: 26401016, PMID: 31145962) and liver cancer (PMID: 29785050), and increased Dcl1 expression in non-small cell lung cancer has been associated with increased survival (PMID: 31059015).

JAK2, tyrosine-protein kinase JAK2, is a non-receptor protein tyrosine kinase that binds cytokine receptors to activate the interferon-alpha/beta/gamma pathway and is a member of the JAK/STAT signaling pathway (PMID: 15575979, PMID: 30092288). JAK2 mutations are observed in a variety of tumor types, including myeloproliferative neoplasms (PMID: 30074114), lymphoma (PMID: 29984752), leukemia (PMID: 29979407), and cervical cancer (PMID: 30003068).

MAGI2, membrane associated guanylate kinase, WW and PDZ domain containing 2, encodes a scaffold protein that is a member of the membrane-associated guanylate kinase family, which interacts with PTEN, stabilizing its expression and thereby enhancing the suppression of PI3K/AKT signaling (PMID: 25271328, PMID: 10760291). MAGI2 rearrangements and decreased expression has been identified in prostate cancer (PMID: 21307934, PMID: 29542165).

ADGRA2, adhesion G protein-coupled receptor A2, is an orphan G protein-coupled receptor that functions as a coactivator of Wnt7-mediated beta-catenin signaling, thus regulates CNS angiogenesis (PMID: 30026314, PMID: 21071672) and contact inhibition of proliferation (PMID: 19853600). ADGRA2 mutations have been identified in colon cancer (PMID: 29844865) and leiomyosarcoma (PMID: 31300531).

CEBPE, CCAAT/enhancer binding protein epsilon, is a transcription factor that regulates gene expression in myeloid and lymphoid cells (PMID: 8661101). A CEBPE with fusion with IGH has been identified in B-lineage acute lymphoblastic leukemia (PMID: 19027493, PMID: 27019113).

FRK, tyrosine-protein kinase FRK, is a SRC family member that functions in regulation of cell proliferation, differentiation, signaling (PMID: 23318459, PMID: 19652529), and plays a role in genomic stability through BRCA1 (PMID: 29156836). Mutations in FRK are associated with hepatocellular adenomas and lung cancer (PMID: 24735922, PMID: 21074287) and decreased FRK expression has been observed in breast cancer (PMID: 29348886, PMID: 29156836).

PDGFB, platelet-derived growth factor beta polypeptide, is a growth factor that signals through PDGFRs, which plays a role in development, cell proliferation, and cell migration (PMID: 18483217). Overexpression of PDGFB has been implicated in several tumor types (PMID: 24359404).
RASA3, RAS p21 protein activator 3, is a member of the GAP1 subfamily of GTPase-activating proteins, which targets Ras and Rap, and has been implicated in cancer (PMID: 25294679).

MEF2B, myocyte enhancer factor 2B, encodes a transcription factor that targets genes involved in cell movement, growth, and proliferation (PMID: 26245647), and tissue development such as the differentiation of vascular smooth cells and cardiac muscle (PMID: 26506234, PMID: 17003108, PMID: 25550204). MEF2B inactivating mutations are associated with non-Hodgkin lymphoma (PMID: 26245647).
PTPRR, protein tyrosine phosphatase, receptor type R, negatively regulates MAPK signaling (UniProt.org). PTPRR fusions have been observed with ETV6 in leukemias (PMID: 16061641).

PMS1, PMS1 homolog 1, mismatch repair system component, is a MutL homolog that interacts with MLH1 and has a putative role in DNA mismatch repair (PMID: 11920679). Germ line PMS1 mutations are associated with Lynch syndrome (PMID: 19466295) and somatic mutations have been identified in multiple myeloma, colorectal cancer, and ovarian cancer (PMID: 30809292, PMID: 24614649, PMID: 24333356).

ATF1, cyclic AMP-dependent transcription factor ATF-1, belongs to the CREB/ATF family of basic/leucine zipper transcription factors  (PMID: 1655749, PMID: 8384217) and plays a role in cell migration and invasion (PMID: 28912415). ATF1 fusions with EWSR1 frequently occur in hyalinizing clear-cell carcinoma (PMID: 21484932, PMID:     29434341), myxoid mesenchymal tumors (PMID: 29143432), and clear cell sarcoma-like tumors (PMID: 29491075, PMID: 29197033) and overexpression of Atf1 occurs in several tumor types (PMID: 28912415).

BFSP2, beaded filament structural protein 2, encodes one of the proteins involved in forming the intermediate filament, a component of the cytoskeleton structure, that is involved in the tissue organization of the eye lens (PMID: 19587458). A fusion with FGFR2 and BFSP2 has been identified in intrahepatic cholangiocarcinoma (PMID: 30420614).

LRRFIP1, leucine-rich repeat flightless-interacting protein 1, represses transcription of several genes and may play a role in cancer metastasis and invasion (PMID: 26047573). Expression of Lrrfip1 has been implicated in cellular invasion in colorectal cancer (PMID: 22750095) and an LRRFIP1 - FGFR1 fusion has been observed in myeloproliferative syndrome (PMID: 19369959).

GNMT, glycine N-methyltransferase, is a metabolic enzyme that catalyzes the formation of sarcosine from glycine, and plays a role in cholesterol homeostasis, DNA methylation, and regulation of DNA integrity (PMID: 19035462, PMID: 23922098, PMID: 24147572). Decreased expression of GNMT is associated with hepatocellular carcinoma (PMID: 19035462).

SEM1, 26S proteasome complex subunit, (also referred to as DSS1) associates with other factors to regulate DNA double strand break repair (PMID: 26145171). Increased expression of SEM1 is associated with cervical and breast cancers (PMID: 26145171, PMID: 23024267, PMID: 24289229).

CDH6, cadherin-6, is also known as kidney-cadherin, K-cadherin, and plays a role in mesenchymal-epithelial differentiation of the kidney during embryogenesis (PMID: 24069422). Overexpression of Cdh6 has been observed in osteosarcoma (PMID: 29628305) and may contribute to lymph node metastasis and decreased survival in oral squamous cell carcinoma (PMID: 29805672), however Cdh6 has been demonstrated to have a tumor suppressive function in cholangiocarcinoma (PMID: 27593557).

SDHC, succinate dehydrogenase cytochrome b560 subunit, mitochondrial, is the large membrane-bound subunit of cytochrome b in mitochondrial complex II that catalyzes electron transfer from succinate to ubiquinone (PMID: 21771581). SDHC germline mutations are found paragangliomas (PMID: 19454582), pheochromocytomas (PMID: 17557926), adrenocortical carcinomas (PMID: 28819017), and somatic promoter methylation leads to decreased expression of Sdhc in parasympathetic paragangliomas (PMID: 29126304).

GATM, glycine amidinotransferase, catalyzes the formation of the creatine precursor, guanidinoacetic acid (PMID: 9218780). GATM fusions have been identified in a variety of cancer types including renal and pancreatic acinar cell carcinoma (PMID: 25888189, PMID: 25266736).

CDC73, cell division cycle 73, also know as parafibromin, encodes a tumor suppressor that is involved in transcriptional and post-transcriptional control pathways. Mutations and loss of expression of Cdc73 have been associated with parathyroid carcinoma (PMID: 22987117, PMID: 28352668, PMID: 30567092) and aberrant expression has been observed in gastric, lung, breast, and ovarian cancers (PMID: 29221126).

APOBEC4, apolipoprotein B mRNA editing enzyme, catalytic polypeptide-like 4 (putative), is a member of the cytidine deaminase family (PMID: 22001110) and may play a role in enhancing HIV-1 replication (PMID: 27249646).

PTEN, phosphatidylinositol 3,4,5-trisphosphate 3-phosphatase and dual-specificity protein phosphatase PTEN, is a tumor suppressor (PMID: 30562755) with roles in the cell cycle, growth, DNA repair, cell survival and regulation of the Akt-mTOR pathway (PMID: 24656806, PMID: 30145641). PTEN germline mutations are common in Cowden syndrome (PMID: 30562755) and PTEN somatic alterations resulting in loss of function have been found in many types of cancer including, but not limited to endometrial (PMID: 30142194), melanoma (PMID: 30148988), and prostate (PMID: 18767981, PMID: 30153654).

KDM3A, lysine (K)-specific demethylase 3A, is a histone demethylase influencing histone modification and chromatin remodeling to regulate cell cycle progression and cell differentiation (PMID: 22581778). Increased expression of KDM3A has been reported in both bladder and lung cancer (PMID: 22020899, PMID: 18984585).

CD79B, CD79b molecule, encodes for a membrane protein involved in forming the B cell receptor complex, which once formed, induces B cell activation (PMID: 24146823). CD79B mutations demonstrate constitutive activation of the NF-kB pathway in diffuse large B-cell lymphomas (PMID: 21324920).

LSM14A, protein LSM14 homolog A, is an mRNA processing body assembly factor that belongs to the Rap55 protein family of conserved mRNA-translation controlling proteins (PMID: 18723115) and plays a role in antiviral response (PMID: 27183626). LSM14A fusions with BRAF have been observed in spitzoid melanomas (PMID: 24445538).

ARMC10, armadillo repeat containting 10, directly decreases the transcriptional activity of Tp53 via binding to the DNA binding domain (PMID: 17904127). ARMC10 fusions with BRAF have been observed in lung cancer (PMID: 26314551) and melanoma (PMID: 30254212).

NUP98, nucleoporin 98, forms part of the nuclear pore complex, which functions in transport across the nuclear membrane, and also plays a role in transcriptional regulation (PMID: 19577736, PMID: 21948299, PMID: 27889185). NUP98 fusions have been demonstrated in hematological malignancies, including acute myeloid leukemia (PMID: 19577736, PMID: 21948299, PMID: 27889185).

IGFBP7, insulin-like growth factor-binding protein 7, is a secreted protein that plays a role in the regulation of cell proliferation, differentiation, and apoptosis (PMID: 29991293, PMID: 31183073). IGFBP7 deletion has been observed in hepatocellular carcinoma (PMID: 28619711), and decreased expression of Igfbp7 has been observed in cholangiocarcinoma (PMID: 29991293).

ZRSR2, zinc finger CCCH-type, RNA binding motif and serine/arginine rich 2, is a component of the splicesome that functions in 3' splice site recognition, therefore regulates expression of E2F transcription factors and genes in the Mapk/Erk pathways (PMID: 21041408, PMID: 25586593). ZRSR2 mutations are associated with myelodysplastic syndromes and acute myeloid leukemia, particularly in males (PMID: 21909114, PMID: 26769228).

EED, embryonic ectoderm development, is a core subunit of polycomb repressive complex 2, which is involved in transcriptional regulation and the maintenance of transcriptional repression during development (PMID: 30951652, PMID: 27449971). Mutations and deletions of EED have been identified in malignant peripheral nerve sheath tumors (PMID: 25240281).

RIT1, Ras-like without CAAX 1, is a member of the RAS superfamily of small GTPases that plays a role in regulation of cell signaling, proliferation, and survival (PMID: 23770287). RIT1 mutations have been observed in lung adenocarcinoma and myeloid leukemia (PMID: 30872527), and germline mutations are associated with Noonan syndrome (PMID: 24469055, PMID: 23791108).

GEN1, Flap endonuclease GEN homolog 1, is a structure-specific endonuclease capable of processing Holliday junctions during double-stranded DNA repair events within mitosis and meiosis (PMID: 28327556). Somatic truncating GEN1 variants have been identified in breast cancers, but do not contribute significantly to BRCA1/2-negative familial breast cancer susceptibility (PMID: 20512659).

SEMA4D, semaphorin-4D, is a member of the class IV Semaphorin family that binds CD72, PLXN1B, PLXNB2, and PLXNC1 receptors and plays a role in regulation of the immune system, angiogenesis, and bone remodeling (PMID: 29971044). Overexpression of Sema4d has been observed in lymphoma, leukemia, prostate, glioma, lung, ovarian, sarcoma, and cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma, where it is associated with tumor aggressiveness and poor prognosis (PMID: 29971044).

MSH6, mutS homolog 6, binds with Msh2 to form the MutS-alpha complex, which functions in initiation of the DNA mismatch repair system (PMID: 23391514) and is associated with microsatellite instability (MSI) (PMID: 30121009). Mutations in MSH6 are associated with susceptibility to colon cancer and endometrial cancer (PMID: 20028993), and germline MSH6 mutations are associated with Lynch (Hereditary Nonpolyposis Colorectal Cancer) syndrome (PMID: 15528792).

SGK1, serum/glucocorticoid regulated kinase 1, is a member of the AGC family of serine/threonine kinases that acts downstream of the PI3K pathway to regulate signaling involved in multiple processes including ion transport, cell proliferation, and differentiation (PMID: 28236975, PMID: 28529581, PMID:  27771704). SGK1 over expression has been demonstrated in several tumor types (PMID: 28529581, PMID: 27771704).

VTCN1, V-set domain containing T cell activation inhibitor 1, is a member of the B7-family proteins that regulates immune response and tumor microenvironment (PMID: 28258701). VTCN1 overexpression has been identified in a wide variety of tumors (PMID: 28258701).

LOC389473, chromosome 5 open reading frame 13 pseudogene, is a pseudogene located 12kb upstream of the IGF2BP3 gene (PMID: 28193878). LOC389473 fusions are identified in thyroid cancers (PMID: 28193878).

RPTOR, regulatory associated protein of MTOR complex 1, is a key regulator of the mammalian target of rapamycin complex 1 (mTORC1) activity, which regulates cell growth and survival (PMID: 29344641). Decreased hypomethylation of RPTOR has been observed in the peripheral blood of breast cancer patients (PMID: 27577081) and inhibition has been demonstrated to overcome EGFR inhibition in TNBC cells in cell culture (PMID: 29344641).

CDX2, caudal type homeobox 2, is a member of the caudal-related homeobox transcription factor family and regulates processes including adhesion, cell proliferation, differentiation, migration, and tumorigenesis (PMID: 21126581). CDX2 fusions have been observed with ETV6 in leukemias (PMID: 9920852).

BAG4, BAG family molecular chaperone regulator 4, also known as silencer of death domains, binds Bcl2 and Hsp70, inhibits receptor signaling by TNF, and prevents apoptosis (PMID: 14559896). BAG4 fusions with FGFR1 have been identified in non-small cell lung cancer (PMID: 24850843).

SMYD3, SET and MYND domain containing 3, is a histone methyltransferase which regulates transcription through chromatin modification and as part of the RNA polymerase complex and therefore, plays a role in epigenetic gene regulation (PMID: 15235609; PMID: 28019723). Overexpression of Smyd3 has been linked to several types of cancer including breast, colorectal, and liver (PMID: 25382779; PMID: 28639750; PMID: 28123630).

SYK, spleen tyrosine kinase, functions in immune cell activation and cell survival (PMID: 25447675, PMID: 24975478). Aberrant activation and expression of SYK is associated with several hematological and epithelial tumor types (PMID: 25447675, PMID: 24975478)

DPP4, dipeptidyl peptidase 4, is a glycoprotein and exopeptidase (PMID: 26284071) of the serine peptidase clan SC subfamily 9b and plays a role in the activation of T-cells and glucose homeostasis (PMID: 26671446). Decreased expression of Dpp4 has been observed during progression in castration-resistant prostate cancer (PMID: 30242112).

KMT2B, lysine methyltransferase 2B, is responsible for the methylation of H3K4, a post-translational modification that leads to the regulation of gene expression, the cell cycle, and embryonic development (PMID: 27839873, PMID: 25998713). KMT2B mutations have been identified in a variety of tumor types including endometrial cancer, lung cancer, and hepatic cancer (PMID: 25998713).

ZKSCAN5, zinc finger with KRAB and SCAN domains 5, belongs to the Kruppel family of zinc-finger transcription factors, and has been identified in a fusion with BRAF in a melanocytic tumor (PMID: 10585779, PMID: 23890088).

KLB, klotho beta, is a transmembrane protein that interacts with Fgfrs to promote high affinity Fgf binding, therefore regulates cell metabolism and growth (PMID: 18772362, PMID: 20657013). Overexpression of KLB have been identified in bladder and liver cancers (PMID: 27573985, PMID: 22439738).

PLAG1, PLAG1 zinc finger, is a mitogenic transcription factor that induces expression of a variety of genes regulating cell proliferation including IGF2 (PMID: 26577933). PLAG1 rearrangements have been identified in pleomorphic adenomas of the salivary gland and lipoblastomas (PMID: 17332914).

CCNA1, cyclin A1, is a testis-specific cyclin that may play a role in germ cell cell cycle control (PMID: 19001847). Expression of Ccna1 has been identified in hematological cancers and in urothelial carcinomas of the bladder (PMID: 9639417, PMID: 25039670).

GNA13, G protein subunit alpha 13, encodes a member of the G12 family of G protein alpha subunits, which activate Rho guanine-exchange factors and play a role in cell migration and invasion (PMID: 19422395, PMID: 19226283). GNA13 mutations have been identified in Burkitts lymphoma and defuse large B-cell lymphoma (PMID: 26616858, PMID: 23699601), and altered expression levels have been identified in multiple malignancies including hepatocellular carcinoma (PMID: 27883022), and gastric cancer (PMID: 26735177).

TNFRSF10B, tumor necrosis factor receptor superfamily member 10B, is a cell surface receptor that binds TRAIL to activate the caspase cascade for induction of apoptosis (PMID: 25770212). Decreased expression of TNFRSF10B may reduced the effectiveness of anticancer drugs promoting apoptosis (PMID: 28624529, PMID: 28467689, PMID: 28798154).
PRDM16, PR domain 16, is a zinc finger transcription factor (UniProt.org). PRDM16 fusions have been observed with ETV6 in leukemia leading to PRDM16 over expression (PMID: 22050763).

PPP2R1A, protein phosphatase 2 scaffold subunit Aalpha, contains 15 Huntingtin-Elongation-A subunit-TOR (HEAT) repeats (PMID: 31214504) and is a scaffold subunit of the major serine-threonine phosphatase PP2A, which has roles in cell signaling, proliferation, differentiation, and apoptosis (PMID: 23454242). PPP2R1A is frequently mutated in uterine serous carcinoma and serous endometrial cancer (PMID: 23454242, PMID: 22888282, PMID: 31214504).

TFE3, transcription factor binding to IGHM enhancer 3, is a transcription factor that plays a role in developmental and cellular processes, including targeting genes downstream in TGF-beta signaling (PMID: 15118077). TFE3 fusions are commonly associated with renal cell carcinoma and perivascular epithelioid cell tumors (PEComas) (PMID: 26975036, PMID: 24455396).

GNAI1, G protein subunit alpha i1, is a member of the G(alpha)i family which is involved in the regulation of cell proliferation and differentiation (PMID: 23691483). GNAI1 may play a role in the pathogenesis of renal cell carcinoma (PMID: 26043775).

HOOK3, hook microtubule-tethering protein 3, is a component of the FHF complex that regulates vesicle trafficking (PMID: 18799622). HOOK3 mutations are detected in various cancers (PMID: 17639057, PMID: 26230842).

YES1, YES proto-oncogene 1, Src family tyrosine kinase, is a nonreceptor tyrosine kinase regulating proliferation, migration, and cytoskeletal function (PMID: 21566460) through activation of CDK4, CTNND1, and YAP1 (PMID: 31391186). YES1 amplification and overexpression has been reported in HER2-positive breast cancer (PMID: 28158234) and in esophageal, uterine, bladder, lung, and head and neck cancers (PMID: 31391186).

TPR, translocated promoter region, nuclear basket protein, is a nuclear pore protein with a role in cellular senescence (PMID: 21811608). TPR and FGFR fusions have been observed in myeloproliferative disorders and cancer (PMID: 22619110, PMID: 26391436).

KDM3B, lysine (K)-specific demethylase 3B, is a histone demethylase influencing histone modification and chromatin remodeling to regulate cell cycle progression and cell differentiation. Decreased KDM3B expression has been reported in breast cancer (PMID: 23266085).

CCNK, cyclin-K, interacts with CDK12 or CDK13 to regulate activity of RNA polymerase II mediated transcription (PMID: 30122539) and may also play a role in regulating the cell-cycle and DNA replication (PMID: 29760377). Overexpression of Ccnk has been shown to promote cell proliferation in cell culture (PMID: 20459741, PMID: 29760377, PMID: 28670704).

FAM76A, family with sequence similarity 76 member A, lacks a histidine tract and consequently has a diffuse nucleoplasmic staining with unknown function (PMID: 19266028). A FGFR2 - FAM76A fusion has been observed in ovarian cancer (PMID: 24563622).

EMSY, BRCA2 interacting transcriptional repressor, is a chromatin modifying protein that regulates transcription and DNA repair via its interaction with BRCA2 (PMID: 24609898). EMSY amplification has been observed in sporadic breast and ovarian cancer and is associated with poor prognosis (PMID: 14651845).

CDK4, cyclin-dependent kinase 4, is a critical regulator of the G1-S cell-cycle transition, inhibits cell senescence and apoptosis (PMID: 24089445) and is also a tumor antigen recognized by T-cells in melanoma (PMID: 29403496). CDK4 dysregulation promotes tumorgenesis in a variety of cancer types (PMID: 24795392) and amplification is common in liposarcoma (PMID: 23569315).
VDR, vitamin D3 receptor, is a transcription factor regulating calcium homeostasis. VDR polymorphisms has been associated with a variety of cancers (PMID: 19667145).

EPHB2, EPH receptor B2, is a receptor tyrosine kinase that binds to ephrin-B family ligands and mediates downstream signaling, which is involved in regulation of cell proliferation and tumorigenesis (PMID: 19962662).

FAS, Fas cell surface death receptor, is a member of the tumor necrosis factor family of receptors and plays an important role in programed cell death (PMID: 12040174, PMID: 11048730). Mutations in FAS have been identified in non-Hodgkin lymphoma (PMID: 9787134), and altered expression has been identified in solid tumors including colorectal cancer (PMID: 28766682), and breast cancer (PMID: 28121628).

SH2B3 (LNK), SH2B adapter protein 3, is an adaptor protein that integrates signaling molecules to JAK and RTK pathways and thereby negatively regulating hematopoiesis and endothelial cell physiology (PMID: 21723852). Loss of functional SH2B3 (LNK) is associated with ALL (PMID: 23908464) and MPN (PMID: 26522763) while SH2B3 (LNK) overexpression is associated with ovarian cancer (PMID: 24704825).

TMEM126A, transmembrane protein 126A, encodes a mitochondrial protein that plays a role in the regulation of epithelial-to-mesenchymal transition and supports mitochondrial function (PMID: 31052256, PMID: 30393159). Decreased Tmem126a expression has been identified in metastatic breast cancer (PMID: 30393159).

MAP3K8, mitogen-activated protein kinase kinase kinase 8, is primarily expressed by the immune system and is activated by TNF-alpha, IL1R, and TLR receptors to induce signaling by MEK 1/2 and ERK 1/2 (PMID: 29183769). MAP3K8 has been shown to function as both a tumor suppressor and an oncogene (PMID: 25723737) and altered expression has been identified in lung cancer (PMID: 28393206) and colorectal cancer (PMID: 23322277).

NISCH, nischarin, is a cytosolic protein with multiple binding partners, including integrin alpha-5, and is involved in regulation of cell signaling and migration (PMID: 26392073). NISCH acts as a tumor suppressor in breast cancer and ovarian cancer (PMID: 26392073, PMID: 21917605).

CHTOP, chromatin target of PRMT1 protein, is a nuclear protein that plays a role in activation of estrogen receptor target genes (PMID: 19858291) and mRNA export (PMID: 27683223). A CHTOP-NTRK1 fusion has been observed in glioblastoma (PMID: 25384085).

GATA1, GATA binding protein 1, is a transcriptional activator or repressor, which plays a role in erythroid development. GATA1 mutations are associated with Down Syndrome preleukemia and leukemia (PMID: 25435116; PMID: 24880866).

RPA3, replication protein A3, is a subunit of the heterotrimeric RPA protein, which plays a role in DNA replication and repair (PMID: 16935876, PMID: 29807999, PMID: 27151292). RPA3 overexpression has been observed in gastric cancer (PMID: 28766245) and hepatocellular carcinoma (PMID: 28683444), and amplification has been identified in breast cancer (PMID: 24955146).

RNF11, ring finger protein 11, is a component of the ubiquitin-editing protein complex (PMID: 14755250) that may regulate Smurf2 and subsequent TGFbeta signalling (PMID: 28292929). A fusion of Rnf11 with Braf has been observed in histiocytic neoplasms (PMID: 26566875).

POLQ, DNA polymerase theta, is a promiscuous DNA polymerase that regulates microhomology-mediated end-joining in response to double-stranded DNA breaks (PMID: 25642963, PMID: 31537809). POLQ expression is elevated in epithelial ovarian cancers and is associated with homologous recombination activity (PMID: 25642963).

SUFU, SUFU negative regulator of hedgehog signaling, negatively regulates hedgehog signaling via association with Gli proteins, resulting in inactivity of Gli and thereby, preventing its transcriptional activity (PMID: 20360384). SUFU loss has been associated with medulloblastoma and rhabdomyosarcoma (PMID: 27234298), and somatic SUFU mutations have been identified in prostate cancer (PMID: 15482598).

CCDC91, coiled-coil domain containing 91, is a protein with a dimerization domain but without a clear biological function (UniProt.org, PubMed, May 2016). CCDC91 fusions with BRAF have been observed in solid tumors (PMID: 26314551).

PLCB4, 1-phosphatidylinositol 4,5-bisphosphate phosphodiesterase beta-4, catalyzes the production of diacylglycerol (DAG) and inositol 1,4,5-trisphosphate (IP3) (PMID: 22560091). Gain of function mutations in PLCB4 have been identified in uveal melanoma (PMID: 26683228).

SIRT1, sirtuin 1, is an NAD+ dependent histone deacetylase that plays a role in metabolism, cell survival, and cell signaling (PMID: 26481524, PMID: 24020000). SIRT1 expression is dysregulated in several tumor types, including leukemia, prostate, colon, and pancreatic, and gastric cancer (PMID: 26655844, PMID: 19244112, PMID: 30710340).
TBP, TATA box binding protein, is a transcription factor that functions as part of the DNA-binding protein complex (TFIID) to regulate RNA polymerase II transcription (PMID: 15970593).

CTCF, CCCTC-binding factor (zinc finger protein), is a DNA binding transcriptional repressor of numerous genes including MYC (PMID: 8649389) and TP53 (PMID: 21465478). Ctcf missense variants have been identified in endometrial cancer, prostate cancer, Wilms tumor, and breast cancer (PMID: 28648147).

NUAK1, NUAK family kinase 1, encodes an AMPK-related kinase and plays a role in cell survival and the regulation of metabolic homeostasis (PMID: 23873311). Elevated expression of NUAK1 has been linked to prognosis in a variety of cancer types including gastric cancer, ovarian cancer, and non-small cell lung carcinoma (PMID: 24943992, PMID: 27833898, PMID: 23215946).

PIK3AP1 (BCAP), Phosphoinositide 3-kinase adapter protein 1, activates PI3K/AKT upon TLR signaling to negatively regulate B-cell inflammatory signaling (PMID: 22187458, PMID: 22187460). PIK3AP1 (BCAP) deletions have been identified in adult ALL (PMID: 25261097) and glioblastoma multiforme (PMID: 25502460).

WNT7A, wingless-type MMTV integration site family, member 7A, is a secreted protein that activates canonical Wnt signalling pathways (PMID: 22232518). WNT7A over expression has been reported in ovarian cancer (PMID: 22232518).

ADAR, double-stranded RNA-specific adenosine deaminase, post-transcriptionally converts adenosine to inosine in RNA (PMID: 24289319) and may regulate miRNA editing (PMID: 30197877). Aberrant Adar function has been associated with certain types of cancer (PMID: 24289319), including hepatocellular carcinoma, chronic myelogenous leukemia, glioblastoma and melanoma (PMID: 28974449).

STAT1, signal transducer and activator of transcription 1-alpha/beta, is a STAT family transcription factor that plays a role in innate immunity and response to growth factors via transcription of anti-viral and cell cycle regulatory genes (PMID: 24058806). STAT1 mRNA expression levels have been associated with favorable (PMID: 12374673) and poor breast cancer prognoses (PMID: 24725474).

CCND2, G1/S-specific cyclin-D2, encodes for the D2-type cyclin protein, which regulates the CDK kinases in order to promote the transition phases of the cell cycle (PMID: 10416984). CCND2 amplifications have been observed in malignant gliomas (PMID: 10416984), loss of Ccnd2 expression has been associated with promoter hypermethylation in renal cell cancer (PMID: 27583477) and in breast and lung cancer (PMID: 30308939), and mutations have been reported in AML (PMID: 27843138).

CENPA, centromere protein A, is a centromere-specific histone variant that is required for centromere function and plays a role in mitotic progression, cell survival, and chromosomal stability (PMID: 26601620, PMID: 28069312, PMID: 24614311). CENPA overexpression has been identified in several tumor types including hormone receptor-negative breast cancer (PMID: 27062469), colorectal cancer (PMID: 12839935), and lung adenocarcinoma (PMID: 22542705).

IL6R, interleukin 6 receptor, encodes for a receptor, which once bound by IL6, plays a role in anti-inflammation and regeneration via activation of the JAK/STAT, ERK, and PI3K signaling pathways (PMID: 21296109). IL6R signaling has been linked to ovarian carcinoma and lung adenocarcinoma via cross-talk with EGFR, and IL6R expression levels have been correlated to a worse prognosis in prostate cancer (PMID: 21156962).

HDAC1, histone deacetylase 1, is a member of the class I HDAC family that functions in deacetylation of histone proteins to repress transcription (PMID: 23697933) and plays a role in regulating cell proliferation and suppression of cytokine production by activated T-cells (PMID: 30096875). HDAC1 mutations have been identified in liposarcoma (PMID: 22328974), while increased expression has been observed in multiple tumor types including gastric, breast, colorectal, Hodgkin lymphoma, lung, and liver cancers (PMID: 24382387).

DNAJB1, DnaJ heat shock protein family (Hsp40) member B1, encodes a molecular chaperone of the DnaJ/Hsp40 family, which stimulates the ATPase activity of Hsp70 proteins, and plays a role in protein folding and degradation (PMID: 16952052, PMID: 20651708). DNAJB1-PRKACA fusion is associated with fibrolamellar hepatocellular carcinoma (PMID: 29162699, PMID: 24578576).

FANCC, Fanconi anemia, complementation group C, is a member of the Fanconi anemia core complex, which plays a role in DNA repair (PMID: 22675617, PMID: 27145721). Germline FANCC mutations are associated with Fanconi anemia, which involves predisposition to various cancers including pancreatic cancer and colorectal cancer (PMID: 15695377, PMID: 27165003).

EP300, E1A binding protein p300, functions in acetylation of histones and other proteins, as well as acting as a transcriptional co-activator, and is frequently mutated in various tumor types (PMID: 25111821, PMID: 24622842).

DTX3L, E3 ubiquitin-protein ligase DTX3L, is also known as B-lymphoma and BAL-associated protein (BBAP) and plays a role in histone modification and the DNA damage response through PARP1 activation (PMID: 23230272). DTX3L overexpression has been observed in melanoma (PMID: 26033450), in glioma patients with poor prognosis (PMID: 28627634), and may play a role in chemoresistance in hematological tumors (PMID: 28653881, PMID: 25605023).

CDK12, cyclin-dependent kinase 12, is a key regulator of transcription elongation, regulates the expression of genes involved in DNA repair, and is required for the maintenance of genomic stability (PMID: 24554720; PMID: 22012619). Loss and or inactivation of CDK12 has been commonly observed in many solid tumor types, including prostate (PMID: 29906450), breast, ovarian, endometrial, uterine (PMID: 30104286) and is a likely tumor suppressor (PMID: 30319007).

BTK, Bruton tyrosine kinase, is a non-receptor tyrosine kinase involved in B-cell activation and development (PMID: 24658273). BTK is commonly overexpressed in various hematological malignancies (PMID: 24658273) and BTK mutations have been linked to BTK inhibitor drug resistance (PMID: 28235842).

NCOA3, nuclear receptor coactivator 3, is a steroid-receptor coactivator family member that functions as a nuclear receptor coactivator and as a transcriptional coactivator (PMID: 21647249). Overexpression of NCOA3 has been associated with poor prognosis in several tumor types, including pancreatic cancer (PMID: 21647249, PMID: 27267632).

PRKAR1B, protein kinase cAMP-dependent type I regulatory subunit beta, is a component of the protein kinase A holoenzyme which mediates cAMP-dependent signaling (PMID: 7925653). PRKAR1B fusion with BRAF has been identified in gastrointestinal stromal tumor (PMID: 29523662).

POLR2A, polymerase (RNA) II subunit A, encodes for the largest RNA polymerase II subunit, which is responsible for the transcription of RNA and thus, required for cell survival (PMID: 8990153). POLR2A variants have been identified in several types of cancer including menigiomas (PMID: 27548314) and colorectal cancer, where POLR2A loss is often linked to hemizygous loss of TP53 (PMID: 25985938).

APOBEC3C, apolipoprotein B mRNA editing enzyme, catalytic polypeptide-like 3C, is a cytidine deaminase that induces C-to-U mutations in single-stranded DNA, functioning in host defense against retroviruses and foreign DNA (PMID: 20062055, PMID: 21632763). APOBEC3C may play a role in the progression of hepatocellular carcinoma (PMID: 26221327).

CA9, carbonic anhydrase 9, is a cell surface protein induced by hypoxia and plays a role in pH regulation leading to matrix remodeling and tumor metastasis (PMID: 28692057). Overexpression of Ca9 has been observed in a variety of solid tumors, including glioblastoma (PMID: 29263302), neuroblastoma (PMID: 22436629), and breast cancer (PMID: 26648580).

SPAG9, sperm associated antigen 9 is scaffold protein that mediates JNK signaling (UniProt.org). A SPAG9 fusion with JAK2 has been observed in acute lymphoblastic leukemia and SPAG9 expression is associated with invasion, cell motility and poor prognosis in diverse solid tumor types (PMID: 25951811, PMID: 25310386, PMID: 24801907, PMID: 18922895)

H2BC4, histone H2B type 1-C/E/F/G/I, encodes a member of the histone H2B family, and may play a role in transcription regulation, DNA repair, DNA replication, and chromosomal stability. The monoubiquitination of histone H2B plays a role in human cancer (PMID: 25009658; PMID: 24891457).

MAX, MYC associated factor X, is a member of the helix-loop-helix leucine zipper transcription factor family, and acts as a transcriptional cofactor for Myc family members, playing a role in regulation of cell growth (PMID: 16908182, PMID: 11031250). MAX inactivating mutations and deletions are associated with gastrointestinal stromal tumors (PMID: 28270683), and have been identified in pheochromocytoma (PMID: 22452945).

CD33, myeloid cell surface antigen CD33, is a cell adhesion molecule that plays a role in myeloid lineage and may inhibit immune cell activation (PMID: 24991573, PMID: 25320078). Altered expression of Cd33 may be a marker for worse prognosis in multiple myeloma (PMID: 24991573).

MEN1, multiple endocrine neoplasia I, is a scaffold protein that can function with various partners to control gene transcription, signal transduction, and genome integrity (PMID: 23850066). MEN1 is mutated in patients with multiple endocrine neoplasia type 1 syndrome (PMID: 9215690).

EPOP, Elongin BC and polycomb repressive complex 2 associated protein, encodes a chromatin regulator that interacts with PRC2, Elongin BC, and USP7 to modulate transcription of genes involved in cell survival and development (PMID: 27863226, PMID: 27863225). Mutations in EPOP have been identified in lung and thyroid tumors (PMID: 24670920), and increase EPOP expression has been identified in multiple tumors (PMID: 27863226).

ROR1, receptor tyrosine kinase like orphan receptor 1, is a type I transmembrane protein that belongs to the NTRK superfamily of receptor tyrosine kinases, which has a potential role in regulation of Wnt pathway signaling (PMID: 28236965, PMID: 18848778). Overexpression of ROR1 has been identified in pancreatic cancer (PMID: 30272313), hepatocellular carcinoma (PMID: 30832318), and colorectal cancer (PMID: 28427197).

ERBB2 (HER2), erb-b2 receptor tyrosine kinase 2, is an EGFR receptor tyrosine kinase that activates PI3K-AKT-mTOR and RAS-RAF-MEK-ERK pathways, therefore regulating growth and transformation (PMID: 17471238). ERBB2 (HER2) amplification, overexpression, and activation has been implicated in several tumor types (PMID: 17471238).

ZNF444, zinc finger protein 444, is a zinc-finger protein that functions in transcriptional activation (PMID: 11978792). Fusions between ZNF444 and EWSR1 have been identified in myoepithelial tumors (PMID: 19760602, PMID: 20815032).

NF1, neurofibromin, is a tumor suppressor (PMID: 30562755), which activates Ras GTPase activity leading to increased cell proliferation and malignant transformation (PMID: 19380279). NF1 germline mutations are common in neurofibromatosis type I (PMID: 30562755) and somatic mutations have been identified in a variety of human cancers (PMID: 28637487).

QKI, QKI, KH domain containing, RNA binding, is a member of the STAR RNA protein family and plays a role in post-transcriptional regulation, developmental processes, and the formation of myelin (PMID: 23630077). Fusions with QKI have been identified in gliomas (PMID: 23817572, PMID: 23583981).

SERPINB4, serpin family B member 4, is a member of the ov-serpin family of protease inhibitors, and has uncharacterized biological function (PMID: 27637160). SERPINB4 over expression is associated with squamous cell carcinomas, as well as other tumor types (PMID: 27637160).

CASP8 (caspase 8) is the initial protease in the death receptor induced apoptosis pathway, where procaspase-8 is recruited to death-inducing signaling complex (DISC) to initiate a cascade of caspases (PMID: 22683265) and is also a tumor antigen recognized by T-cells in HNSCC (PMID: 29403496). CASP8 mutations may promote carcinogenesis due to loss of the proapoptotic function of Casp8 or by activating Nfkb signaling (PMID: 23659359) and depending on the context, Casp8 may promote tumor progression (PMID: 20817393).

AFF1, AF4/FMR2 family, member 1, is  also referred to as AF4, and is a transcription elongation cofactor that regulates gene expression (PMID: 24367103). AFF1 gene rearrangements are frequently observed in childhood leukemia (PMID: 20701601).

ANGPT1, angiopoietin 1, promotes angiogenesis through the Tie2 receptor, leading to cell proliferation, migration, and cell invasion (PMID: 20651738, PMID: 27703260). Increased expression of Angpt1 has been observed in a variety of cancers, including ovarian and prostate (PMID: 27703260).

DKK1, dickkopf WNT signaling pathway inhibitor 1, is a glycoprotein that acts to inhibit canonical Wnt signaling, and may play a role in cellular differentiation, proliferation, and apoptosis (PMID: 12775774, PMID: 16763196, PMID: 17143291). Increased expression of Dkk1 is associated with metastasis in hilar cholangiocarcinoma (PMID: 27608843), and both low and high levels of Dkk1 expression have been demonstrated in various tumor types, including lung cancer and hepatocellular carcinoma, respectively (PMID: 28979801).

ID3, inhibitor of DNA binding 3, HLH protein, is a helix-loop-helix (HLH) transcription factor family member that lacks a DNA binding domain, which binds to other HLH proteins to prevent their DNA binding activity (PMID: 25248477, PMID: 16034366) and regulate apoptosis (PMID: 30008847). Overexpression of Id3 is associated with several tumor types (PMID: 12842081), including intrahepatic cholangiocarcinoma, where it is associated with poor prognosis and resistance to chemotherapy (PMID: 30520117), but in other tumor types, Id3, may enhance sensitivity of chemotherapy (PMID: 30008847).

FCER2, low affinity immunoglobulin epsilon Fc receptor, is a a low-affinity receptor for IgE and a B-cell specific antigen that plays a role as a mitogenic growth factor and in regulation of the immune system (PMID: 24010859). Expression of Fcer2 may be altered in acute and chronic leukemias (PMID: 17041886).

EIF4E, eukaryotic translation initiation factor 4E, encodes a protein that is essential for initiation of protein translation in the cytoplasm and also plays a role in nuclear export of some mRNAs (PMID: 29396141, PMID: 20049173). EIF4E overexpression has been identified in multiple tumor types (PMID: 20049173) including breast (PMID: 7665244), head and neck (PMID: 9247311), and colorectal cancers (PMID: 28242042).
ESRP1, epithelial splicing regulatory protein 1, is a splicing factor that regulates EMT (PMID: 21876675). An ESRP1 fusion with RAF1 has been observed in prostate cancer (PMID: 20526349).

ERCC4, ERCC excision repair 4, endonuclease catalytic subunit, is a component of the Ercc1-Xpf nuclease that nicks DNA at specific sites, thus is involved in DNA repair (PMID: 26074087). ERCC4 mutations results in xeroderma pigmentosum, Cockayne syndrome, Fanconi anemia, and XFE progeria, therefore may be associated with increased cancer risk (PMID: 26074087).

CCNT1, cyclin-T1, interacts with CDK9 to form the positive transcription elongation factor B (P-TEFb) complex, which regulates transcription and mRNA processing (PMID: 28722178). Ccnt1 interacts with estrogen receptor alpha (PMID: 15940264) and is upregulated during activation and differentiation of lymphoid cells (PMID: 17352406).

PARP1, poly (ADP-ribose) polymerase 1, is an enzyme that catalyzes poly (ADP-ribosyl)ation of proteins, which initiates cellular response to DNA damage (PMID: 15743666). PARP1 dysregulation has been identified in acute myeloid leukemia, breast and colorectal cancers (PMID: 25483710, PMID: 25528020, PMID: 16809031).

RAD51, RAD51 recombinase, is a DNA recombinase that mediates strand exchange during homologous recombination in DNA double strand break repair (PMID: 24856061, PMID: 22467216, PMID: 30551670). Overexpression of RAD51 is associated with several tumor types (PMID: 24856061), including neuroblastoma (PMID: 31632548), colorectal cancer (PMID: 31973027), and pancreatic cancer (PMID: 31889908).

NFATC3, nuclear factor of activated T cells 3, is a calcium responsive member of the NFAT family, which functions as a transcriptional activator and plays a role in cardiac development, vascular development, and thymic development (PMID: 25072963, PMID: 11983154). NFATC3 fusions with PLA2G15 have been identified in acute myeloid leukemia (PMID: 23251452), T-cell acute lymphocytic leukemia (PMID: 29330284), and colorectal cancer (PMID: 29909608).

SMC1A, structural maintenance of chromosomes 1A, is a member of the cohesion complex, which potentially regulates cell cycle, and plays a role in the cellular proliferation, migration and apoptosis (PMID: 23426528, PMID: 29988990; PMID: 30242889). Mutations in SMC1A have been identified in colorectal cancer, and overexpression has been demonstrated in colorectal carcinoma (PMID: 30823889), hepatocellular carcinoma (PMID: 29988990), and prostate cancer (PMID: 30242889).

MAPK14, mitogen-activated protein kinase 14, is a member of the mitogen-activated protein kinase family that is involved in diverse cellular processes (PMID: 26377941). MAPK14 demonstrates both anti- and pro-tumorigenic roles in tumors of the breast, colon, lung, liver, and other tissues (PMID: 26377941).

DDIT4, DNA-damage-inducible transcript 4, (REDD1) is a hypoxia induced inhibitor of MTORC1 (PMID: 20166753). Decreased expression of DDIT4 (REDD1) has been observed in breast cancers and loss of DDIT4 promoted tumorigenicity in mouse models (PMID: 18198340).

SRGAP3, SLIT-ROBO Rho GTPase activating protein 3, may function in inactivation of Rac1, and plays a role in regulation of cytoskeletal dynamics and neurodevelopment (PMID: 23108406, PMID: 23127797). SRGAP3 has been identified in a fusion with RAF1 in pilocytic astrocytoma (PMID: 19363522).
FAM166A, protein FAM166A, is member of the uncharacterized protein family (UniProt.org) and decreased expression in semen has been observed in infertile males (PMID: 24882558).

FANCI, Fanconi anemia group I protein, is an ATM/ATR kinase target that interacts with FANCD2 to regulate DNA repair (PMID: 17412408). FANCI mutations have been identified in patients with invasive breast cancer (PMID: 26296701) and triple-negative receptor breast cancer (PMID: 26824983).

PDGFRA, platelet-derived growth factor receptor alpha, is a receptor tyrosine kinase (RTK) that activates PI3K/Akt, RAS/MAPK, and JAK/STAT pathways upon ligand binding. Activation of PDFGRA promotes cell cycle activation, cell proliferation, and survival (PMID: 21605429).

MED12, mediator complex subunit 12, is a subunit of Mediator, a complex involved in regulating expression of most RNA polymerase II transcripts (PMID: 24123922). Additionally, MED12 acts in Gli3-dependent Sonic hedgehog signaling and epigenetic silencing of genes (PMID: 24123922).

MED12, mediator complex subunit 12, is a subunit of Mediator, a complex involved in regulating expression of most RNA polymerase II transcripts (PMID: 24123922). Additionally, MED12 regulates signals involved in cell growth, development, and differentiation and acts in Gli3-dependent Sonic hedgehog signaling and epigenetic silencing of genes (PMID: 24123922).

MAPK1, mitogen-activated protein kinase 1, translocates to the nucleus upon activation by upstream kinases, thereby influencing many cellular processes, including cell proliferation, differentiation and apoptosis (PMID: 22450690). Additionally, phosphorylation of MAPK1 influences cellular response to stress (PMID: 22450690).

ACSL6, acyl-CoA synthetase long-chain family member 6, is an enzyme that catalyzes the formation of acyl-CoA from fatty acids (PMID: 20429931). ACSL6 and ETV6 fusions are observed with ETV6, in some cases out of frame, in hematologic disorders and acute myelogenous leukemia (PMID: 10502316, PMID: 16572202).

ATR, ataxia telangiectasia and Rad3 related, is involved in regulation of the DNA damage response and mediation of cell-cycle checkpoints (PMID: 25512053). Inhibition of Atr selectively sensitizes cancerous cells to radiation and chemotherapy (PMID: 23583268).

MYCL, v-myc avian myelocytomatosis viral oncogene lung carcinoma derived homolog, is a transcription factor that plays a role in cell cycle progression, apoptosis, and cellular transformation (PMID: 25038584). Amplification of MYCL is associated with small cell lung cancer (PMID: 16116477).

HEY2, hes related family bHLH transcription factor with YRPW motif 2, is a downstream effector of Notch signaling (PMID: 22806875; PMID: 24403239). Overexpression of Hey2 has been observed in several solid tumors, including  osteosarcoma, prostate cancer, hepatocellular carcinoma, pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma, and hemangioma (PMID: 31396342).

FANCM, Fanconi anemia, complementation group M, is a component of the Fanconi anemia core complex and plays a role in DNA repair and replication (PMID: 27145721, PMID: 26593718). Germline FANCM mutations are associated with Fanconi anemia, which involves predisposition to various cancers, and are associated with susceptibility to breast cancer (PMID: 25237197, PMID: 25288723).

FGF4, fibroblast growth factor 4, is a paracrine member of the fibroblast growth factor family, and plays a role in cell proliferation and differentiation (PMID: 20940169, PMID: 23967228). FGF4 is amplified in several tumor types (PMID: 22890726, PMID: 8962718).

AKR1C3, aldo-keto reductase family 1 member C3, is an enzyme that catalyze the conversion of 17-ketoreduction thus contribute to androgen biosynthesis (PMID: 23748150). Overexpression of Akr1c3 has been implicated in castration-resistant prostate cancer, breast cancer, and acute myeloid leukemia (PMID: 30012349).

PDE4D, phosphodiesterase 4D, is a cyclic nucleotide phosphodiesterase that regulates cAMP degradation (PMID: 16968949). Overexpression of PDE4D has been observed in a variety of cancers (PMID: 23536305),�including pancreatic ductal carcinoma (PMID: 31772658) and melanoma (PMID: 28092671),�decreased PDE4D expression has been demonstrated in bladder cancer (PMID: 30482227), and a fusion of PDE4D with CCNB1 has been identified in ovarian endometrioid�ovarian�carcinoma (PMID: 29633253).

MTOR, mechanistic target of rapamycin, is a serine/threonine protein kinase, which regulates cell growth and proliferation and is activated in many oncogenic pathways (PMID: 24764656). MTOR mutations are frequently identified in a variety of human cancers (PMID: 24631838).

PDCD1, programmed cell death 1, encodes the receptor PD-1, which is expressed on immune cells and has an inhibitory effect on immune response upon interaction with its ligands, PD-L1 and PD-L2 (PMID: 26681673, PMID: 24403232). PDCD1 (PD-1) inhibition in cancer therapy may relieve suppression of anti-tumor immune response (PMID: 26325035, PMID: 26681673, PMID: 26320063, PMID: 24403232).

PRKAA2, 5'-AMP-activated protein kinase catalytic subunit alpha-2, is a catalytic subunit of AMP-activated protein kinase (AMPK), an energy sensor protein kinase that plays a key role in regulating cellular energy metabolism (PMID: 24895169). Prkaa2 loss of function mutations have been identified in some cancers (PMID: 26934201) and Ube2o ubiquitination of Prkaa2 promotes tumor growth in mice (PMID: 28162974).

ENTPD1 (CD39), ectonucleoside triphosphate diphosphohydrolase 1, converts ATP to adenosine to regulate cellular homeostasis and functions as an immune checkpoint inhibitor (PMID: 29914571). ENTPD1 (CD39) high expression in the tumor microenvironment has been implicated as a prognostic biomarker in a variety of tumor types, including gastric, hepatocellular, and chronic lymphocytic leukemia (PMID: 29914571, PMID: 28258700).

MPL, thrombopoietin receptor, binds the cytokine, thrombopoietin, to induce signaling of JAK2 and TYK2 to activate several signal transduction pathways to control blood cell development (PMID: 16834459, PMID: 28408900).
