MPL mutations are often found in myeloproliferative neoplasms (PMID: 27727468).

H3C4, H3 clustered histone 4, encodes a member of the histone H3 family, and potentially plays a role in DNA repair and replication, differentiation, and heterochromatin formation (PMID: 28112369, PMID: 25003966). Overexpression of H3C4 is associated with poor prognosis in lung (PMID: 28112369) and gastric cancer patients (PMID: 24097871).

POLE, DNA polymerase epsilon catalytic subunit, mediates proofreading activity during DNA repair and replication (PMID: 26822575, PMID: 29604063) and plays a role in genomic stability (PMID: 31747945). Somatic mutations in POLE have been identified in colorectal cancer (PMID: 29998005, PMID: 29072370), frequently in endometrial cancer (PMID: 26822575, PMID: 28795426, PMID: 30733993), and are often associated with high tumor mutational burden (PMID: 30733993, PMID: 29880869), but are less likely to be associated with DNA mismatch repair (MMR) deficiency (PMID: 30585826).

BICC1, BicC family RNA binding protein 1, is an RNA binding protein that plays a role in development, but with uncharacterized biological function (PMID: 20215348). BICC1 mutations are associated with hyperactive Wnt signaling and BICC1 fusions with FGFR2 have been observed in solid tumors (PMID: 21922595, PMID: 23558953).
DDX21, DExD-box helicase 21, is a member of the DExD/H box family of proteins that regulates RNA metabolism (PMID: 16935882). DDX21 fusion has been identified in cholangiocarcinoma (PMID: 30745300).

LLGL2, LLGL scribble cell polarity complex component 2, is a scaffold protein that plays a role in ensuring the correct organization and orientation of bipolar spindles for normal cell division (PMID: 30996345). LLGL2 expression is associated with tumorgenesis (PMID: 22580609; PMID: 23110097) and overexpression has been observed in estrogen receptor positive breast cancer (PMID: 30996345).

RUNX1, runt-related transcription factor 1, is a transcription factor that binds to core binding factor beta (CBFB) and plays a role in hematopoiesis (PMID: 22150309, PMID: 23180629). RUNX1 mutations and translocations have been implicated in several hematologic cancers (PMID: 22150309, PMID: 30289875).

KPNA3, karyopherin subunit alpha 3, is a member of the importin alpha family and plays a role in importing cargo into the nucleus (PMID: 26245896). A TP53-KPNA3 has been identified in osteosarcoma (PMID: 27626065) and overexpression has been reported in colorectal cancer (PMID: 30098595).

MAP3K5, mitogen-activated protein kinase kinase kinase 5, plays a key role in the immune and stress response, and regulates apoptosis and inflammation through the activation of intracellular signaling pathways (PMID: 24008424, PMID: 23031789, PMID: 17883330, PMID: 10734135). MAP3K5 mutations and amplifications have been demonstrated in melanoma (PMID 24008424) and malignant fibrous histiocytomas (PMID: 15034865).
ZSCAN30, zinc finger and SCAN domain containing 30, is a protein with unknown biological function, which has been identified in fusion with BRAF in pancreatic acinar cell carcinoma (PMID: 25266736).

IGF2, insulin like growth factor 2, encodes for a growth factor involved in cell growth and differentiation processes that occur during embyronic development and adult life (PMID: 18308616). Over expression of IGF2 has been linked to mesenchymal tumors and hepatocellular carcinoma and may be associated with worse prognosis in breast cancer, esophageal cancer, and chronic myeloid leukemia (PMID: 24080445).

ABL2, ABL proto-oncogene 2, non-receptor tyrosine kinase, serves as a liaison between extracellular stimuli and signaling pathways involved in cell growth, survival, and invasion (PMID: 23842646). ABL2 amplification, fusions, and altered expression has been observed in a variety of tumor types, including hepatocellular carcinoma (PMID: 24940071), leukemia (PMID: 25098428), and gastric cancer (PMID: 29767389).

INSR, insulin receptor, encodes for a receptor tyrosine kinase, which, upon ligand activation, leads to regulation of glucose, lipids, and energy, and tissue generation (PMID: 23457259, PMID: 24384568). INSR is often overexpressed in multiple cancer types including prostate, breast, and ovarian cancer (PMID: 18785179, PMID: 19074892, PMID: 12193537).

XRCC6, X-ray repair cross complementing 6, is a family member of the XRCC genes that is involved in DNA non-homologous end joining (PMID: 15279796). XRCC6 polymorphism may be a risk factor in breast cancer (PMID: 23098447).
ZNF767P (ZNF767), zinc finger family member 767, pseudogene, is an uncharacterized pseudogene (UniProt.org), which has been identified in a fusion with BRAF in mucosal melanoma (PMID: 26314551).

BRD2, bromodomain containing 2, encodes for an adaptor protein that is a member of the bromodomain and extra-terminal (BET) domain family and plays a role in acetylation and transcription during the mitotic cycle (PMID: 18406326). Constitutive expression of BRD2 in a transgenic mouse model led to B-cell lymphoma (PMID: 14563639).

FGFR1OP2, FGFR1 oncogene partner 2, is a highly conserved gene expressed in diverse tissues (PMID: 15034873). The FGFR1OP2 fusion with FGFR1 is considered a driver mutation in hematopoietic malignancies (PMID: 21745565, PMID: 15034873).

SRP54, signal recognition particle 54, regulates secretion and membrane integration of nascent proteins, including death receptor 4 which mediates apoptosis (PMID: 15356269). Amplification of SRP54 has been identified in esophageal squamous cell carcinoma (PMID: 11550278).

CD79A, CD79a molecule, immunoglobulin-associated alpha,  encodes for a membrane protein involved in forming the B cell receptor complex, which once formed, induces B cell activation (PMID: 24146823). CD79A mutations demonstrate constitutive activation of the NF-kB pathway in diffuse large B-cell lymphomas (PMID: 21324920).

MELK, maternal embryonic leucine zipper kinase, is a serine/threonine-protein kinase that plays a role in regulation of the cell cycle, cell proliferation, and apoptosis (PMID: 30334367). Overexpression of Melk has been observed in a variety of tumor types, including cervical cancer (PMID: 30334367), hepatocellular carcinoma (PMID: 29151817), breast cancer (PMID: 27225691), melanoma (PMID: 29212029), and leukemia (PMID: 25365263).

CTNND1, catenin delta 1, encodes for p120-catenin, which plays a role in cell adhesion via association with E-cadherin, resulting in the regulation and stability of cadherins found at the cellular membrane (PMID: 23071139). CTNND1 amplification has been identified in lung cancer (PMID: 20715154), CTNND1 loss has been associated with breast cancer (PMID: 23733751), CTNND1 overexpression has been reported in hepatocellular carcinoma (PMID: 27193094), and a CTNND1 missense mutation has been observed in metastatic urothelial carcinoma (PMID: 31192134).

ADORA2A, adenosine A2a receptor, is a G-protein coupled receptor that binds adenosine to regulate a number of physiological functions and is expressed by a variety of cells, including dendritic cells (DCs), T-cells and NK-cells (PMID: 23856527). ADORA2A in the tumor microenvironment evades immune surveillance by inhibiting T-cell receptor function (PMID: 23856527, PMID: 25377469) and therapeutic blockade may restore the anti-tumor response (PMID: 28174424).

MAP2K4, mitogen-activated protein kinase kinase 4, is a member of the MAP kinase family, which activates stress-activated protein kinase/c-Jun N-terminal kinases (PMID: 10785355) and plays a role in cell proliferation, differentiation, transcriptional regulation, and development (PMID: 31761784). Overexpression of MAP2K4 has been correlated with poor survival in breast cancer (PMID: 31761784) and MAP2K4 missense mutations have been observed in breast, prostate, and colon cancers (PMID: 29795445).
RPGR, retinitis pigmentosa GTPase regulator, is a ciliary protein, which acts as a guanine exchange factor for RAB8A and plays a role in protein trafficking in photoreceptors (PMID: 22563985).

SSTR2, somatostatin receptor 2, is a member of the somatostatin family of G protein-coupled receptors that regulates endocrine and exocrine secretions (PMID: 16625838). Aberrant Sstr2 expression has been identified in a variety of tumors (PMID: 21034425, PMID: 20637207, PMID: 9440032).

PSMB5, proteasome subunit beta 5, is a subunit of the 20S proteasome core complex, which plays a role in degradation of proteins involved in cycle cycle regulation, proliferation, transcriptional regulation, and antigen presentation (PMID: 24252210, PMID: 29218236).  PSMB5 mutations and overexpression have been identified as mechanisms of acquired resistance to proteasome inhibitors, such as bortezomib, in leukemia (PMID: 18502982) and TNBC (PMID: 18502982).

CCNE1, G1/S-specific cyclin-E1, predominately interacts with CKD2 to regulate the cell-cycle in transition from G1 to S phase (PMID: 14965268, PMID: 27461360). Amplification and/or overexpression of CCNE1 is common in chemoresistant ovarian high grade serous carcinomas (PMID: 27461360), and in general, is associated with poor prognosis in solid tumor types (PMID: 30026836).

SMC3, structural maintenance of chromosomes 3, is a component of the cohesin complex, which functions in cohesion of sister chromatids during mitosis (PMID: 24856830, PMID: 23776448, PMID: 29187575). SMC3 mutations have been identified in chronic myeloid neoplasms (PMID: 30138727) as well as several additional hematological and solid tumor types (PMID: 24335498, PMID: 24856830, PMID: 23955599).
TMB, Tumor Mutational Burden

KNSTRN, kinastrin, is a kinetochore-associated protein that regulates the cell cycle (PMID: 19667759) and chromosomal stability (PMID: 25194279), and plays a role in cellular apoptosis (PMID: 24718257). KNSTRN is broadly expressed  in various tissues, and mutations have been observed in cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma (PMID: 25194279) and basal cell carcinoma (PMID: 26348826).

ASXL1, additional sex combs like 1, transcriptional regulator, is involved in epigenetic regulation of gene expression and forms complexes with several proteins to regulate transcription (PMID: 23736028). Mutations in ASXL1 are frequent in chronic myelomonocytic leukemia (PMID: 26771811, PMID: 23736028), and have been identified in a number of different tumor types including acute myeloid leukemia and liver cancer (PMID: 23736028).

PNRC1, proline rich nuclear receptor coactivator 1, acts as a co-activator for nuclear receptors such as SF1, PR, ERR-alpha1, and TR (PMID: 10894149), and is a putative tumor suppressor, playing a role in regulation of ribosomal RNA processing and thereby regulating cell proliferation (PMID: 30373810, PMID: 30455174). PNRC1 copy number loss and decreased gene expression has been identified in several tumor types (PMID: 30373810).

RCSD1, capZ-interacting protein, is an actin capping protein that plays a role in the remodeling of actin filaments (PMID: 15850461). RCSD1 fusions have been observed with ABL1 in pre-B lymphoblastic leukemia (PMID: 19794096) and with ABL2 in B-cell acute lymphoblastic leukemia (PMID: 25098428).

RARA, retinoic acid receptor alpha, plays a role in regulating gene transcription and is involved in the differentiation of hemaopoietic cells (PMID: 21911359). RARA fusions with PML have been linked to acute promyelocytic leukemias (PMID: 15103387).

RAD50, RAD50 double strand break repair protein, forms a complex with Mre11 and Nbs1 to repair double strand breaks, mediate DNA recombination, and maintain telomeres (PMID: 21035407). RAD50 mutations have been observed in Burkitt lymphoma, myeloid leukemia, ovarian cancer, liver cancer, and endometrial carcinoma (PMID: 31767017).

CHEK1, checkpoint kinase 1, is a tumor suppressor (PMID: 30562755) and serine/threonine kinase activated in response to DNA damage that is responsible for mediating  checkpoint signaling from ATM and ATR (PMID: 23613359, PMID: 12781359). Overexpression of Chek1 has been observed in several tumor types, including gastric cancer, small cell lung cancer, and T-cell leukemia (PMID: 25132270, PMID: 26867682, PMID: 28490518).

AFP, alpha-fetoprotein, is a glycoprotein that transports metal ions, drugs, bilirubin, and steroids and is highly expressed during fetal development (PMID: 29805966). AFP overexpression in serum may be a prognostic marker for hepatocellular carcinoma (PMID: 30183583, PMID: 30009939), urothelial cancer (PMID: 30208947), and uterine carcinosarcoma (PMID: 29992073).

EPHA5, EPH receptor A5, is an ephrin receptor tyrosine kinase involved in cell adhesion, migration, and axon guidance (PMID: 19326470). Epha5 has been demonstrated to be overexpressed in lung cancer (PMID: 25623065).

MST1, macrophage stimulating 1 (hepatocyte growth factor-like), is a core member of the Hippo signaling pathway, which regulates organ size, proliferation, and apoptosis, and functions in tumor suppression (PMID: 23985272,  PMID: 20951342).

BRD3, bromodomain containing 3, is a member of the bromodomain and extra-terminal (BET) domain family and acts as a transcription regulator via association with the transcription factor, GATA1 (PMID: 21536911). BRD3 fusion with NUTM1 has been identified in NUT midline carcinomas (PMID: 25688404).
ACTC1, actin alpha cardiac muscle 1, is the primary actin isoform in the adult heart and in early heart development (PMID: 20962418, PMID: 17947298).

NRAS, NRAS proto-oncogene, GTPase, is a member of the family of small GTPase that when activated by growth factors, stimulates multiple effector pathways such as RAF and PI3K to promote cell proliferation and survival (PMID: 29524560). NRAS mutations have been observed in a variety of cancers including melanoma, thyroid, breast, ovary cancer, and leukemia (PMID: 29524560, PMID: 30154648, PMID: 28860801).

PTPN11, tyrosine-protein phosphatase non-receptor type 11, is a member of the PTP Src homology-2 (SH2) domain-containing phosphatases that induces the MAPK signal transduction pathway to regulate growth factor signaling and has been characterized as both an oncogene and tumor suppressor (PMID: 20337577, PMID: 28074573). PTPN11 activating mutations have been identified in a variety of tumors including, lung, colon, brain, thyroid, skin and heme (PMID: 18286234, PMID: 21407260) and germline mutations are implicated in Noonan syndrome (PMID: 28328117).

HOXA9, homeobox protein Hox-A9, is a homeodomain-containing transcription factor that regulates transcriptional activation and repression (PMID: 27258906) and plays a role in hematopoiesis (PMID: 27258906) through regulation by MLL histone methytransferase (PMID: 27258906). Overexpression of Hoxa9 is commonly observed in acute myeloid leukemia and is associated with poor prognosis (PMID: 30270123, PMID: 26028034).

CLCN6, chloride voltage-gated channel 6, is a member of the chloride channels family and mainly functions as an antiporter (PMID: 25794116). A CLCN6 fusion with BRAF has been observed in pilocytic astrocytoma (PMID: 23817572).

NUB1, negative regulator of ubiquitin-like proteins 1, is an interferon-inducible  protein that downregulates NEDD8 expression thereby indirectly playing a role in cell-cycle regulation (PMID: 20160729). A NUB1 fusion with BRAF was identified in prostate cancer (PMID: 26314551).

CD276 (B7H3), CD276 antigen, is a member of the B7 family of immune checkpoint regulators (PMID: 30035102) and may be a co-inhibitory protein for T-cell activation by binding to a currently unidentified receptor (PMID: 28685773). Overexpression of CD276 (B7H3) has been observed to correlate with poor prognosis, cell migration, and cell invasion in many solid tumor types including, endometrial, cervical, breast, kidney, colorectal (PMID: 30035102) and possibly pancreatic (PMID: 29996538).

PIK3CG, phosphatidylinositol 4,5-bisphosphate 3-kinase catalytic subunit gamma isoform, is predominantly expressed in leukocytes and regulates leukocyte proliferation and differentiation (PMID: 23330955).

RNPC3, RNA binding region (RNP1, RRM) containing 3, is a component of the U12-dependent splicesome that catalyzes pre-mRNA splicing, and regulates cellular integrity and embryonic development (PMID: 30254136). A fusion of RNPC3 with ROS1 has been observed in non-small cell lung cancer (PMID: 27370605), and the expression of RNPC3 has been identified in cancer-associated scleroderma (PMID: 27821747).

CDK18, cyclin-dependent kinase 18, is a potential inhibitor of autophagy (PMID: 30289335) and plays a role in the DNA damage response by maintaining chromosome stability through ATR signalling (PMID: 30034634). Overexpression of Cdk18 has been observed to correlate with better prognosis of ER-negative breast cancer patients and response to chemotherapy (PMID: 30034634).

PRKCB, protein kinase C beta, encodes two alternatively spliced isoforms, which are members of the classical subfamily of the PKC family of protein kinases, and play a role in B-cell receptor and insulin receptor signaling (PMID: 25399570, PMID: 12417015). Altered PRKCB expression has been associated with several tumor types, including increased expression in diffuse large B-cell lymphoma (PMID: 28571764, PMID: 17384583, PMID: 25399570).

PPHLN1, periphilin 1, interacts and colocalizes with periplakin (PPL) and may play a role in epithelial differentiation (PMID: 12853457). A FGFR2-PPHLN1 fusion has been identified in intrahepatic cholangiocarcinoma (PMID: 25608663).

ESRRA, estrogen related receptor alpha, encodes for a constitutively active transcription factor that is a member of the NR3B family, binding to coregulatory proteins and playing a role in energy metabolism (PMID: 18174917). ESRRA overexpression has been associated with a worse prognosis in ovarian and breast cancer patients (PMID: 26542058) and the fusion, ESRRA-TEX40, has been identified in serous ovarian carcinoma (PMID: 21949640).

BRDT, bromodomain testis-specific protein, encodes for a bromodomain containing protein, which plays a role in transcriptional regulation and spermatogenesis (PMID: 26565999) and functions to remodel hyperacetylated chromatin (PMID: 28580303). BRDT is defined as a cancer-testis antigen with increased gene expression in multiple cancer types (PMID: 10704737), including lung cancer (PMID: 26565999).

FGF8, fibroblast growth factor 8, is a member of the fibroblast growth factor family with multiple isoforms that play critical roles in embryogenesis and development via signaling through FGF family receptors (PMID: 21506104). FGF8 overexpression has been identified in colorectal (PMID: 25473897), breast (PMID: 10023681), and prostate cancers (PMID: 9605740).

PFN2, profilin 2, is a member of the profilin family of actin binding proteins, which plays a role in actin polymerization (PMID: 27188458, PMID: 15308213). Aberrant expression of PFN2 has been demonstrated in esophageal squamous cell carcinoma (PMID: 27188458), and oral squamous cell carcinoma (PMID: 21725608).

CCN2, cellular communication network factor 2, encodes for a matricellular protein that is induced by growth factors and plays a role in cell adhesion, aggregation, and migration in a number of cell types (PMID: 25120383, PMID: 15371538, PMID: 18789696). CCN2 over expression has been associated with a poor prognosis in a variety of tumor types, including chondosarcoma, pancreatic cancer, esophageal cancer, and breast cancer (PMID: 30158025).

ROCK1, Rho-associated, coiled-coil containing protein kinase 1, is a serine/threonine kinase involved in cell contraction, motility, and survival through regulation of actomyosin dynamics (PMID: 24553779). ROCK1 is a key player in tumorigenesis and metastasis (PMID: 26725045).

DAPK3, death associated protein kinase 3, is a serine/threonine kinase that is involved in programmed cell death (PMID: 9488481). Loss of function DAPK3 mutations have been identified in a variety of cancers (PMID: 21487036).

FAT1, FAT atypical cadherin 1, is a transmembrane atypical cadherin that regulates cell growth via inhibition of the Yap1 pathway, and is involved in cell migration and invasion (PMID: 23076869, PMID: 29565465). FAT1 homozygous deletions have been identified in glioblastoma, astrocytoma and oral cancers (PMID: 23076869, PMID: 23354438), and mutations have been observed in several tumor types including glioblastoma, head and neck squamous cell carcinoma, colorectal, and esophageal cancer (PMID: 23354438, PMID: 23076869, PMID: 29565465), and T-cell acute lymphoblastic leukemia (PMID: 24972153).

PRPF40B, pre-mRNA processing factor 40 homolog B, plays a role in the processing of pre-mRNA, specifically, alternative splicing via association with the splicing factors, SF1 and U2AF (PMID: 25605964). PRPF40B mutations have been identified in myelodysplastic syndrome and acute myeloid leukemia (PMID: 23270583).

FLCN, folliculin, plays a role in cell-cycle regulation and functions as a tumor suppressor (PMID: 23874397). Inactivating mutations in FLCN are associated with renal carcinoma (PMID: 26418749, PMID: 15956655).
FER1L5, fer-1 like family member 5, plays a role in mediating myoblast fusion (PMID: 21177873). Decreased expression of FER1L5 has been observed in several cancer types (PMID: 31443490).

ELAVL1, ELAV-like RNA binding protein 1, encodes a protein that binds to the 3' untranslated region of RNA to regulate processing, splicing, and stability of RNAs and control expression of target genes related to cell proliferation, differentiation, inflammation, and survival (PMID: 14517288, PMID: 21723170, PMID: 22201738). ELAVL1 overexpression has been associated with increased malignancy (PMID: 21935886) in a number of cancers including bladder (PMID: 23516604), breast (PMID: 15781626), and colon (PMID: 16799479), and a fusion of ELAVL1 with TYK2 has been identified in acute myeloid leukemia (PMID: 27189703).

NEK11, NIMA-related kinase 11, is a member of the NEK protein kinase family�that negatively regulates�CDC25A (PMID: 19734889,�PMID: 20090422), and plays�a putative�role in cell cycle regulation in response to DNA damage (PMID: 23132929).�Decreased NEK11 expression has been observed in ovarian cancer (PMID: 24969318),�and NEK11 mutations have been associated with increased susceptibility to melanoma (PMID: 31704778).

PBK, PDZ binding kinase, is a serine/threonine kinase that belongs to the MAPKK family, which plays a role in mitosis and cell proliferation (PMID: 25575812, PMID: 25881543, PMID: 26081429). PBK over expression has been demonstrated in several solid and hematological tumor types (PMID: 25881543, PMID: 27334838).

NUTM2E, NUT family member 2E, is a member of the NUT family gene with unknown function (PMID: 26542179). A NUTM2E fusion with YWHAE has been identified in clear cell sarcoma of the kidney (PMID: 26493387).

KIT, mast/stem cell growth factor receptor Kit, is a receptor tyrosine kinase that binds the stem cell factor (SCF) ligand to activate PI3K, JAK/STAT, and MAPK pathways to promote cell survival and proliferation (PMID: 23181448, PMID: 29704617). Activating Kit mutations are driver mutations in a variety of cancers, particularly in gastrointestinal stromal tumors (PMID: 23127174, PMID: 29704617), acute myeloid leukemia (AML), melanomas, and seminomas (PMID: 29704617).

MBIP, MAP3K12 binding inhibitory protein 1, is a component of the double-histone-acetyltransferase complex ATAC, which catalyzes histone acetylation and thus regulates cell cycle progression, apoptosis, and development (PMID: 19103755). MBIP fusion with AXL has been identified in lung adenocarcinoma (PMID: 22975805).

RAD51D, RAD51 paralog D, functions in homologous recombination in DNA repair and plays a role in telomere maintenance (PMID: 21821141, PMID: 23108668). Mutations in RAD51D are associated with increased susceptibility to ovarian cancer (PMID: 23372765, PMID: 21822267).

NFE2L2, nuclear factor erythroid 2 like 2, encodes NRF2 and is a member of the Cap 'N' Collar family of transcription factors that functions to regulate antioxidant gene expression in response to stress (PMID: 25408701, PMID: 24142871) and is regulated by KEAP1 (PMID: 29615460). Overexpression of NFE2L2 has been implicated in progression of several tumor types (PMID: 24142871) and NFE2L2 gain of function mutations have been observed in lung cancer and are commonly associated with chemoresistance (PMID: 29615460).

ERCC2, ERCC excision repair 2 TFIIH core complex helicase subunit, is an ATP-dependent 5-3 DNA helicase that plays a role in nucleotide excision repair, RNA transcription, and chromosome segregation (PMID: 20797633). ERCC2 variants have been associated with susceptibility to gastric cancer (PMID: 24338713) and lung cancer (PMID: 20627704) and somatic Ercc2 loss of function mutations may confer sensitivity to cisplatin (PMID: 29980530).

PRPF8, pre-mRNA processing factor 8, encodes an essential component of the U5 small nuclear ribonucleoprotein particle that forms a catalytic center in the spliceosome allowing the inclusion of two key proteins, Eftud2 and Snrnp200, which are required for splicing (PMID: 28515276, PMID: 15840809). PRPF8 mutations have been associated with myeloid malignancies (PMID: 22323480, PMID: 24781015).

GUCY2C, guanylate cyclase 2C, is a heat-stable enterotoxin receptor that binds guanylin and uroguanylin and is expressed in the  intestinal epithelium (PMID: 28162021, PMID: 29210639). Aberrant expression of Gucy2c has been observed in colorectal cancer (PMID: 28162021), where it may function as an intestinal tumor suppressor (PMID: 29210639).

ICAM1, intercellular adhesion molecule 1, is a glycoprotein and member of the immunoglobulin superfamily that is expressed on endothelial cells and immune cells (PMID: 30470940). Overexpression of soluble Icam1 has been observed in gastric cancer, pancreatic cancer, melanoma, colorectal cancer (PMID: 30470940), and breast cancer (PMID: 30082828).

WASF1, WASP family member 1, is part of the WAVE complex that regulates actin dynamic and membrane protrusion, thus contributing to cell migration (PMID: 25145849). Loss of WASF1 has been identified in prostate cancer (PMID: 25906751) and overexpression of Wasf1 was observed in acute myeloblastic leukemia (PMID: 21281239).

GYG1, glycogenin 1, encodes for the enzyme protein, glycogenin, which adds glucose residues to itself, thereby acting as a catalyst for glycogen synthesis (PMID: 28683291). ESR1 fused to GYG1 has been identified in ER-positive, HER2 (ERBB2)-positive breast cancer (PMID: 29360925).

TEK (TIE2), angiopoietin-1 receptor, is the angiopoietin receptor tyrosine kinase that regulates angiogenesis and a variety of endothelial cell functions including proliferation, survival, and morphology (PMID: 28289658). Elevated TEK (TIE2) and Ang2 expression is negatively correlated with disease free survival and overall survival in patients with breast cancer (PMID: 28062977).

RAD17, cell cycle checkpoint protein RAD17, plays a role in DNA repair of double-strand breaks through recruitment of the MRN (MRE11-RAD50-NBS1) complex upon activation by ATM (PMID:     24619000, PMID: 24534091). Loss of Rad17 may render tumor cells sensitive to chemotherapy (PMID: 23687379, PMID: 23637229) and targeted therapies (PMID: 26513298) and overexpression has been observed in non-small cell lung cancer (PMID: 11606373).

NTRK2 (neurotrophic tyrosine kinase, receptor, type 2) is membrane receptor tyrosine kinase that binds neurotrophins, initiating signaling cascades that lead to cell growth and differentiation. Inappropriately regulated NTRK2 may be involved in initiation and metastasis of some cancers (PMID: 17008023).

DEK, DEK proto-oncogene, is a nuclear chromatin binding protein (PMID: 30412857) that plays a role in DNA repair, hematopoiesis, chromatin remodeling, gene transcription, and apoptosis (PMID: 30854097). DEK-NUP214 fusions have been observed in pediatric myeloid leukemia (PMID: 24441146) and Dek overexpression in pancreatic cancer has been correlated with poor prognosis (PMID: 30854097) and overexpression has been observed in ovarian cancer (PMID: 30412857), TNBC (PMID: 29228721), and lung cancer (PMID: 29844811).

PTK7, protein tyrosine kinase 7, is a catalytically-inactive receptor protein tyrosine kinase that is involved in non-canonical Wnt signaling and plays a role in cell migration (PMID: 27438854, PMID: 27499181). Dysregulation of Ptk7 expression has been demonstrated in various tumor types, including colorectal cancer and ovarian cancer (PMID: 27499181, PMID: 25550828).

PGR, progesterone receptor, is a member of the steroid nuclear receptor superfamily, which is activated by progesterone binding and mediates downstream signaling (PMID: 24287036). PGR expression is an indicator of estrogen-ERalpha activity and is used as a prognostic and predictive biomarker in breast cancer (PMID: 20436503, PMID: 23280579, PMID: 20586616, PMID: 30120700).

PER1, period circadian regulator 1, is a member of the period gene family that functions as a repressor in the circadian rhythm (PMID: 30791227). Decreased expression of Per1 has been observed in colorectal cancer (PMID: 17699798) and an ETV6-PER1 fusion has been identified in acute myeloid leukemia (PMID: 12661008).

PRKCD, protein kinase C delta, is a serine/threonine-protein kinase that plays both inhibiting and stimulating roles in cell proliferation and apoptosis (PMID: 15054085). PRKCD signaling is iimplicated in tumorigenesis of a variety of human cancers (PMID: 23474764, PMID: 26015399, PMID: 26811494).

RAD54L2, RAD54 like 2, is a member of the SNF2-like protein family, which functions as an androgen receptor cofactor, and plays a role in cell growth and proliferation (PMID: 17374848). Aberrant expression of Rad54l2 may be associated with higher risk and overall survival in gastrointestinal stromal tumors (PMID: 23942094).

TNFRSF4 (OX40), tumor necrosis factor receptor superfamily member 4, is expressed on activated T-cells and plays a role in immune co-stimulation through enhanced cell proliferation and survival of T-cells (PMID: 28092803). TNFRSF4 (OX40) antibody based therapies that mimic TNFSF4 (OX40L) may activate T-cells in an antitumor response (PMID: 29574275, PMID: 29529339).

CLTCL1, clathrin heavy chain like 1, is a component of membrane vesicles and is involved in endocytosis and mitosis (PMID: 8733129, PMID: 19509056). CLTCL1 mutations and fusions have been associated with several types of carcinomas and lymphomas (PMID: 26622902, PMID: 22496928, PMID: 26934577).

LMNA, lamin A/C, is a component of the nuclear lamina that forms the structural framework of the nuclear envelope (PMID: 25283634). An LMNA fusion with NTRK1 has been identified in colorectal cancer and congenital infantile fibrosarcoma (PMID: 26563355, PMID: 26563356).

TMEM106B, transmembrane protein 106B, is a lysosomal trafficking protein involved in dendrite development and cell death (PMID: 27563066). TMEM106B fusions have been identified in pleomorphic xanthoastrocytoma (PMID: 28299358), ganglioma (PMID: 28069802), and lung adenocarcinoma (PMID: 25851827).

BID, BH3 interacting domain death agonist, interacts with either BAX (to induce cell death) or BCL2 (to antagonize cell death) (PMID: 8918887) and is important in regulating the cross-talk of cell cycle arrest and apoptosis signaling (PMID: 20482490). Increased expression of Bid may play a role in cell transformation and growth in liver cancer (PMID: 27196317, PMID: 25951810).

RET, ret proto-oncogene, is a receptor tyrosine kinase that activates MAPK and PI3K/AKT pathways and regulates cell growth and differentiation (PMID: 24561444, PMID: 29134959). RET germline mutations result in MEN2 syndromes and familial medullary thyroid carcinoma (PMID: 20930041, PMID: 24561444) and somatic RET activating mutations, fusions, and Ret overexpression has been associated with a variety of cancers including lung (PMID: 30257958) and colorectal (PMID: 30210625, PMID: 30038711).

NCAM1, neural cell adhesion molecule 1, also referred to as CD56, is a member of the Immunoglobulin protein superfamily that plays a role in cell-cell adhesion, neuronal migration, and axon outgrowth (PMID: 3281256, PMID: 28791027). NCAM1 expression has been demonstrated in several tumor types, including acute myeloid leukemia, small cell lung cancer, and ovarian carcinomas (PMID: 28791027, PMID: 24091017, PMID: 27984374).

MPRIP, myosin phosphatase Rho interacting protein, regulates cytoskeleton dynamic via targeting myosin phosphatase for myosin light chain phosphorylation (PMID: 16257966). MPRIP fusions have been identified in pancreatic cancer and lung cancer (PMID: 26314551, PMID: 24162815).

SSTR3, somatostatin receptor 3, is a member of the somatostatin family of G protein-coupled receptors that regulates endocrine and exocrine secretions (PMID: 16625838). Aberrant Sstr3 expression has been identified in a variety of tumors including MALT lymphoma, hepatocellular carcinoma, and gallblader cancer (PMID: 27544389, PMID: 27391928, PMID: 23991955).

ARF1, ADP ribosylation factor 1, encodes for a GTPase that plays a role in the formation of transport vesicles on membranes via coat proteins (PMID: 18689681). Overexpression of ARF1 has been identified in breast cancer cells (PMID: 24196838).

RNF213, ring finger protein 213, is an E3 ubiquitin-protein ligase involved in angiogenesis (PMID: 21799892). A fusion between RNF213 and ALK has been identified in  anaplastic large cell lymphoma (PMID: 12112524).

KDELR2, ER lumen protein-retaining receptor 2, is a KDEL (Lys-Asp-Glu-Leu) endoplasmic reticulum protein retention receptor that plays a role in the unfolded protein response (PMID: 30428351). A KDELR2 fusion with ROS1 has been identified in non-small cell lung cancer (PMID: 22980976).

KEL, Kell metallo-endopeptidase (Kell blood group), encodes a type II transmembrane glycoprotein, the  polymorphic Kell blood group antigen, which plays a role in the conversion of endothelin-3 to its bioactive form (PMID: 23581578, PMID: 16423827). KEL amplification has been identified in pediatric low grade gliomas (PMID: 28912153).

ANKRD1, ankyrin repeat domain 1, encodes for a transcription regulator of the Nkx2-5 pathway and plays a role in muscle development, injury, inflammation, and cellular stress response (PMID: 24531715, PMID: 24515436). Differential expression of ANKRD1 may alter sensitivity to cisplatin, with high ANKRD1 expression being associated with resistance to cisplatin in ovarian cancer (PMID: 24531715).

AREG, amphiregulin, is a member of the epidermal growth factor family that activates epidermal growth factor receptor signaling, therefore regulating cell growth and motility (PMID: 24463227). AREG over expression has been reported in a variety of cancers (PMID: 21658434).

SLC45A3, solute carrier family 45, member 3, encodes the protein Prostein, which is expressed in prostate and potentially functions in transport of sugars (PMID: 11245466, PMID: 23506898). SLC45A3 expression and fusions involving SLC45A3 have been demonstrated in prostate cancer (PMID: 11245466, PMID: 23506898).

FGF23, fibroblast growth factor 23, is an endocrine FGF that activates FGFR signaling in conjunction with an alpha-Klotho cofactor and plays a role in regulation of mineral and vitamin D metabolism and cell proliferation (PMID: 26567701, PMID: 26483756, PMID: 25772309). FGF23 single nucleotide polymorphisms have been associated with increased risk for prostate cancer (PMID: 24053368).

GPRIN2, G protein regulated inducer of neurite outgrowth 2, interacts with activated alpha subunits of the Gi subfamily to induce neurite outgrowth in cell assays and is postulated to function downstream of G(o)alpha to regulate neurite growth (PMID: 10480904, PMID: 15488195).

TGFBR1, TGF-beta receptor type-1, is a membrane bound Ser/Thr protein kinase which acts with Tgfbr2 to form a receptor for transforming growth factor beta (Tgfb), a regulator of cell growth (PMID: 21461994). Tgfbr1 mutations and abnormal expression have been reported in colon and pancreatic cancers (PMID: 20001556).

LRRC71, leucine rich repeat containing 71, is a member of leucine-rich repeat (LRR) superfamily with unknown biological function (PMID: 18408889). A fusion of LRRC71 with NTRK1 has been observed in uterine endometrial carcinoma (PMID: 28235761).

ICOSLG, inducible T cell costimulator ligand, encodes a member of the B7 family of ligands, which triggers T cell proliferation and cytokine production upon binding to the T cell receptor, ICOS (PMID: 11973139, PMID: 10549624). Expression of ICOSLG has been identified in myeloma and acute myeloid leukemia (PMID: 19188146, PMID: 16115907), and over expression of ICOSLG has been observed in esophageal squamous cell carcinoma (PMID: 29147607).

PCBP2, poly(rC) binding protein 2, is an RNA binding protein that plays a role in post-transcriptional regulation (PMID: 19284986,     PMID: 29744291). PCBP2 overexpression is associated with several tumor types, including glioma (PMID: 23585479), gastric cancer (PMID: 29744291), and hepatocellular carcinoma (PMID: 27748915).

PPARGC1A, peroxisome proliferator-activated receptor gamma, coactivator 1 alpha, is a transcriptional cofactor regulating mitochondrial biogenesis and cell metabolism (PMID: 10412986, PMID: 29361779). PPARGC1A is up-regulated in a number of drug-resistant cancers driving tumor dependency on oxidative phosphorylation (PMID: 25490445) but, has also been observed to be down regulated in a variety of cancer types, indicating an unknown role of Ppargc1a in cancer (PMID: 29361779) .

LIN28A, lin-28 homolog A, is an RNA-binding protein that functions in regulation of RNA processing and inhibits the processing of Let-7, and plays a role in cellular self-renewal and metabolism (PMID: 28400788, PMID: 23561442). LIN28A overexpression has been observed in several tumor types including head and neck squamous cell carcinoma (PMID: 31574415), and epithelial ovarian cancer (PMID: 30365085).

PARP2, poly (ADP-ribose) polymerase 2, is an enzyme catalyzes poly(ADP-ribosyl)ation of proteins which initiates cellular response to DNA damage (PMID: 15743666). PARP2 mutation has been identified in prostate cancer (PMID: 25111073).

TARBP2, TARBP2 subunit of RISC loading complex, functions as part of the RNA induced silencing complex (RISC) to regulate siRNA mediated gene silencing, acts as an inhibitor of PKR (PMID: 25437560), and regulates RNA stability in the nucleus (PMID: 31300274). Mutations in Tarbp2 have been detected in gastrointestinal cancers and overexpression has been detected in breast cancer (PMID: 22719182, PMID: 24563327, PMID: 30759864) and correlated with decreased survival (PMID: 27980417).

TSGA10, testis specific 10, is a protein expressed in spermatazoa that interacts with Vimentin, and also plays a role in nuclear localization and activity of HIF1A (PMID: 16777103, PMID: 20797700). TSGA10 overexpression has been demonstrated in several tumor types including glioma, bladder cancer, and ovarian cancer (PMID: 15107545, PMID: 23408118).

PPL, periplakin, is a membrane-associated protein that functions in the formation of the cornified cell envelope in keratinocytes (PMID: 24942859). A PPL-NTRK1 fusion has been observed in thyroid carcinoma (PMID: 25384085) and loss of Ppl expression has been observed in colorectal carcinoma (PMID: 28068625) and urothelial carcinoma (PMID: 24942859).

CA6, carbonic anhydrase VI, is a salivary enzyme involved in the sensation of bitterness and plays a role in cellular homeostasis (PMID: 28423504). CA6 has been implicated in susceptibility to colorectal cancer (PMID: 28423504) and may be a marker for subtypes of salivary carcinomas (PMID: 29876739, PMID: 26212680).

SOX2, SRY-box transcription factor 2, plays a significant role in the determination and reprogramming of cell fate via gene expression regulation, which often requires cofactors (PMID: 31477842). SOX2 amplification has been identified in multiple tumor types, including non-small cell lung cancer and glioblastoma (PMID: 22941189, PMID: 21518820, PMID: 25114775).

IRF8, interferon regulatory factor 8, encodes for a member of the IRF family of transcription factors, playing a role in immune response and the differentiation of dendritic cells and B-cells (PMID: 24807060). Loss of IRF8 has been linked to the development of chronic myeloid leukemia (PMID: 17189268), and its downregulation has been observed in esophageal, breast, cervical, lung, and colorectal cancers (PMID: 18469857).

CFTR, cystic fibrosis transmembrane conductance regulator, is a membrane transporter regulating chloride and water secretion and absorption (PMID: 24534272). Germline mutation of CFTR is associated with familial pancreatitis, which increases the risk of developing pancreatic cancer (PMID: 27555793).

EREG, epiregulin, is a secreted peptide ligand of epidermal growth factor receptor that is involved in cell growth regulation (PMID: 10681561). Elevated Ereg expression has been identified in gastric and colorectal cancers (PMID: 28399526, PMID: 27344184).

TNFSF4 (OX40L), tumor necrosis factor ligand superfamily member 4, is expressed on antigen presenting cells and co-stimulates T-cells through binding of TNFRSF4 (OX40) to induce cell proliferation and survival of T-cells in autoimmunity responses (PMID: 28092803, PMID: 26215166). TNFSF4 (OX40L) fusion protein based therapies may stimulate TNFRSF4 (OX40) to activate T-cells in an antitumor response (PMID: 29545330, PMID: 29207606).

CCNI, cyclin-I, interacts and activates Cdk5 (PMID: 26698249, PMID: 25500740) to regulate cell-cycle progression (PMID: 23907122) and may play a role in angiogenesis (PMID: 25667501). Increased expression of Ccni has been observed in ovarian cancer (PMID: 25667501) and has been implicated in cisplatin resistance  (PMID: 26698249).

SEPTIN14, septin 14, is a member of the septin family of GTP-binding cytoskeletal proteins that plays a role in cortical neuronal migration (PMID: 20181826). An EGFR-SEPTIN14 fusion has been identified in glioblastoma (PMID: 26762204, PMID: 23917401) and a KMT2A-SEPTIN14 fusion has been observed in acute myeloid leukemia (PMID: 28573893), and somatic SEPTIN14 mutations have been identified in skin, large intestine, and soft tissue tumors (PMID: 27882315).

ENPP3, ectonucleotide pyrophosphatase/phosphodiesterase family member 3, is a basophil activation marker (PMID: 26589436) that hydrolyze nucleotides (PMID: 25692702) and nucleotide sugars, which may influence overall cellular glycosylation profiles (PMID: 23960081). Overexpression of Enpp3 has been observed in adrenocortical carcinomas (PMID: 29045509) and is a target for antibody-drug conjugates in refractory renal cell carcinoma (PMID: 29848572, PMID: 26589436).

ZNF703, zinc finger protein 703, is a member of the NET family of transcription repressor that is involved in embryonic development (PMID: 19014486) and activation of PI3K/AKT/GSK3beta and mTOR signaling (PMID: 29176314, PMID: 23991038). ZNF703 amplification and overexpression have been associated with breast (PMID: 21328542, PMID: 24156016), gastric (PMID: 24481460), colorectal (PMID: 25017610), head and neck (PMID: 26063961), thyroid (PMID: 30361900), non-small cell lung cancer (PMID: 27650486), and cholangiocarcinoma (PMID: 27764785).

KCTD7, potassium channel tetramerisation domain containing 7, is a potassium channel-related gene associated with myoclonus epilepsy (PMID: 22693283). A KCTD7 fusion with BRAF has been identified in melanoma cells (PMID: 23890088).

RAD21, RAD21 cohesin complex component, is a double-strand-break repair protein and member of the cohesion complex, which is responsible for maintaining sister chromatid segregation during the S-phase of the mitotic cycle (PMID: 22145905). Amplification and overexpression of Rad21 has been observed in several cancer types including breast, prostate, colorectal (PMID: 21255398, PMID: 24548858), and mutations have been identified in acute myeloid leukemia (PMID: 29288251).

CATSPERZ, catsper channel auxiliary subunit zeta, encodes for a protein in the CatSper ion channel complex, which is vital for sperm navigation and penetration (PMID: 28226241). The fusion, ESRRA-CATZPERZ, has been identified in serous ovarian carcinoma (PMID: 21949640).

LOXL2, lysyl oxidase homolog 2, is a copper-dependent amine oxidase, which plays a role in remodeling the extracellular matrix and has been demonstrated to promote tumor progression and metastasis in a variety of solid tumors (PMID: 22810810, PMID: 26329904, PMID:     28199967).  Overepxression of Loxl2 has been observed in NSCLC (PMID: 27860390) and intrahepatic cholangiocarcinoma (PMID: 27363654).

NOTCH1, neurogenic locus notch homolog protein 1, is a transmembrane receptor, which plays a role in cell fate determination, growth, survival (PMID: 25388163) and chemoresistance (PMID: 29998084). Activating Notch1 mutations are common in T-cell lymphoblastic leukemia/lymphoma (PMID: 22006338, PMID: 30103821), chronic lymphocytic leukemia (PMID: 29998084) and amplification and/or overexpression has been observed in bladder (PMID: 29643502), colorectal (PMID: 30136202, PMID: 30043645), and gastric cancers (PMID: 30043645).

ITGA5, integrin subunit alpha 5, interacts with ITGB1 to form a fibronectin receptor and functions in cell surface adhesion and signaling (PMID: 28336765). Overexpression of Itga5 has been observed to correlate with metastasis in non-small cell lung cancer (PMID: 27143927) and esophageal squamous cell carcinoma (PMID: 26772401).

IKBKB, inhibitor of nuclear factor kappa B kinase subunit beta, encodes a protein that phosphorylates inhibitors of NF-kB transcription factors, thereby, resulting in activation of NF-kB and thus, indirectly influencing cellular processes related to immune function, survival, and apoptosis (PMID: 18308615). Activating IKBKB mutations have been identified in lymphoma and myeloma (PMID: 25107905).

ANGPT2, angiopoietin 2, is a glycoprotein that prevents the function of ANGPT1 via binding to the Tie-2 receptor, thereby resulting in new vessel formation or disruption of existing vessels (PMID: 9204896). Elevated expression of ANGPT2 has been linked to a worse prognosis in lung cancer (PMID: 29118335).

IRF4, interferon regulatory factor 4, is a transcription factor of the interferon regulatory factor (IRF) family that plays critical roles in immune cell differentiation (PMID: 19383829). IRF4 expression is associated with lymphoid malignancies (PMID: 19383829).

NTRK1, high affinity nerve growth factor receptor, is a receptor tyrosine kinase involved in maturation and development of the nervous system. Fusions involving NTRK1 and producing constitutively active Ntrk1 kinase activity have been demonstrated to be oncogenic (PMID: 25054037).

PRMT6, protein arginine methyltransferase 6, is a type I arginine methyltransferase that mediates histone methylation, and functions in transcriptional repression and methylation of tumor suppressors (PMID: 22904088, PMID: 25263650). Overexpression of PRMT6 has been associated with several tumor types (PMID: 22904088, PMID: 20473859), including lung cancer (PMID: 31619507).

ELAVL3, ELAV like neuron-specific RNA binding protein 3, is an RNA-binding protein within the ELAV-like protein family with uncharacterized biological function (PMID: 10079173, PMID: 17534028). An FGFR3-ELAVL3  fusion has been observed in glioma (PMID: 25204415).

TCF3, transcription factor 3, is a Tcf/Lef factor that interacts with beta-catenin, acting as a repressor of transcription, and plays a role in embryonic development (PMID: 22573616, PMID: 23090119). Elevated expression of TCF3 has been observed in breast cancer (PMID: 23090119) and a fusion with PBX1 has been identified in acute lymphoblastic leukemia (PMID: 25729575).

NFIB, nuclear factor I B, encodes for a transcription factor involved in developmental regulation, primarily, in the lung and brain (PMID: 20725108). NFIB fusions and amplifications have been associated with multiple cancer types including prostate cancer, glioblastoma, and lipomas (PMID: 27083054).

KIR2DL1, killer cell immunoglobulin like receptor, two Ig domains and long cytoplasmic tail 1, encodes for a transmembrane glycoprotein present on the surface of natural killer cells thereby preventing activation of NK cells (PMID: 18574028). KIR2DL1 expression has been suggested to participate in immune resistance of cancer cells (PMID: 24592397).

GNG2, G protein subunit gamma 2, is a subunit of the heterotrimeric G protein, which plays a role in transducing cellular signals (PMID: 24660107). A MAP3K8-GNG2 has been identified in spitzoid melanoma (PMID: 30833747) and decreased Gng2 expression has been reported in melanoma (PMID: 24660107).

RAD52, RAD52 homolog, DNA repair protein, is involved in homologous recombination in DNA repair, and is proposed to mediate Rad51 activity though a pathway alternative to the BRCA1-BRCA2-PALB2 pathway (PMID: 23071261; PMID: 22964643, PMID: 31340507).

FASN, fatty acid synthase, converts acetyl-CoA and malonyl-CoA to palmitate in the synthesis of fatty acids (PMID: 30619288). Altered expression of Fasn in ovarian cancer may impair the anti-tumor response (PMID: 30619288) and development of Fasn inhibitors is an active area of investigation for Fasn-overexpressing tumors (PMID: 30578319, PMID: 30667213, PMID: 29779975, PMID: 29751678).

ZFP36L1, ZFP36 ring finger protein-like 1, is a zinc-finger protein which  binds and enhances mRNA turnover to regulate expression of target proteins including PLK3 and VEGFA (PMID: 25106868, PMID: 20802528). Upregulation of ZFP36L1 expression has been identified in hepatocellular carcinoma (PMID: 17058241) and breast cancer (PMID: 17855657).

RAD54B, RAD54 homolog B (S. cerevisiae), is a member of the SWI2/SNF2 family of dsDNA-dependent ATPases, which plays a role in homologous recombination in DNA repair and in the DNA damage response (PMID: 11782437, PMID: 25384516). Overexpression of RAD54B has been demonstrated in several tumor types (PMID: 25384516).

MAGEA6, melanoma-associated antigen 6, is a member of the cancer testis antigen (CTA) family that has normal, restricted expression in the testis (PMID: 29448247) and also functions as a cancer-specific ubiquitin ligase that degradates AMPK (PMID: 29448247, PMID: 29024810). Abnormal expression of Magea6 has been reported in a number of solid tumor types including, glioma (PMID: 29024810), renal cell carcinoma (PMID: 29448247), and head and neck squamous cell carcinoma (PMID: 25564441).

PRKCA, protein kinase C alpha, is a member of the PKC family of serine/threonine kinases, which plays a role in several biological processes including proliferation, differentiation, survival, and migration (PMID: 15585319, PMID: 12417014). Dysregulation of PRKCA expression has been associated with multiple tumor types, including breast cancer (PMID: 24970481, PMID: 24366551, PMID: 12417014).

CDK17, cyclin-dependent kinase 17, is a potential inhibitor of autophagy (PMID: 30289335) and may be part of the glycerophospholipid metabolism pathway (PMID: 29362722). Decreased expression of Cdk17 has been observed to correlate with decreased survival of glioma patients (PMID: 29362722).

OSBPL1A, oxysterol binding protein like 1A, is a member of the OSBPL family and plays a role in endosome function and cholesterol transport (PMID: 28564600, PMID: 27105157). A fusion between OSBPL1A and BRAF has been identified in well-differentiated thryoid cancer (PMID: 28634282).

KCNQ2, potassium voltage-gated channel subfamily Q member 2, is a subunit of the M channel, a slowly activating and deactivating potassium channel that regulates neuronal excitability (PMID: 9836639). KCNQ2 is associated with several cardiac and neurological diseases and is expressed in neuroblastoma cells (PMID: 11160379; PMID: 10455268).

FGF7, fibroblast growth factor 7, also known as keratinocyte growth factor, binds FGFR2 (PMID: 16597617) to activate MAPK and PIK3 signaling pathways to regulate cell proliferation, migration, and differentiation (PMID: 28339036). Overexpression of Fgf7 has been observed in bladder urothelial carcinoma (PMID: 25623741), gastric cancer (PMID: 17049492), and prostatic hyperplasia (PMID: 10411093).

AURKA, Aurora kinase A, is part of the aurora serine-threonine kinase family and plays a role in mitosis (PMID: 22864622). Amplification and overexpression of Aurka has been identified in a variety of solid tumor types, including breast cancer (PMID: 22825030).

EPHA7, EPH receptor A7, encodes a receptor, which upon interaction with cell surface bound ephrin ligands, reduces Akt signaling, increases apoptotic signaling, and plays a role in cell-cell repulsion and adhesion (PMID: 24003208, PMID: 15928710, PMID: 29022918). EPHA7 mutations and deletions have been observed in multiple tumor types (PMID: 23676193), including mutations lung cancer (PMID: 22941188, PMID: 18948947), and head and neck squamous cell carcinoma (PMID: 21798893), and deletions in follicular lymphoma (PMID: 22036564).

IRAK1, interleukin-1 receptor-associated kinase, mediates TLR and IL1R signaling and regulates immune response (PMID: 17890055). Overexpression of Irak1 has been observed in patients with myelodysplastic syndrome (PMID: 23845443), breast cancer (PMID: 26503059), and hepatocellular carcinoma (PMID: 29483095).

MAPRE1, microtubule-associated protein, RP/EB family, member 1, is a microtubule binding protein that associates with APC and plays a role in chromosome stability and cell polarity (PMID: 24492008). Increased expression of MAPRE1 has been demonstrated in colorectal cancer (PMID: 24492008, PMID: 26342024).

PDCD1LG2, programmed cell death 1 ligand 2, encodes PD-L2, a ligand for PD-1, which upon interaction exert an inhibitory effect on immune response (PMID: 11224527, PMID: 26432723, PMID: 28018338). PDCD1LG2 (PD-L2) is expressed in several tumor types, and amplification and over expression of PD-L2, along with PD-L1, has been demonstrated in Hodgkin lymphoma and PMBCL (PMID: 28619999, PMID: 26432723).

NUTM1, NUT family member 1 (nuclear protein in testis), is a nuclear protein only expressed in testis. NUTM1 fusions with BRD4 (t15;19) are commonly found in the NUT midline subset of squamous cell carcinomas (PMID: 12543779) and have been reported in soft tissue tumors (PMID: 29356724).

PIK3R1, phosphoinositide-3-kinase regulatory subunit 1, is the alpha subunit of PI3K that stabilizes and inhibits the catalytic subunit (Pik3ca) until ligand stimulation activates PI3K (PMID: 26807692) for subsequent AKT and mTOR signaling to promote cell growth and survival (PMID: 19629070). PIK3R1 alterations are common in endometrial, glioma, and colon cancers and have also been detected in renal, ovarian, urothelial, breast, and prostate tumors (PMID: 24367658, PMID: 26807692, PMID: 26501081, PMID: 17932254).

NRAP, nebulin related anchoring protein, is a member of the actin-binding cytoskeletal protein family that plays a role in myofibrillogenesis and is predominately expressed in the heart and in striated muscles (PMID: 28611399). A FGFR2-NRAP has been reported in intrahepatic cholangiocarcinoma (PMID: 31109923).

ESR2, estrogen receptor 2, may negatively regulate estrogen and play a role in the development of follicles (PMID: 20019181). ESR2 variants have been associated with a small elevated risk of developing colorectal cancer (PMID: 25376484) and breast cancer (PMID: 17935138).

CD74, CD74 molecule, encodes for an integral membrane protein that acts as an MHC class II chaperone and plays a role in the  signal transduction of pathways related to cell survival and proliferation (PMID: 16484589). CD74 overexpression as well as fusions with ROS1 and NRG1 have been linked to several tumor types including lung (PMID: 21228923, PMID: 23877438).

GOLGA4, golgin A4, encodes golgin-245, a coiled-coil protein found on the Golgi that plays a role in the Golgi structure and membrane trafficking (PMID: 21436057, PMID: 18308930). A fusion with GOLGA4 and RAF1 has been observed in melanoma (PMID: 30835257).

TMEM98, transmembrane protein 98, is a transmembrane protein expressed in ocular tissues and is associated with nanophthalmos (PMID: 24852644). Overexpression of TMEM98 has been associated with chemoresistance in hepatocellular carcinoma (PMID: 24608572).

CCNF, cyclin-F, is an F-box protein that plays a role in DNA repair and cell-cycle regulation through substrate recognition as a member of the E3 ubiquitin ligase complex, which mediates protein degradation (PMID: 28652210, PMID: 28954236). CCNF decreased expression has been observed in hepatocellular carcinoma (PMID: 23305207) and Ccnf mutations have been reported in Endemic Burkitt lymphoma (PMID: 26468873).

GPR32, G protein-coupled receptor 32, binds resolvin D1 (RvD1) and participates in resolving acute inflammation (PMID: 20080636) and plays a role in the suppressive effect of RvD1 on  TGF-beta-induced epithelial-mesenchymal-transition (PMID: 24120851). Deletion of GPR32 in gastric cancer cells prevents FPR1 anti-angiogenesis activity (PMID: 28507800).

CD22, CD22 molecule, is a B-cell surface molecule that inhibits B-cell antigen receptor (BCR) signaling, therefore induce tolerance to self-antigens (PMID: 24763061). CD22 is a target for cancer therapies (PMID: 23696252).

PABPC4, polyadenylate-binding protein cytoplasmic 4, encodes a protein that binds to the poly(A) tail of mRNA, which regulates mRNA stability and translation to control gene expression during development, differentiation, and cell activation (PMID: 8524242, PMID: 15355595, PMID: 24469397). PABPC4 overexpression has been observed in colorectal cancer (PMID: 22884093), and a fusion of PABPC4 with TYK2 has been identified in anaplastic large cell lymphoma (PMID: 25873174).

EGFR (HER1), epidermal growth factor receptor, is a tyrosine kinase receptor, which activates RAS/RAF/MEK and PI3K/AKT/mTOR pathways, leading to increased cell proliferation and growth (PMID: 24312144). EGFR activating mutations, amplification, and overexpression are found in a variety of tumors, including non-small cell lung cancer (PMID: 26609494, PMID: 30284706) and colorectal cancer (PMID: 30243897), and the EGFRvIII variant is commonly found in glioblastoma (PMID: 30201736).

SELE, E-selectin, binds sialylated, fucosylated glycan ligands (PMID: 29272415) and is primarily expressed in the endothelium where it initiates and enables rolling and adhesion of cells for migration (PMID: 25301730) and may play a role in modulating the tumor microenvironment (PMID: 29272415). Targeting and detecting Sele (E-slectin) and associated ligands is an active area of investigation (PMID: 26834953, PMID: 29716546).

PLEKHA7, pleckstrin homology domain containing A, localizes to the apical zonula adherens in epithelial cells to inhibit growth through indirect regulation of p120 catenin, CTNNB1 (PMID: 26302406). Decreased expression of PLEKHA7 has been observed in high grade ductal carcinomas and in lobular carcinomas (PMID: 26270346) and a fusion with ALK has been identified in non-small cell lung cancer (PMID: 29883838).

CYLD, ubiquitin carboxyl-terminal hydrolase, acts as a tumor suppressor through enzymatic removal of ubiquitin chains on target substrates and its activity influences NFKB, WNT, MAPK, HDAC6, and EGFR pathways among others (PMID: 20347313, PMID: 25342597, PMID: 28572092). Loss of Cyld expression and function is associated with a variety of cancers, including squamous cell carcinomas (PMID: 20347313, PMID: 21900959, PMID: 26982322).

BAD, BCL2-associated agonist of cell death, is a member of the Bcl2 family that promotes apoptosis (PMID: 7834748). Decreased Bad expression has been associated with poor outcome in non-small cell lung cancer and breast cancer patients (PMID: 21918885, PMID: 17004114).

ZKSCAN1, zinc finger with KRAB and SCAN domains 1, (also referred to as ZNF139), is a member of the zinc-finger family of transcription factors (PMID: 25561801, PMID: 26722429). Overexpression of ZKSCAN1 is associated with gastric cancer, and ZKSCAN1 fusions have been identified in melanoma (PMID: 25561801, PMID: 26013381, PMID: 26314551, PMID: 30254212).

CSNK1A1, casein kinase 1 alpha 1, encodes a member of the CK1 protein family that functions as a signaling molecule involved in multiple cellular processes including proliferation, autophagy, cell survival, and immune response, and plays a role in the regulation of the Wnt and Hedgehog signaling pathways, Tp53, and Nf-kappaB (PMID: 29793495, PMID: 28969692). CSNK1A1 mutations have been identified in myelodysplastic syndrome (PMID: 25792355) and colorectal cancer (PMID: 27031502).

IGF1R, insulin-like growth factor 1 receptor, is a receptor tyrosine kinase which activates MAPK, PI3K/AKT, and JAK/STAT pathways, promoting cell proliferation (PMID: 22520978). Overexpression of Igf1r has been observed in various tumors, including invasive bladder carcinoma (PMID: 30338346).
AQP1, aquaporin 1 (Colton blood group), is a membrane channel protein mediating water transport (PMID: 9013443). Aqp1 over expression has been reported in a variety of human tumors (PMID: 15809704).

IGF1, insulin like growth factor 1, encodes for a growth factor protein involved in mediating growth regulatory processes that occur during embryonic development and adult life typically via the IGF-1 receptor (PMID: 9032050). Expression of IGF1 has been evaluated in several types of cancer including colorectal, breast, prostate, and lung, but its role remains unclear (PMID: 15229476).

HIF1A, hypoxia-inducible factor 1-alpha, induces transcription of many genes under hypoxic conditions and is a tumor antigen. Hif1a alters metabolism, promotes tumor progression, and targeting vaccines have been experimentally tested in TNBC (PMID: 23999440, EJC, Vol 72, Suppl. 1, p.S26, abstr. 210, 2017).

PRKAA1, protein kinase AMP-activated catalytic subunit alpha 1, is a catalytic subunit of AMP-activated protein kinase (AMPK), an energy sensor protein kinase that plays a key role in regulating cellular energy metabolism (PMID: 24895169). AMPK has been shown to play a role  in inhibiting tumor growth and metastasis (PMID: 24895169) and overexpression of Prkaa1 may promote cell proliferation in gastric cancer cells (PMID: 31558185, PMID: 31841039).

CD38, ADP-ribosyl cyclase/cyclic ADP-ribose hydrolase 1, is a glycoprotein that binds CD31 and is also an ectoenzyme involved in the metabolism of nicotinamide (PMID: 29118010, PMID: 30546360). CD38 is highly expressed on multiple myeloma cells and serves as a target for anti-CD38 antibody therapy (PMID: 29118010, PMID: 30546360) and CD38 overexpression may contribute to resistance to PD-1 (PDCD1)/PD-L1 (CD274) therapies (PMID: 30012853).

PIM3, serine/threonine-protein kinase pim-3, phosphorylates BAD to prevent apoptosis and promote cell survival and therefore, likely functions as an oncogene (PMID: 30370255). Overexpression of Pim3 has been reported in a variety of tumor types, including hepatoblastoma (PMID: 29854306), pancreatic (PMID: 26547690), prostate (PMID: 27826135), colorectal (PMID: 17270021), and gastric (PMID: 24488669).

CREB1, cAMP responsive element binding protein 1, encodes for a transcription factor, which upon phosphorylation, induces cellular gene transcription in part via the CREB-binding protein/p300 paralog (PMID: 15753290). CREB1 fusions with EWSR1 have been observed in sarcomas (PMID: 25134518) and Creb1 overexpression has been observed to induce cell proliferation in gastric cancer cells (PMID: 28498439).

STRN, striatin, is a member of the striatin family of WD repeat proteins that may function in protein scaffolding and in neuronal development and function (PMID: 24333164, PMID: 10748158). Fusions of STRN with ALK have been demonstrated in several tumor types, including recurrent fusions in thyroid cancer (PMID: 26933125, PMID: 24613930).

KDM2B, lysine (K)-specific demethylase 2B is a histone demethylase which regulates cell cycle progression and cellular senescence (PMID: 21310926). Overexpression of Kdm2b has been observed and implicated in the progression of leukemia (PMID: 21310926), gastric cancer (PMID: 28506929), GBM (28661478), and ovarian cancer (PMID: 28706445).

MAP3K4, mitogen-activated protein kinase kinase kinase 4, encodes a member of the MAPK superfamily of protein kinases, which can be activated by cellular stress, leading to activation of the MAP2K-MAPK signaling pathway, and has been demonstrated to play a role in development, including mammalian sex determination (PMID: 31346208, PMID: 24928207, PMID: 17348032). MAP3K4 mutations have been identified in triple-receptor negative breast cancer (PMID: 25079324) and overexpression of MAP3K4 has been identified in small cell lung cancer (PMID: 16705311).

CAMTA1, calmodulin binding transcription activator 1, is a transcription factor that plays a role in neuronal differentiation, maturation, and survival (PMID: 21857646, PMID: 25049392, PMID: 21385898). WWTR1-CAMTA fusions have been observed in epithelioid hemangioendothelioma (PMID: 25961935, PMID: 25353289).
GOPC, golgi-associated PDZ and coiled-coil motif containing protein, is a regulator of protein trafficking (PMID: 25616555). GOPC fusions with ROS1 have been identified in cancers (PMID: 23052255).

FGR, FGR proto-oncogene, Src family tyrosine kinase, is a non-receptor tyrosine kinase that is a member of the Src gene family and plays a role in the control of integrin-mediated signal transduction, affecting the actin cytoskeletal structure and cell migration (PMID: 10547366). A fusion of WASF2 and FGR was identified in melanoma, ovarian cancer, and lung squamous cell carcinoma (PMID: 25204415) while a fusion of FYB and FGR was found in lymphoma (Journal of Clinical Oncology 35, no. 15_suppl), and increased expression of FGR has been observed in B-cell lymphomas and may be associated with resistance to HDAC inhibitors (PMID: 27324824).

SLAMF7, SLAM family member 7, belongs to the CD2 subset of the immunoglobulin superfamily of receptors, which plays a role in regulating Natural Killer cell and T-cell mediated immune response (PMID: 21219180, PMID: 12213321). SLAMF7 expression has been demonstrated in multiple myeloma (PMID: 28424516, PMID: 18451245).
MIR548F1, microRNA 548f-1, is a microRNA with unknown biological function (PMID: 30897084). A fusion of MIR548F1 with NTRK1 has been observed in pediatric mesenchymal tumor (PMID: 29683818).

RANBP2, RAN binding protein 2, plays a role in appropriate assembly of the nuclear envelope and ensures proper progression of mitosis and chromosomal segregation (PMID: 24113188). RANBP2 fusions with ALK have been identified in acute myelomonocytic leukemia, diffuse large B-cell lymphoma, and an inflammatory myofibroblastic tumor (PMID: 24613277, PMID: 24470379, PMID: 12661011).

CD8A, T-cell surface glycoprotein CD8 alpha chain, is a subunit of the CD8 complex, which forms a coreceptor with major histocompatibility complex class I (MHCI) molecules for antigen detection (PMID: 21677135, PMID: 24675400). Expression of Cd8a is a marker for T-cell activation and levels detected on tumor-infiltrating T-cells is often used to predict favorable response to immunotherapy (PMID: 30323667, PMID: 30318514, PMID: 30221739).

PTPRK, protein tyrosine phosphatase, receptor type K, is a signaling molecule that negatively regulates EGFR signaling thereby playing a role in cell invasion, migration, and proliferation (PMID: 23552869, PMID: 25609089). Decreased expression and molecular alterations of PTPRK have been observed in breast and colon cancer (PMID: 23552869, PMID: 22895193).

CRTC1, CREB regulated transcription coactivator 1, encodes for a transcription co-factor that activates CREB (PMID: 19164581). CRTC1 fusions have been observed in mucoepidermoid carcinoma (PMID: 23018873) and melanocytoma (PMID: 29240581).

CHD2, chromodomain helicase DNA binding protein 2, is a chromatin remodeling protein that regulates gene expression and plays a role in neuronal development (PMID: 29962935, PMID: 30521773). CHD2 mutations are associated with chronic lymphocytic leukemia (PMID: 26031915).

ITPKB, inositol-trisphosphate 3-kinase B, regulates cytoplasmic Ca2+ signals and plays a role in the development of immune cells (PMID: 21148483). ITPKB expression is associated with malignant melanoma (PMID: 16946712) and may also play a role in cisplatin resistance (PMID: 31081803).

YAP1, Yes-associated protein 1, is a downstream transcriptional regulator in the Hippo signalling pathway, affecting organ size and tumor formation via cell proliferation and apoptotic control. YAP amplification or over expression has been reported in various cancers (PMID: 17974916, PMID: 22609812).

HES5, hes family bHLH transcription factor 5, is a member of the basic helix-loop-helix transcriptional repressor family and is activated downstream of the NOTCH pathway to regulate cell differentiation (PMID: 27878283). Hypermethylation of the HES5 promoter has been observed early in prostate tumorogenesis (PMID: 25560400), while overexpression of HES5 has been demonstrated in NSCLC (PMID: 27878283) and has been associated with a 15-gene signature for prediction of colon cancer recurrence (PMID: 27998790).

YY1, YY1 transcription factor, is a zinc-finger transcription factor that regulates expression of genes involved in biological processes including cell growth, proliferation, and differentiation (PMID: 16611997, PMID: 20081375). Dysregulation of YY1 is associated with several tumor types including,  nasopharyngeal carcinoma (PMID: 30718276), and YY1 mutations are recurrent in insulinoma (PMID: 20081375, PMID: 25787250).

CTRC, chymotrypsin C, is a pancreatic serine protease that activates or degrades trypsinogens and procarboxypeptidase, depending on the cleavage site (PMID: 23430245). A CTRC fusion with NTRK1 has been reported in pancreatic cancer (PMID: 29466156).

H3C1, H3 clustered histone 1, encodes a member of the histone H3 family, which is a replication-dependent histone, and plays a role in nucleosome assembly and cell division (PMID: 25288118, PMID: 14718166, PMID: 11420717). Mutations in H3C1 have been identified in undifferentiated soft tissue sarcoma (PMID: 27174990).

PAX3, paired box 3, encodes for one of the transcription factors of the PAX gene family, which plays a prominent role during fetal development (PMID: 19221588). PAX3 fusions with FOXO1 are frequently observed in alveolar rhabdomyosarcoma (PMID: 24334454).

IFNGR1, interferon gamma receptor 1, is the ligand binding subunit that forms a dimer with IFNGR2 to form a cytokine receptor for IFNG, which activates the JAK/STAT signaling pathway (PMID: 24453034). Germline variants in Ifngr1 may be associated with increased risk of gastric cancer (PMID: 24453034, PMID: 18593809).

STK32B, serine/threonine kinase 32B, is a protein kinase with uncharacterized biological function (PMID: 24885002). Decreased expression of Stk32b has been associated with aggressive clinicopathological features in oral squamous cell carcinoma and a STK32B fusion has been identified in leiomyosarcoma (PMID: 24885002, PMID: 30518629).

FGF3, fibroblast growth factor 3, is an FGF family member involved in inner ear development and regulation of cell proliferation (PMID: 17601531, PMID: 16263090). Amplification of FGF3 is associated with several tumor types (PMID: 24265351, PMID: 12429977).

MXD4, MAX dimerization protein 4, is a member of the MAD protein family and can form a heterodimer with MAX to repress Myc transcriptional activity (PMID: 16908182, PMID: 16064138). MXD4-NUTM1 fusions have been identified in NUT sarcoma (PMID: 30723300), and ovarian sarcoma (PMID: 30338611).

HSP90AA1, heat shock protein 90kDa alpha family class A member 1, encodes a cytosolic isoform of Hsp90, which functions as a molecular chaperone to regulate the activities of several cellular proteins (PMID: 26071189). HSP90AA1 over expression is associated with several tumor types (PMID: 26071189).

TRPM2, transient receptor potential cation channel subfamily M member 2, is a member of the transient receptor potential (TRP) protein super-family that is activated by oxidative stress (PMID: 28008929) to regulate calcium and sodium flux across membranes (PMID:  27068538) and may play a role in neutrophil recruitment (PMID: 30251149) and autophagy (PMID: 29875336, PMID: 29343514). Overexpression of Trpm2 has been observed in oral squamous cell carcinoma (PMID: 28008929) and somatic mutations may be correlated with decreased survival in pancreatic cancer (PMID: 29620272).

HRAS, HRas proto-oncogene, GTPase, is a member of the small GTPase family that upon activation by growth factors stimulates multiple downstream pathways such as RAF and PI3K to promote cell proliferation and survival (PMID: 21779504). HRAS activating mutations are commonly found in tumors, including dermatological, head and neck, thyroid, kidney, and bladder cancers (PMID: 29524560).

CASP7, caspase 7, apoptosis-related cysteine peptidase, plays a central role in the execution-phase of cell apoptosis (PMID: 23979156). Activation of CASP7 has been proposed as a mechanism to combat cancer cell growth (PMID: 23979156).

RAD51C, RAD51 paralog C, functions in homologous recombination in DNA repair and plays a role in cell cycle checkpoint signaling in response to DNA damage (PMID: 21821141). Mutations in RAD51C are associated with increased susceptibility to breast and ovarian cancers (PMID: 21821141).

ID2, inhibitor of DNA binding 2, dominant negative helix-loop-helix protein, is a HLH transcription factor family member that lacks a DNA binding domain, which binds to other HLH proteins and prevents their DNA-binding activity (PMID:  25248477, PMID: 16034366). Overexpression of Id2 is associated with several tumor types (PMID: 12842081) and may play a role in initiating breast ductal carcinoma in situ  formation (PMID: 30725231).

SSRP1, FACT complex subunit SSRP1, is a histone chaperone and forms part of the facilitates chromatin transcription (FACT) complex to mediate DNA replication, DNA damage repair, apoptosis and cell cycle regulation (PMID: 29048646). SSRP1 overexpression has been observed in glioma, where it may correlate with stage (PMID:  29048646), and in breast cancer (PMID: 28496363) and hepatocellular carcinoma (PMID: 26755331).

ANGPTL4, angiopoietin like 4, is a secreted protein and a member of the angiopoietin family, which inhibits lipoprotein lipase and regulates lipid metabolism and potentially, glucose homeostasis (PMID: 28182091, PMID: 22458843). Overexpression of Angptl4 has been demonstrated in many epithelial tumors, including adenoma, melanoma, squamous cell carcinoma, and hepatocellular carcinoma (PMID: 21397862), and increased transcript levels in stage 2 osteosarcoma (PMID: 29739381), and colorectal cancer (PMID: 21937683).

CCNT2, cyclin-T2, interacts with CDK9 to form the positive transcription elongation factor B (P-TEFb) complex, which regulates transcription and mRNA processing (PMID: 15563843, PMID: 9499409). Overexpression of Ccnt2 may play a role in gastric cancer (PMID: 29849811) and expression may be regulated by microRNA 192 (miR-192) in acute myeloid leukemia (PMID: 28409330).

KDM5C, lysine (K)-specific demethylase 5C, is a histone demethylase, regulating gene transcription through chromatin remodeling to affect cell growth and differentiation. KDM5C over expression has been reported in prostate cancer (PMID: 25016185).

FLT3, receptor-type tyrosine-protein kinase FLT3, activates Akt, Ras, and Erk pathways to regulate differentiation, proliferation, and survival of hematopoietic progenitor cells (PMID: 29316714, PMID: 28538663).  Activating mutations of FLT3 are common in hematologic tumors (PMID: 19467916) and the internal tandem duplication (ITD) mutation is commonly observed in acute myeloid leukemia (PMID: 30181385).

NFIA, nuclear factor type 1 A, is a member of the nuclear factor one transcription factor family, which plays a role in cellular growth, proliferation, migration, and apoptosis, and promotes tumor formation (PMID: 24305710, PMID: 25435940, PMID: 23946414, PMID: 28076901). Fusions with NFIA have been observed in pilocytic astrocytoma (PMID: 27810072) and acute erythroid leukemia (PMID: 23032695).

CREB3L2, cAMP responsive element binding protein 3-like 2, is a member of the CREB3 family of transcription factors that mediates ER stress response (PMID: 17117415, PMID: 17178827). CREB3L2 fusions have been identified in thyroid carcinoma (PMID: 18757431) and fibromyxoid sarcoma (PMID: 15139001).

ZNF217, zinc finger protein 217, is a transcription repressor that regulates the expression of genes involved in cell proliferation, survival, and epithelial mesenchymal transition (PMID: 26431164). ZNF217 amplification and overexpression have been identified in a variety of tumors, including breast, gastric, colorectal, ovarian, head and neck, bladder, pancreatic cancer, melanoma, and lymphoma (PMID: 17572303).

ERCC5, ERCC excision repair 5, endonuclease, is a DNA endonuclease that participates in DNA excision repair (PMID: 3477874). ERCC5 mutations have been associated with susceptibility to gastric, esophageal, and colorectal cancer (PMID: 29072052, PMID: 28952217, PMID: 28749454).

CCT2, T-complex protein 1 subunit beta, is a component the molecular chaperone T-complex protein 1 Ring complex (TRiC), which functions in telomere maintenance (PMID: 25467444, PMID: 25704758). Overexpression of Cct2 has been observed in small cell lung cancer (PMID: 29299146) and in extracellular vesicles in glioblastoma (PMID: 30451371).

ELF3, ETS-related transcription factor Elf-3, is a transcriptional activator involved in inflammation (PMID: 22157719), cell differentiation (PMID: 29523781), and cell cycle progression (PMID: 29050229). ELF3 overexpression has been implicated in ERBB2 (HER2) positive breast cancer progression (PMID: 29050229, PMID: 29187433) and hepatocellular carcinoma (PMID: 29523781), while decreased expression has been correlated with reduced survival in ovarian cancer (PMID: 28199976).

CAD, carbamoyl-phosphate synthetase 2, aspartate transcarbamylase, and dihydroorotase, encodes for a protein that is responsible for the biosynthesis of pyrimidines, thus, playing a significant role in the process of DNA replication and cell proliferation (PMID: 24332717). The fusion, CAD-ALK, has been observed in colorectal cancer (PMID: 26633560).

MLLT1, myeloid/lymphoid or mixed-lineage leukemia; translocated to, 1, is also referred to as ENL and is a component of the super elongation complex that activates transcription (PMID: 8080983). MLLT1 gene rearrangements are frequently observed in leukemia (PMID: 19262598).

APOBEC1, apolipoprotein B mRNA editing enzyme catalytic subunit 1, is a cytidine deaminase that is part of a complex responsible for C-to-U editing of the ApoB transcript and also functions to edit additional RNA targets and acts as a DNA mutator (PMID: 25085003, PMID: 30619092). Overexpression of APOBEC1 is correlated with a high number of cancer in-frame insertions and deletions and a worse prognosis (PMID: 29346513).

APOBEC3D, apolipoprotein B mRNA editing enzyme, catalytic polypeptide-like 3D, is a cytidine deaminase that deaminates single stranded DNA, functioning in host defense against retroviruses and to inhibit retrotransposons (PMID: 22001110). APOBEC3D may also induce genomic mutations, potentially contributing to the onset and progression of cancer (PMID: 23388464).
