ASAP1, Arf-GAP with SH3 domain, ANK repeat and PH domain-containing protein 1, is an enzyme stimulated by PIP2 to activate ADP-ribosylation factors (Arfs) and plays a role in cytoskeleton remodeling (PMID: 26893376). Altered expression of ASAP1 has been observed in multiple cancers, where it may promote metastasis (PMID: 27694689).

PBRM1, polybromo 1, is a subunit of the PBAF complex, which functions in chromatin remodeling to modulate gene expression (PMID: 23867514). PBRM1 is frequently mutated in clear cell renal cell carcinoma (PMID: 19084573, PMID: 31861590).

ETV6, ets variant 6, is a member of the ETS family of transcription factors, which functions as a transcriptional repressor and is involved in hematopoietic differentiation (PMID: 16828711). Fusions of ETV6 with various partners are frequently associated with hematological cancers (PMID: 22578774).

MYH9, myosin heavy chain 9, is an actin motor protein involved in cytokinesis, protein transport, and organ development (PMID: 25098841). MYH9 has been associated with lymphoma and its expression is associated with poor prognosis in several types of carcinomas (PMID: 24436421, PMID: 21951916, PMID: 25826333, PMID: 12800156).

MUC16, mucin 16, cell surface associated, also known as CA125, is a high molecular weight transmembrane glycoprotein expressed by epithelial cells for protection and lubrication (PMID: 25002120) in the maintenance of mucosa (PMID: 29999426). Overexpression of Muc16 is associated with ovarian, pancreatic, and breast cancers (PMID: 25002120), while fusions have been observed in high-grade serous ovarian cancer (PMID: 31745703) and Muc16 mutations are common in gastric (PMID: 30389134, PMID: 30098163) and endometrial cancers (PMID: 30288353).
PLEKHF1, pleckstrin homology and FYVE domain containing 1, is a lysosome-associated protein that induces caspase-independent apoptosis (PMID: 16188880).

IDH2, isocitrate dehydrogenase (NADP(+)) 2, mitochondrial, is an enzyme that catalyzes the conversion of isocitrate to alpha-ketoglutarate (alpha-KG), and is involved in the tricarboxylic acid cycle (PMID: 28711227, PMID: 28980701). Mutations in IDH2 are associated with aberrant conversion of alpha-KG to 2-HG, which is an oncogenic metabolite, and are recurrent in acute myeloid leukemia and subtypes of glioma (PMID: 27621679, PMID: 19228619, PMID: 23999441).

FCGR1A, Fc fragment of IgG receptor Ia, is a monomeric IgG receptor expressed on the surface of antigen-presenting cells, which in turn initiates downstream immune responses (PMID: 28895912). FCGR1A is a target in immunotherapies (PMID: 10598685).

DDIT3, DNA-damage-inducible transcript 3, is a member of CCAAT/enhancer-binding protein transcription factor family and is involved in ER stress response (UniProt.org). DDIT3 fusions have been observed with FUS in sarcomas (PMID: 16651630, PMID: 18850010).

ACOX1, acyl-CoA oxidase 1, functions in lipid metabolism by converting very-long chain fatty acids to acetyl-CoA (PMID: 17603022, PMID: 29287774). Altered Acox1 expression has been observed in metastatic breast cancer (PMID: 26334757), pancreatic cancer (PMID: 25858497) and possibly liver cancer (PMID: 29491006).

CDK7, cyclin-dependent kinase 7, is a component of the transcription factor IIH (TFIIH) complex, which is involved in transcription and DNA repair (PMID: 29545334, PMID: 28792271). Overexpression of Cdk7 has been observed in a variety of solid tumor types including, triple-negative breast cancer (PMID: 28455421), ER-positive breast cancer (PMID: 27301701), and gastric cancer (PMID: 27562173).

SPTA1, spectrin alpha, erythrocytic 1, is a major component of the cytoskeletal network maintaining membrane stability of erythrocytes (PMID: 24569979). SPTA1 mutations have been identified in papillary thyroid carcinoma (PMID: 31724970), small cell lung cancer (PMID: 31612912), prostate adenocarcinoma (PMID: 30720096), and colorectal cancer (PMID: 28280605).
ERBB3 encodes HER3, an EGFR receptor tyrosine kinase, which activates PI3K-AKT-mTOR and RAS-RAF-MEK-ERK pathways to promote cell survival and proliferation (PMID: 17471238).

NPAP1, nuclear pore associated protein 1, encodes a component of the nuclear pore complex that is associated with Prader-Willi syndrome (PMID: 22694955). NPAP1 mutations have been identified in non-small cell lung cancer (PMID: 31290993).

WDR11, WD repeat domain 11, is a protein with limited characterization that plays a role in endosome to trans-golgi network vesicle trafficking (PMID: 29426865). Mutations in WDR11 have been identified in small-cell lung cancer (PMID: 22941188), and biliary tract cancer (PMID: 29360550).

FANCD2, Fanconi anemia, complementation group D2, is activated by monoubiquitination by the Fanconi anemia core complex, and functions in DNA repair (PMID: 24905007, PMID: 27145721). Germline FANCD2 mutations are associated with Fanconi anemia, which involves predisposition to various cancers (PMID: 24025411, PMID: 12509764).

POLR2B, RNA polymerase II subunit B, is a core component and the second largest subunit of RNA polymerase II that plays a role in transcription initiation and elongation (PMID: 9325316, PMID: 1518060, PMID: 21670157, PMID: 31304538). A fusion between POLR2B and IGFBP7 has been demonstrated in uterine cancer (PMID: 25485619).

ZNF713, zinc finger protein 713, encodes a zinc finger domain-containing protein that may be associated with Autistic spectrum disorder (PMID: 25196122). ZNF713 fusion has been identified in lung adenocarcinoma (PMID: 31064887).

TNK2, tyrosine kinase, non-receptor, 2, associates with several other proteins and functions in cell signaling (PMID: 20432460, PMID: 23597703). Activating mutations in TNK2 have been identified in several tumor types, including ovarian and stomach cancer (PMID: 20432460, PMID: 22322295).

ETNK1, ethanolamine kinase 1, phosphorylates ethanolamine and initiates the biosynthesis of phosphatidylethanolamine (PMID: 11044454), which is a major phospholipid of the mammalian cell membrane and is involved in a variety of diseases (PMID: 28785375). ETNK1 mutations have been identified in systemic mastocytosis and chronic myeloid leukemia (PMID: 25615281, PMID: 25343957), and amplification of ETNK1 has been identified in testicular seminoma (PMID: 11912161) and lung adenocarcinoma (PMID: 31448219).

BTG1, BTG anti-proliferation factor 1, is a member of the B-cell translocation gene family, and is a negative regulator of cell cycle progression, activates ATF4 in response to cellular stress, and is required for neuronal and hematopoietic cell differentiation (PMID: 30350856). BTG1 loss is associated with B-cell acute lymphoblastic leukemia (PMID: 22359517), and reduced expression has been identified in multiple solid tumors including ovarian carcinoma (PMID: 24084718), and hepatocellular carcinoma (PMID: 25405901).

SFPQ, splicing factor proline and glutamine rich, interacts with RAD51 paralogs, thus, playing a role in homologous recombination repair, and maintains sister chromatid cohesion (PMID: 20813759). SFP1-TFE3 fusions are commonly associated with perivascular epithelioid cell tumors (PEComas) (PMID: 26274027).

ANKRD11, ankyrin repeat domain 11, is a transcriptional regulator that plays a role in histone acetylation, inhibits ligand-dependent transactivation, and enhances Tp53 transcriptional activity (PMID: 29258554, PMID: 17521611, PMID: 15184363, PMID: 18840648). Decreased ANKRD11 expression has been identified in breast cancer (PMID: 22538187).

INHA, inhibin subunit alpha, encodes a member of the transforming growth factor-beta superfamily of proteins, which plays a role in reproductive and endocrine function and has been demonstrated to negatively regulate the synthesis of follicle-stimulating hormone (PMID: 20005735). Increased expression of INHA has been observed in metastatic prostate cancer (PMID: 19436293) while decreased expression and mutations of INHA have been identified in adrenocortical carcinoma (PMID: 25111790).

GPS2, G protein pathway suppressor 2, is part of the nuclear co-repressor (N-CoR) and SMRT complexes (PMID: 25374920, PMID: 19858209), and plays a role in lipid metabolism, adipogenesis, proliferation, apoptosis, and DNA repair (PMID: 27460081). Somatic GPS2 mutations have been reported in medulloblastoma (PMID: 22820256), a fusion with MLL2 has also been observed in spindle cell sarcoma (PMID: 25139254), and decreased GPS2 expression may be prognostic in liposarcoma (PMID: 27460081).

BTBD1, BTB/POZ domain-containing protein 1, may play a role in muscle differentiation through interaction with DNA topoisomerase I (TOP1) (PMID: 15486563) and functions in mesenchymal differentiation (PMID: 17462629). A BTBD1-NTRK3 fusion has been observed in high-grade glioma (PMID: 24705251).

NUDCD3, NudC domain containing 3, encodes a Nudc like protien that plays a role in mitosis, specifically cytokinesis (PMID: 19806165). A NUDCD3 fusion with BRAF has been identified in a melanoma related Spitz tumor (PMID: 23890088).

PCM1, pericentriolar material 1, is a centriolar satellite protein, which recruits microtubule and dynactin-dependent proteins for appropriate microtubule organization (PMID: 12403812). A PCM1 fusion with RET has been identified in papillary thyroid carcinoma and both over expression and amplification of PCM1 have been linked to myeloid leukemias (PMID: 10980597, PMID: 23431203).

IFIT1, interferon-induced protein with tetratricopeptide repeats 1, is a member of the IRF-inducible gene family that plays a role in the immune defense against RNA viruses and may regulate expression of inflammatory cytokines (PMID: 30282041). Overexpression of Ifit1 in glioblastoma has been associated with improved prognosis and increased survival (PMID: 26980050).

DHX15, DEAH-box helicase 15, encodes an RNA helicase, which plays a key role in mRNA splicing and ribosome biogenesis, and has been demonstrated to indirectly activate Nf-kappaB signaling in response to viral RNA (PMID: 25692149) and bind to Cmtr1 to inhibit methyltransferase activity (PMID: 30079402). DHX15 overexpression has been identified in acute myeloid leukemia (PMID: 29163777), and reduced DHX15 expression has been identified in glioma (PMID: 28829764).

HRG, histidine rich glycoprotein, is a glycoprotein synthesized in the liver that circulates in the plasma and binds heme and divalent metal ions and plays a role in angiogenesis, coagulation, fibrinolysis, apoptosis, cell adhesion, cell migration, cell growth, cell proliferation, and the immune response (PMID: 26336134, PMID: 24510988). Decreased expression of Hrg has been observed in endometrial carcinoma (PMID: 21489304) and ovarian cancer (PMID: 22827608).

STAT2, signal transducer and activator of transcription 2, is a STAT family transcription factor that mediates anti-viral and anti-proliferative responses via transcription of IFN stimulated genes (PMID: 24416652). In mouse models, STAT2 knockout mice with constitutive expression of IFN-a form medulloblastomas, while STAT2 knockout mice form fewer tumors relative to wild-type (PMID: 22280068).

AKT1, RAC-alpha serine/threonine-protein kinase, is a ubquitously expressed serine-threonine protein kinase, which regulates a variety of cell functions including, metabolism, growth, angiogenesis, cell proliferation and survival through PI3K signaling in response to extracellular signals (PMID: 23297823, PMID: 26698230). Akt1 mutations are observed in a variety of tumor types (PMID: 23134728), including breast cancer (PMID: 30212483), gastric cancer (PMID: 29714127), salivary carcinoma (PMID: 29682203), and overexpression has been observed in osteosarcoma (PMID: 29762834) and gastric cancer (PMID: 29278885).

MYT1L, myelin transcription factor 1-like, is a neural zinc-finger transcription factor family member that likely plays a role in neural differentiation (PMID: 9373037, PMID: 24015200). Decreased expression of MYT1L is correlated with poor prognosis in medulloblastoma (PMID: 24252690).

BCORL1, BCL6 corepressor-like 1, is a transcription corepressor and is involved in histone deacetylase activity (PMID: 17379597). BCORL1 mutations have been observed in acute myeloid leukemia and myelodysplastic syndromes (PMID: 30618304), while elevated expression of BCORL1 has been identified in hepatocellular carcinoma (PMID: 22210327, PMID: 26879601).

AKAP4, A-kinase anchor protein 4, binds protein kinase A and is a cancer testis antigen that regulates cell proliferation, angiogenesis (PMID: 27148411) and may play a role in epithelial-to-mesenchymal transition (PMID: 30145836). Overexpression of Akap4 has been observed in esophageal (PMID: 27158351), lung (PMID: 27148411), thyroid (PMID: 27983916), colorectal (PMID: 29480665), ovarian (PMID: 23762804), and gastric  cancers (PMID: 30145836).
INO80D, INO80 complex subunit D, is part of the INO80 chromatin remodeling complex (PMID: 21303910). An INO80D fusion with ETV6 has been observed in leukemia (PMID: 22237106).

MUC5B, mucin 5B, oligomeric mucus/gel-forming, is a large gel-forming glycoprotein that is a major component of mucus in the saliva, respiratory tract, and cervix (PMID: 9729478, PMID: 19783639). Abnormal expression of MUC5B is associated with breast cancer (PMID: 23056409, PMID: 22269464) and lung cancer (PMID: 25733373).

GNA11, G protein subunit alpha 11, is a guanine nucleotide-binding protein (G protein) subunit, which is activated following ligand binding to G-protein coupled receptors and functions in cell signaling (PMID: 27148356). GNA11 hotspot mutations impair intrinsic Gna11 GTPase activity, resulting in constitutive pathway activation and are common in uveal melanoma (PMID: 23640210, PMID: 27148356, PMID: 29209985).

BMPR1A, bone morphogenetic protein receptor type IA, is a serine/threonine kinase receptor that activates SMAD signaling pathways, thus regulating transcription of geens involved in growth and development (PMID: 16246179). Germline mutations of BMPR1A are associated with juvenile polyposis syndrome (PMID: 16246179).

DTL, denticleless E3 ubiquitin protein ligase homolog, encodes for a protein that plays a significant role in cell cycle control, including preventing additional replication via CDT1 regulation (PMID: 17085480). DTL amplification and/or overexpression has been found to be associated with several cancer types including gastric, hepatocellular carcinoma, breast, and Ewing sarcoma (PMID: 26472028).

TRIM24, tripartite motif containing 24, functions as E3 ubiquitin ligase that regulates Tp53 degradation, and also acts to regulate the transactivation activity of multiple nuclear receptors (PMID: 21979307, PMID: 19844164). TRIM24 over expression is associated with several tumor types, and fusions have been identified in tumors including liver and thyroid cancers (PMID: 24409330, PMID: 21979307).

ZMYM4, zinc finger MYM-type containing 4,  a fragment from this gene codes for cell death inhibiting RNA, which may inhibit apoptosis (PMID: 12356764). A FGFR2 - ZMYM4 fusion has been observed in intrahepatic cholangiocarcinoma (PMID: 28034880).

FGFR4 is a receptor tyrosine kinase activated upon binding of the FGF ligand, which activates RAS-MAPK, PI3K-AKT, and STAT pathways.  Altered function of FGFR4 in cancer may lead to increased cell proliferation and decreased apoptosis (PMID: 22508544).

CLIP2, CAP-GLY domain containing linker protein 2, links membranes to microtubules and cell organelles and plays a role in cell polarity (PMID: 21273437). Overexpression of Clip2 has been observed as a radiation exposure marker in papillary thyroid carcinoma (PMID: 25957251, PMID: 25284583) and a fusion protein with Braf has been identified in non-Langerhans histiocytic neoplasms (PMID: 26566875).

CIC, protein capicua homolog, is a member of the HMG-box superfamily of transcriptional repressors. CIC mutations are associated with oligodendroglioma and CIC fusions are associated with sarcoma (PMID: 21817013; PMID: 22588899; PMID: 16717057).

SETDB1, SET domain bifurcated histone lysine methyltransferase 1, is a histone methyltransferase that regulates chromatin structure through methylation of H3K9 to repress gene transcription (PMID: 27732843, PMID: 28887438), and has a role in maintaining stem cell pluripotency (PMID: 19884255). Amplifications of SETDB1 have been observed in a variety of cancers (PMID: 27732843), including lung (PMID: 23770855), breast (PMID: 25537518), and melanoma (PMID: 31131878).

BCL2L11, BCL2-like 11, is a member of the Bcl2 family of programed cell death regulators that activates apoptosis (PMID: 26405162). Down regulation of BCL2L11 is found in various cancers including lymphoma and colorectal cancer (PMID: 26405162), and is associated with resistance to tyrosine kinase inhibitor therapy in non-small cell lung cancer (PMID: 26325082).

RPA2, replication protein A2, is a subunit of the heterotrimeric RPA protein, which binds to single-stranded DNA and plays a role in regulation of DNA replication and repair (PMID: 16935876, PMID: 27151292, PMID: 29807999). RPA2 overexpression has been observed in breast cancer (PMID: 28007956) and esophageal carcinoma (PMID: 23420526).

CDK3, cyclin-dependent kinase 3, interacts with cyclin C (CCNC) to phosphorylate Rb1 during transition of the cell-cycle from G0-G1 phase to G1-S phase (PMID: 15084261). Overexpression of Cdk3 in glioblastoma has been reported to enhance cell proliferation through activation of Atf1 (PMID: 18794154), but has also been demonstrated to suppress breast cancer metastasis (PMID: 29156693).

FLT1 (VEGFR1), fms related tyrosine kinase 1, encodes VEGFR1, a receptor tyrosine kinase involved in angiogenesis (PMID: 23172303).  Overexpression and germline mutations in FLT1 are associated with various human cancers (PMID: 24625025; PMID: 24909162).

SH3PXD2A, SH3 and PX domains 2A, encodes for an adaptor protein that is a substrate of Src and plays a role in forming podosomes and invadosomes, which influence the extracellular matrix (PMID: 25259869). The fusion, SH3PXD2A-HTRA1, has been identified in schwannomas (PMID: 27723760).

BLM, Bloom syndrome RecQ like helicase, is a DNA helicase that plays important roles in maintaining genomic integrity (PMID: 28232778). Loss of Blm protein function leads to Bloom's syndrome and increased cancer risk (PMID: 28232778).

PPP2R1B, protein phosphatase 2 regulatory subunit A, beta, is a scaffold subunit of the major serine-threonine phosphatase PP2A, which has roles in cell signaling, proliferation, differentiation, and apoptosis (PMID: 23454242). Alterations of PPP2R1B have been observed in lung, colon, and breast cancer (PMID: 9765152, PMID: 10713707).

SPOP, speckle-type POZ protein, acts as the substrate targeting component of the cullin-RING-based BCR (BTB-CUL3-RBX1) E3 ubiquitin-protein ligase complex, to influence degradation of proteins, which includes the BET protein family and therefore, is a putative tumor suppressor (PMID: 19818708, PMID: 28805820, PMID: 30244836, PMID: 28292441). Loss of function Spop mutations in prostate cancer may decrease degradation of BET proteins and confer resistance to BET inhibitors, while gain of function Spop mutations in endometrial cancer may increase degradation of BET proteins and confer sensitivity to BET inhibitors (PMID: 28805821).

SF3B1, splicing factor 3b, subunit 1, is a core member of the U2 small nuclear ribonucleoprotein complex of the spliceosome which mediates the splicing of genes involved in myelodysplastic syndrome (MDS) pathogenesis (PMID: 25510282, PMID: 26842708). Mutations in SF3B1 are frequent in MDS and have also been identified in chronic lymphocytic leukemia and melanoma (PMID: 24709888, PMID: 25510282, PMID: 26842708).

STAG1, stromal antigen 1, encodes a component of the cohesin complex, and plays a role in telomeric chromatin cohesion, apoptosis, DNA repair, and regulation of gene expression (PMID: 24856830, PMID: 27207471, PMID: 15361841). STAG1 mutations have been identified in several tumor types including acute myeloid leukemia (PMID: 24856830, PMID: 24335498), and bladder cancer (PMID: 27207471).

APOBEC3A, apolipoprotein B mRNA editing enzyme, catalytic polypeptide-like 3A, deaminates single stranded DNA acting as host defense against retroviruses and foreign DNA (PMID: 22001110, PMID: 23977391). APOBEC3A is also able to hypermutate somatic DNA, which may impact onset and progression of cancer (PMID: 23977391).

CUL3, cullin 3, acts as a scaffold in Cullin-RING E3 ubiquitin ligase complexes, and is involved in cell differentiation and vesicle trafficking (PMID: 29249570). Loss of CUL3 has been identified in esophageal squamous cell carcinoma (PMID: 28860350), and overexpression has been demonstrated in breast cancer (PMID: 22825334).

RUFY1, RUN and FYVE domain containing 1, is an effector protein for Rab14 and Rab4, and plays a role in endosomal enlargement and recycling, and interacts with Etk, functioning as a downstream effector (PMID: 20534812, PMID: 11877430). A fusion between RUFY1 and RET has been identified in MSI-H colorectal cancer (PMID: 30279230).

H3C6, H3 clustered histone 6, encodes a member of the histone H3 family that plays a role in DNA repair and replication, and differentiation (PMID: 25003966, PMID: 27698205). Hypermethylation of H3C6 has been observed in various tumors, including lung (PMID: 27782156), ovarian (PMID: 31775891), and uterine cancer (PMID: 31575549).

PCLO, piccolo presynaptic cytomatrix protein, is a component of presynaptic active zones and a scaffold protein that potentially plays a role in trafficking of synaptic vesicles (PMID: 12654920, PMID: 10707984). Overexpression of PCLO is associated with poor survival, and mutations and amplifications have been observed in esophageal squamous cell carcinoma (PMID: 28263981).

KLHL6, kelch like family member 6, is a BTB-kelch protein that plays a role in germinal center B cell formation (PMID: 16166635) and functions as an E3 ligase (PMID: 30646831). KLHL6 mutations are associated with chronic lymphocytic leukemia (CLL) (PMID: 21642962) and diffuse large B-cell lymphoma (PMID: 30646831, PMID: 29695787).

PALB2, partner and localizer of BRCA2, recruits Brca2 and Rad51 to repair DNA through homologous recombination (PMID: 24998779, PMID: 30638972). PALB2 loss of function mutations have been linked to hereditary breast cancer (PMID: 25135369) and male breast cancer (PMID: 31067289).

POLD1, polymerase (DNA directed), delta 1, catalytic subunit, is the catalytic subunit of DNA polymerase delta, which mediates DNA replication (PMID: 27320729). POLD1 mutations have been identified in a variety of human cancers (PMID: 27320729).

CDK6, cyclin-dependent kinase 6, is regulated by cyclin D to moderate the cell-cycle transition from G1 to S phase (PMID: 26658964) through phosphorylation of RB1 and subsequent activation of E2F transcription factors (PMID: 26315616). Overexpression and/or amplification of CDK6 has been reported in lymphoma, leukemia, and in salivary gland, bladder, pancreas, colon breast, and prostate cancers (PMID: 26658964).

LZTR1, leucine-zipper-like transcription regulator 1, is a member of the BTB/POZ superfamily, which functions as a tumor suppressor, and is downregulated or inactivated in several tumor types (PMID: 24362817, PMID: 23917401, PMID: 18686028).

SETBP1, SET-binding protein, is part of a multiprotein epigenetic complex, which regulates target genes including MECOM (PMID: 29875417) and the tumor suppressor protein phosphatase type 2a (PP2A) (PMID: 11231286). Overexpression and gain of function mutations in Setbp1 have been linked to a variety of myeloproliferative diseases with worse clinical outcomes (PMID: 23892662, PMID: 28447248) and loss of function mutations have been reported in leukemia (PMID: 29875417).

NAB2, NGFI-A binding protein 2, interacts with EGR proteins (1/2/3) to co-activate or co-repress gene transcription, and plays a role in  regulation of T-cell function and in cellularity of the thymus (PMID: 28282643, PMID: 20506119, PMID: 17142725). NAB2-STAT6 fusions are associated with solitary fibrous tumor (PMID: 23313954, PMID: 23313952).

CD37, leukocyte antigen CD37, is a member of the tetraspanin family that is expressed predominately on B-cells and is involved in cell adhesion, migration, and spreading (PMID: 30072994). Loss of CD37 expression has been observed to correlate with decreased survival of B-cell lymphoma patients (PMID: 29896201) and targeting CD37 with antibodies may be effective in treating B-cell malignancies (PMID:     24555705).

E2F3, E2F transcription factor 3, is a member of the activator subclass of E2F transcription factors, and drives expression of genes involved in cell-cycle progression and proliferation upon dissociation from Rb (PMID: 19851314, PMID: 28855541). E2F3 amplification has been identified in bladder cancer (PMID: 16953223), and retinoblastoma (PMID: 16007192), and overexpression has been identified in multiple tumor types including lung adenocarcinoma and lung squamous cell carcinoma (PMID: 16938365, PMID: 19851314).

ZNF384, zinc finger protein 384, is a zinc-finger protein with putative transcription factor activity (PMID: 10669742, PMID: 12359745). Fusions involving ZNF384 are recurrent in acute lymphoblastic leukemia (PMID: 12359745, PMID: 25943178).

BCAM, basal cell adhesion molecule (Lutheran blood group), is a member of the immunoglobulin superfamily that functions as a receptor for laminin alpha5 and has a putative role in cell migration and metastasis (PMID: 24223164, PMID: 24036115). BCAM over expression and and fusions with AKT2 have been demonstrated in ovarian carcinoma (PMID: 24036115, PMID: 25733895).

CDK14, cyclin-dependent kinase 14, is regulated by cyclin-Y (CCNY) (PMID: 19524571) and plays a role in the transition of the cell-cycle through the Wnt signaling pathway (PMID: 29557391). Overexpression of Cdk14 has been observed to promote progression of breast, gastric, ovarian, esophageal, and hepatocellular cancers (PMID: 29193658, PMID: 26772918).

HMCN1, hemicentin 1, is an immunoglobulin family member that is a component of the extracellular matrix and is proposed to have roles in cell adhesion, migration, and invasion (PMID: 25338956, PMID: 17031392). Overexpression of HMCN1 has been correlated with decreased survival in ovarian carcinoma (PMID: 31638245) and mutations may be associated with cell invasion and metastasis in breast cancer (PMID: 30279964).

JMJD1C, jumonji domain containing 1C, encodes a histone H3K9 demethylase implicated in the nuclear hormone receptor-based transcriptional regulation (PMID: 17549425). JMJD1C expression and mutations are associated with various tumor types (PMID: 17549425; PMID: 24501218; PMID: 24896186) and specifically, overexpression has been observed in MLL-rearranged leukemia (PMID: 31076406) and esophageal cancer (PMID: 28123852).

RBM10, RNA binding motif protein 10, plays a role in regulating RNA splicing and expression, and acts as a tumor suppressor by promoting apoptosis, reducing cell proliferation, and inhibiting tumor growth (PMID: 29274279, PMID: 30955253, PMID: 24000153). A fusion of RBM10 and TFE3 is associated with microphthalmia-associated transcription factor family translocation renal cell carcinoma (PMID: 30622287), and RBM10 mutations have been identified in lung adenocarcinoma (PMID: 22980975), and astroblastoma (PMID: 30803556).

TTK (MPS1), TTK protein kinase, functions in the spindle assembly checkpoint (PMID: 27819146) and regulates Aurkb activity during mitotic chromosome alignment (PMID: 18243099). Dysregulation of TTK (MPS1) has been reported in a number of solid tumor types (PMID: 26202014), including glioblastoma, thyroid carcinoma, and breast cancer (PMID: 27819146).

ERBB4, erb-b2 receptor tyrosine kinase 4, encodes HER4, an ERBB family member that plays a role in cell survival and differentiation (PMID: 12648466). ERBB4 activating mutations are frequent in melanoma, and have been demonstrated in lung adenocarcinoma (PMID: 19718025, PMID: 26050618).

ABCA10, ATP binding cassette subfamily A member 10, is a member of the ATP-binding cassette (ABC) transporter family that may play a role in macrophage lipid homeostasis (PMID: 12821155). Expression levels of Abca10 have been shown to correlate with progression-free survival in ovarian carcinoma (PMID: 26820484) and decreased expression has been reported in osteosarcoma (PMID: 29050494).

SOX17, SRY-box transcription factor 17, is a member of the SOXF subclass of SOX transcription factors that regulates endoderm development, and antagonizes Wnt signaling through competing for beta-catennin binding (PMID: 31419525). SOX17 mutations have been associated with endometrial cancer (PMID: 28978154) and decreased Sox17 expression has been identified in a variety of solid tumors including hepatocellular carcinoma, breast, and colorectal cancer (PMID: 31536760).

GAB2, GRB2-associated binding protein 2, is an adaptor protein, which upon activation by cytokines, growth factors and antigens, amplifies the Shp2-Ras-Erk and PI3K-Akt signalling pathways (PMID: 26095858). Amplification and/or overexpression of Gab2 has been observed in breast cancer (PMID: 12140767), neuroblastoma (PMID: 28329685), melanoma (PMID: 19509136) and may play a role in BCR-ABL1 mediated leukemia (PMID: 28804122).

RPS6KB2, ribosomal protein S6 kinase B2, is a serine/threonine kinase that regulates translation, therefore involved in multiple cellular processes (PMID: 20953835). RPS6KB2 expression has been associated with risks of breast, lung, and colon cancers (PMID: 26577839, PMID: 24894543, PMID: 21035469).

PRDM1, PR domain zinc finger protein 1, encodes a repressor of beta-interferon gene expression (PMID: 1851123) and regulates plasma cell differentiation (PMID: 27687004). PRDM1 plays a tumor suppressor role in various tumor types (PMID: 22143801; PMID: 20047096) and decreased expression may predict poor survival in colon cancer patients (PMID: 29760071) and may promote metastasis in lung cancer (PMID: 28378641).

RYBP, RING1 and YY1 binding protein, is a component of a non-canonical PRC1 complex, and functions in monoubiquitylation of Histone 2A and facilitation of communication between PRC1 and PRC2 complexes, and plays a role in apoptosis and negative regulation of DNA repair (PMID: 29320735, PMID: 27705745, PMID: 29665352). Decreased expression of RYBP1 has been observed in several tumor types (PMID: 29665352),  including lung cancer (PMID: 28254703), hepatocellular carcinoma (PMID: 28123534) and breast cancer (PMID: 27748911).

OPTN, optineurin, is a coiled-coil domain containing protein that has a variety of functions, including vesicle transport, actin reorganization, cell cycle control, regulation of NF-kB signaling, and autophagy (PMID: 29971063, PMID: 24244017). An FGFR2-OPTN fusion has been identified in intrahepatic cholangiocarcinoma (PMID: 28034880).

PPP2R2A, protein phosphatase 2 regulatory subunit Balpha, is a regulatory subunit of the PP2A holoenzyme that negatively regulates cell cycle progression (PMID: 25483052). Altered expression of PPP2R2A has been associated with survival outcomes in pancreatic cancer (PMID: 26893480) and breast cancer (PMID: 25879784).

CLIP1, CAP-Gly domain containing linker protein 1, is a microtubule binding protein, which regulates cellular polarization and migration, and plays a role in angiogenesis (PMID: 23549612). A fusion with CLIP1 and ROS1 has been identified in spitzoid neoplasms (PMID: 24445538) and overexpression of CLIP1 has been identified in breast carcinoma (PMID: 23549612).

MAP2K7, mitogen-activated protein kinase kinase 7, is a member of the MAPK family of protein kinase that functions as a putative tumor suppressor and plays a regulatory role in cell proliferation, differentiation, and migration through JNK signaling (PMID: 21333379, PMID: 27028764). Aberrant expression or activation of  MAP2K7 has been observed in T-cell acute lymphoblastic leukemia (PMID: 28479419) and  prostate cancer (PMID: 17577251).

PDPK1, 3-phosphoinositide dependent protein kinase 1, encodes for a serine/threonine kinase that is responsible for phosphorylating the activation domain of the AGC protein kinases (PMID: 24039447). Overexpression and amplification of PDPK1 has been demonstrated to result in transformation in several types of cancer cells (PMID: 24039447, PMID: 25269480).

AXIN1, axin 1, axis inhibition protein 1 is a scaffold protein that regulates the Wnt signaling pathway and also Tp53, Myc, Tgfbeta, and Jun pathways (PMID: 30166345). Germline variations in AXIN1 have been associated with ovarian (PMID: 30929455), bladder (PMID: 31143301), kidney (PMID: 29053018), and colorectal cancers (PMID: 25236910) and loss of Axin1 function leads to increased cellular beta-catenin (CTNNB1), potentially promoting cell proliferation (PMID: 10700176).

TBX3, T-box 3, is a transcription factor with key roles in embryogenesis, cell cycle control, and cellular senescence (PMID: 22002537). Overexpression of Tbx3 has been identified in cancers including breast, pancreatic, liver, bladder, and melanoma (PMID: 24025717).

AEBP2, AE binding protein 2, is a zinc finger protein that modulates chromatin methylation as a component of the PRC2 complex, thus regulates embryonic development and cell migration (PMID: 27317809, PMID: 25451679). Mutations in AEBP2 have been identified in clear cell renal cell carcinoma (PMID: 24487277) and esophageal squamous cell carcinoma (PMID: 27749841), and loss of AEBP2 has been identified in acute myeloid leukaemia (PMID: 27022003) and chronic myeloid malignancies (PMID: 22190018).

CDK16, cyclin-dependent kinase 16, interacts with cyclin Y (CCNY) and plays a role in neurite outgrowth, trafficking of vesicles (PMID: 26205494), spermatogenesis (PMID: 28274513) and is a putative oncogene (PMID: 28716136). Overexpression of Cdk16 has been observed in ovarian cancer cell lines (PMID: 26546806), cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma (PMID: 28274513), hepatocellular carcinoma (PMID: 28716136), and non-small cell lung cancer (PMID: 29674275).

GSK3B, glycogen synthase kinase 3 beta, is a serine-threonine kinase that is involved in glycogen synthesis, regulates proteosomal degradation of signaling molecules including beta-catenin, Ccnd1, Myc, and Jun (PMID: 11563964, PMID: 29379583), and also promotes cell survival through activation of NF-kappaB signaling (PMID: 28053024). GSK3B overexpression has been identified in pancreatic and colorectal cancer (PMID: 22100174, PMID: 16043125).

USH2A, Usher syndrome 2A, encodes a basement membrane protein whose function is unclear but appears to be important in cochlear and retinal development. Mutations in Ush2a are commonly reported in Usher syndrome and in retinitis pigmentosa, However, mutations in various cancers have also been reported (PMID: 11788194, Cancer Res April 15, 2012 72; 3959).

TRPV6, transient receptor potential cation channel subfamily V member 6, is a member of the TRPV (vanilloid) subfamily of transient receptor (TRP) channels that forms a calcium sensitive ion channel and plays a role in calcium homeostasis (PMID: 28501141). Overexpression of Trpv6 has been observed in ovarian, (PMID: 30210643), pancreatic (PMID: 29344675), prostate (PMID: 24704446), and breast cancer (PMID:     28008282), where it may increase cell proliferation in a calcium-dependent manner (PMID: 28501141).

ARID2, AT-rich interactive domain-containing protein 2, is a member of the SWI/SNF chromatin remodeling complex and is involved in cell-cycle activation. Arid2 loss of function has been identified in hepatoceullar carcinoma (PMID: 22095441, PMID: 28238438), NSCLC (PMID: 23047306), and papillary renal cell carcinoma (PMID: 25790038).

TP73, tumor protein 73, is a p53 family transcription factor, which is involved in regulating cell death and cell cycle arrest, and is dysregulated in several tumor types (PMID: 24488880, PMID: 23913810). TP73 is expressed as several isoforms, including some with opposing activities (PMID: 24488880, PMID: 23913810).

IDO1, indoleamine 2,3-dioxygenase 1, is an enzyme that catalyzes the conversion of tryptophan to kynurenine, and plays an important role in the inflammatory response (PMID: 29413421, PMID: 26378585). IDO1 promoter hypomethylation is associated with reduced survival in patients with esophageal cancer (PMID: 31012515), and expression of IDO1 has been demonstrated in various solid tumors, including endometrial, cervical, and non-small cell lung cancer (PMID: 25271151).

AICDA, activation-induced cytidine deaminase, is part of the cytidine deaminase family, involved in somatic hypermutation, and class-switching of immunoglobulin genes. Mutations in AICDA are associated with lymphoma, leukemia, and GIST (PMID: 23181381).

STRN3, striatin-3, is a member of the striatin family of WD repeat proteins (PMID: 26022125), a subunit of the striatin-interacting phosphatase and kinase (STRIPAK) complex, and may function to maintain the endoplasmic reticulum (PMID: 28634818). STRN3 fusions with BRAF have been observed in unknown primary adenocarcinoma (PMID: 26314551) and with NTRK3 in fibrosarcoma (PMID: 30520818).

BCAN, brevican, is a chondroitin sulfate proteoglycan, which plays a role in neuronal attachment and neurite out-growth (PMID: 20840587). Tumor-specific isoforms of brevican have been identified in gliomas and are associated with glioma progression (PMID: 16061654).

IFIT3, interferon-induced protein with tetratricopeptide repeats 3, is a member of the IRF-inducible gene family that plays a role in the immune defense against RNA viruses and regulation of apoptosis (PMID: 30234477). Overexpression of Ifit3 in pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma has been associated with decreased cell apoptosis, resistance to chemotherapy, and poor prognosis (PMID: 28210844) however, in hepatocellular carcinoma Ifit3 overexpression shows a better response to interferon-alpha (PMID: 28295457).

CCND3, cyclin D3, encodes for the D3-type cyclin protein, which regulates the CDK kinases in order to promote the transition phases of the cell cycle (PMID: 23079656). CCND3 over expression and amplification have been linked to B-cell lymphomas (PMID: 16402392, PMID: 16322284).

YWHAE, tyrosine 3-monooxygenase/tryptophan 5-monooxygenase activation protein epsilon, is a member of the 14-3-3 family signaling proteins that is involved in signaling pathways regulating diverse cellular functions (PMID: 15364926, PMID: 17728103, PMID: 23472066). YWHAE rearrangement has been identified in endometrial stromal sarcoma (PMID: 25355621), clear cell sarcoma of the kidney (PMID: 26493387), and round cell sarcoma (PMID: 26945340).

TSC1, TSC complex subunit 1, is a tumor suppressor (PMID: 30562755) that forms a complex with Tsc2 and inhibits mTOR pathway signaling, thus regulating cell growth and metabolism (PMID: 27226234). Germline TSC1 inactivating mutations cause tuberous sclerosis complex and somatic TSC1 mutations have been identified in various cancers, including renal cell carcinoma, mucosal melanoma, and breast cancer (PMID: 27226234, PMID: 30327302, PMID: 29185092, PMID: 28027327).

ACVR1B, activin A receptor type 1B, is a serine/threonine kinase that functions as a receptor for activin and modulates downstream signaling (PMID: 15451563). ACVR1B has been identified as a possible tumor suppressor in pancreatic cancer (PMID: 11248065, PMID: 24886203, PMID: 29625053).

CDC42BPB, CDC42 binding protein kinase beta, is a serine/threonine kinase that functions downstream of Cdc42, regulating cytoskeleton organization and cell motility (PMID: 15723050). CDC42BPB has been suggested as a diagnostic marker in bladder cancer (PMID: 28193625).

SLC12A7, solute carrier family 12 member 7, is a potassium-chloride cotransporter that plays a role in the movement of salt across the transmembrane (PMID: 21733850). Amplification and overexpression of SLC12A7 has been observed in adrenocortical carcinoma and a fusion with BRAF has been identified in a cutaneous melanoma spitzoid tumor (PMID: 26314551, PMID: 26454676).

RHEB, Ras homolog, mTORC1 binding, is a member of the Ras superfamily of small GTPase that regulates cell growth through activation of mTORC1 (PMID: 25429186, PMID: 26234902). RHEB mutations have been identified in colorectal cancer and renal cell carcinoma (PMID: 17932254, PMID: 26255626).

SARAF, store-operated calcium entry associated regulatory factor, encodes for a membrane protein that plays a role in regulating calcium homeostasis within the cell (PMID: 22464749). SARAF fusions have been observed in colorectal cancer and lymphoma (PMID: 27461012, PMID: 28489605).

FH, fumarate hydratase, is an citric acid cycle enzyme that catalyzes the conversion of fumarate to malate (PMID: 25864878). Mutations in FH are associated with hereditary leiomyomatosis and renal cell carcinomas (PMID: 25864878, PMID: 25105836).

ABR, ABR activator of RhoGEF and GTPas, also known as active BCR-related, is a negative regulator of RAC1, which plays a role in regulation of the innate immune system (PMID: 29262589). Decreased expression of Abr has been observed in acute myeloid leukemia (PMID: 29262589).

SOX9, SRY-box 9, is an HMG box transcription factor which plays a crucial role in chondrogenesis, organogenesis, and neural crest development (PMID: 22246670). Overexpression of Sox9 has been observed in cancers of the skin, prostate, lung, colon, and brain, while decreased expression has been reported in melanoma (PMID: 22246670, PMID: 28988015, PMID: 30675295, PMID: 30642390).

AFF2, AF4/FMR2 family member 2, is a transcription factor associated with the folate-sensitive fragile X E locus on chromosome X (PMID: 9299237). AFF2 mutations have been identified in breast cancer patients (PMID: 23000897).

AFF3, AF4/FMR2 family, member 3, is a nuclear protein with transcriptional activation potential (PMID: 8555498). AFF3 fusions are observed with MLL in childhood leukemias (PMID: 12203795, PMID: 8555498).

TTC5, tetratricopeptide repeat domain 5, encodes Strap, which functions as a cofactor in the DNA damage response, acting to potentiate p53 activity, and as a cofactor for HSF1 in the heat shock response, acting to prevent apoptosis (PMID: 18719389, PMID: 23559008).

VEGFB, vascular endothelial growth factor B, is a growth factor that may stimulate angiogenesis through interaction with the FLT1 receptor (PMID: 19029957). Vegfb overexpression has been observed in ovarian, colorectal, renal-cell, and prostate cancer (PMID: 19029957) and VEGFB promoter methylation correlates with increased Vegfb expression and tumor progression in ovarian cancer (PMID: 23965899).

TRAF7, TNF receptor-associated factor 7, E3 ubiquitin protein ligase, acts as an E3 ligase for multiple NF-kappaB pathway members and for p53, and plays a role in regulation of several signaling pathways and in promoting apoptosis (PMID: 23128672, PMID: 22105767). Mutations in TRAF7 are associated with non-NF2 meningiomas (PMID: 23348505).

CDK11B, cyclin-dependent kinase 11B, is also known as CDC2L1 and is one of eleven isoforms encoding CDK11, which is also encoded by CDK11A and it is not clear which CDK11 isoforms (p46, p58, and p110) correspond to CDK11 A or B (PMID: 27049727). CDK11 plays a role in the regulation of cell growth, proliferation, and apoptosis (PMID: 24007862) and aberrant expression of Cdk11 has a role in tumor progression in multiple tumor types (PMID: 27049727, PMID: 28262798, PMID: 27207777, PMID: 26470709).

PAK1, p21 protein (Cdc42/Rac)-activated kinase 1, is a Group I PAK family member that functions as an effector for Rac and Cdc42 signaling, and is involved in regulation of cell signaling, proliferation, migration, and survival (PMID: 23125950, PMID: 23162742). PAK1 amplification and over expression have been observed in several tumor types (PMID: 23125950, PMID: 24529727).

COL1A1, collagen 1 alpha 1, is a member of the fibrillary type collagens that maintain tissue structural integrity (PMID: 23145505). COL1A1 fusions are observed with PDGFB in sarcoma (PMID: 10446987).
NUDT3, nudix hydrolase 3, is an mRNA decapping enzyme of the Nudix family proteins that regulates breast cancer cell motility in cell culture (PMID: 26932476).

APOBEC3F, apolipoprotein B mRNA editing enzyme, catalytic polypeptide-like 3F, is a cytidine deaminase that induces C-to-U mutations, functioning in host defense against retroviruses and inhibition of retrotranspons (PMID: 22001110). Overexpression of Apobec3f has been observed in HBV-positive hepatocellular carcinoma (PMID: 26760979).

CLU, clusterin, is a stress-induced chaperone that prevents protein misfolding and functions in apoptosis, cell proliferation, cell-cycle regulation, DNA damage response (PMID: 19879421, PMID: 19903745, PMID: 30002194). Overexpression of Clu has been observed in hepatocellular carcinoma (PMID: 25609201), esophageal cancer (PMID: 25574066), and promotes cell growth and invasion in renal carcinoma cells (PMID: 29400663).

RALGAPA1, ral GTPase-activating protein subunit alpha-1, is component of the Ral GTPase-activating protein complex (RalGAP), which activates the GTPase function of RALA and RALB (PMID: 24768767). A RALGAPA1-NRG1 fusion has been observed in non-small cell lung carcinoma (PMID: 29636358).

CRTC3, CREB regulated transcription coactivator 3, encodes for a member of the CRTC family, which plays a role in the metabolic stress response via PKA or AMPK and is associated with the activation of Pgc-1alpha, a protein involved in mitochondrial biogenesis (PMID: 21536665). CRTC3-MAML2 fusion has been observed in mucoepidermoid carcinoma (PMID: 23035786) and cutaneous hidradenoma (PMID: 27402217).

HIKESHI, heat shock protein nuclear import factor hikeshi, encodes a protein responsible for the nuclear import of ATP-bound Hsp70 proteins, thereby playing a role in the protection of cells from heat shock damage (PMID: 26523678, PMID: 22541429). Increased expression of HIKESHI has been identified in gastric cancer (PMID: 28731175).

AGTRAP, angiotensin II receptor associated protein, is a transmembrane protein localized to the plasma membrane and interacts with the AT1 angiotensin II receptor (PMID: 25562590). AGTRAP fusions are observed with BRAF in solid tumors (PMID: 20613748).

PML, promyelocytic leukemia, is a nuclear phosphoprotein that is associated with cellular functions related to cell adhesion, differentiation, migration, and proliferation (PMID: 23555679). The PML-RARA oncogenic fusion is diagnostic for acute promyelocytic leukemia (PMID: 23555679).

ZMIZ1, zinc finger MIZ domain-containing protein 1, is regulator of DNA transcription factors (PMID: 26522984) and a cofactor for Notch1 in the process of early T-cell development (PMID: 30076146). Overexpression of Zmiz1 has been observed in acute T lymphoblastic leukemia (PMID: 23161489) and a ZMIZ1 - ABL1 fusion has been identified in B-cell acute lymphoblastic leukemia (PMID: 18007576).

PAK4, serine/threonine-protein kinase PAK 4, is a member of the group 2 family of PAKs that functions in regulation of the cytoskeleton, cell adhesion, migration, growth, and proliferation (PMID: 29508632). Overexpression of Pak4 has been observed in pancreatic, lung, breast, and ovarian cancer, where it may correlate with poor prognosis (PMID: 29508632, PMID: 29330094).

ARID5B, AT-rich interaction domain 5B, encodes a member of the ARID DNA-binding protein family, which plays a role in gene transcription by forming a complex with Phf2 to facilitate the demethylation of H3K9me2 (PMID: 21890642, PMID: 11959810, PMID: 21532585). ARID5B germline variants are associated with acute lymphoblastic leukemia (PMID: 25310577, PMID: 24564228), and reduced expression has been identified in B-cell and T-cell acute lymphoblastic leukemia (PMID: 30420689).

NR3C1, nuclear receptor subfamily 3 group C member 1, a transcription factor and a mediator of protein-protein interaction, which plays a role in metabolism, cell proliferation and apoptosis, and immune and inflammatory response (PMID: 31212954, PMID: 24084075, PMID: 10696570). Decreased expression of NR3C1 has been observed in various hematologic malignancies and advanced solid tumors, including breast, colorectal and prostate cancers (PMID: 29158269).

GAB1, GRB2-associated-binding protein 1, is an adaptor protein that mediates signal transduction from tyrosine kinase receptors, including Egfr, Met, and Src to regulate cell proliferation and migration (PMID: 22751113). Amplification, overexpression, and somatic mutations have been observed in Bcr-Abl-positive adult acute lymphoblastic leukemia (PMID: 17312329), medulloblastoma (PMID: 21267586), breast cancer (PMID: 16959974), and colorectal cancer (PMID: 16959974).

ETV5, ETS variant 5, is a member of the ETS family of transcription factors (PMID: 18781147). ETV5 fusions have been observed with TMPRSS2 and SLC5A3 in prostate cancer and over-expression regulates cell adhesion and proliferation in ovarian cancer (PMID: 18781147, PMID: 21520040).

STAG2, cohesin subunit SA-2, functions as part of the cohesin complex to regulate spindle formation and sister chromatid association in  mitosis (PMID: 12034751, PMID: 24854081, PMID: 29175904). Somatic STAG2 mutations have been reported in glioblastoma, Ewing's sarcoma, bladder cancer, and melanoma, and loss of Stag2 expression has been demonstrated in a variety of other tumor types, including bladder cancer (PMID: 22668012, PMID: 28627627, PMID: 27207471, PMID: 29954776).

PRSS1, protease serine 1, is a cationic trypsinogen involved in peptide cleavage when activated (PMID: 24458023). Germline PRSS1 mutations are associated with familial pancreatitis, which increases the risk of developing pancreatic cancer (PMID: 24458023).

DICER1, endoribonuclease Dicer, plays a role in synthesis of micro-RNA's and in cell proliferation (PMID: 26033159). Somatic loss of function mutations in Dicer1 have been linked to a variety of cancers (PMID: 25176334) including, endometrial (PMID: 26033159), pleuropulmonary blastoma (PPB), cystic nephroma (CN), and Sertoli-Leydig cell tumor (SLCT) (PMID: 27906793).

DDR2, discoidin domain-containing receptor 2, is a tyrosine kinase receptor activated by collagen, promoting cell migration, proliferation, and survival (PMID: 22328973, PMID: 27398168). Altered expression and mutations of DDR2 have been identified in a variety of solid tumors, including ovarian (PMID: 27398168), lung (PMID: 28161936), gastric (PMID: 27350126), and HNSCC (PMID: 27434411).

PRKCG, protein kinase C gamma, is a serine/threonine-protein kinase mainly expressed in neuronal tissues and regulates diverse functions (PMID: 12417016). PRKCG alteration may be correlated with osteosarcoma susceptibility (PMID: 25252845) and Burkitt lymphoma prognosis (PMID: 15028022).

ABCC4, ATP binding cassette subfamily C member 4, functions in transport of various molecules out of the cell (PMID: 16586096, PMID: 18353444). Abcc4 expression is dysregulated in various tumor types, such as neuroblastoma (PMID: 28735070), and overexpression is associated with drug resistance (PMID: 18353444, PMID: 25572969, PMID: 26499190, PMID: 28765596).

NUP93, nucleoporin 93, encodes a nucleopore protein, which forms a subcomplex of the nuclear pore complex thereby mediating the transport of proteins and nucleic acids between the nucleus and cytoplasm (PMID: 22171326). Overexpression of NUP93 has been identified in cervical cancer (PMID: 31774908).

H1-2, histone H1.2, encodes a member of the histone H1 family, which binds to linker DNA between nucleosomes and functions in the compaction of chromatin into higher order structure. H1-2 expression is associated with various tumor types (PMID: 24289130; PMID: 18852131).

ID1, inhibitor of DNA binding 1, HLH protein, is a helix-loop-helix protein (HLH) transcription factor family member that lacks a DNA binding domain, which binds to other HLH family members and prevents their DNA binding activity (PMID: 25248477, PMID: 16034366). Overexpression of Id1 is associated with several tumor types (PMID: 12842081), including breast, prostate, gastric, lung, and esophageal squamous cell carcinoma (PMID: 31440083) and altered expression of Id1 has been observed in pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma (PMID: 31582374).

SOS1, SOS Ras/Rac guanine nucleotide exchange factor 1, is a Grb2 anchored membrane bound protein (PMID: 28452363), which acts as a GTP exchange factor to activate RAS proteins (PMID: 21779500, PMID: 30683722) and enhance downstream signaling of MAPK and PI3K pathways (PMID: 30735352). Germline Sos1 mutations are commonly observed in Noonan syndrome (PMID: 30635434) and somatic Sos1 gain of function mutations have been identified in lung adenocarcinoma (PMID: 30635434).

TRIB2, tribbles homolog 2, is a pseudokinase, without kinase activity that plays a role in regulating protein stability through E3 ubiquitin ligases and also regulates AKT signaling (PMID: 30254057). Overexpression of Trib2 has been observed in malignant melanoma (PMID: 20208562), colon cancer, and pancreatic cancer (PMID: 28276427) and may contribute to drug resistance to PIK3 inhibitors (PMID: 28276427) and cisplatin (PMID: 29312632).

NUP214, nucleoporin 214kDa, encodes a nucleoporin protein that forms a subcomplex with the nuclear pore complex and is involved in protein export, especially during mitosis (PMID: 25743594). The DEK-NUP214 fusion, which upregulates Mtor signaling, has been identified in acute myeloid leukemia (PMID: 24073922).

FGF2, fibroblast growth factor 2, encodes for a member of the fibroblast growth factors (FGF) family, playing a role in cellular development via activation of signal transduction pathways through binding of FGF receptors (PMID: 16216232). Elevated expression of FGF2 has been associated with several types of cancer (PMID: 27007053).

SPTBN1, spectrin beta chain, non-erythrocytic 1, is an an adapter protein within the TGF-beta/Smad3/Smad4 complex that plays a role in organization of the cytoskeleton (PMID: 25632041) and functions in liver development, liver regeneration, platelet formation, heart development (PMID: 25307947), and genomic stability (PMID: 28114741, PMID: 27248179). Fusions of SPTBN1-ALK have been observed in lung adenocarcinoma (PMID: 27496196) and colorectal cancer (PMID: 26678488).

HAVCR1, hepatitis A virus cellular receptor 1, is a member of the T cell immunoglobulin mucin (TIM) family that regulates T cell proliferation and activation (PMID: 12776205). HAVCR1 expression has been associated with renal tumors progression (PMID: 23352434, PMID: 24390735).

MALT1, MALT1 paracaspase, regulates nuclear factor kappa B signaling through both scaffolding and proteolytic functions (PMID: 26386283). Constitutive activation of Malt1 has been associated with B-cell lymphomas (PMID: 25285878, PMID: 15286744).

ABCB1, ATP binding cassette subfamily B member 1, is a membrane-bound ABC drug transport protein involved in movement of various compounds out of the cell (PMID: 27449595, PMID: 27180306). Abcb1 activity is associated with multidrug resistance in cancer (PMID: 27449595, PMID: 27180306, PMID: 30176891) and may predict toxicity (PMID: 30213564).

PTP4A1, protein tyrosine phosphatase IV A1, is a member of the PRL protein tyrosine phosphatase family that regulates cellular proliferation and migration, and promotes invasion and metastasis in cancer cells (PMID: 25003523, PMID: 17656357, PMID: 16540666, PMID: 12782572). PTP4A1 amplification and overexpression has been observed in hepatocellular carcinoma (PMID: 25003523), and a fusion of PTP41A and ROS1 has been identified in non-small cell lung cancer (PMID: 30978502).

NEK10, NIMA-related kinase 10, is a member of the NEK protein kinase family, that plays a role in regulation of the cell cycle in response to DNA damage (PMID: 23132929), is a positive regulator of ERK1/2 signaling, and is a putative tumor suppressor (PMID: 30474248). Loss of Nek10 expression has been observed in squamous cell carcinoma, prostate cancer, and glioblastoma (PMID: 30474248).

EYA2, EYA transcriptional coactivator and phosphatase 2, acts as a co-activator for SIX to regulate transactivation of target genes, and plays a role in regulation of DNA damage response (PMID: 22971774, PMID: 25555392). EYA2 overexpression has been demonstrated in several tumor types (PMID: 22971774), including epithelial ovarian cancer (PMID: 15705892) and prostate cancer (PMID: 31317026).

KLK2, kallikrein-related peptidase 2, is a serine protease that cleaves pro-prostate-specific antigen (PMID: 18344018). KLK2 is considered a potential diagnostic and prognostic biomarker for prostate cancer (PMID: 24809052).

GTF2I, general transcription factor IIi, is a transcription factor involved in cell cycle regulation in response to diverse signaling pathways (PMID: 17976384). Mutations of GTF2I have been identified in multiple cancers (PMID: 25284716, PMID: 24974848).

TERC, telomerase RNA component, is the RNA component of telomerase that serves as template for new telomeric repeats, therefore is essential for telomerase function and regulates chromosomal stability and cell senescence (PMID: 27245259).  TERC amplification and/or overexpression have been identified in lung squamous cell carcinoma (PMID: 31837325), cervical cancer (PMID: 31685833), esophageal squamous cell precursor lesions (PMID: 30311151), and prostate cancer (PMID: 28888037).

CTNNB1, beta-catenin, is a member of the Wnt signaling pathway, component of cadherin-based adherens junctions, and is also a tumor antigen recognized by T-cells in melanoma (PMID: 29403496). CTNNB1 plays a fundamental role in neurodevelipment and controls cell growth and adhesion (PMID: 27131348).

TP53, cellular tumor antigen p53, is a tumor suppressor (PMID: 30562755) involved in cell cycle arrest and apoptosis, and is the most frequently mutated gene in cancer (PMID: 10065147, PMID: 22713868). TP53 germline mutations are common in Li-Fraumeni syndrome (PMID: 30239254) and somatic missense mutations are frequent in almost all cancer types cancers (PMID: 30224644) and are also implicated  in chemoresistance (PMID: 9927204, PMID: 24065105, PMID: 27066457).

ZBTB2, zinc finger and BTB domain containing 2, is a member of the POK family transcription factor that regulates the ARF-HDM2-p53-p21 pathway through transcriptional repression (PMID: 19380588). ZBTB2 mutations have been identified in colorectal cancer (PMID: 23684749).

TACC2, transforming acidic coiled-coil containing protein 2, encodes a centrosomal protein that plays a role in the organization of the microtubules during the cell cycle (PMID: 15226440, PMID: 11121038). A fusion with FGFR2 and TACC2 has been identified in intrahepatic cholangiocarcinoma (PMID: 30420614).

CREB3L1, cAMP responsive element binding protein 3-like 1, is a transcription factor involved in the unfolded protein response (UniProt.org). CREB3L1 fusions are observed with EWSR1 in sarcoma (PMID: 21987447).

MAP2K2 (MEK2), mitogen-activated protein kinase kinase 2, is a serine-threonine kinase, which activates that RAS-RAF-MEK-ERK pathway to regulate, the cell cycle, cell proliferation, and cell differentiation (PMID: 22753777, PMID: 29706623). MAP2K2 (MEK2) missense mutations are commonly associated with acquired resistance to RAF and MEK inhibitors (PMID: 24265153, PMID: 28263969, PMID: 28655712).

SMARCA5, SWI/SNF related, matrix associated, actin dependent regulator of chromatin, subfamily a, member 5, is an ATPase subunit of ISWI family chromatin remodeling complexes and plays a role in DNA damage response and double strand break repair (PMID: 25486562). SMARCA5 over expression has been demonstrated in gastric and breast cancer (PMID: 25377162, PMID: 21261476).

DYRK1B, dual specificity tyrosine phosphorylation regulated kinase 1B, encodes for a serine/threonine kinase, which plays a role in the differentiation of muscle cells via regulation of the cell cycle, survival, and transcription (PMID: 24955215, PMID: 29193696). DYRK1B amplification and overexpression have been observed in a number of cancers including ovarian, pancreatic (PMID: 17583556), and breast cancer (PMID: 28554575).

FGF6, fibroblast growth factor 6, is a member of the fibroblast growth factor family that drives oncogenic transformation (PMID: 1549352). Fgf6 overexpression has been identified in prostate cancer (PMID: 10945637).

PIK3R2, phosphatidylinositol 3-kinase regulatory subunit beta, encodes a PI3K regulatory subunit that recruits active PI3K/AKT signaling pathway kinases via its SH2 domain (PMID: 22733740). PIK3R2 expression is correlated with tumor progression (PMID: 22733740) and is regulated by miR-126 microRNA in several cancer types (PMID: 21249429, PMID: 27698796, PMID: 27578985).

GAS7, growth arrest specific 7, is a member of the growth arrest specific (GAS) gene family (PMID: 29269300) and plays a role in neurite growth and migration in neuronal development (PMID: 29706651). A KMT2A-GAS7 fusion may be associated with leukemia (PMID: 26766589, PMID: 12620410) and overexpression has been reported in non-small cell lung cancer (PMID: 29269300).
RAD51B, RAD51 paralog B, plays a role in homologous recombination in DNA repair, and mutations in RAD51B are associated with susceptibility to breast cancer (PMID: 21821141, PMID: 24139550).

TEAD4, TEA domain family member 4, is a transcription factor which functions through the Hippo pathway to regulate cell proliferation and apoptosis (PMID: 18579750). Abnormal expression of Tead4 has been reported in breast cancer, testicular cancer, and serous fallopian tube carcinoma  (PMID: 20945341).

IDH1, isocitrate dehydrogenase (NADP(+)) 1, cytosolic, is an enzyme that catalyzes the conversion of isocitrate to alpha-ketoglutarate (alpha-KG), and is involved in the tricarboxylic acid cycle (PMID: 23999441, PMID: 28711227). Mutations in IDH1 are associated with aberrant conversion of alpha-KG to 2-HG, which is an oncogenic metabolite, and are recurrent in acute myeloid leukemia and glioma (PMID: 23999441, PMID: 28711227).

KMT2A, lysine methyltransferase 2A, also referred to as MLL, is a transcriptional coactivator that epigenetically regulates gene transcription via methylation and is primarily associated with hematopoietic and embyronic development (PMID: 26161385). KMT2A translocations are frequently observed in specific leukemias including acute myeloid, acute lymphoblastic, and mixed lineage (PMID: 17957188).

ASH1L, ASH1 like histone lysine methyltransferase, is a histone methyltransferase in the trithorax group of transcription factors, which functions in gene regulation and is frequently mutated in lung cancer and esophageal squamous cell cancer (PMID: 21239497, PMID: 23033341, PMID: 24670651).

SORBS1, sorbin and SH3 domain containing 1, also known as CAP/ponsin is an adaptor protein that regulates insulin signaling, cell adhesion, and cell motility (PMID: 27791200). Decreased expression in breast cancer may promote tumorigenesis and decreased sensitivity to cisplatin (PMID: 27791200), and a fusion with FGFR2 has been reported in intrahepatic cholangiocarcinoma (PMID: 31109923).

HDAC9, histone deacetylase 9, is a member of the class IIa HDAC family (PMID: 30096875) that functions in deacetylation of histone proteins and plays a role in multiple cellular regulatory processes via repression of gene transcription, and can result in alternative isoforms with variable biological function (PMID: 11535832). Differential expression of HDAC9 has been observed in tumor types including glioblastoma, medulloblastoma, and acute lymphocytic leukemia (PMID: 21435179).

PRSS8, serine protease 8, is a membrane-anchored serine protease that plays a role in epidermal barrier function (PMID: 26719335, PMID: 16061697) and in regulation of glucose homeostasis (PMID: 24614850). Decreased PRSS8 expression has been demonstrated in several tumor types including colorectal cancer (PMID: 30115975), hepatocellular carcinoma (PMID: 27915333), and prostate cancer (PMID: 12518323).

PLK1, polo-like kinase 1, is a serine-threonine kinase that regulates mitotic events and cell cycle progression in the transition of metaphase to anaphase during mitosis (PMID: 30414309, PMID: 27888710). Overexpression of Plk1 has been observed in metastatic tumors including, prostate, lung, neuroblastoma, and non-Hodgkin's lymphoma, where Plk1 leads to chromosome instability, aneuploidy (PMID: 24667170, PMID: 23227884, PMID: 30414309), and resistance to chemotherapy (PMID: 27330107).

FANCE, Fanconi anemia, complementation group E, is a member of the Fanconi anemia core complex, which plays a role in DNA repair (PMID: 27145721, PMID: 17308347). Germline FANCE mutations are associated with Fanconi anemia, which involves predisposition to various cancers including colorectal cancer (PMID: 25237197, PMID: 27165003).

MKRN1, E3 ubiquitin-protein ligase makorin-1, is a zinc-finger protein (PMID: 23104211) and transcriptional coregulator which, inhibits cell death by negative regulation of Tp53 (PMID: 26817873). MKRN1 fusions with BRAF have been observed in pediatric gliomas (PMID: 23817572) and anaplastic thyroid carcinomas (PMID: 26680454) and overexpression of Mkrn1 has been observed in cervical cancer (PMID: 26183061).

MAGI3, membrane associated guanylate kinase, WW and PDZ domain containing 3, localizes to epithelial cell tight junctions to regulate AKT1 through PTEN (PMID: 10748157). Fusion of MAGI3 with AKT3 has been identified in breast cancer (PMID: 22722202).

KDM6A, lysine demethylase 6A, is a Jumonji domain histone demethylase that targets  H3 lysine 27 (H3K27) to regulate gene transcription through chromatin remodeling and plays a role in cell growth and differentiation (PMID: 30753822). Altered expression of Kdm6a has been reported in HNSCC and bladder cancer (PMID: 25275298, PMID: 25225064) and mutations have been observed in acute myeloid leukemia, bladder carcinoma, breast cancer, chronic myeloid leukemia, colorectal adenocarcinoma, endometrial adenocarcinoma, clear cell renal cell carcinoma, and glioblastoma (PMID: 30753822).

TYRO3, tyrosine-protein kinase receptor TYRO3, is a member of the TAM family (Tyro3, Axl, and Mer) and plays a role in regulation of the immune system and cell survival, migration, and differentiation through activation of PI3K and AKT (PMID: 30322068, PMID: 20546121). Overexpression of Tyro3 has been observed in leukemia, thyroid cancer, metastatic colorectal cancer, and melanoma (PMID: 30322068).

MAPK1, mitogen-activated protein kinase 1, translocates to the nucleus upon activation by upstream kinases, thereby influencing many cellular processes, including cell proliferation (PMID: 22450690). Dysregulation of MAPK1 is associated with several human tumor types (PMID: 12937136).

PAX7, paired box 7, encodes for a transcription factor that plays a role in embryogenesis, cellular migration (PMID: 12647804), and chromatin reorganization (PMID: 28441415). Overexpression of Pax7 is associated with rhabdomyosarcoma (PMID: 12865925, PMID: 8187070), and a PAX7-FKHR fusion has been identified in alveolar rhabdomyosarcoma (PMID: 8187070).

ACTG2, actin gamma 2, smooth muscle, encodes an isoform of actin specifically expressed in smooth muscle cells and contributes to cell contractility (PMID: 1710027, PMID: 26647307). Altered Actg2 expression has been identified in colorectal and prostate cancer, small intestinal neuroendocrine tumors, and leiomyosarcoma (PMID: 30786729, PMID: 29286311, PMID: 27107594, PMID: 24889065).

MDK, midkine, is a heparin-binding growth factor that regulates cell growth, differentiation, survival, and migration (PMID: 23976985, PMID: 12204104, PMID: 8507561, PMID: 10537068). A fusion of MDK and ERBB2 (HER2) has been observed in gastric adenocarcinoma (PMID: 25889497), and increased expression of MDK has been demonstrated in several tumor types including gastric, colorectal, and hepatocellular carcinomas (PMID: 23976985, PMID: 12204104).

EPHA8, ephrin type-A receptor 8, is a receptor kinase that binds ephrin-A ligands and plays a role in cell adhesion, cell migration, and nuerite outgrowth (PMID: 26989075). Overexpression of Eph8 has been correlated with poor prognosis in oral tongue squamous cell carcinoma (PMID: 30300334) and epithelial ovarian cancer (PMID: 26989075).

CHGA, chromogranin A, is a member of the granin protein family expressed by neuroendocrine cells, which is cleaved into multiple peptides, and plays a role in formation of secretory granules, endothelial barrier function, and calcium homeostasis (PMID: 24671122, PMID: 22388654). CHGA level is a biomarker for neuroendocrine tumors (PMID: 24671122, PMID: 22388654).

TTC28, tetratricopeptide repeat 28, plays a key role in the progression of cell cycle and cytokinesis, and mediates protein-protein interactions (PMID: 23036704, PMID: 10517866). Fusions involving TTC28 have been demonstrated to occur in lung (PMID: 22960745), and colorectal cancer (PMID: 22810696).

NRG1, neuregulin 1, encodes for a ligand that can bind to Erbb3 (Her3) and Erbb4, which upon binding forms dimers with other ERBB (HER) family receptors and thus, may result in activation of downstream signaling pathways (PMID: 10880430). NRG1 fusions have been demonstrated to bind to Erbb3 (Her3), leading to Erbb3-Erbb2 heterodimers, and have been identified in lung adenocarcinomas (PMID: 25501131).

CD19, CD19 molecule, is a B-cell surface protein that binds to and activates B cell antigen receptor signaling, which activates B lymphocytes (PMID: 18059271). CD19 has been used as a diagnostic marker for leukemia and lymphoma, and is a target for  immunotherapy (PMID: 8528044, PMID: 28413717).

RSPO4, R-spondin 4, encodes for one of the secreted proteins in the TSR1-containing protein family, which plays a role in canonical Wnt signaling and nail development (PMID: 22439850). RSPO4 overexpression has been identified in serous endometrioid adenocarcinoma (PMID: 24894155) and breast cancer (PMID: 28472820).

ABL1, ABL proto-oncogene 1, non-receptor tyrosine kinase, plays a role in regulation of cell growth through ERK5, Rac/JNK, and Stat1/3 pathways (PMID: 10373409). Fusion proteins of BCR-ABL1 resulting in constitutive kinase activity have been reported in various cancers (PMID: 18851712, PMID: 30125955) and a number of Abl1 mutations in the context of BCR-ABL1 have been demonstrated to confer drug resistance (PMID: 24456693).

PPP1CB, protein phosphatase 1 catalytic subunit beta, is a component of the type 1 serine/threonine phosphatase phosphoprotein phosphatase 1 (PPP1) holoenzyme and is involved in regulating glycogen metabolism (PMID: 9045612), muscle contraction (PMID: 1336455, PMID: 20675715), and adipogenesis (PMID: 26449462). PPP1CB fusions have been identified in glioma (PMID: 30709888), astrocytoma (PMID: 28069802), uterine leiomyosarcoma (PMID: 30116888), and chronic lymphocytic leukemia (PMID: 23382248).

RPA1, replication protein A 70 kDa DNA-binding subunit, is part of a heterotrimeric protein complex, which functions in DNA replication, homologous recombination, excision repair (PMID: 29477843), and telomere maintenance (PMID: 29665433). Overexpression of Rpa1 is associated with poor prognosis in hepatocellular carcinoma (PMID: 29477843) and esophageal carcinoma (PMID: 26824734).

MUTYH, mutY DNA glycosylase, encodes for an enzyme that is part of the base excision pathway, which is responsible for excising an adenine that was inserted into the DNA to pair with the oxidation base lesion, 8-Oxoguanine (PMID: 21235684). Germline MUTYH mutations have been linked to an increased risk for colorectal cancer development (PMID: 29147111), and have been associated with an elevated risk for breast cancer (PMID: 21952991).

ZFHX3, zinc finger homeobox 3, encodes a transcription factor that functions as a tumor suppressor by transactivating CDKN1A and repressing AFP (PMID: 29126922, PMID: 20599712). ZFHX3 mutations and loss of heterozygosity have been identified in gastric (PMID: 17671116), prostate (PMID: 15750593), and endometrial cancer (PMID: 26330387).

NUFIP2, nuclear FMR1 interacting protein 2, is an RNA-binding protein that interacts with FMRP of the mRNP complex, potentially playing a role in nervous system development and cognitive function (PMID: 12837692). Deletion of a chromosomal region encompassing NUFIP2 gene has been identified in a Neurofibromatosis type 1 patient (PMID: 18648396).

AKT2, RAC-beta serine/threonine-protein kinase, regulates a number of cell functions, including proliferation, survival, growth, angiogenesis, and metabolism through PI3K signaling (PMID: 28557977). Amplification and overexpression of Akt2 has been identified in a variety of solid tumor types (PMID: 7657393, PMID: 29199386, PMID: 29374601) and is downregulated by several micro-RNAs to inhibit cell migration and invasion (PMID: 28586057, PMID: 28548936, PMID: 28534950).

SCGB1A1, secretoglobin family 1A member 1, is a small secreted protein that has putative anti-inflammatory role (PMID: 21385388, PMID: 24461757). Decreased SCGB1A1 expression has been associated with lung cancer (PMID: 11193761).

SETD7, histone-lysine N-methyltransferase SETD7, is a histone methyltransferase that regulates chromatin structure to activate and repress gene expression (PMID: 27046831). Setd7 influences a broad variety of targets and pathways with ties to cancer including p53, ER, YAP (PMID: 25136132, PMID: 27046831), and breast cancer (PMID: 26779630).

GRIN2B, glutamate ionotropic receptor NMDA type subunit 2B, is a subunit of the NMDA receptor ion channel that is critical for neuronal development (PMID: 27818011), and may contribute to tumor cell survival (PMID: 22291485). GRIN2B mutations have been identified in urothelial carcinoma (PMID: 31192134), and GRIN2B promoter hypermethylation has been identified in gastric (PMID: 18158559), breast (PMID: 21120523), lung cancer (PMID: 21494759), and diffuse large B-cell lymphoma (PMID: 18288132).

PAXIP1, PAX-interacting protein 1, is a DNA repair protein that plays a role in the cellular response to DNA double strand breaks (PMID: 28475402, PMID: 27196765). PAXIP1 overexpression has been observed in Brca1 mutated breast cancer (PMID: 28475402).

CBLC, E3 ubiquitin-protein ligase CBL-C, is an ubiquitin ligase that targets activated receptor kinases for degradation (PMID: 10362357). Overexpression of Cblc has been observed in non-small cell lung cancer (PMID:  29945960), mutations have been identified in myeloproliferative neoplasms (PMID: 22315494), and Cblc may modulate response to PARP inhibitors (PMID: 25883215).

BACH1, BTB and CNC homology 1, is a member of the CNC-bZip family of transcription factors that regulates heme degradation and oxidative stress responses (PMID: 21555518). BACH1 over expression has been shown to promote breast cancer cell migration and metastasis (PMID: 27108804).

IFIT1B, interferon-induced protein with tetratricopeptide repeats 1B, is a member of the IRF-inducible gene family that may play a role in the immune defense against RNA viruses (PMID: 27240734). Loss of Ifit1b, in conjunction with loss of Ifit1, Ifit2, and Ifit3, has been associated with resistance to Yervoy (ipilimumab) in a melanoma patient (PMID: 27667683).

PAPSS1, 3'-phosphoadenosine 5'-phosphosulfate synthase 1, encodes PAPS synthase 1, which is necessary for sulfate reactions in eukaryotes (PMID: 22451673). PAPSS1-BRAF was identified in melanoma (PMID: 24345920).

CDH3, cadherin-3, is also known as placental-cadherin, P-cadherin, (PMID: 29142905) is a cell adhesion molecule that may play a role in cell growth and differentiation (PMID: 27399126). Overexpression of Cdh3 has been observed in a variety of solid tumor types, including colorectal, esophageal, pancreatic, bladder, prostate, melanoma, breast cancer (PMID: 29142905) and may correlate with decreased survival in endometrial cancer (PMID: 15051772).

KTN1, kinectin 1, is a kinesin-binding protein involved in intercellular organelle motility (PMID: 10913441). KTN1 fusions have been identified in a CNS tumor and papillary thyroid carcinoma (PMID: 25795305, PMID: 10850414).

DYNC1I2, dynein cytoplasmic 1 intermediate chain 2, is a non-catalytic member of the dynein intermediate chain family, and is involved in transport of organelles and vesicles (UniProt.org). A DYNC1I2 fusion with BRAF has been observed in cutaneous melanoma spitzoid (PMID: 26314551).

PCNA, proliferating cell nuclear antigen, plays an important role in diverse cellular functions, including DNA replication, repair, regulation of cell cycle, chromatin assembly, and transcription, and undergoes post-translational modifications and interacts with multiple proteins (PMID: 24655521, PMID: 19442257, PMID: 9038370). Overexpression of Pcna has been demonstrated in prostate adenocarcinoma (PMID: 21031434), and is associated with reduced survival in colorectal cancer (PMID: 8095852).

CD8B, T-cell surface glycoprotein CD8 beta chain, is a subunit of the CD8 complex, which forms a coreceptor with major histocompatibility complex class I (MHCI) molecules for antigen detection (PMID: 21677135, PMID: 24675400). Expression of Cd8b is a marker for T-cell activation and levels detected on tumor-infiltrating T-cells is often used to predict favorable response to immunotherapy (PMID: 30323667, PMID: 30387832, PMID: 30120041).

B2M, beta-2-microglobulin, forms the light chain of the class I major histocompatibility complex (MHC) (PMID: 3312414) and is required for antigen presentation during the immune response (PMID: 27433843). B2M loss of function mutations have been associated with mismatch repair (MMR) deficiency in colon cancer (PMID: 28616688) and with acquired resistance to immune checkpoint inhibitors in melanoma (PMID: 27433843, PMID: 30466478).

ETV1, ETS variant transcription factor 1, encodes a member of the ETS family of transcription factors, which plays a role in multiple cellular processes including cell growth, migration, differentiation, and angiogenesis (PMID: 21298110, PMID: 30629294). ETV1 fusions have been observed in prostate cancer, Ewing's sarcoma (PMID: 17390040, PMID: 10523827), and glioma (PMID: 31381204), and ETV1 overexpression has been reported in Ewing sarcoma, prostate cancer, and gastrointestinal stromal tumors (PMID: 31381204).

SDC1, syndecan 1, encodes CD138 and is a member of the syndecan family of heparan sulfate proteoglycans that interacts with several other molecules including cell matrix components, growth factors, and adhesion molecules, and plays a role in cell adhesion, cell signaling, and epithelial-to-mesenchymal transition (PMID: 26420915, PMID: 31810587). Altered SDC1 expression has been observed in several tumor types (PMID: 26420915, PMID: 31810587), including high SDC1 expression in breast cancer (PMID: 29666962), and gallbladder cancer (PMID: 18544939), and decreased SDC1 expression in colorectal cancer (PMID: 31182980).

CDK2, cyclin dependent kinase 2, a member of the family of serine/threonine kinases that is activated by cyclin E in the later stage of G1 and plays a role in the DNA damage pathway (PMID: 19445729). Overexpression of CDK2 has been observed in oral cancer (PMID: 11267947).

PIP4K2C, phosphatidylinositol-5-phosphate 4-kinase type 2 gamma, may play a role in regulation of cellular polyphosphoinositide levels and has been associated with vesicular structures in the brain and kidney (PMID: 19757494, PMID: 18753295). Decreased expression of Pip4k2c has been observed in acute myeloid leukemia patients with more favorable outcomes (PMID: 31109595).
