MYRIP, myosin VIIA and Rab interacting protein, is a type of Rab27a binding protein, which is responsible for regulating membrane trafficking, particularly in the process of exocytosis (PMID: 15927964). A MYRIP fusion with BRAF has been identified in pancreatic carcinoma (PMID: 26314551).

TAF15, TATA-box binding protein associated factor 15, is a FET family member that plays a role in cell proliferation and stress response (PMID: 18620564, PMID: 23128393). TAF15-NR4A3 fusions are associated with extraskeletal myxoid chondrosarcoma (PMID: 24746215), and TAF15-ZNF384 fusions are recurrent in acute lymphoblastic leukemia (PMID: 12359745, PMID: 27139620).

UBR5, ubiquitin protein ligase E3 component n-recognin 5, is a key regulator of the ubiquitin-proteasome system, thus plays a role in diverse biological processes including development and turmorigenesis (PMID: 26464214). Amplification of UBR5 has been reported in breast and ovarian cancer, and UBR5 mutations are frequently identified in mantle cell lymphoma (PMID: 26464214).

DPYD, dihydropyrimidine dehydrogenase, is a rate-limiting enzyme involved in catabolism of pyrimidines, including uracil (PMID: 9830621, PMID: 26804652, PMID: 24648345). DPYD deficiency, including inactivating mutations, has been associated with increased risk of toxicity with fluoropyrimidine chemotherapy treatments, such as 5-fluorouracil (PMID: 9830621, PMID: 28481884, PMID: 24648345, PMID: 26804652, PMID: 14635116).

EPHB4, EPH receptor B4, encodes for a a receptor tyrosine kinase, which upon ligand binding can result in bidirectional signaling between cells (PMID: 12094214). Amplification and aberrant expression of EPHB4 has been demonstrated in several tumor types including breast cancer and lung cancer, and is associated with cancer cell survival (PMID: 16816380, PMID: 26073592).

POLI, DNA polymerase iota, is an error-prone Y family DNA polymerase, which is involved in translesion DNA synthesis (PMID: 23922701, PMID: 23955086, PMID: 28865289). Overexpression of POLI may promote cell migration and invasion in breast cancer (PMID: 30829610), lung cancer (PMID: 30060029), and esophageal squamous cell carcinoma (PMID: 28905458).

MAP3K14, mitogen-activated protein kinase kinase kinase 14, encodes for a serine/threonine protein kinase that activates the NF-kappaB pathway, and plays a large role in immune regulation (PMID: 20685151, PMID: 22718757). MAP3K14 amplification has been identified in Hodgkin lymphoma, multiple myeloma, and splenic marginal zone lymphoma (PMID: 22469134).

CBFA2T3, CBFA2/RUNX1 partner transcriptional co-repressor 3, is a member of the ETO family of proteins and a transcriptional repressor that mediates interaction with other corepressors, transcription factors and chromatin-modifying enzymes, and plays a role in cellular proliferation and differentiation (PMID: 15203199, PMID: 16407974). Fusions with CBFA2T3 have been identified in acute erythroid leukemia (PMID: 23032695), and acute myeloid leukemia (PMID: 30592296).

HIP1, huntingtin interacting protein 1, is an endocytic protein that regulates protein trafficking (PMD: 15059611). Fusions with HIP1 are transforming and HIP1 over expression has been associated with several tumor types including breast, lung, colon, prostate, and ovarian (PMID: 15059611).

PRDM14, PR/SET domain 14, is a transcription factor required for the maintenance of embryonic stem cell identity and the reacquisition of pluripotency in somatic cells (PMID: 20953172, PMID: 31741141, PMID: 31130394). Overexpression and amplification of PRDM14 is associated with various tumor types (PMID: 23690269; PMID: 17942894; PMID: 24249158), including poor prognosis in colorectal cancer patients (PMID: 31741141).

AGO1, protein argonaute-1, regulates RNA silencing in the cell cytoplasm and interacts with RNA polymerases to affect gene expression. Increased expression of AGO1 has been identified in multiple cancer cell lines (PMID:16289642, PMID: 24086155).

PJA2, praja ring finger ubiquitin ligase 2, is an E3 ubiquitin ligase that plays a role in regulation of PKA signaling and gene expression (PMID: 30021253, PMID: 24083380). PJA2 overexpression has been observed in papillary thyroid cancer (PMID: 22948757), and a fusion of PJA2 and BRAF has been identified in lung cancer (PMID: 30831205).

RUNX1T1, RUNX1 translocation partner 1, encodes for a transcription factor in the RUNX1 family, which plays a role in the proliferation and differentiation of hematopoietic cells (PMID: 24586690). RUNX1T1 fusions with RUNX1 (also referred to as RUNX1-ETO) have been associated with acute myeloid leukemia (PMID: 21499216, PMID: 30050054).

CHEK2, checkpoint kinase 2, is a serine-threonine protein kinase and a putative tumor suppressor (PMID: 30562755) required for checkpoint-mediated cell cycle arrest and activation of DNA repair and apoptosis in response to DNA damage (PMID: 28553140). CHEK2 alterations are associated with predisposition to certain human cancers, including breast, prostate, kidney, and colon (PMID: 24880342; PMID: 24713400, PMID: 28553140).

IL6, interleukin 6, is a cytokine that activates Stat3 signaling and is involved in immune response (PMID: 28749573). IL-6 level has been associated with tumor status, treatment response, and survival in cancer patients (PMID: 28749573).

SYN2, synapsin II, is a member of the synapsin family of synaptic vesicle proteins with potential functions in neuronal growth and maturation and synaptic transmission (PMID: 23443540, PMID: 20438797).

MYCN, MYCN proto-oncogene, bHLH transcription factor, is a transcription factor that plays a role in cell cycle progression, apoptosis, and cellular transformation (PMID: 25038584). MYCN amplification is commonly associated with neuroblastoma (PMID: 31685267, PMID: 31615807, PMID: 31501192) and has been identified in spinal ependymal tumors (PMID: 31414211).

NPM1, nucleophosmin, is a phosphoprotein that shuttles between the nucleus and cytoplasm, and is involved in several cellular processes including ribosomal processing and export, chromatin remodeling, DNA replication and repair, and cell cycle control (PMID: 29157973, PMID: 23436734). NPM1 is frequently mutated in acute myeloid leukemia (PMID: 29157973, PMID: 23436734, PMID: 30122998, PMID: 29785446).

IL10, interleukin 10, encodes for an anti-inflammatory cytokine that is involved in the regulation of the immune response (PMID: 18424693). IL10 expression has been linked to immune protection in cancer (PMID: 24076584).

MAML2, mastermind like transcriptional coactivator 2, encodes for a member of the Mastermind-like gene family and acts as a transcriptional co-activator for Notch receptors (PMID: 12370315). A fusion with CRTC1 and MAML2 has been found in mucoepidermoid carcinoma (PMID: 26503699) and a fusion with CXCR4 and MAML2 has been identified in chronic lymphocytic leukemia (PMID: 24855209).

DCUN1D1, defective in cullin neddylation 1 domain containing 1, encodes a component of the E3 ubiquitin ligase complex, which binds to Ubc12 and cullin, thereby resulting in increased neddylation activity and subsequent assembly of the cullin-RING ligase complexes (PMID: 18826954, PMID: 21247897). DCUN1D1 overexpression has been identified in solid tumors including squamous cell carcinoma (PMID: 15657565), prostate cancer (PMID: 29077169), and non-small cell lung carcinoma (PMID: 22500162).

EPHB6, EPH receptor B6, is a kinase-inactive member of the Eph receptor tyrosine kinase family that regulates cell adhesion and migration (PMID: 15955811). Downregulation of EphB6 is associated with metastasis and invasive behavior in several tumor types (PMID: 25239188), including gastric cancer (PMID: 28453458) and colon cancer (PMID: 28262839).

TSHR, thyroid stimulating hormone receptor, is the receptor for thyrotropin, which acts to promote thyroid cell proliferation and function (PMID: 21511239, PMID: 25333622). TSHR mutations are frequently observed in thyroid cancer (PMID: 21511239, PMID: 25333622) and have also been observed in hepatocellular carcinoma (PMID: 29715101).

UBC, ubiquitin C,  is a stress-responsive polyubiquitin that contributes to cellular ubiquitin pools, and plays a role in liver development and cell proliferation (PMID: 23669039, PMID: 17491588). UBC has been demonstrated to be overexpressed in renal cancer (PMID: 1660345).

CREBBP, CREB-binding protein, is an acetyltransferase (PMID: 30181244) that plays a key role in transcription regulation for a number of different genes involved in a variety of cellular processes including proliferation, differentiation, apoptosis, and DNA repair (PMID: 27380996, PMID: 20435671). Expression, mutations and chromosomal translocations of CREBBP have been associated with various human cancers (PMID: 23839013; PMID: 21390130; PMID: 23022987; PMID: 9290955), including glioblastoma, leukemia (PMID: 21390130, PMID: 21390126, PMID: 25423036), and small cell lung cancer (PMID: 30181244).

CCNB2, G2/mitotic-specific cyclin-B2, is a cell-cycle protein that controls transition of G2 to M phase (PMID: 26349989). CCNB2 overexpression has been observed in certain subtypes of epithelial ovarian cancer (PMID: 29967001), hepatocellular carcinoma (PMID: 29435009), NSCLC (PMID: 26349989, PMID: 24375198), and bladder cancer (PMID: 26706119).

CIRBP, cold-inducible RNA-binding protein, plays a protective role in the genotoxic stress response by stabilizing transcripts of genes involved in cell survival and may play a role in DNA double strand break repair (PMID: 29432179). Overexpression of Cirbp has been implicated in human cancers (PMID: 19277990; PMID: 12819390) and observed in bladder cancer (PMID: 30315244).

HNRNPA2B1, heterogeneous nuclear ribonucleoprotein A2/B1, is an RNA-binding protein that is involved in pre-mRNA processing (PMID: 26321680). HNRNPA2B1 overexpression is frequently found in lung cancer (PMID: 25483567, PMID: 19414390) and fusions with ETV1 (PMID: 17671502) and NTRK3 (PMID: 29920189) have also been observed.

SEC31A, SEC31 homolog A, COPII coat complex component, assists with the transport of proteins from the endoplasmic reticulum to the golgi complex (PMID: 25715771). SEC31A fusions with ALK and JAK2 have been identified in lung adenocarcinoma and lymphomas (PMID: 25715771, PMID: 21325169).

MYO5A, unconventional myosin-Va, functions as an actin-based motor to transport molecules to the plasma membrane (PMID: 23176491) and plays a role in malignant transformation in melanoma (PMID: 23652798). MYO5A fusions with ROS1 and NTRK3 have been observed in Spitz naevi and spitzoid melanomas (PMID: 24445538, PMID: 27477320, PMID: 28433076) and overexpression of Myo5a has been reported in melanoma (PMID: 23652798).

CD70, CD70 antigen, is a cytokine and member of the tumor necrosis factor family that is expressed on activated T cells and B cells (PMID: 29088768). Overexpression of CD70 has been observed in non-small cell lung cancer (PMID: 29088768), HNSCC (PMID: 29496042), and glioblastoma (PMID: 28651374).

THRB, thyroid hormone receptor beta, is a nuclear receptor that functions as a transcription factor to mediate thyroid hormone signaling, and plays a role in several biological processes including regulation of basal metabolism and growth (PMID: 20051527, PMID: 11427693). THRB mutations have been demonstrated in various tumor types, including hepatorcellular carcinoma (PMID: 22507269).

HACL1, 2-hydroxyacyl-CoA lyase 1, is a peroxisomal enzyme that plays an important role in fatty acid metabolism (PMID: 17956236). HACL1 fusion to RAF1 has been identified in pancreatic cancers (PMID: 25266736).

MAP3K1, mitogen-activated protein kinase kinase kinase 1, is a E3 ubiquitin protein ligase and serine/threonine kinase that regulates JNK and ERK signaling and the full length Map3k1 protein functions in cell migration and cell survival, while the caspase-cleaved C-terminal Map3k1 fragment acts to promote apoptosis (PMID: 24386504). MAP3K1 mutations have been identified in breast cancer (PMID: 31620934, PMID: 31552290, PMID: 29765551).

TNFRSF12A, tumor necrosis factor receptor superfamily member 12A, is a membrane receptor for Tnfsf12, which regulates diverse cellular functions including proliferation, differentiation, and inflammation (PMID: 28639899). TNFRSF12A expression level has been associated with prognosis of breast, gastric, lung, and liver cancers (PMID: 28639899).

PDE10A, phosphodiesterase 10A, is a cyclic nucleotide phosphodiesterase that regulates cAMP and cGMP signaling (PMID: 10373451). PDE10A has been demonstrated to regulate tumor cell growth in culture (PMID: 26713600, PMID: 24704829).
MSI, Microsatellite Instability

LYPD3 (C4.4A), Ly6/PLAUR domain-containing protein 3, is a glycoprotein that may play a role in cell adhesion (PMID: 25302166) and has limited expression in healthy tissues (PMID: 29048672). Overexpression of LYPD3 has been observed in a number of solid tumors including, hepatocellular (PMID: 29048672), gastric cancer (PMID: 24935570), and non-small cell lung cancer (PMID: 25302166).

SEPTIN7, septin 7, is a member of the septin family of GTP-binding proteins, plays a role in vesicle transport, and is an essential component of septin filaments (PMID: 28224124, PMID: 25690008, PMID: 21824007). SEPT7 down-regulation has been observed in central nervous system tumors (PMID: 15915442), and a fusion of SEPT7 and BRAF has been identified in infantile fibrosarcoma (PMID: 28877062).

TLE4, transducin-like enhancer protein 4, is a co-repressor that belongs to the Groucho (Gro)/TLE protein family (PMID: 26701208) and may play a role in hematopoiesis and bone development (PMID: 25153823). Overexpression of Tle4 has been observed in colorectal cancer (PMID: 26701208), while decreased expression has been reported in acute myeloid leukemia (PMID: 18258796, PMID: 27636548), and a fusion, TLE4-NTRK2, is associated with ganglioglioma (PMID: 29502353).

CDH2, cadherin 2, encodes N-Cadherin, an extracellular matrix protein that plays a significant role in cell migration and invasion, especially during embryonic development (PMID: 15349821). CDH2 has been shown to be either upregulated or overexpressed in a variety of cancer types including, but not limited to melanoma, and, downregulation of CDH2 has been observed in neuroblastoma (PMID: 24442140).

AKT3, AKT serine/threonine kinase 3, is a serine-threonine protein kinase, which regulates cell proliferation and survival through PI3K signaling (PMID: 18955974). AKT3 mutations have been identified in melanoma (PMID: 18813315).

CTLA4 (CD152), cytotoxic T-lymphocyte-associated protein 4, is a negative regulator of T-cell activation (PMID: 27249753) that is constitutively expressed on Tregs and upregulated upon T-cell receptor (TCR) signaling to compete with the co-stimulatory molecule, CD28, for binding to CD80 and CD86 (PMID: 30565239, PMID: 28102259). CTLA4 germline mutations in CTLA4 insufficiency may increase lymphoma and gastric cancer risk (PMID: 30250467) and immune checkpoint inhibitor blockade of CTLA4 is an important component of anti-tumor immunotherapies (PMID: 23748107, PMID: 26325034).

THADA, THADA, armadillo repeat containing, is a gene frequently rearranged in thyroid adenomas and may encode a death receptor-interacting protein (PMID: 12955091). THADA fusions are identified as driver mutations in thyroid cancer (PMID: 28193878).

MDM2, MDM2 proto-oncogene, is an E3 ubiquitin protein ligase that mediates Tp53 degradation and therefore, regulates apoptosis and cell-cycle (PMID: 27993876). Dysregulation of MDM2 has been identified in several cancer types (PMID: 23303139) and amplification is common in liposarcoma (PMID: 30237864).

CDK10, cyclin-dependent kinase 10, binds Cyclin M (encoded by FAM58A) to regulate the transcription factor, ETS2 (PMID: 24218572), and functions in organization of the actin cytoskeleton and ciliogenesis (PMID: 27104747, PMID: 28178678). Decreased expression of Ckd10 has been observed and gastric cancer (PMID: 29512714, PMID: 28928881) and reported in endocrine therapy resistant breast cancer (PMID: 18242510).

GRM3, glutamate receptor, metabotropic 3, is a Group II G-coupled glutamate receptor that functions in regulation of glutamatergic signaling (PMID: 16417579, PMID: 22564439). Mutations in GRM3 are associated with melanoma (PMID: 21946352).

ABRAXAS1 (FAM175A), abraxas 1, BRCA1 A complex subunit, is a BRCA1-binding protein that plays a role in DNA repair and regulation of the G2/M cell cycle phase checkpoint (PMID: 17525340, PMID: 29497033). ABRAXAS1 variants have been identified in several breast cancer pedigrees (PMID: 22357538) and contribute to a small proportion of unexplained hereditary breast cancer cases (PMID: 27270457).

MS4A1, membrane spanning 4-domains A1, is a cell surface marker for mature B-cells that potentially regulates B-cell activation and growth (PMID: 11225995). MS4A1 is expressed in B-cell originated tumors and is a therapeutic target (PMID: 6609729, PMID: 19687518).

HOXA10, homeobox protein Hox-A10, is a transcription factor that plays a role in the regulation of testicular descent (PMID: 27108669) and in uterus development during embryogenesis (PMID: 26865543). Decreased expression of Hoxa10 has been observed in prostate cancer (PMID: 30614022) and in testicular cancer (PMID: 30581773), while overexpression has been reported in endometrial cancer, HNSCC (PMID: 30581773), and coloreactal cancer (PMID: 29870276).

TP63, tumor protein p63, is a p53 family transcription factor, which is involved in regulating cell cycle arrest and apoptosis, suppression of metastasis in cancer, and is overexpressed in several tumor types (PMID: 21760596, PMID: 24488880). TP63 is expressed as multiple isoforms, including some with opposing activities (PMID: 21760596, PMID: 24488880).

ZMYM2, zinc finger MYM-type containing 2, (also referred to as ZNF198) is a member of the MYM-type zinc finger protein family and may play a role in transcriptional regulation (PMID: 18806873, PMID: 26283374). ZMYM2-FGFR1 fusions are associated with 8p11 translocations in myeloproliferative neoplasms (PMID: 20226962, PMID: 22875613).

EPHB1, EPH receptor B1, is a receptor tyrosine kinase that is involved in diverse biological processes including adhesion, migration, and survival (PMID: 26790531). Aberrant Ephb1 expression has been reported in brain tumors (PMID: 28194092).

MST1R, macrophage stimulating 1 receptor, encodes the receptor tyrosine kinase RON, which acts as a receptor for macrophage-stimulating protein and is involved in cell migration and differentiation (PMID: 21543897, PMID: 23792360). Alterations in MST1R are associated with several tumor types (PMID: 23792360) and overexpression has been correlated with pancreatic cancer progression (PMID: 30967626).

FGF5, fibroblast growth factor 5, is a member of the fibroblast growth factor family that regulate growth and development, particularly hair growth (PMID: 18058912). Fgf5 overexpression has been identified in breast cancer (PMID: 29804124), pancreatic cancer (PMID: 9333017), and bone metastasis of solid tumors (PMID: 22120474).

MAPK3, mitogen-activated protein kinase 3, is a serine/threonine kinase involved in the MAPK pathway, thus, playing a role in cellular processes including proliferation, survival, migration, differentiation, and transcription (PMID: 22569528). A few MAPK3 mutations have been demonstrated to confer resistance to ERK inhibitors in vitro (PMID: 25320010).

MLANA, melan-A, is a transmembrane tumor antigen (PMID: 27143649) that plays a role in melanosome biogenesis and pigementation through regulation of PMEL (PMID: 15695812). Expression of Mlana is often used as a biomarker for melanoma (PMID: 30632191, PMID: 30626524) and is also a target for melanoma tumor vaccines (PMID: 30520800).

BRCA2, breast cancer type 2 susceptibility protein, is a tumor suppressor involved in the homologous recombination pathway for double-strand DNA repair, thereby playing a role in genome stability (PMID: 27530658). BRCA2 germline mutations increase the risk of developing ovarian and/or breast cancer (PMID: 23364291) and somatic mutations are highest in colon, NSCLC, and ovarian cancers (PMID: 27283171).

SUV39H1, suppressor of variegation 3-9 homolog 1, regulates transcription through chromatin modification and plays a role in cell cycle and differentiation (PMID: 12723694, PMID: 28106510). Dysregulated SUV39H1 expression has been associated with genomic instability in chronic lymphocytic leukemia (PMID: 28833505).
ZNF700, zinc finger protein 700, is a zinc-finger protein with unknown biological function (PMID: 25875936). A fusion of ZNF700 and MAST1 has been identified in breast cancer (PMID: 22101766).

CSMD3, CUB and Sushi multiple domains 3, is a member of the CSMD family and acts as a tumor suppressor (PMID: 12906867). Mutations in Csmd3 have been linked to colorectal (PMID: 21351276, PMID: 29575536) and prostate cancer (PMID:19528667) and CSMD3 amplification has been observed in prostate adenocarcinoma (PMID: 30720096).

USP38, ubiquitin specific peptidase 38, is a deubiquitinases that negatively regulates type I Interferon signaling (PMID: 27692986). USP38 is associated with breast cancer development (PMID: 22961600).

ELF1, E74 like ETS transcription factor 1, plays a role in the regulation of angiogenesis and hematopoiesis, including the development of natural killer T cells (PMID: 26643049) and blood vessels (PMID: 11157678), and demonstrates an antiviral role upon interferon stimulation (PMID: 31682641). Variable expression of ELF1 has been observed in a variety of tumor types, including decreased expression in prostate cancer (PMID: 30603056) and Hodgkin lymphoma (PMID: 30681722), and over expression in endometrial carcinoma (PMID: 12798703).

ROPN1, ropporin-1A, is an AKAP (A-kinase anchor protein) interacting protein that functions in male fertility (PMID: 20705794) and sperm moltility (PMID: 29247344). Abnormal expression of Ropn1 on plasma cells has been commonly observed in multiple myeloma, suggesting Ropn1 is a cancer/testis antigen (PMID: 21654522).

NR0B2, nuclear receptor subfamily 0 group B member 2, encodes for a nuclear receptor that plays a significant role in regulating metabolic pathways and demonstrates functionality related to transcriptional corepression (PMID: 27540300). Loss of NR0B2 has been shown to be associated with development of hepatocellular carcinoma (PMID: 26504773).

MYH11, myosin heavy chain 11, smooth muscle, encodes for the myosin heavy chain protein that plays a role in the contractility of smooth muscle (PMID: 21937134). MYH11 fusions with CBFB have been frequently found in acute myleoid leukemia (PMID: 14736823, PMID: 31353165) and frameshift mutations have been observed in gastric and colorectal cancers (PMID: 29517504).

GPR161, G protein-coupled receptor 161, is a member of the class A rhodopsin family that regulates sonic hedgehog (Shh) signaling and plays a role in development (PMID: 24599592, PMID: 29438014). Overexpression of Gpr161 has been observed to promote cell proliferation and migration in breast cancer (PMID: 24599592).

SSTR1, somatostatin receptor 1, is a member of the somatostatin family of G protein-coupled receptors that regulates endocrine and exocrine secretions (PMID: 16625838). Aberrant Sstr1 expression has been identified in a variety of tumors including prostate cancer and hepatocellular carcinoma (PMID: 28905400, PMID: 24634938).

NTRK3 (TRKC), neurotrophic receptor tyrosine kinase 3, is a membrane receptor tyrosine kinase that binds neurotrophins, initiating signaling cascades that lead to cell growth and differentiation. NTRK3 has been described as a dependence receptor that induces apoptosis when ligand-free and so may be a tumor suppressor or oncogene, depending on context (PMID: 23396845), and ETV6-NTRK3 fusions are commonly observed in secretory breast carcinomas and spindle cell tumors of the kidney (PMID: 31075511).

PPARG, peroxisome proliferator-activated receptor gamma, is a transcription factor and member of the proliferator-activated receptor family of nuclear receptors and regulates adipocyte differentiation and glucose homeostasis (PMID: 9209705, PMID: 30651555). PPARG fusions are frequently observed with PAX8 in follicular thyroid carcinoma (PMID: 25069464) and missense mutations and amplification have been reported in luminal bladder cancer (PMID: 30651555).

ID4, inhibitor of DNA binding 4, HLH protein, is a member of the Id family of helix-loop-helix (HLH) proteins, which bind other HLH family members to negatively regulate their activity (PMID: 25248477, PMID: 16034366, PMID: 28143562). Dysregulation of Id4 expression is associated with several tumor types including glioblastoma (PMID: 20842217), prostate cancer (PMID: 28252832), and the basal-like subtype of breast cancer (PMID: 28652379).

PATZ1, POZ/BTB and AT hook containing zinc finger 1, encodes a transcription factor that can act as either an activator or repressor and is linked to P53 regulation (PMID: 24336083). PATZ1 over expression has been associated with a number of cancer types (PMID: 18401526, PMID: 18241078).

CIT, citron rho-interacting serine/threonine kinase, is an effector of Rho signaling (PMID: 27503289) and functions in cell division during cytokinesis (PMID: 29069760) and plays a role in the development of the nervous system (PMID: 27519304). Overexpression of Cit has been observed in colon cancer (PMID: 29069760) and a FGFR2 - CIT fusion has been identified in lung adenocarcinoma (PMID: 23558953).
NOTCH2 is a transmembrane receptor, which plays a role in cell fate determination and differentiation, and can be an oncogene or tumor suppressor depending on the tumor type (PMID: 22891276).

VEGFA, vascular endothelial growth factor A, is a growth factor, which binds Vegf receptors to promote cell proliferation and angiogenesis. Vegfa may stimulate tumor angiogenesis in several tumor types (PMID: 23216836).

TSC2, TSC complex subunit 2, forms a complex with Tsc1 and inhibits mTOR pathway signaling, thus regulating cell growth and metabolism (PMID: 27226234). Germline TSC2 inactivating mutations cause tuberous sclerosis complex and somatic TSC2 mutations have been identified in various cancers, including renal cell carcinoma, sarcoma, and breast cancer (PMID: 27226234, PMID: 30303819, PMID: 28860410, PMID: 28027327).

MAP2K1 (MEK1), mitogen-activated protein kinase kinase 1, is a serine-threonine kinase, which activates that RAS-RAF-MEK-ERK pathway in cell proliferation and differentiation (PMID: 22753777). MAP2K1 (MEK1) activating mutations have been identified in a number of solid tumor types including, melanoma (PMID: 29753091), colorectal (PMID: 28819429), lung adenocarcinoma (PMID: 25351745), histiocytic sarcoma (PMID: 29768143), and Map2k1 mutations are often associated with resistance to Mek and Raf inhibition (PMID: 29753091).

SHOC2, leucine-rich repeat protein SHOC-2, is a scaffold protein that forms a complex with protein phosphatase 1 (PP1c) to activate Raf1 kinase and subsequent ERK1/2 signaling (PMID: 27574535, PMID: 26876614). Preclinical studies have implicated Shoc2 in tumorgenesis through accelerated activation of ERK1/2 kinase (PMID: 27574535).

RPS6, ribosomal protein S6, encodes for a member of the S6K substrate family, which upon phosphorylation plays a role in controlling cell size, cell proliferation, and maintaining glucose levels (PMID: 16679021). Increased phosphorylation of Rps6 has been observed in a variety of tumor types, including pancreatic cancer, non-small cell lung carcinoma, and renal cell carcinoma (PMID: 23361300, PMID: 26490682, PMID: 26506236).

SNCAIP, synuclein alpha interacting protein, encodes Synphilin 1, and is involved in formation of protein inclusions and in degradation of alpha-synuclein (PMID: 15322916, PMID: 21103907, PMID: 23212369). SNCAIP tandem duplication and increased SNCAIP expression have been identified in medulloblastoma (PMID: 22832581).

SHQ1, SHQ1, H/ACA ribonucleoprotein assembly factor, functions in the assembly of H/ACA ribonucleoproteins and plays a role in RNA splicing (PMID: 30323192, PMID: 19383767, PMID: 25553844). SHQ1 overexpression has been demonstrated in T-cell acute lymphoblastic leukemia (PMID: 30323192), and amplification of SHQ1 has been observed in prostate cancer (PMID: 27328849).

SMARCD1, SWI/SNF related, matrix associated, actin dependent regulator of chromatin, subfamily d, member 1, encodes a component of the SWI/SNF complex that facilitates chromatin remodeling by interacting with the glucocorticoid receptor and mediates antitumor activity by directly interacting with Tp53 (PMID: 19234488, PMID: 12917342, PMID: 18303029). SMARCD1 mutations have been identified in breast cancer (PMID: 22722201).

PAX5, paired box protein Pax-5, is a developmental transcription factor, which plays a role in B-cell development. Pax5 fusions and mutations have been implicated in hematological malignancies (PMID: 22127921).

KANK1, KN motif and ankyrin repeat domains 1, is a member of the KANK protein family that plays a role in actin polymerization, microtubule growth, and cell growth, and acts a tumor suppressor in renal cell carcinoma (PMID: 29183992, PMID: 28067315, PMID: 19554261, PMID: 12133830). Decreased expression of KANK1 has been demonstrated in renal cell carcinoma (PMID: 12133830), and a fusion between KANK1 and NTRK3 has been identified in MSI-high colorectal cancer (PMID: 30279230).

KLHL7, kelch-like family member 7, is a component of the E3 ubiquitin ligase complex that regulates protein degradation (PMID: 21828050). A KLHL7 fusion with BRAF has been identified in thyroid carcinoma (PMID: 26314551).

KDR (VEGFR2), vascular endothelial growth factor receptor 2, is an endothelial cell surface receptor tyrosine kinase and member of the vascular endothelial growth factor family of proteins that plays a role in angiogenesis and cell proliferation through activation of RAF-MEK-MAP and PI3K-AKT pathways (PMID: 25568876, PMID: 29093528, PMID: 26578684). KDR amplification and overexpression have been reported in a variety of tumor types (PMID: 21382095, PMID: 27218826, PMID: 25231439, PMID: 20606037) and somatic mutations have been reported in sarcomas and head and neck squamous cell carcinomas (PMID: 22314185, PMID: 11801954).

POLD3, polymerase (DNA-directed), delta 3, accessory subunit, is a subunit of DNA polymerase delta, which mediates DNA replication (PMID: 27320729). POLD3 amplification and mutations are identified in colorectal and breast cancers (PMID: 17384679, PMID: 19706770).

SERPINB3, serpin family B member 3, is a member of the ova-serpin family of protease inhibitors, which plays a role in cell differentiation, programmed cell death, and autoimmune response (PMID: 19332150, PMID: 25984243, PMID: 27668655). Over expression of SERPINB3 is associated with squamous cell carcinomas (PMID: 19332150, PMID: 25984243).

VCL, vinculin, interacts with F-actin and other cytoskeletal proteins and regulates cell adhesion and migration (PMID: 23466368, PMID: 26195589). VCL-ALK fusions have been identified in pediatric renal cell carcinoma and epithelioid cell histiocytoma (PMID: 26773439, PMID: 25413595).

PIM2, Pim-2 proto-oncogene, serine/threonine kinase, is a member of the PIM family serine/threonine kinases that regulates apoptosis and survival (PMID: 23041228). PIM2 overexpression has been identified in lymphomas and chronic lymphocytic leukemia (PMID: 23041228) and is a potential therapeutic target (PMID: 30370255).

MAPKAPK2, MAPK activated protein kinase 2, is a substrate of the p38/MAPK pathway and plays a role in the inflammatory response, and in regulation of cell cycle, cell migration, and transcript stability (PMID: 31023373, PMID: 30850014, PMID: 15629715, PMID: 10559880). Overexpression of Mapkapk2 has been demonstrated in head and neck squamous cell carcinoma (PMID: 31023373).

FGF1, fibroblast growth factor 1, is a member of the heparin-binding growth factor family and plays a role in mitogenesis (PMID: 19561198), but also participates in cell proliferation, survival, growth, and morphogenesis (PMID: 26840910). Increased expression of FGF1 has been observed in prostate and breast cancer while FGF1 amplification and elevated expression has been identified in ovarian cancer (PMID: 20094046).

SHTN1 (KIAA1598), shootin 1, is a gene involved in asymmetrical neuronal growth (PMID: 17030985). SHTN1 (KIAA1598) fusions have been identified in intrahepatic cholangiocarcinoma  and spitzoid neoplasms (PMID: 24563076, PMID: 24445538).

IGLL5, immunoglobulin lambda like polypeptide 5, encodes a protein with an unknown function, but demonstrates homology to IGLL1, which is known to play a role in the development of B-cells (PMID: 30606723, PMID: 17363301). IGLL5 mutations have been identified in multiple myeloma (PMID: 29563506) and B-cell lymphoma (PMID: 30309852).

CTAG1B, cancer/testis antigen 1B, encodes for a cancer testis antigen that is normally expressed on male germ cells and may play a role in the regulation of gene expression (PMID: 15715909, PMID: 22936067). CTAG1B expression has been observed in liposarcomas (PMID: 22936067).

IGHV4-34, immunoglobulin heavy variable 4-34, encodes part of the variable portion of the immunoglobulin heavy chain, which functions in antigen recognition (PMID: 22551722). IGHV4-34 expression is associated with a subtype of hairy cell leukemia (PMID: 22210875), and IGHV4-34 somatic hypermutation has been demonstrated in chronic lymphocytic leukemia (PMID: 28536306)

ETV4, ETS variant transcription factor 4, is an ETS transcription factor that plays a role in cellular proliferation, migration, and differentiation (PMID: 22425584). ETV4 overexpression has been demonstrated in several tumor types, including lung (PMID: 31670855, PMID: 31253395) and pancreatic (PMID: 30460327), and fusions with ETS family members are recurrent in prostate cancer (PMID: 22425584, PMID: 23634237, PMID: 23814484).

PARP6, poly(ADP-ribose) polymerase 6, is an enzyme with limited characterization that catalyzes the transfer of mono-ADP ribosyl groups to its protein targets (PMID: 25043379). Overexpression of Parp6 has been demonstrated in colorectal adenocarcinoma (PMID: 28260087).

CCNB3, G2/mitotic-specific cyclin-B3, is a member of the cyclin family and a regulator of the cell-cycle (PMID: 12185076). Recurrent fusions between CCNB3 and BCOR have been observed in sarcomas (PMID: 22387997, PMID: 29300189, PMID: 28877060, PMID: 28833375).

ACTL6A, actin like 6A, encodes for a subunit of the SWI/SNF complex, which plays a key role in the regulation and maintenance of embryonic and adult stem cells (PMID: 25802002, PMID: 23018638). ACTL6A in a fusion with PIK3CA has been identified in breast cancer and co-amplification of ACTL6A and TP63 has been observed in head and neck squamous cell carcinoma (PMID: 29242214, PMID: 28041841).

NCOR1, nuclear receptor corepressor 1, is a transcriptional co-repressor with diverse binding partners, which functions in differentiation, homeostasis, and metabolism (PMID: 23630073, PMID: 20091860). Overexpression of Ncor1 has been observed in gastric cancer (PMID: 26589942) and a fusion has been reported in undifferentiated pleomorphic sarcoma (PMID: 31467233).

CHD4, chromodomain helicase DNA binding protein 4, is a subunit of the nucleosome remodeling and histone deacetylase (NuRD) complex, acting as a transcriptional regulator as well as promoting DNA double strand break repair (PMID: 23697937, PMID: 23954449). CHD4 mutations have been identified in endometrial cancer (PMID: 29888111), and increased CHD4 expression has been observed in colorectal cancer (PMID: 28486105) and glioblastoma (PMID: 30872624).

STAG3, cohesin subunit SA-3, functions as part of the cohesin complex to regulate spindle formation and sister chromatid association in meiosis (PMID: 24992337, PMID: 24797474). Loss of Stag3 expression has been observed to correlate with loss of sensitivity to BRAF inhibition in melanoma (PMID: 27500726).

ITPR2, inositol 1,4,5-trisphosphate receptor type 2, regulates intracellular Ca2+ release (PMID: 25499268) and plays a role in the cell cycle and proliferation (PMID: 25779662). An in-frame fusion of the ETV6 promoter with the C-terminal portion of Itpr2 has been observed in breast cancer (PMID: 20033038) and overexpression of Itpr2 has been observed in AML (PMID: 25779662).

ANXA1, annexin A1, encodes a phospholipid protein in the annexin family and is involved in multiple biological processes such as proliferation, differentiation, and apoptosis (PMID: 24156336). Decreased expression of ANXA1 has been observed in several tumor types such as prostate and esophageal while increased expression has been seen in others including breast and pancreatic (PMID: 17215481).

PSCA, prostate stem cell antigen, is a cell surface protein with unknown biological function (PMID: 20501618). Over expression of Psca has been identified in prostate, pancreatic, and bladder cancers (PMID: 24308679).

STK3, serine/threonine kinase 3, is a serine/threonine protein kinase activated by caspases to promote DNA fragmentation in apoptosis. Stk3 functions as a tumor suppressor within the HIPPO pathway to regulate cell proliferation and organ size (PMID: 15994916, PMID: 24336504).

CASP6, caspase 6, is a cysteine-aspartic acid protease that plays a key role in the process of programmed cell death (PMID: 28726391). Over expression and decreased expression have been observed in a variety of tumor types (PMID: 28726391), and CASP6 somatic mutations have been identified in gastric and colorectal cancer (PMID: 16948818).

RICTOR, Rapamycin-insensitive companion of mTOR, is a component of the mTORC2 complex, which regulates cell survival and tumorgenesis (PMID:25450580). Amplification and overexpression of Rictor have been identified in a variety of cancers (PMID: 29455662).

FAM131B, family with sequence similarity 131 member B, is a protein of uncharacterized biological function (PMID: 21424530). Fusions between FAM131B and BRAF have been observed in gliomas (PMID: 21424530, PMID: 25040262).

SLIT2, slit guidance ligand 2, is a secreted ligand for ROBO receptors that serves as a repulsive cue during axon guidance and plays a role in angiogenesis (PMID: 10102268, PMID: 24448236, PMID: 21326323). Decreased expression of SLIT2, including through promoter hypermethylation, has been demonstrated in several tumor types including lung and breast cancer (PMID: 12384551), colorectal cancer (PMID: 12615722), pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma (PMID: 24448236), and papillary thyroid carcinoma (PMID: 26935705), and deletion of SLIT2 has been identified in breast cancer (PMID: 27659325).

ROR2, receptor tyrosine kinase-like orphan receptor 2, is a type I transmembrane protein that acts as the receptor for Wnt5a in non-canonical Wnt signaling (PMID: 23233346) and is a tumor associated antigen (PMID: 30450096). Overexpression of ROR2 has been implicated in tumorigenesis in several tumor types (PMID: 23233346), including cervical, pancreatic, lung (PMID: 29395309), renal cell carcinoma, osteosarcoma, breast, and colorectal (PMID: 30450096).

TRIM63, E3 ubiquitin-protein ligase TRIM63, is specifically expressed in cardiac and skeletal muscles where it functions to degrade thick filament proteins (PMID: 22821932). A fusion of TRIM63 with NTRK1 has been observed in melanoma (PMID: 29683819, PMID: 28719467).

CDH23, cadherin related 23, is a cadherin related protein that composes part of the tip links of hair cells and is involved in mechanotransduction (PMID: 28268172, PMID: 20498078). CDH23 over expression has been identified in breast cancer (PMID: 22413011).

PMAIP1, phorbol-12-myristate-13-acetate-induced protein 1, is a member of the Bcl2 family and BH3-only member that plays a role in promoting apoptosis (PMID: 23175245, PMID: 28670929). PMAIP1 altered expression has be observed in multiple myeloma and chronic lymphocytic leukemia (PMID: 28670929).

TRIM16, tripartite motif containing 16, encodes for a member of the TRIM protein family that transcriptionally regulates the retinoic acid receptor beta 2 gene and plays a role in autophagy, indirectly facilitating protein turnover (PMID: 30143514, PMID: 22629402). Decreased expression of TRIM16 has been observed in squamous cell carcinoma (PMID: 22009481) and breast cancer (PMID: 26718507).

HNF4G, hepatocyte nuclear factor 4 gamma, encodes a transcription factor that is a member of the orphan nuclear receptor family and plays a role in regulating genes involved in development and metabolism (PMID: 8995295). A fusion with HNF4G and RSPO2 has been identified in gastric cancer (PMID: 30250044) and over expression of HNF4G has been associated with lung cancer (PMID: 29719587) and bladder cancer (PMID: 23896584).

NKX3-1, NK3 homeobox 1, encodes a transcription factor that acts as a tumor suppressor by suppressing cell growth and differentiation in the prostate epithelium, thereby regulating prostate growth (PMID: 8943214, PMID: 20588175, PMID: 11085535). Decreased expression and loss of NXK3-1 has been associated with prostate cancer (PMID: 11085535, PMID: 18557759).

EHMT2, euchromatic histone-lysine N-methyltransferase 2, is a methyltransferase involved in dimethylation of histone H3 at lysine 9, which is associated with gene repression (PMID: 23466651). Overexpression of Ehmt2 is associated with several tumor types (PMID: 27748874, PMID: 24832370) and with aggressive tumor behavior in melanoma (PMID: 24658378).

RAD35, RAB35, member RAS oncogene family, is a member of the Rab family of GTPases that is localized to the cell membrane and endosomes, and plays a role in several cellular processes including endosome trafficking, endocytosis, phagocytosis, and cell migration (PMID: 29781368, PMID: 27329675). RAB35 expression has been demonstrated in ovarian cancer (PMID: 19623182), and RAB35 mutations have been identified in human cancers (PMID: 26338797).

KDM4D, lysine (K)-specific demethylase 4D, is a Jumonji domain histone demethylase, regulating gene transcription through chromatin remodeling to affect cell growth and differentiation (PMID: 24349617). Kdm4d expression has been linked with resistance to radiotherapy in Hodgkin lymphoma (PMID: 27630312).

EIF4A2, eukaryotic translation initiation factor 4A2, encodes an RNA helicase that is required for initiation of protein translation (PMID: 21427765), and plays a role in microRNA-mediated gene silencing (PMID: 23559250). BCL6-EIF4A2 fusions have been identified in non-Hodgkin's lymphoma (PMID: 10637510), and altered expression of EIF4A2 has been observed in malignant peripheral nerve sheath tumor, vestibular schwannoma (PMID: 26951381), triple-negative breast cancer (PMID: 31308851), and non-small cell lung cancer (PMID: 23867391).

BBC3, BCL2 binding component 3, is also referred to as PUMA and is a member of the BH3-only Bcl2 protein family that promotes both Tp53-dependent and -independent apoptosis through inhibition of antiapoptotic Bcl2 family members (PMID: 19641508, PMID: 14585351). BBC3 overexpression has been identified in hepatocellular carcinoma (PMID: 30712844) and pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma (PMID: 23321162), and decreased BBC3 expression has been identified in colorectal cancer (PMID: 29344228), Burkitts lymphoma, and cutaneous melanoma (PMID: 19641508).

FN1, fibronectin 1, encodes for fibronectin, which is part of the extracellular matrix (PMID: 25319834). Fusion proteins involving FN1 have been reported in various types of cancers (PMID: 25319834, PMID: 22570254).

PAN3, poly(A) specific ribonuclease subunit PAN3, is a regulatory subunit of the poly(A)-nuclease (PAN) deadenylation complex, which removes the poly(A) tail from the 3' end of mRNA to trigger degradation and turnover (PMID: 28559491). A PAN3-NTRK2 fusion has been observed in head and neck squamous cell carcinoma (PMID: 25204415).

PIK3R3, phosphoinositide-3-kinase regulatory subunit 3, is a class 1A PI3K regulatory subunit that plays a role in cell proliferation, differentiation, and migration (PMID: 24837077, PMID: 22722333). PIK3R3 amplification and overexpression has been demonstrated in ovarian cancer (PMID: 17875760), and overexpression has been demonstrated in several additional tumor types, including pancreatic cancer (PMID: 29719293), uveal melanoma (PMID: 30825222), and gastric cancer (PMID: 22876838).

LCK, LCK proto-oncogene, Src family tyrosine kinase, plays a role in T-cell receptor signaling and T-cell development (PMID: 19290918) and is activated upon antigen presentation by MHC (PMID: 30660961). LCK overexpression has been demonstrated in chronic lympocytic leukemia (PMID: 23505068) and promotes proliferation of acute myeloid leukemia cells in culture PMID: 30660961).

ACVR1, activin A receptor type 1, is a bone morphogenic protein (BMP) type 1 receptor involved in numerous signaling pathways including BMP signaling, and plays a critical role in chondrogenesis, osteogenesis, and angiogenesis (PMID: 28780023, PMID: 28232325). ACVR1 mutations are associated with diffuse intrinsic pontine gliomas (PMID: 24705251).

SOX10, SRY-box transcription factor 10, is a member of the SOXE subclass of SOX transcription factors that regulates neural crest and periphery nervous system cells survival, differentiation, and development (PMID: 27552919). SOX10 expression has been identified in melanoma and malignant peripheral nerve sheath tumors (PMID: 18636017).

MCL1, induced myeloid leukemia cell differentiation protein Mcl-1, is a BCL2-family member that functions in inhibition of apoptosis to promote cell survival (PMID: 29061914). MCL1 overexpression and/or amplification has been reported in a variety of tumor types (PMID: 26556430, PMID: 23478333), including NSCLC (PMID: 29567880), cholangiocarcinoma (PMID: 17404574), hepatocellular carcinoma (PMID: 16289418), melanoma (PMID: 17384650), and hematologic malignancies (PMID: 29061914).

NACC2, nucleus accumbens-associated protein 2, functions as a transcriptional repressor, which regulates Tp53, through Mdm2, to decrease cell proliferation (PMID: 22926524). An NACC2 fusion with NTRK2 has been observed in pilocytic astrocytoma (PMID: 23817572).

FBXW7, F-box/WD repeat-containing protein 7, is part of the SCF E3 ubiquitin-protein ligase complex, which plays a role in the degradation of proteins involved in cell division and cell growth (PMID: 17909001, PMID: 22673505). FBXW7 mutations have been associated with cholangiocarcinoma and acute lymphocytic leukemia (PMID: 17909001) and have been identified in many other cancers, including colorectal (PMID: 28424412), endometrial, and stomach cancer (PMID: 17909001).

MAST1, microtubule associated serine/threonine kinase 1, is a serine/threonine kinase that potentially functions as a scaffolding protein and interacts with syntrophin (PMID: 18206861, PMID: 10404183). MAST1 fusions are recurrent in breast cancer (PMID: 22101766).

CCNO, cyclin-O, is a cyclin-like protein (PMID: 30464498) that interacts with CDK2 (PMID: 25364462) and plays a role in ciliogenesis (PMID: 25712475) and apoptosis (PMID: 29245899). Decreased expression of Ccno has been observed in gastric cancer (PMID: 30464498).

ATP1B1, ATPase Na+/K+ transporting subunit beta 1, encodes for a protein that plays a major role in ensuring normal NA+ and K+ gradients across the plasma membrane and manages cell activity (PMID: 26506237). An ATP1B1 - NRG1 fusion has been observed in cholangiocarcinoma (PMID: 28950338) and pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma (PMID: 29802158), and decreased expression of ATP1B1 has been associated with clear cell renal cell carcinoma (PMID: 24452105).

MYC, MYC proto-oncogene, bHLH transcription factor, is a transcription factor that regulates expression of genes involved in cell cycle progression, apoptosis, and cellular transformation (PMID: 25038584). Amplification of MYC is commonly observed in human cancers (PMID: 28587062).

SPA17, sperm surface protein Sp17, is a cancer-testis antigen (CTA) that is specifically expressed in ciliated cells and flagella of spermatozoa, indicating a role in sperm motility and may also function in cell adhesion and migration (PMID: 30309325). Overexpression of Spa17 has been observed in subtypes of ovarian cancer (PMID: 30309325, PMID: 26263201), uterine cancer (PMID: 27618037), lung cancer (PMID: 25739119, PMID: 24103781), and hepatocellular carcinoma (PMID: 23923079).

NUTM2B, NUT family member 2B, is a member of the NUT family gene with unknown function (PMID: 26542179). NUTM2B fusions have been identified in clear cell sarcoma of the kidney (PMID: 26493387), round cell sarcoma (PMID: 26945340), and uterine sarcoma (PMID: 28508463, PMID: 28288693).

HDAC2, histone deacetylase 2, is a member of the class I HDAC family that functions in deacetylation of histone and non-histone proteins to regulate various cell cycle and developmental processes via transcriptional repression of target genes (PMID: 25072962, PMID: 30096875). HDAC2 is overexpressed in variety of cancers in which  Tp53 is a critical regulatory target during tumorigenesis (PMID: 25072962).

FANCA, Fanconi anemia complementation group A, is a member of the Fanconi anemia (FA) nuclear complex, which plays a role in DNA repair (PMID: 11673408, PMID: 12509764). Germline FANCA mutations are associated with Fanconi anemia, which involves predisposition to various cancers including acute myeloid leukemia (PMID: 12509764, PMID: 25455269).

BCL10, BCL10 immune signaling adaptor, acts to link Card and Malt1 proteins during immune responses, playing a critical role in the activation of nuclear factor-kappaB (NF-kappaB) (PMID: 30022982, PMID: 30814996). BCL10 translocation and expression alterations are associated with MALT lymphoma (PMID: 27452667, PMID: 29225710), and BCL10 mutations have been identified in subtypes of lymphoma (PMID: 29225710, PMID: 29289361) and in chemorefractory acute myeloid leukemia (PMID: 29253671).

PCDH11X, protocadherin 11 X-linked, encodes for a cell adhesion molecule belonging to the protocadherin family and may be linked to the Wnt and beta-catenin pathways (PMID: 22744706). A fusion with ESR1 and PCDH11X has been identified in breast cancer (PMID: 30089255).

DALRD3, DALR anticodon-binding domain-containing protein 3, has arginine-tRNA ligase activity, but its function is relatively unknown (UniProt.org). Two micro-RNA's  (miR-191 and miR-425) lie within intronic regions of DALRD3 and transcription of all three is impacted by estrogen, thereby influencing tumorgenesis and aggressiveness of breast cancer (PMID: 23505378).

SOCS1, suppressor of cytokine signaling 1, is a member of a family of proteins which regulate cytokine production through a negative feedback loop involving inhibition of JAK kinase activity as well as interacting in a variety of other signaling networks (PMID: 21084693). Mutations in SOCS1 are associated with a wide variety of cancers (PMID: 24757565) and dysregulated Socs1 expression has been identified in both heme and solid tumor types (PMID: 28228755).

CDK5, cyclin dependent kinase 5, is an atypical CDK that is not activated by an associated cyclin (PMID: 28077789), is highly expressed in neurons (PMID: 30410599), and plays a role in regulating the cell-cycle (PMID: 29312535) and DNA damage repair (PMID: 27917404). Overexpression of Cdk5 has been correlated with decreased survival in lung cancer (PMID: 30410599), with enhanced cell proliferation in hepatocellular carcinoma (PMID: 29312535), and is associated with a variety of other solid tumors, including breast, colon, pancreatic, melanoma, thyroid and brain (PMID: 27917404).

FEV, FEV, ETS transcription factor, is a member of the ETS family of transcription factors that acts as a transcriptional repressor (PMID: 12761502). FEV fusions with EWSR1 have been observed in Ewings sarcoma (PMID: 24898918).

SLC16A1, solute carrier family 16 member 1 (monocarboxylic acid transporter 1), transports monocarboxylates across cell membrane, therefore regulates cellular environment and metabolism (PMID: 23506875). Increased Slc16a1 level has been detected in various cancers (PMID: 23999443).

NUAK2, NUAK family SNF1-like kinase, 2, is an AMPK family member that plays a role in cytoskeletal and cell cycle regulation (PMID: 21911917, PMID: 25832654) and regulates YAP/TAZ of the Hippo pathway (PMID: 30158528). NUAK2 amplification is associated with acral melanoma (PMID: 21911917, PMID: 25832654) and overexpression has been observed in high-grade bladder cancer (PMID: 30158528).

PAK3, p21 p21 (RAC1) activated kinase 3, is a serine/threonine kinase that binds Rho GTPases to participate in signaling of cell migration and cytoskeletal reorganization (PMID: 23818969). PAK3 appears to play a role in cell transformation (PMID: 18639460, PMID: 23818969) and overexpression may promote tumorgenesis in pancreatic cancer cells (PMID: 31051214).

POT1, protection of telomeres 1 is involved in the regulation of telomerase activity and chromosome stability. Pot1 germline mutations have been implicated in melanoma, glioma, and cardiac angiosarcoma (PMID: 26403419).

HNF1A, HNF1 homeobox A, is a transcription factor that demonstrates tumor suppressor activity and plays a role in hepatocyte differentiation and glucose transport (PMID: 25233928, PMID: 26855178, PMID: 25076298). HNF1A inactivating mutations are associated with hepatic adenomas (PMID: 25076298).

ZCCHC8, zinc finger, CCHC domain containing 8, is a zinc-knuckle protein that forms a subunit of the Nuclear Exosome Targeting (NEXT) complex, which may function in the regulation of RNA metabolism (PMID: 21855801, PMID: 25852104). ZCCHC8-ROS1 fusions have been identified in congential glioblastoma mulitforme (PMID: 27121553) and spitzoid tumors (PMID: 24445538).

MAPK8, mitogen-activated protein kinase 8, is a serine/threonine c-Jun NH2-terminal kinase (JNK) that acts in signaling cascades to regulate gene expression, cell proliferation, differentiation and development and apoptosis (PMID: 15077147). MAP kinase signaling cascades are often disregulated in cancer (PMID: 15077147) and MAPK8 overexpression in glioblastoma cells mediates resistant to temozolomide (PMID: 30119215).

ANKRD26, ankyrin repeat domain 26, encodes a protein found within the inner part of the cell membrane that plays a role in pathway signaling, in particular the MAPK/ERK pathway, and is required for appropriate platelet formation and adipogenesis (PMID: 29545013, PMID: 21669876, PMID: 24430186). ANKRD26 mutations that result in truncation of the N-terminus or impact the promoter region have been identified in myeloid malignancies (PMID: 24030261, PMID: 28100250).

DDX41, DEAD-box helicase 41, encodes an SF2 superfamily member that plays a role in innate immunity, and has putative involvement in mRNA splicing and post-transcriptional regulation (PMID: 27502187, PMID: 28547672). DDX41 mutations, both somatic and germline, are associated with myeloid neoplasms including myelodysplastic syndrome and acute myeloid leukemia (PMID: 25920683, PMID: 31484648).

LMO1, LIM domain only 1, plays a role in gene regulation by direct DNA binding or by binding to other transcription factors (PMID: 23303138) and has limited expression to the central nervous system during development (PMID: 30038707). LMO1 overexpression has been observed in small cell lung cancer and is correlated with decreased survival (PMID: 30038707) and is also associated with metastasis in gastric cancer (PMID: 29344115).

ERCC1, ERCC excision repair 1, endonuclease non-catalytic subunit, forms part of an endonuclease complex that functions in DNA repair (PMID: 26074087). ERCC1 expression level has been correlated with response to platinum-based therapies in various tumor types, including ovarian, non-small cell lung, and head and neck cancers (PMID: 26804248, PMID: 26179868, PMID: 26870207).

AIM2, interferon-inducible protein AIM2, regulates assembly of the inflammasome, induces apoptosis, and prevents proliferation of tumor cells (PMID: 21804607, PMID: 28243117). Loss of Aim2 expression has been shown in liver cancer (PMID: 27167192), to result in Akt activation in colorectal cancer (PMID: 26107252, PMID: 28243117), and may be prognostic for poor outcomes in renal cell carcinoma (PMID: 30031129).

TBXT, T-box transcription factor T, also known as Brachyury protein is an embryonic nuclear transcription factor that regulates notochord development (PMID: 30664779). Germline and somatic gene duplication of TBXT and subsequent overexpression of TBXT is common in chordoma (PMID: 30664779, PMID: 29026114).

MECOM, MDS1 and EVI1 complex locus, is a transcriptional factor regulating haematopoietic cell differentiation (PMID: 26729571). MECOM gene dysregulation is commonly found in acute myeloid leukemia (PMID: 26729571).

H3-5, H3.5 histone, is a testis-specific histone H3 variant that potentially plays a role in nucleosome stability in germ cells and is enriched near exon regions (PMID: 21274551, PMID: 26779285). Mutations in H3-5 have been observed in various advanced solid tumors, including uterine corpus endometrial carcinoma and lung squamous cell carcinoma (PMID: 24132290).

KDM4C, lysine demethylase 4C, is a Jumonji domain histone demethylase, regulating gene transcription through chromatin remodeling to affect cell growth and differentiation (PMID: 24349617) and chromosome stability (PMID: 30083054). KDM4C overexpression had been reported in numerous cancers (PMID: 24349617), including prostate (PMID: 31766290) and breast (PMID: 31784197, PMID: 30083054).

AXIN2, axin 2, is a homologue of Axin that regulates beta-catenin degradation (PMID: 9554852). AXIN2 mutations have been identified in colorectal, ovarian, endometrial, and liver cancers (PMID: 15735151).

JUN, jun proto-oncogene, is a member of the AP-1 family of transcription factors, which regulates several biological processes, including cell proliferation and differentiation (PMID: 24315690, PMID: 20044606). JUN functions as a proto-oncogene, and dysregulation of JUN is associated with several tumor types (PMID: 24315690).

OLFM4, olfactomedin 4, is a member of the olfactomedin glycoprotein family that is involved in neural development and immunity (PMID: 25364714). OLFM4 expression has been associated with gastric, pancreatic, colon, lung, breast, and cervical cancers (PMID: 25364714).

CDK19, cyclin-dependent kinase 19, is a component of the multiprotein Mediator complex (MED), which is an activator of RNA polymerase II (Pol II) and plays a role in regulation of gene transcription (PMID: 27678455). Overexpression of Cdk19 has been observed to correlate with increased aggressiveness and decreased survival of prostate cancer patients (PMID: 27678455, PMID: 29568371).

TTN, titin, is a large protein filament that is a major component of the sarcomere, and plays mechanical, organizational, and signaling roles in cardiac and skeletal muscle (PMID: 21257761). TTN has been demonstrated to be frequently mutated in several tumor types (PMID: 17344846, PMID: 18085994).

ERCC3, TFIIH basal transcription factor complex helicase XPB subunit, is an ATP-dependent 5-3 DNA helicase that plays a role in nucleotide excision repair and RNA transcription (PMID: 8157004). An ERCC3 nonsense mutation is associated with breast cancer risk (PMID: 27655433) and ERCC3 mRNA expression is correlated with poor prognosis in pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma (PMID: 27384421).

RPS6KB1, ribosomal protein S6 kinase B, encodes S6K1, which is a serine/threonine kinase that acts downstream of mTORC1, and plays a role in several cellular processes including cell growth, cell survival, and cell metabolism (PMID: 22168436, PMID: 20932932). RPS6KB1 amplification and over expression, as a consequence of 17q23 amplification, has been demonstrated in breast cancer (PMID: 10922410, PMID: 18335499).

RASA1, RAS p21 protein activator 1, is a RAS GTP activating protein (RasGAP), which promotes RAS GTP hydrolysis to negatively regulate RAS pathway signaling, and plays a role in cell proliferation, migration, and apoptosis and in angiogenesis (PMID: 19022332, PMID: 29127119). RASA1 co-mutation with NF1 has been identified in non-small cell lung cancer (PMID: 29127119), and decreased RASA1 expression and RASA1 mutations have been observed in metastatic melanoma (PMID: 26993606).

PPM1D, protein phosphatase, Mg2+/Mn2+ dependent 1D, also known as wild-type p53-induced phosphatase 1 (Wip1), is a nuclear serine/threonine phosphatase that inhibits ATM, CHK2, p38MAPK and TP53 signaling (PMID: 32006900). PPM1D is often amplified in human cancers (PMID: 19879149), including breast cancer (PMID: 32006900), and overexpression is associated with poor prognosis in esophageal (PMID: 30374621) and gastric cancers (PMID:  32006900).

IRF2, interferon regulatory factor 2, encodes a transcription factor that participates in both the activation and repression of genes, playing a role in the interferon response and cellular functions related to growth and apoptosis (PMID: 18514056, PMID: 18395009). IRF2 overexpression has been identified in a variety of tumor types including pancreatic cancer (PMID: 24632547), esophageal squamous cell carcinoma (PMID: 17363571), and colorectal cancer (PMID: 28465494).

FAM114A2, family with sequence similarity 114 member A2, encodes a protein with uncharacterized biological function, which may bind ATP or GTP (PMID: 10843801). A fusion between FAM114A2 and BRAF has been demonstrated in thyroid cancer (PMID: 25204415).

LTK, leukocyte receptor tyrosine kinase, is an orphan receptor with unknown ligand, but is very similar to ALK and is believed to be involved in growth and development (PMID: 22347506). Expression of LTK engineered to harbor mutations at sites analogous to transforming ALK mutations demonstrated transforming ability in cell assays (PMID: 22347506).

CCNY, cyclin-Y, is a regulatory subunit of CDK14 (PMID: 19524571) and CDK16 (PMID: 22184064), and plays a role in the transition of the cell-cycle through the Wnt signaling pathway (PMID: 29557391). Overexpression of Ccny promotes proliferation, migration, and metastasis of hepatocellular carcinoma cells and may also promote proliferation of breast cancer cells (PMID: 27666310).

FYB1, FYN binding protein 1, encodes for a protein associated with hematopoiesis, playing a role in platelet activity, cell motility and proliferation, and cell adhesion (PMID: 25876182). A fusion with FGR has been identified in lymphoma (Journal of Clinical Oncology 35, no. 15_suppl).

CUX1, homeobox protein cut-like 1, is a transcription factor required for cell motility (PMID: 22306263) and plays a role in cell cycle progression, cell proliferation, and DNA repair (PMID: 28147323). CUX1 fusions with BRAF have been observed in solid tumors (PMID: 25190083, PMID: 26314551), with FGFR1 in hematological tumors (PMID: 21330321), and with ALK in NSCLC (PMID: 30010043).

ATRX, transcriptional regulator ATRX, is in the SWI/SNF family of chromatin remodeling proteins and plays a role in DNA repair and telomere length. ATRX loss and mutations have been identified in a high percentage of tumor types including glioma (PMID: 23249563; PMID: 26936505) and copy number loss has also been observed in pancreatic neuroendocrine tumors (PMID: 30081149) and ovarian ependymomas (PMID: 29944970).

PPP6C, protein phosphatase 6 catalytic subunit, encodes the catalytic subunit of the trimeric holoenzyme protein phosphatase 6 (PP6), which regulates dephosphorylation of Aurora Kinase A (PMID: 24336958), and plays a role in DNA damage repair, chromosome segregation, and negative regulation of inflammatory signaling (PMID: 30036567, PMID: 26868000, PMID: 21451261). PPP6C mutations are associated with melanoma (PMID: 24336958, PMID: 23729733), and basal cell carcinoma (PMID: 26950094), and upregulation of PPP6C has been demonstrated in glioblastoma (PMID: 22158480).

TGFBR2, transforming growth factor, beta receptor II, is a membrane bound Ser/Thr protein kinase that heterodimerize with Tgfbr1 to meidate Tgf beta signaling (PMID: 15270668). Mutations or abnormal expression of Tgfbr2 have been reported in colon and pancreatic cancers (PMID: 15256431, PMID: 25060520).

SETD2, histone-lysine N-methyltransferase SETD2, regulates chromatin structure through H3K36 to influence gene transcription (PMID: 28159833; PMID: 28386724) and plays a role in genomic stability (PMID: 31747945). Loss of function and decreased expression of Setd2 has been demonstrated in clear cell renal cell carcinoma (PMID: 28260718), breast cancer (PMID: 20501857) and lung cancer (PMID: 28202515).
SAMD4B, sterile alpha motif domain containing 4B, is a transcription suppressor that inhibits activator protein-1 (AP-1), p53 and p21-mediated transcription (PMID: 20510020).

H3C3, H3 clustered histone 3, encodes a member of the histone H3 family, and plays a role in nucleosome assembly, and cell division (PMID: 25288118, PMID: 14718166, PMID: 11420717). Mutations in H3c3 have been identified in high-grade astrocytoma (PMID: 24705250), and methylation of H3C3 is associated with reduced survival in neuroblastoma patients (PMID: 23034519).

POLD2, polymerase (DNA directed), delta 2, accessory subunit, is a subunit of DNA polymerase delta, which mediates DNA replication (PMID: 27320729). POLD2 amplification and over expression have been found in ovarian cancers (PMID: 21079801, PMID: 25875127).
TLE6, TLE family member 6 subcortical maternal complex member, is a transcriptional co-repressor which regulates oogenesis, stem/progenitor cell state and differentiation (PMID: 24501176).

FANCB, Fanconi anemia, complementation group B, is a member of the Fanconi anemia core complex, which plays a role in DNA repair and hematopoiesis (PMID: 24905007, PMID: 26658157). Germline FANCB mutations are associated with Fanconi anemia, which involves predisposition to various cancers (PMID: 15502827, PMID: 23613520).

LATS1, serine/threonine-protein kinase LATS1, is a negative regulator of YAP1 in the Hippo signaling pathway, which plays a role in organ size control and tumor suppression by restricting proliferation and promoting apoptosis. LATS1 plays a role as a tumor suppressor in human cancer (PMID: 24026096).

DAB2, DAB2, clathrin adaptor protein, encodes for a phosphoprotein that activates upon binding to other proteins, and is found to play a role in stem cell differentiation, cell arrangement, cytoskeleton assembly, and epithelial-mesenchymal transition (PMID: 24638085). DAB2, described as a tumor suppressor, has been found to be deleted or methylated, resulting in decreased expression, in ovarian cancer, breast cancer, and nasopharyngeal carcinoma (PMID: 17115114, PMID: 20525238).

KIAA1549 is an uncharacterized member of the UFP0606 (UniProt.org) gene family and is commonly found in fusion with Braf (PMID: 18974108, PMID: 23242278) in pediatric pilocytic astrocytoma (PMID: 28002790).

KANK2, KN motif and ankyrin repeat domains 2, is a member of the ankyrin repeat domain-containing protein family that regulates actin dynamics (PMID: 17996375, PMID: 27548916). KANK2 fusion has been identified in leiomyosarcoma (PMID: 30518629).

DLG5, discs large MAGUK scaffold protein 5, encodes for a scaffolding protein, which is involved in epithelial cell structure and extracellular signaling (PMID: 24910533). Decreased expression of DLG5 has been associated with the proliferation and migration of cancer cells (PMID: 24910533).

INA, internexin neuronal intermediate filament protein alpha, also known as alpha-internexin is a type IV intermediate filament protein of the cytoskeleton that may play a role in cell differentiation (PMID: 29940892). Altered expression of Ina has been reported in medulloblastomas, neuroblastomas, while loss of expression has been observed in gastroenteropancreatic neuroendocrine neoplasms (PMID: 29940892), and Ina fusions with Fgfr2 have been reported in low-grade mixed neuronal-glial tumors (PMID: 29767381) and intrahepatic cholangiocarcinoma (PMID: 31109923).

SHH, sonic hedgehog, encodes for a signaling protein that plays a significant role in embryonic development, specifically, in midline tissue formation and organogenesis, and thus, participates in cell growth, differentiation, and survival (PMID: 18794343). Over expression of SHH has been associated with multiple tumor types including triple negative breast cancer, pancreatic cancer, prostate cancer, and breast cancer (PMID: 26727947, PMID: 14520413, PMID: 15132968, PMID: 20180807).

HSD3B1, hydroxy-delta-5-steroid dehydrogenase, 3 beta- and steroid delta-isomerase 1, is an enzyme that is involved in the biosynthesis of steroid hormones, specifically, participating in the catalysis step required for the formation of all types of steroid hormones (PMID: 28655875, PMID: 15632317). A mutation in HSD3B1 has been associated with prostate cancer (PMID: 27575027).

KDM1B, lysine (K)-specific demethylase 1B, is a histone demethylase influencing histone modification and chromatin remodeling to activate or repress gene transcription (PMID: 20670891). Overexpression of Kdm1b has been observed during breast cancer progression (PMID: 29137219).

CEACAM6, carcinoembryonic antigen-related cell adhesion molecule 6, is a transmembrane glycoprotein that belongs to the immunoglobulin superfamily (PMID: 29881289). Overexpression of Ceacam6 has been observed in pulmonary metastatic lesions in osteosarcoma (PMID: 29881289) and in gastric cancer patients with poor prognosis (PMID: 29137373, PMID: 27421133).

NT5E (CD73), 5'-nucleotidase, converts adenosine monophosphate (AMP) to adenosine to regulate cellular homeostasis and functions as an immune checkpoint inhibitor (PMID: 29720980). NT5E (CD73) high expression in the tumor microenvironment has been implicated as a prognostic biomarker in a variety of tumor types, including colorectal, NSCLC, ovarian, TNBC, melanoma, renal, and gastric (PMID:  29914571, PMID: 28258700).

ATP10B, probable phospholipid-transporting ATPase VB, is a P4-ATPase hypothesized to be part of a phospholipid flippase involved in catalyzing aminophospholipid transport to create lipid asymmetry in biomembrane compartments (UniProt.org, PMID: 21914794). Mutation of ATP10B has been reported in a patient with malignant peritoneal mesothelioma (PMID: 27187383).

MLH3, DNA mismatch repair protein Mlh3, is a DNA mismatch repair gene that dimerizes with MLH1 and localizes to centrosomes (PMID: 24333356, PMID: 25116689). MLH3 mutations have been associated with cervical squamous cell carcinoma (PMID: 24759751).

PRKCI, protein kinase C iota, is an atypical protein kinase family member that plays a role in cell proliferation and survival, and acts as an oncogene in human cancer to promote cellular transformation (PMID: 17570678, PMID: 24231509). PRKCI amplification has been demonstrated in several tumor types (PMID: 17570678), including ovarian serous carcinoma (PMID: 28698296) and esophageal squamous cell carcinoma (PMID: 17990328).

ABL2, ABL proto-oncogene 2, non-receptor tyrosine kinase, serves as a liaison between upstream receptors and regulates biological processes ssuch as cell survival, apoptosis, response to genotoxic stress and cell motility (PMID: 28086240; PMID: 23842646). In addition knockdown of ABL2 can decrease cancer cell invasion and intravasation (PMID: 26729027)

BCL2L2, BCL2 like 2, encodes an antiapoptotic member of the BCL2 protein family that regulates cell death via apoptotic suppression and is required for spermatogenesis (PMID: 29099482, PMID: 28094768). Additionally, roles for BCL2L2 have been shown for B-cell survival and lymphomagenesis (PMID: 28094768).

CD79A, CD79a molecule, immunoglobulin-associated alpha, expressed early in B-cell development and maintained until differentiation to plasma cells (PMID: 24146823; PMID: 1395095). CD79a forms a heterodimer with CD79b and IgM to form the B-cell receptor complex (BCR), which once formed, induces B cell activation (PMID: 24146823). Mutations in CD79A can activate the NF-kB pathway (PMID: 21324920).

DDX41, DEAD-box helicase 41, encodes an SF2 superfamily member that plays a role in innate immunity, and has putative involvement in mRNA splicing and post-transcriptional regulation (PMID: 27502187, PMID: 28547672).

NCOA4 (also referred to as ARA70), nuclear receptor coactivator 4, is an androgen receptor coactivator (PMID: 15166229). NCOA4 fusions are frequently observed with RET in papillary thyroid carcinoma (also referred to as RET/PTC3) (PMID: 25731779).

PLA2G15, phospholipase A2 group XV, is a an enzyme with phospholipase A2 and transacylase activity that plays a role in lipid homeostasis (PMID: 30830753) and localizes to the lysosome and late endosome (PMID: 30077006). A NFATC3-PLA2G15 fusion has been identified in acute myeloid leukemia (PMID: 23251452) and lung adenocarcinoma (PMID: 27058892).

TYK2, tyrosine kinase 2, is a non-receptor tyrosine kinase in the JAK subfamily, which regulates cytokine signal transduction through STATs (PMID: 31694222), cellular growth, and differentiation, and plays a role in immune surveillance (PMID: 23482926, PMID: 15578097). Increased expression of TYK2 has been observed in prostate and squamous cervical carcinomas (PMID: 23482926), decreased TYK2 expression has been observed in ESR1-negative breast cancer (PMID: 22116632), and TYK2 missense mutations have been observed in pediatric leukemia (PMID: 31694222).

NFKBIA, NFKB inhibitor alpha, encodes IKappa B alpha, a member of the nuclear factor kappa B inhibitor family, which is responsible for inactivation of NF-kappa B via inhibition of nuclear localization signals (PMID: 24578542). Inactivating mutations and deletion of NFKBIA have been observed in lymphoma and glioblastoma (PMID: 19507254, PMID: 21774728).

EPHA2, EPH receptor A2, is a receptor tyrosine kinase involved in cell morphology, adhesion, and migration (PMID: 23738943). EPHA2 overexpression has been observed in lung cancers and has been associated with poor outcomes (PMID: 24713656).

CALCR, calcitonin receptor, is a G-protein-coupled receptor that mediates downstream signaling in response to ligand binding and plays a role in calcium homeostasis (PMID: 29263181, PMID: 21649645, PMID: 11298188, PMID: 23820954). Increased CALCR expression has been observed in prostate cancer (PMID: 23820954), and CALCR loss of function mutations have been demonstrated in glioblastoma (PMID: 29263181).

CXCR4 (Cd184) chemokine (C-X-C motif) receptor 4, acts as a receptor for both cytokines and ubiquitin, regulating cellular calcium levels and signaling pathways which include PI3K, RAS, and MAPK (PMID: 20228059, PMID: 15339043). CXCR4 expression has been linked to several cancer types and is thought to influence tumor metastasis and vascularization (PMID: 15339043, PMID: 30733896).

CTAG1A, cancer/testis antigen 1A, may play a role in tumor growth, angiogenesis, apoptosis, invasion, and metastasis (PMID: 30122941) and may be specifically expressed in tumor, but not normal tissue (PMID: 15704127). CTAG1A high expression has been observed in lung cancer (PMID: 30122941).

BIRC3, baculoviral IAP repeat containing 3, is a member of the inhibitors of apoptotic protein (IAP) family that regulates apoptosis and other cellular processes through ubiquitination of targeting proteins (PMID: 23790005). BIRC3 mutations are frequently identified in hematological cancers (PMID: 17692804, PMID: 21881048, PMID: 24145436).

NOTCH3, notch receptor 3, is a transmembrane receptor, which plays a role in cell fate regulation, proliferation, and survival (PMID: 30030828). NOTCH3 amplification has been implicated in the development of ovarian high-grade serous carcinoma (PMID: 20001801, PMID: 30723507) and myofibroma (PMID: 31566039) and NOTCH3 overexpression has been implicated in breast cancer metastasis (PMID: 30180881).

NFIX, nuclear factor I X, is a transcription factor that belongs to the nuclear factor I family and plays a role in regulation of neural and muscle development, and in hematopoeisis (PMID: 28962832, PMID: 30287093). A fusion of NFIX and MAST1 has been identified in breast carcinoma (PMID: 22101766).

BRCA1, breast cancer type 1 susceptibility protein, is a tumor suppressor (PMID: 30562755) involved in the DNA damage response and DNA repair (PMID: 21203981). BRCA1 germline mutations increase the risk of developing ovarian and/or breast cancer (PMID: 21285145) and somatic mutations are highest in NSCLC, pancreatic, and colon cancers (PMID: 27283171).

LIMA1, LIM domain and actin-binding protein 1, plays a role in regulating the polymerization state of actin, cross linking of actin bundles (PMID: 26350886), and cholesterol homeostasis (PMID: 29941963). Decreased expression of Lima1 has been observed in prostate and breast cancers (PMID: 26350886) and a LIMA1-ROS1 has been identified in lung cancer (PMID: 25264305).

ARFRP1, ADP ribosylation factor related protein 1, encodes a small GTPase that plays a role in protein trafficking via recruitment of Arl1, Golgin-97, and Golgin-245 to the Golgi membrane (PMID: 23033902, PMID: 16129887). ARFRP1 amplification has been identified in non-small cell lung cancer (PMID: 24736079).

CYP17A1, cytochrome P450 family 17 subfamily A member 1, is an enzyme that catalyzes the addition of a hydroxyl group to pregnenolone and progesterone, and cleaves the hydroxylated intermediates to synthesize androgens and corticoids (PMID: 29372682, PMID: 21051590, PMID: 27748439). Overexpression of CYP17A1 is associated with poor prognosis in glioma (PMID: 28530704).

MTAP, methylthioadenosine phosphorylase, encodes an enzyme that plays a role in the methionine salvage pathway via catalyzing methylthioadenosine (MTA), a product of polyamine biosynthesis, and results in salvaging adenine and methionine (PMID: 26751376, PMID: 24324622). Loss of MTAP frequently occurs in a variety of tumors, which may result in an accumulation of MTA, leading to deregulation of cellular pathways (PMID: 27068473, PMID: 26819315).

SSX1, SSX family member 1, is a putative transcriptional repressor (PMID: 27276714), and a known cancer testis antigen (CTA) (PMID: 30186454, PMID: 25363656). SYT-SSX1 and SS18-SSX1 fusions are commonly associated with synovial sarcoma (PMID: 30219714, PMID: 29502955, PMID: 27572315).

RAC1, ras-related C3 botulinum toxin substrate 1 (rho family, small GTP binding protein Rac1), is a member of the Rho-family small GTPases that involves in diverse cellular activities through regulating actin dynamics (PMID: 14744429). RAC1 mutations have been identified in human cancers including melanoma, head and neck cancer, and prostate cancer (PMID: 27991930).

XRCC3, X-ray repair cross complementing 3, is a family member of the XRCC genes that is involved in homologous recombination repair (PMID: 15279796). XRCC3 mutations have been identified in breast, skin, lung, and bladder cancers (PMID: 15723711).

MAGEA1, melanoma-associated antigen 1, is a member of the cancer testis antigen (CTA) family (PMID: 30498011, PMID: 28300603) that is normally expressed in male germ line cells and placenta (PMID: 28459460) and may play a role in increased cell motility, cell proliferation, and inflammation (PMID: 29763778). Overexpression of Magea1 has been observed in metastatic lung cancer (PMID: 30122941) and may be prognostic marker for early detection (PMID: 29356386, PMID: 29308305).

HTRA1, HtrA serine peptidase 1, is a serine protease and member of the high temperature requirement family, and plays a role in protein degradation and cell signaling, specifically, the TGF-B pathway (PMID: 24040176).
