Reduced expression of HTRA1 has been observed in a variety of tumor types including urothelial bladder, esophageal, liver, and endometrial cancer (PMID: 26035313).

HEY1, hes related family bHLH transcription factor with YRPW motif 1, functions as a downstream effector of the NOTCH signaling pathway, and plays a role in cell proliferation and differentiation (PMID: 28468863, PMID: 27129302). Increased HEY1 expression has been demonstrated in several tumor types (PMID: 28468863), and HEY1-NCOA2 fusions are recurrent in mesenchymal chondrosarcoma (PMID: 22034177).

FAP, prolyl endopeptidase FAP, is a membrane gelatinase of the serine protease family (PMID: 29410133) that is expressed in embryonic tissues, but rarely in normal tissues (PMID: 30383930). Aberrant expression of Fap is commonly observed in tumor stromal fibroblasts (PMID: 29410133) in epithelial carcinomas, where it may suppress tumor immunity (PMID: 29273462).

PBX1, PBX homeobox 1, is a transcription factor that is involved in regulating the development of many processes such as hematopoiesis, skeleton patterning, and organogenesis of the pancreas and urogenital systems (PMID: 22125492). PBX1 fusions with E2A have been observed in pre-B-cell leukemia and PBX1 activity has been linked to multiple cancer types (PMID: 22125492, PMID: 1967983).

AR, androgen receptor, belongs to the nuclear hormone receptor family, which acts as a transcription factor, resulting in either transcription or repression of specific genes (PMID: 24909511, PMID: 21784131). AR overexpression leads to ligand independent activation of AR and is common in prostate cancer (PMID: 16598769).

U2AF1, U2 small nuclear RNA auxiliary factor 1, is a 35 kDa subunit splicing factor, that functions in 3' splice site recognition to regulate expression of genes involved in hematological and solid tumor development (PMID: 2963698, PMID: 28986033). U2AF1 is frequently mutated in myelodysplatic syndrome (MDS), chronic myelomonocytic leukemia, atypical CML, acute myeloid leukemia, and lung adenocarcinoma (PMID: 23645565, PMID: 22678168, PMID: 24498085, PMID: 30138727, PMID: 29991672).

DOCK4, dedicator of cytokinesis protein 4, activates Rap GTPase to regulate formation of intercellular adherens junctions and cell migration (PMID: 12628187). Overexpression of Dock4 may indicate risk of bone metastasis in breast cancer (PMID: 30426503) and a DOCK4-BRAF fusion has been identified in non-small cell lung cancer (PMID: 29883838).

PIK3CA, phosphatidylinositol 4,5-bisphosphate 3-kinase catalytic subunit alpha isoform, activates AKT/mTOR signaling to promote cell proliferation (PMID: 23411347). PIK3CA activating mutations have been identified in a number of tumor types such as breast cancer, colon cancer, endometrial cancer, glioblastoma, skin cancer, and ovarian cancer (PMID: 20535651).

PTPRS, protein tyrosine phosphatase receptor type S, plays a role in regulation of intestinal epithelial permeability (PMID: 24385580) and autophagy (PMID: 21303930), and has a putative role in regulation of RAS signaling (PMID: 29915291). PTPRS mutations have been identified in colorectal cancer (PMID: 29915291), and deletion of PTPRS has been identified in head and neck cancers (PMID: 22065749).

SEPTIN3, septin 3, is a filament-forming GTP-binding protein that may play a role in membrane remodeling (PMID: 23163726). SEPTIN3 has been observed in a fusion protein with BRAF in melanoma (PMID: 30254212).

H3C13, H3 clustered histone 13, encodes a member of the histone H3 family that may play a role in nucleosome assembly during DNA replication (PMID: 30165676). Mutations in H3C13 have been identified in colorectal cancer (PMID: 25344691).

FCHSD1, F-BAR and double SH3 domains protein 1, is a protein of uncharacterized biological function (PMID: 17301836). A FCHSD1 fusion with BRAF has been observed in congenital melanocytic nevi (PMID: 17301836).

DLL3, delta-like protein 3, is a member of the Notch family of ligands, which may inhibit Notch receptor activation (PMID: 27932068). Overexpression of Dll3 has been observed in a variety of tumor types, including small cell lung cancer (PMID: 29088717) and large-cell neuroendocrine tumours (PMID: 29535388).

MDM4, MDM4, p53 regulator, inhibits Tp53 activity through interaction with the transcriptional activation domain of Tp53, and regulates Tp53 degradation together with Mdm2 (PMID: 23303139). MDM4 amplification leads to overexpression of Mdm4 in many cancers, including sarcoma, retinoblastoma, breast, lung, and colon cancers, as well as melanoma (PMID: 27371671).

TNFRSF14, TNF receptor superfamily member 14, encodes a transmembrane glycoprotein that acts as a receptor in the tumor necrosis factor signaling pathway, coordinating pro- and anti-inflammatory signaling, and plays a role in T-cell activation and maintenance (PMID: 22017438, PMID: 21920726). TNFRSF14 mutations have been identified in follicular lymphoma (PMID: 20884631) and diffuse large B-cell lymphoma (PMID: 22343534), and altered expression has been reported in multiple cancers including reduced levels in classical Hodgkin lymphoma (PMID: 26650888), and increased expression in gastric cancer (PMID: 28243127).

LIG4, DNA ligase 4, is an enzyme that catalyzes the transfer of adenosine 5'-monophosphate (AMP) to 5-phosphate of double-stranded DNA breaks, and plays an important role in non-homologous end joining and V(D)J recombination (PMID: 18518823, PMID: 10946235). Overexpression of Lig4 has been observed in prostate cancer (PMID: 26134445), and polymorphisms in LIG4 have been associated with survival in glioblastoma (PMID: 20368557).
SAAL1, serum amyloid A-like 1, is an SAA superfamily member involved in synoviocyte development, and has a putative role in inflammatory signaling (PMID: 22127701, PMID: 30513680).

MYB, v-myb avian myeloblastosis viral oncogene homolog, is a transcriptional activator that regulates cell differentiation and proliferation,(PMID: 21196221). MYB is dysregulated in several tumor types (PMID: 21196221).

CDK13, cyclin-dependent kinase 13, binds cyclin K (CCNK) (PMID: 29021403, PMID: 26748711) and plays a role in pre-mRNA processing (PMID: 29996118, PMID: 26886422) and maintenance of genomic stability during the DNA damage response (PMID: 22012619). Amplification of CDK13 has been observed in hepatocellular carcinoma (PMID: 22912832).

PDGFRA, platelet-derived growth factor receptor alpha, is a receptor tyrosine kinase that activates PI3K/Akt, RAS/MAPK, and JAK/STAT pathways to promote cell proliferation and survival (PMID: 21605429). PDGFRA mutations have been detected in melanoma, AML, peripheral nerve sheath tumors, sarcoma, and neuroendocrine carcinomas (PMID: 23752188, PMID: 20685895), several fusions have also been reported (PMID: 22432087, PMID: 26276769), and amplification has been observed in glioblastoma (PMID: 23438035).

MAP3K13, mitogen-activated protein kinase kinase kinase 13, is a member of the mixed lineage kinase (MLK) protein family that is involved in JNK pathway signaling (PMID: 11726277). MAP3K13 mutations have been identified in breast cancer (PMID: 22722201), and amplification has been observed in head and neck squamous cell carcinoma (PMID: 28760853).

AURKC, Aurora kinase C, is part of the aurora serine-threonine kinase family and regulates chromosome segregation during meiosis. AURKC amplification and overexpression promotes proliferation and migration of tumor cells (PMID: 21710690, PMID: 23581231, PMID: 28147341).

MUC17, mucin 17, cell surface associated, is a membrane-bound glycoprotein expressed by intestinal epithelia with proposed roles in cell protection and restitution (PMID: 16737958, PMID: 20702471). Overexpression of Muc17 has been correlated with pancreatic cancer (PMID: 19817750, PMID: 16737958).

HGF, hepatocyte growth factor, is an activating ligand of MET, which induces MET dimerization to promote MAPK signaling and plays a role in cell morphogenesis, proliferation, survival, angiogenesis, motility, and invasion (PMID: 30513872, PMID: 24930887, PMID: 24865428). Overexpression of Hgf has been observed in melanoma (PMID: 30513872) and increased circulating levels of Hgf has been observed in several cancers (PMID: 31512514).

CEBPA, CCAAT enhancer binding protein alpha, is a transcription factor that regulates the expression of genes involved in cell differentiation (PMID: 26601784). Inactivation of CEBPA is associated with the pathogenesis of leukemia and dysregulation of CEBPA has been identified in various solid tumors (PMID: 28720765, PMID: 28504718).

IGFBP2, insulin like growth factor binding protein 2, is a member of the IGF-binding protein (IGFBP) family that functions as a secretory and intracellular protein (PMID: 30626422) to regulate IGF and integrin pathways in modulation of cell growth and migration (PMID: 26317790). Overexpression of Igfbp2 has been observed in a number of tumor types including, ovarian, breast, colon, lung, glioma, prostate, and leukemia (PMID: 30626422, PMID: 26662106, PMID: 25774149).

TBL1XR1, transducin (beta)-like 1 X-linked receptor 1, is an F-box-like protein which acts as a co-repressor of nuclear hormone transcription factors influencing gene expression (PMID: 16893456). Mutations and changes in expression of Tbxlr1 have been identified in a variety of cancer types (PMID: 24667177, PMID: 22837180).

CTAG2, cancer/testis antigen 2, encodes for a cancer testis antigen that is normally expressed on male germ cells and may play a role in the regulation of gene expression (PMID: 15715909). CTAG2 expression has been observed in breast cancer and liposarcoma (PMID: 26895102, PMID: 24457462).
MUSK, muscle, skeletal, receptor tyrosine kinase plays a role in the formation of the neuromuscular junction  through induction of AChR clustering (PMID: 25537362).

GPNMB, transmembrane glycoprotein NMB, plays a role in osteoblast differentiation, bone mineral deposition, cell invasion, and motility (PMID: 29441921, PMID: 29344282). GPNMB overexpression has been observed in melanoma, breast cancer, glioma, and gastrointestinal cancer (PMID:29344282).

BCL2L1, BCL2 like 1, is a member of the Bcl2 family of programmed cell death regulators that inhibits apoptosis (PMID: 8358789). Overexpression of Bcl2l1 has been identified in various cancers and is associated with resistance to chemotherapy (PMID: 14613034) and BCL2L1 amplification has been observed in colorectal cancer (PMID: 28611106).

MUC4, mucin 4, cell surface associated, is a membrane-bound glycoprotein with roles in cell protection, adhesion, differentiation, and proliferation, and in cancer progression (PMID: 20001800, PMID: 18024835). Altered expression of Muc4 is associated with several tumor types (PMID: 20001800).

PURB, purine rich element binding protein B, is a DNA binding transcription factor that belongs to the Pur protein family, playing a role in DNA replication and transcription (PMID: 19496623). A PURB fusion with EGFR has been associated with lung adenocarcinoma and deletions of PURB have been linked to myelodysplastic syndrome (PMID: 11417483, PMID: 27102076).

HNRNPK, heterogeneous nuclear ribonucleoprotein K, plays a role in RNA metabolism by acting as a scaffolding protein, thereby allowing interaction with multiple proteins and subsequent mediation of various RNA-related processes, including transcription and processing of pre-mRNA (PMID: 11231586, PMID: 21693523). Over expression of HNRNPK has been identified in renal cell carcinoma (PMID: 26713736), while decreased expression has been identified in acute myeloid leukemia (PMID: 26412324).

AKAP9, A-kinase anchor protein 9, belongs to a family of diverse A-kinase anchor proteins (AKAPs) that have a common function of binding to the protein kinase A regulatory subunit (PMID: 26441649). AKAP9 fusions have been observed with BRAF in thyroid cancer (PMID: 15630448) and in sclerosing malignant melanoma (PMID: 29464327) and framshift mutations of Akap9 have been reported in MSI-H colon and gastric cancers (PMID: 26786868).

CD47, leukocyte surface antigen CD47, is an immunoglobulin superfamily protein  that mediates cell-cell communication through binding to signal regulatory protein alpha (Sirpa) (PMID: 24627525) and servers as a marker of self recognition (PMID: 28286286). CD47 is often overexpressed on tumor cells to evade immune surveillance (PMID: 29743205) and therapeutic disruption of binding of CD47 to the Sirpa receptor on macrophages may stimulate phagocytosis of tumor cells (PMID: 28286286, PMID: 28258703).

NOP2, NOP2 nucleolar protein, encodes for an RNA methylase, which is thought to play a role in RNA methylation (PMID: 25014650). A fusion with ESR1 and NOP2 has been observed in breast cancer (PMID: 30089255).

CCNE2, cyclin E2, is a cyclin that controls S phase entry and regulates spermatogenesis (PMID: 9840927, PMID: 12941272). Upregulation of Ccne2 expression has been reported in breast, ovarian, and gastric cancers (PMID: 12466974, PMID: 28537669, PMID: 27034264).

GPBP1L1, GC-rich promoter binding protein 1-like 1, is a protein that may play a role in transcriptional regulation (PMID: 29765130). A fusion of GPBP1L1 and MAST2 has been identified in breast carcinoma (PMID: 22101766).

BMI1, BMI1 proto-oncogene, polycomb ring finger, is a member of the polycomb repressive complex 1 (PRC1), which binds to Ring1b to inhibit expression of PRC1 target genes and has a PRC1-independent role in AR regulation (PMID: 26448339, PMID: 29402932, PMID: 29337063). Overexpression of BMI1 has been observed in a number of solid tumor types, including prostate cancer (PMID: 29402932), tongue squamous cell carcinoma (PMID: 29607565), and colon cancer (PMID: 29337063).

SDHD, succinate dehydrogenase [ubiquinone] cytochrome b small subunit, mitochondrial, is the small membrane-bound subunit of cytochrome b in mitochondrial complex II that catalyzes electron transfer from succinate to ubiquinone (PMID: 21771581). SDHD mutations are found in paragangliomas, extra-adrenal pheochromocytomas (PMID: 16317055, PMID: 15328326, PMID: 19454582), and gastrointestinal stromal tumours (PMID: 29070651).

SLC12A1, solute carrier family 12 member 1, is a sodium-dependent cation-chloride cotransporter that regulates ionic balance (PMID: 23325410). A SLC12A1 fusion to LEO1 has been detected in glioma (PMID: 20196086).

GNAS, GNAS complex locus, is a GTPase that is activated upon ligand binding of a G-protein coupled receptor, and is involved in mediating hormone response (PMID: 23640210, PMID: 25851935). Hotspot mutations impair Gnas GTPase activity, resulting in constitutive pathway activation and are common in a variety of tumor types (PMID: 23640210).

FOXA1, forkhead box A1, is a transcription factor that de-compacts condensed chromatin to expose hormone receptor binding sites (PMID: 31243372) and plays a role in regulation of tissue-specific gene expression, gene expression in differentiated tissue, and androgen signalling (PMID: 22722839). Foxa1 expression has been associated with various tumor types (PMID: 24948874; PMID: 24596370; PMID: 24528009) and is often mutated in hormone-receptor-driven prostate, breast, bladder and salivary cancers (PMID: 31243372).

NKX2-1, NK2 homeobox 1, is a transcription factor involved in thyroid, lung, and brain development (PMID: 23763999). NKX2-1 may act as an oncogene or tumor suppressor, depending on the cellular context (PMID: 23763999, PMID: 29237428), and enrichment of NKX2-1 inactivating mutations has been demonstrated in non-terminal respiratory unit (TRU)-type lung adenocarcinomas (PMID: 28677170).

AHCYL1, adenosylhomocysteinase like 1, interacts with calcium channel inositol 1,4,5-trisphosphate receptor and activates multiple ion channels and ion transporters (PMID: 24518248). AHCYL1 fusions are observed with FGFR2 in cholangiocarcinomas (PMID: 24122810).
ZMYND19, zinc finger, MYND-type containing 19, is a zinc finger protein which binds to MCHR1and Tubulin, yet whose function remains unknown (PMID: 16039987).

PHF6, PHD finger protein 6, is involved in chromatin organization, interacts with several factors that regulate transcription, and plays a role in cell-cycle regulation via suppression of ribosomal RNA transcription (PMID: 23229552, PMID: 28607179, PMID: 26103525). PHF6 inactivating mutations have been observed in T-cell acute lymphoblastic leukemia and acute myeloid leukemia (PMID: 20228800, PMID: 21030981, PMID: 26103525).

ZC3H7B, zinc finger CCCH domain-containing protein 7B, has several protein-protein interaction domains and may function as a nuclear export signal (PMID: 23580382). ZC3H7B-BCOR fusions have been observed in endometrial stromal sarcomas with high-grade morphology (PMID: 29901520, PMID: 29192652), and in small blue round cell tumors (PMID: 26752546) and ossifying fibromyxoid tumors (PMID: 24285434).

CSF3R, colony stimulating factor 3 receptor, encodes a cytokine receptor regulating proliferation and differentiation of myeloid progenitor cells (PMID: 27789332). CSF3R mutations commonly occur in chronic neutrophilic leukemia and acute myeloid leukemia (PMID: 23896413, PMID: 30348809).

IRS2, insulin receptor substrate 2, is a member of the IRS family of intracellular adaptor proteins, which is involved in mediating IGF-IR signaling and functions in regulation of growth, metabolism (PMID: 17030631, PMID: 25200290), glucose uptake, cell migration, and cell invasion (PMID: 29669935). Overexpression and amplification of IRS2 are associated with colorectal cancer, breast cancer (PMID: 23594372, PMID: 23562473), and intrahepatic cholangiocarcinoma (PMID: 30250623) and gain of function mutations have been reported in pleomorphic invasive lobular breast carcinoma (PMID: 29669935).

ETS1, ETS proto-oncogene 1, transcription factor, encodes for an ETS family transcription factor involved in positive regulation of cytokines and chemokines (PMID: 20378371), promotion of angiogenic and extracellular matrix degradation, and is implicated in tumor invasiveness (PMID: 15574387, PMID: 22366814). ETS1 overexpression has been identified in several tumor types including breast (PMID: 12466970), ovarian (PMID: 11297247), and prostate cancer (PMID: 23064684).

NAPRT, nicotinate phosphoribosyltransferase 1, is an enzyme catalyzing NAD synthesis from nicotinic acid, therefore regulating cellular oxidative stress (PMID: 17604275). NAPRT1 is expressed in a wide variety of tumor cell lines (PMID: 26675378).

MSN, moesin, belongs to the ERM (Ezrin, Radixin, and Moesin) family, which is associated with cellular structure, adhesion and motility (PMID: 17594689). Fusion proteins involving MSN may result in constitutive kinase activity and have been reported in hematological cancers (PMID: 11310834).

LATS2, serine/threonine-protein kinase LATS2, is a negative regulator of YAP1 in the Hippo signaling pathway, which plays a role in organ size control and tumor suppression by restricting proliferation and promoting apoptosis. LATS2 plays a role as a tumor suppressor in human cancer (PMID: 24026096).

CD4, CD4 molecule, is a glycoprotein that recognizes MHC class II peptides on antigen-presenting cells, regulates activation of T-lymphocytes leading to proliferation and differentiation of effector T-cells, and plays a key role in adaptive immune response (PMID: 22474485, PMID: 8057386). CD4 expression is associated with poor survival in acute myeloid leukemia patients (PMID: 9436919).

C11orf95, chromosome 11 open reading frame 95, is an uncharacterized gene with limited information (UniProt.org). C11orf95 fusions with RELA are prognostic for aggressive supratentorial ependymomas (PMID: 29949764).

AFDN, afadin, adherens junction formation factor; encodes Afadin, which has roles in cell adhesion, migration, survival, and differentiation (PMID: 23481206). AFDN is a frequent binding partner for MLL in acute leukemias, and loss of Afadin expression is associated with poor prognosis in breast cancer (PMID: 20395419, PMID: 21478912).

EFNA4, ephrin-A4, is a plasma membrane protein, anchored through glycophosphatidylinositol (PMID: 23983218) to ephrin receptors (PMID: 15561600) and plays a role in cell adhesion and transendothelial migration (PMID: 19828693). Blockade of Efna4 may promote tumor regression in triple negative breast cancer and ovarian cancer (PMID: 26015513) and cytoplasmic localization has been correlated with prognosis in osteosarcoma (PMID: 20071790).

RECQL4, RecQ like helicase 4, is a RecQ family helicase that unwinds double-stranded DNA, therefore is involved in DNA repair and replication initiation (PMID: 24606147). RECQL4 mutations are associated with increased risk of developing lymphoma and osteosarcoma (PMID: 29080750).

CBFB, core-binding factor beta subunit, is a transcription factor (PMID: 31061501) of the non DNA-binding regulatory subunit that complexes with Runx1, Runx2, or Runx3 proteins to make up the core-binding factors that are involved in regulating hematopoiesis (PMID: 15156179). CBFB is frequently involved in chromosomal translocations, such as CBFB-MYH11 (PMID: 31399807, PMID: 31721036) in leukemia (PMID: 8351518) and sarcoma (PMID: 31671434), and CBFB mutations have been observed in breast cancer (PMID: 31061501).

FADD, Fas associated via death domain, is a cytoplasmic adaptor protein that associates with Fas and other death receptors and thus, plays a primary role in apoptotic signaling (PMID: 20576468). Decreased expression of FADD has been observed in acute myeloid leukemia (PMID: 15520222).

MET (c-MET), hepatocyte growth factor receptor, is a receptor tyrosine kinase, which activates MAPK, PI3K/AKT, SRC, and STAT pathways to promote cell proliferation, invasion and angiogenesis (PMID: 22128285). MET mutations have been identified in a variety of human cancers (PMID: 28603720).

OSBPL3, oxysterol binding protein-like 3, is an intracellular lipid receptor that plays a role in regulation of cell adhesion and actin cytoskeleton organization (PMID: 28881752, PMID: 25447204). Mutations in Osbpl3 have been observed in metastatic breast cancer (PMID: 28027327).

NSD2, nuclear receptor binding SET domain protein 2, is a histone methyltransferase that regulates gene transcription via chromatin remodeling (PMID: 18172012, PMID: 25188243, PMID: 27604143). NSD2 over expression has been reported in myeloma and in several solid tumor types (PMID: 18172012, PMID: 25188243, PMID: 27604143).
PLIN3, perilipin 3, is a lipid droplet type protein that rearranges liposomes to form small-lipid discs (PMID: 19451273). A PLIN3 fusion with BRAF was identified in melanoma (PMID: 23890088).

CYSLTR2 , cysteinyl leukotriene receptor 2, is a member of the rhodopsin-like family of G-protein coupled receptors that plays a role in inflammation, cellular migration, differentiation and may play a role in apoptosis (PMID: 27089179, PMID: 27150534, PMID: 20824707, PMID: 17909024). Overexpression of Cysltr2 has been observed in colon cancer (PMID: 17909024) and acute myeloid leukemia (PMID: 27258612).

PRKCQ, protein kinase C theta, is a serine/threonine protein kinase that is involved in immune response, transcription activation, and muscle and endothelial cell functions (PMID: 9617893). PRKCQ expression has been identified in leukemia (PMID: 12188914).

CX3CR1, CX3C chemokine receptor 1, binds the chemokine ligand, CX3CL1 (PMID: 30628679) and is involved in angiogenesis and the recruitment of leukocytes (PMID: 30310518). Overexpression of Cx3cr1 has been observed to promote metastasis in gastric cancer (PMID: 25482732), prostate cancer (PMID: 30066854), and breast cancer (PMID: 30310518).

KEAP1, kelch like ECH associated protein 1, binds Nrf2 and targets it for ubiquitin-mediated degradation, thereby negatively regulating the downstream cytoprotective activity of Nrf2 (PMID: 24142871, PMID: 27263465, PMID: 28523248). KEAP1 loss-of-function mutations have been identified in several tumor types, including lung and liver cancers (PMID: 24142871, PMID: 27263465, PMID: 29615460).

STK40, serine/threonine kinase 40, is a pseudokinase that plays an important role in endoderm and mesoderm differentiation and development, potentially through regulating MAPK and cJUN signaling (PMID: 28089446, PMID: 20080709, PMID: 31092598). STK40 overexpression has been identified in triple-receptor-negative breast cancer (PMID: 29854300).

H3C8, H3 clustered histone 8, encodes a member of the histone H3 family that plays a role in DNA repair and replication, and differentiation (PMID: 25003966). H3C8 is associated with poor prognosis in glioma patients (PMID: 30762207).

KDM4A, lysine demethylase 4A, is a Jumonji domain histone demethylase of H3K9 and H3K36, regulating gene transcription through chromatin remodeling to effect cell growth and differentiation (PMID: 24349617) and plays a role in hematopoietic stem cell maintenance (PMID: 31434704). KDM4A overexpression is commonly observed in ovarian cancer and in squamous cell carcinoma (PMID: 24349617, PMID: 29113308) and has also been implicated in prostatic intraepithelial tumors (PMID: 27767379).

FOXO1, forkhead box O1, encodes for a protein belonging to the family of forkhead box O transcription factors, which plays a role in multiple cellular processes including cell cycle arrest, apoptosis, and prevention of reactive oxygen species (PMID: 18715783). FOXO1 fusions with PAX3 are frequently observed in alveolar rhabdomyosarcoma (PMID: 24334454).

KDM1A, lysine demethylase 1A, is also known as LSD1, is a histone demethylase influencing histone modification and chromatin remodeling to activate or repress gene transcription (PMID: 15620353). KDM1A knockdown has been demonstrated to decrease proliferation and colony formation in both mouse and human AML cells (PMID: 22464800) and KDM1A promotes cancer progression in breast cancer, prostate cancer, and AML (PMID: 30518104).

MERTK, tyrosine-protein kinase Mer, binds ligands, LGALS3, TUB, TULP1 and GAS6, to activate downstream signaling pathways including ERK and AKT (PMID: 29554921) and plays a role in phagocytosis of apoptotic cells (PMID: 28369510). MERTK overexpression has been observed in mantle cell lymphoma (PMID: 29554921), glioblastoma multiforme (PMID: 29553850), gastric cancer (PMID: 29285287), and is associated with resistance to Braf inhibition in Braf mutant melanoma (PMID: 29050198).

SMARCB1, SWI/SNF related, matrix associated, actin dependent regulator of chromatin, subfamily b, member 1, is a member of the SWI/SNF chromatin remodeling complex and regulates transcription of several genes involved in cell proliferation (PMID: 23095836). Smarcb1 inactivation through loss is characteristic of atypical teratoid/rhabdoid tumors (PMID: 23095836), schwannomas (PMID: 28368924, PMID: 28824165), and sinonasal carcinomas (PMID: 29797680).

PIK3IP1, phosphoinositide-3-kinase-interacting protein 1, is a negative regulator of PI3K activity and may function as a tumor suppressor and negative regulator of T-cell activation (PMID:  22706993, PMID: 30429249). Altered regulation of Pik3ip1 has been observed to promote cell proliferation and migration of osteosarcoma cells in culture (PMID: 28549102).

FOXL2, forkhead box L2, encodes for a transcription factor that is a member of the forked-winged helix family and plays a role in ovary development (PMID: 21640373). FOXL2 is commonly mutated in granulosa-cell tumors (PMID: 19956657).

ALK, anaplastic lymphoma kinase, is a receptor in the insulin receptor superfamily and is a key regulator of neuronal development (PMID: 21502284) and also promotes cell proliferation through activation of MAPK and PI3K signaling pathways (PMID: 27573755). Alk activating mutations, rearrangements, and fusions have been identified in various cancers (PMID: 22649787), including EML4-ALK in non-small cell lung cancer (PMID: 30108712, PMID: 30194140), and a number of mutations confer resistance in the context of Alk fusions (PMID: 25749034, PMID: 21948233).

CCDC88A, coiled-coil domain containing 88A, (also known as Girdin) is a member of Girdin family of proteins and functions downstream of PI3K-AKT signaling, regulates cell motility and metastasis (PMID: 22308453). CCDC88A fusions with ALK have been observed in pediatric brain tumors (PMID: 25795305).

FYN, FYN proto-oncogene, Src family tyrosine kinase, is a non-receptor tyrosine kinase that plays a role in cell signaling, proliferation, differentiation, and migration, and has been implicated in metastasis and drug resistance (PMID: 26305432, PMID: 18991062). Over expression of FYN has been demonstrated in prostate and breast cancers (PMID: 26305432, PMID: 18991062).

PPEF1, protein phosphatase with EF-hand domain 1, is a serine-threonine phosphatase that contains an EF hand domain (PMID: 19662497) and may play a role in regulating Tp53 induction of apoptosis in response to genotoxic stress (PMID: 28051100). Overexpression of Ppef1 has been observed in colorectal, breast, prostate, liver, and lung cancers (PMID: 28051100).

CCNG1, cyclin-G1, is a cell-cycle checkpoint protein that promotes degradation of Tp53 (PMID: 25431954). CCNG1 altered expression may play a role in osteosarcoma (PMID: 29399167), pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma (PMID: 29458145), and ovarian cancer (PMID: 26872615, PMID: 26477861, PMID: 25981880).

TF, serotransferrin, is a glyoprotein that delivers iron to actively dividing cells and plays a role in cell growth, proliferation, differentiation, and apoptosis (PMID: 28849262, PMID: 15708745). Transferrin receptors are widely expressed on cancer cells, and therefore, targeting or modulating TF is an active area of investigation (PMID: 27784246, PMID: 30623814).

NF2, neurofibromin 2, is a tumor suppressor that inhibits cell proliferation and promotes apoptosis through regulating cell-cell contact and gene expression (PMID: 22482125). Germline inactivating mutations of NF2 cause neurofibromatosis 2, while somatic mutations of NF2 are identified in a wide variety of tumors (PMID: 24393766).

ASS1, argininosuccinate synthase 1, is a urea cycle enzyme involved in arginine biosynthesis (PMID: 24453997, PMID: 27452468). Decreased expression of ASS1 is associated with several tumor types, including melanoma and malignant pleural mesothelioma (PMID: 24453997, PMID: 27452468, PMID: 26560030).

CSF1R, macrophage colony-stimulating factor 1 receptor, is a tyrosine kinase and receptor for CSF1 and IL34, which upon ligand binding activates PI3K-AKT-mTOR, RAS-RAF-MEK-ERK and STAT signaling pathways (PMID: 22186992). CSF1R is expressed by tumor-associated macrophages to induce tumor promotion (PMID: 30065206) and therefore, a number of therapies to block Csf1r are under development (PMID: 28716061).

NAMPT, nicotinamide phosphoribosyltransferase, is an enzyme required for glycolysis because it catalyzes the formation of nicotinamide, which is the rate-limiting step in the synthesis of NAD, and also plays a role in metabolism, stress response and aging and the soluble for of Nampt is immunosuppressive (PMID: 30631755). Overexpression of Nampt has been observed in a number of tumor types, including colorectal, ovarian, breast, gastric, thyroid, prostate, and glioma (PMID: 30631755) and is associated with shorter survival in acute myeloid leukemia (PMID: 30692102).

DEPTOR, DEP domain containing MTOR-interacting protein, is an mTOR binding protein that negatively regulates signaling by mTORC1 and mTORC2 (PMID: 19446321, PMID: 29897294). Aberrant expression of Deptor has been observed in a variety of tumor types, but a recent meta-analysis shows Deptor expression does not correlate with prognosis (PMID: 30174446), however, it may mediate chemoresistance (PMID: 28267437).

PDCD4, programmed cell death protein 4, regulates transcript translation through Cap-dependent initiation and may play a role in apoptosis and negative regulation of cell proliferation (PMID: 30518628, PMID: 29806708). Decreased expression of Pdcd4 has been observed in prostate cancer (PMID: 30518628), glioma (PMID: 29921407), and may be diagnostic for colorectal cancer (PMID: 30243936).

TENM4, teneurin transmembrane protein 4, is a member of the Teneurin family of type II transmembrane proteins that plays a role in regulation of cell differentiation and axon guidance (PMID: 26188006, PMID: 24648313, PMID: 24344332). TENM4 over expression has been demonstrated in brain tumors, and fusions have been identified in breast cancer and neuroblastoma (PMID: 22841666, PMID: 23991058).

RSPO3, R-spondin 3, encodes for one of the secreted proteins in the TSR1-containing protein family, which plays a role in canonical Wnt signaling due to its furin repeat domains (PMID: 24980904). RSPO3 fusions with PTPRK have been frequently identified in colorectal cancer (PMID: 26924569) and decreased RSPO3 expression has been observed with prostate cancer invasiveness (PMID: 30987640), whereas overexpression of RSPO3 has been observed in bladder cancer (PMID: 30329043).

IRS1, insulin receptor substrate 1, encodes an adaptor protein that acts as a substrate for a variety of receptors including the insulin and insulin-like growth factor receptors, thereby mediating insulin signaling and subsequent PI3K signaling, and cytokine receptors, leading to JAK/STAT pathway signaling (PMID: 8384986, PMID: 15157524). Overexpression of IRS1 has been identified in pancreatic cancer (PMID: 8607861), hepatocellular carcinoma (PMID: 16127164), and breast cancer (PMID: 9815941).

PAK5, p21 (RAC1) activated kinase 5, is a group II member of the p21-activated kinase family of Serine/Threonine kinases, and plays a role in cell survival, proliferation, and migration (PMID: 26811660, PMID: 23685956). PAK5 over expression has been associated with several tumor types, including colorectal and hepatocellular cancers (PMID: 23685956, PMID: 26212009, PMID: 26811660).

BTF3L4, basic transcription factor 3-like 4, is a transcription factor with an unknown biological function (PMID: 26314551). BTF3L4 fusions with BRAF have been observed in solid tumors (PMID: 26314551).

NSD3, nuclear receptor binding SET domain protein 3, is a histone methyltransferase that regulates gene expression via chromatin remodeling (PMID: 23011637). NSD3 over expression has been reported in bladder cancer, lung cancer, liver cancer, and chronic myeloid leukemia (PMID: 23011637), and NSD3 amplification has been demonstrated in breast and lung cancers (PMID: 24874471).

GPC3, glypican 3, is a cell surface glycoprotein that plays a role in cell growth and differentiation (PMID: 30352677). Overexpression of Gpc3 is identified in hepatocellular carcinoma and is associated with poor prognosis (PMID: 29901640, PMID: 28621802, PMID: 29369198).

RBMS3, RNA binding motif single stranded interacting protein 3, interacts with c-Myc thereby playing  a role in replication, transcription, apoptosis, and cell cycle activity (PMID: 21844183). Downregulation of RBMS3 has been observed in various cancer types such as lung squamous cell carcinoma and esophageal squamous cell carcinoma (PMID: 25588924).

ESR1, estrogen receptor alpha, modulates response to estrogen and is used as a marker to predict response to endocrine therapy in breast cancer patients (PMID: 23542176, PMID: 26183887). ESR1 fusions are recurrent in breast cancer, and mutations in ESR1 have been associated with decreased response to endocrine therapy (PMID: 27372070, PMID: 26183887).

KMT2D, histone-lysine N-methyltransferase 2D, is a histone methyltransferase which methylates H3K4me and is involved in transcriptional activation, mostly during development and cell differentiation (PMID: 28669924, PMID: 24240169). KMT2D mutations are associated with various tumor types, including ESCC (PMID: 25151357), follicular lymphoma (PMID: 24362818), and lung (PMID: 28007623, PMID: 27873319).

EPS15, epidermal growth factor receptor pathway substrate 15, is involved in the internalization of receptor tyrosine kinases and assembly of clathrin-coated pits (UniProt.org). EPS15 fusions with BRAF have been observed in solid tumors (PMID: 26314551).

CD274, CD274 molecule, encodes for an immunomodulatory ligand (PD-L1), which once bound to its receptor, PD-1, results in inhibition of T-cell activation (PMID: 24551119). CD274 overexpression has been observed across multiple tumor types, which has been associated with CD274 amplification, specifically in Hodgkin's lymphoma (PMID: 20628145).

STAT5A, signal transducer and activator of transcription 5A, is a transcription factor that regulates proliferation and differentiation of hematopoietic cells and plays a role in mammary gland development (PMID: 23541951, PMID: 24416653). Activation of STAT5A is associated with prostate cancer, breast cancer, and hematological cancers (PMID: 21704724, PMID: 25333255).

BAP1, BRCA1 associated protein 1, belongs to the ubiquitin C-terminal hydrolase subfamily and interacts with the RING finger domain of the BRCA1 protein, resulting in deubiquitylation of BARD1 (PMID: 23550303) and is associated with genomic stability (PMID: 31747945). BAP1 germline mutations are associated with mesothelioma and melanoma (PMID: 23550303) and somatic mutations are highest in renal and endometrial cancers (PMID: 27283171).

CARM1, coactivator-associated arginine methyltransferase 1, is a type 1 arginine methyltransferase that acts in the regulation of transcription, pre-mRNA splicing, cell cycle progression and the DNA damage response. There are conflicting reports of Carm1 activity in normal and tumor cells, possibly due to different transcripts (PMID: 24921003), but overexpression has been correlated with invasive breast cancer and lung cancer (PMID: 23915145, PMID: 24211191).

CYP2D6, cytochrome P450 family 2 subfamily D polypeptide 6, is a member of the cytochrome P450 family of monooxygenases that catalyzes drug metabolism (PMID: 28480783). CYP2D6 variants have been associated with risks of various cancers (PMID: 22994728, PMID: 16550168).

GABRA6, gamma-aminobutyric acid type A receptor alpha6 subunit, encodes a protein that plays a role in physiological stress response (PMID: 15197399, PMID: 20109491). GABRA6 mutations have been identified in ovarian carcinoma (PMID: 21720365), and gliomas (PMID: 24120142).

ELL, elongation factor RNA polymerase II, is a component of the super elongation complex that increases the catalytic rate of RNA polymerase II (PMID: 10995463). A KMT2A - ELL  fusion has been demonstrated to transform primary myeloid progenitor cells, which eventually leads to acute myeloid leukemia in mouse models (PMID: 10995463).

USP42, ubiquitin specific peptidase 42, mediates deubiquitylation of target proteins, which leads to protein stabilization (PMID: 25336640). USP42 fusions have been identified in acute myeloid leukemia and lung adenocarcinoma (PMID: 24673627, PMID: 29472054).

CDKN1B (p27), cyclin-dependent kinase inhibitor 1B, regulates cell cycle progression and is involved in G1 arrest to function as a tumor suppressor, while altered Cdkn1b may promote oncogenesis (PMID: 28687353). Germline mutations in CDKN1B are associated with multiple endocrine neoplasia type IV (MEN4) and reduced expression and somatic mutations are associated with a variety of tumors, including lymphoma, breast, and endocrine (PMID: 23555276; PMID: 18354415; PMID: 28687353).

PRMT1, protein arginine N-methyltransferase 1, encodes a member of the protein arginine N-methyltransferase (PRMT) family and plays a role  in the post-translational modification of histones, embryonic development, and hematopoietic differentiation (PMID: 31853216). Expression of PRMT1 is associated with various tumor types (PMID: 23187807; PMID: 19414388; PMID: 22839530), including pancreatic cancer (PMID: 31520395).

HSF4, heat shock transcription factor 4, is a heat shock transcription factor family member that lacks the suppression of trimerization domain, allowing it to trimerize and bind to DNA in the absence of cellular stress (PMID: 10488131) and also regulates tissue-specific activation and repression of heat shock genes and has a role in lens cell differentiation (PMID: 10488131, PMID: 22528049). Overexpression of Hsf4 has been associated with decreased survival in colorectal cancer (PMID: 29131521).

CCNA2, cyclin-A2, interacts with CDK1 and CDK2 to regulate the cell cycle (PMID: 1312467, PMID: 24622579). Overexpression of Ccna2 has been observed in a variety of cancers, including tamoxifen resistance ER-positive breast cancer (PMID: 24622579).

DHX9, DExH-box helicase 9, encodes for a nucleotide triphosphate-dependent helicase protein that plays a role in a variety of regulatory processes, including DNA replication, transcription, translation, RNA processing and transport, and microRNA processing (PMID: 27034008). Overexpression of DHX9 has been observed in lung cancer and osteosarcoma (PMID: 27034008), and DHX9 fused to RAF1 has been identified in triple-negative breast cancer (PMID: 29203461).
MZT1, mitotic spindle organizing protein 1, regulates the function of the microtubule-organizing center (PMID: 24006493). An MZT1 fusion to BRAF has been identified in melanoma (PMID: 26314551).

RPS6KA4, ribosomal protein S6 kinase A4, is also known as MSK2 and is a mitogen and stress-activated kinase that phosphorylates several targets including CREB, ATF1, and H3, and plays a role in immunity (PMID: 18508628, PMID: 27376065). RPS6KA4 overexpression has been observed in squamous cell cervical cancer (PMID: 30756420).

GLI1, GLI family zinc finger 1, is a transcription factor acting in the Sonic Hedgehog signaling pathway of developmental regulation (PMID: 11001584). GLI1 amplification has been identified in glioma (PMID: 3563490), and is able to transform cells when coexpressed with adenovirus E1A (PMID: 1825351).

PLCG2, phospholipase C gamma 2, is an enzyme important in immune-receptor signaling transduction (PMID: 27542411, PMID: 25456276, PMID: 16204312). PLCG2 mutations have been demonstrated in cutaneous T-cell lymphoma and in inhibitor-resistant chronic lymphocytic leukemia (PMID: 27542411, PMID: 25456276).

EMC2, ER membrane protein complex subunit 2, encodes a member of the endoplasmic reticulum membrane complex, but its function is currently unknown (PMID: 26190106). A fusion with EMC2 and RSPO2 has been observed in gastric cancer (PMID: 30250044).

ARID1B, AT-rich interactive domain-containing protein 1B, is a member of the SWI/SNF chromatin remodeling complex and is involved in cell-cycle activation (PMID: 15170388). ARID1B mutations have been identified in several tumor types including, melanoma, gastric, colorectal, liver, neuroblastoma, and pancreatic (PMID: 27737960).

CHKA, choline kinase alpha, phosphorylates choline to phosphocholine, which is the first step in the synthesis of phosphatidylcholine for membranes (PMID: 19915674). Overexpression of Chka has been observed in breast, lung, colorectal, and prostate tumors (PMID: 29389115) and may correlate with higher grade breast cancer (PMID: 12082619).

SLC44A4, solute carrier family 44 member 4, (also referred to as CTL4) is a transport protein involved in thiamine pyrophosphate uptake (PMID: 27550944, PMID: 24379411). Aberrant SLC44A4 (CTL4) expression is associated with several tumor types, including prostate and colon cancer (PMID: 27550944).

RNF43, ring finger protein 43, is an E3 ubiquitin ligase that targets Frizzled receptors, resulting in lysosomal degradation of Frizzleds and negative regulation of Wnt signaling (PMID: 25460271). RNF43 mutations are associated with several tumor types, and are frequent in colorectal and endometrial cancer (PMID: 25460271, PMID:  25344691).

ERRFI1, ERBB receptor feedback inhibitor 1, encodes an adaptor/scaffold protein that plays a role in signal transduction, thereby facilitating the regulation of various signaling molecules, which may include members of the Erbb and Egfr family and the Hgf/Met family depending on the physiological condition in the cell (PMID: 17351343). Decreased ERRFI1 expression has been identified in lung squamous cell carcinoma and adenocarcinoma (PMID: 24573418), and breast cancer (PMID: 14871811).

JAK3, tyrosine-protein kinase JAK3, is a non-receptor protein tyrosine kinase involved in the interferon-alpha/beta/gamma pathway and is a member of the JAK/STAT signaling pathway (PMID: 15575979). JAK3 gain of function mutations are commonly observed in T-cell leukemias and lymphomas (PMID: 30079384, PMID: 30250904, PMID: 28284718).

SOX11, transcription factor SOX-11, is member of the group C of Sry-related high mobility group box family (PMID: 30517979) and is a neural transcription factor involved in neurogenesis and embryonic development (PMID: 29315911). Abnormal expression of Sox11 in B-cells has been observed in typical mantle cell lymphoma (PMID: 29738333, PMID: 30530749) and dysregulated expression has been reported in solid tumors including, ovarian carcinoma, basal-like breast carcinoma, glioma, medulloblastoma, prostate  cancer (PMID: 30530749) and hepatocellular carcinoma (PMID: 30517979).

RAB11FIP1, RAB11 family interacting protein 1, encodes for a member of the Rab family of proteins and has the ability to activate Ras, thereby potentially playing a role in cell differentiation and proliferation (PMID: 21143914), and along with binding partners, is also involved in cellular membrane trafficking (PMID: 15355514). Overexpression and amplification of RAB11FIP1 has been observed in breast cancer (PMID: 19620787) and elevated expression of Rab11fip1 has been associated with head and neck squamous cell carcinoma, colon cancer, and non-small cell lung carcinoma (PMID: 30761451).

MEF2D, myocyte-specific enhancer factor 2D, is a member of the MEF2 (Myocyte Enhancer Factor-2) family of transcription factors, which may activate or repress gene transcription, depending on interaction with co-activators or co-repressors (PMID: 29879430). Fusions of Mef2d have been identified in pediatric precursor B-cell acute lymphoblastic leukemia and correlated with worse clinical outcomes (PMID: 30171027).

Unknown gene is used in combination with unknown variant (Unknown, Unknown) to connect evidence to therapies and tumor types when a specific gene variant has not been identified in the cited literature.

APP, amyloid beta precursor protein, is a transmembrane protein that is cleaved to form peptides with a variety of functions, including cell growth and cell adherence (PMID: 25491510). A fusion of APP with NRG1 has been identified in pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma (PMID: 29802158) and overexpression in breast cancer cell lines promotes cell proliferation (PMID: 25491510).

HSPA5, endoplasmic reticulum chaperone BiP, is an endoplasmic reticulum chaperone of the Hsp70 protein family (PMID: 28286085) that plays a role in regulation of the unfolded protein response (PMID: 27791469). Overexpression of Hspa5 has been observed in breast, prostate, lung, and liver cancer, where it may promote proliferation and metastasis  (PMID: 28286085).

PTPRD, receptor-type tyrosine-protein phosphatase delta, is a tumor suppressor, which plays a role in cell growth, adhesion, migration and survival (PMID: 25113440). PTPRD is inactivated in a variety of solid tumors (PMID: 19478061).

VEGFD, vascular endothelial growth factor D, is a member of the platelet-derived growth factor/vascular endothelial growth factor (PDGF/VEGF) family that regulates angiogenesis and lymphangiogenesis (PMID: 28087639). FIGF has been associated with prognosis of colon, bladder, ovarian, breast and lung cancers (PMID: 27730400, PMID: 26241709, PMID: 23915006, PMID: 23054001, PMID: 21161269).

GATA6, GATA binding protein 6, is a member of the GATA family of zinc finger transcription factors, that plays a role in differentiation of endodermal and mesodermal tissues during embryogenesis, leading to formation of the gut, lung, and heart (PMID: 29106391). Aberrant expression of Gata6 may be prognostic for decreased survival in ovarian cancer (PMID: 30633927) and gastric cancer (PMID: 30674866), and is frequently amplified in gastric cancer (PMID: 29106391).

MED12, mediator complex subunit 12, is a subunit of Mediator, a complex involved in regulating expression of most RNA polymerase II transcripts (PMID: 24123922). MED12 acts in Gli3-dependent Sonic hedgehog signaling and epigenetic silencing of genes, and is mutated in several cancers (PMID: 24123922).

MORC2, MORC family CW-type zinc finger 2, is a member of the MORC family of proteins and functions in chromatin remodeling, DNA repair, cell-cycle regulation, and cell differentiation, and plays a role in lipogenesis and adipogenesis (PMID: 29620211, PMID: 27791268, PMID: 30644437, PMID: 24286864). MORC2 mutations have been identified in triple-negative breast cancer (PMID: 30093560), and colorectal cancer with microsatellite instability (PMID: 25117815), and MORC2 overexpression has been demonstrated in liver cancer (PMID: 29620211).

SEPTIN6, septin 6, s a member of the septin family of GTP-binding cytoskeletal proteins and plays a role in multivesicular body biogenesis (PMID: 25380047) and organization of the cytoskeleton (PMID: 21544625). A KMT2A-SEPT6 fusion has been identified in acute myeloid leukemia (PMID: 16843108, PMID: 16314519).
NKAIN4, Na+/K+ transporting ATPase interacting 4, is a transmembrane protein demonstrated to interact with the beta subunit of Na,K-ATPase in cell based assays (PMID: 17606467).

FLT4, fms related receptor tyrosine kinase 4, encodes a tyrosine kinase receptor for VEGFC and VEGFD and plays a role in the regulation of angiogenesis and lymphangiogenesis (PMID: 11114740). FLT4 expression is associated with cancer metastases (PMID: 11718224) in hepatocellular carcinoma (PMID: 31529503).

LY75, lymphocyte antigen 75, is a member of the mannose receptor family that is involved in endocytosis and antigen presentation, and plays a role in the maturation of immune cells, epithelial to mesenchymal transition, cellular proliferation, migration and invasion (PMID: 26871602, PMID: 26039988, PMID: 22988114, PMID: 12223280, PMID: 9178815). Overexpression of LY75 has been demonstrated in various solid tumors, including breast and colon cancer, and hematologic cancers (PMID: 31227646).

BMP4, bone morphogenetic protein 4, is a member of the transforming growth factor beta family involved in regulation of cell proliferation, cell differentiation, and epithelial-mesenchymal transition (PMID: 28987388). Overexpression of Bmp4 has been observed in hepatocellular carcinoma (PMID: 28987388), colorectal cancer (PMID: 28611046), and thyroid carcinoma (PMID: 28214211).

PTCH1, patched 1, is the receptor for secreted hedgehog ligands, which is involved in embryonic development and tumorigenesis (PMID: 29274272). PTCH1 mutations are associated with basal cell carcinoma (PMID: 29165358).

MAD1L1, MAD1 mitotic arrest deficient-like 1, is a spindle checkpoint factor that regulates chromosomal segregation (PMID: 11980658). MAD1L1 mutations are commonly identified in several types of cancer (PMID: 11423979).

SPANXA1, sperm protein associated with the nucleus on the X chromosome A, is a cancer testis antigen (CTA) that localizes to the nuclear envelope and plays a role in spermatogenesis (PMID: 27323831). Aberrant expression of Spanxa1 has been observed in lung adenocarcinoma, melanoma, bladder carcinoma, myeloma, head and neck squamous cell carcinoma, colorectal cancer, and prostate cancer (PMID: 27323831).

RBPMS, RNA-binding protein with multiple splicing, is a member of RRM family of RNA-binding proteins that binds poly(A) plus RNA and forms ribonucleoprotein complexes with messenger RNA, and regulates axonal branching and synapse formation (PMID: 24318667, PMID: 23785151, PMID: 25651939). A fusion of RBPMS with NTRK3 has been observed in uterine spindle cell sarcoma (PMID: 29553955).

H3-3A, H3 histone family member 3A, encodes for the H3.3 histone, which incorporates into chromatin independent of the DNA synthesis process and appears to play a role in developmental and transcriptional processes (PMID: 25773741). H3-3A mutations have been identified in pediatric tumors including glioblastomas and giant cell tumors of the bone (PMID: 23079654, PMID: 24162739).

FGFR3, fibroblast growth factor receptor 3, is a receptor tyrosine kinase activated upon binding of the FGF ligand, which activates RAS-MAPK and PI3K-AKT pathways (PMID: 22508544). Altered function of FGFR3 in cancer may lead to increased cell proliferation and decreased apoptosis (PMID: 22508544) and mutations and fusions are commonly observed in bladder cancer (PMID: 30975452, PMID: 23175443).

TPM4, tropomyosin 4, is a member of the tropomyosin family of actin-interacting proteins, which plays a role in regulation of actin function in the cytoskeleton (PMID: 26240174). TPM4-ALK fusions have been identified in inflammatory myofibroblastic tumors (PMID: 10934142).

CIP2A, cell proliferation regulating inhibitor of protein phosphatase 2A, plays a role in regulating PP2A activity thereby indirectly influencing cell cycle progression (PMID: 24214971). CIP2A overexpression and amplification have been reported in numerous cancer types (PMID: 24214971, PMID: 25015035).

IKBKE, inhibitor of kappa light polypeptide gene enhancer in B-cells, kinase epsilon, is an I-kappaB family member that regulates activation of NF-kappaB signaling in response to inflammation and infection (PMID: 15102433, PMID: 26025939). IKBKE is over expressed in several tumor types, and is amplified in triple-negative breast cancer (PMID: 26025939, PMID: 25365225).

KDM2A, lysine (K)-specific demethylase 2A, is a histone demethylase responsible for maintaining centromere integrity, influencing histone modification, and affecting chromatin remodeling to activate or repress gene transcription (PMID: 19001877). Overexpression, amplification, and Kdm1a function has been associated with proliferation of lung cancer cells (PMID: 24482232), breast cancer progression (PMID: 26207617), and inhibition of Tet2 in TNBC (PMID: 28785073), respectively.

HMGN2P46, high mobility group nucleosomal binding domain 2 pseudogene 46, is a prostate specific, androgen repressed gene (PMID: 18594527). HMGN2P46 fusions are commonly found in prostate cancer (PMID: 15027122).

APOBEC3G, apolipoprotein B mRNA editing enzyme, catalytic polypeptide-like 3G, is a cytidine deaminase that induces C-to-U mutations in DNA, functioning in host defense against retroviruses and to inhibit retrotransposons (PMID: 22001110). APOBEC3G expression correlates with poor prognosis in colon cancer patients with hepatic metastasis (PMID: 24753761) and overexpression has been observed in uterine cervical intraepithelial neoplasia (PMID: 28590025).

SS18, SS18, nBAF chromatin remodeling complex subunit, is a transcription activator that may be involved in regulating epithelial morphogenesis (PMID: 18835266). SS18 fusions with SSX genes are commonly identified in synovial sarcoma (PMID: 25438927).

NEK8, NIMA-related kinase 8, is a serine/threonine kinase of the never-in-mitosis A (NIMA) family which regulates mitotic entry (PMID: 23132929). NEK8 mutations have been identified in renal and breast cancers (PMID: 25451921, PMID: 15019993).

DAZAP1, DAZ associated protein 1, is an RNA binding protein that plays a role in transcription, and translation, and regulates alternative splicing, and cellular migration and growth (PMID: 24452013, PMID: 21576381, PMID: 18391021, PMID: 15744350). A fusion with MEF2D and DAZAP1 has been observed in B-cell acute lymphoblastic leukemia (PMID: 27428428).

PTPN1, protein tyrosine phosphatase, non-receptor type 1, dephosphorylates protein substrates to regulate signaling involved in multiple cellular processes including proliferation, survival, and glucose metabolism, and has both tumor suppressor and promoter functions (PMID: 19782770, PMID: 27855221, PMID: 16198645). PTPN1 mutations have been demonstrated in thyroid and colon cancers, as well as B-cell and Hodgkin lymphomas (PMID: 27855221, PMID: 24531327).
KLC1, kinesin light chain 1, is a microtubule motor protein that plays a role in cargo transport (PMID: 11144355). KLC1 fusion with ALK has been identified in lung cancer (PMID: 22347464).

SH3GLB1, SH3 domain containing GRB2 like, endophilin B1, encodes a protein that interacts with Bax and thereby, may play a role in apoptotic signaling (PMID: 11161816). A fusion with FGFR2 and SH3GLB1 has been identified in intrahepatic cholangiocarcinoma (PMID: 30420614).

HDAC3, histone deacetylase 3, is a member of the class I HDAC family that functions in deacetylation of histone and non-histone proteins to repress transcription (PMID: 30472601, PMID: 30096875) and plays a role in inflammation (PMID: 29498635). Overexpression of Hdac3 has been observed in high-grade glioma (PMID: 30053564), in invasive ductal breast cancer (PMID: 29680858), in colorectal cancer (PMID: 29558042), and in classical Hodgkin lymphoma (PMID: 29481474).

CCNB1, G2/mitotic-specific cyclin-B1, is a regulatory subunit of cyclin-dependent kinase 1 (CDK1) and plays a role in the regulation of the cell cycle (PMID: 27030811). CCNB1 overexpression has been demonstrated in a variety of solid tumors (PMID: 27030811), has been associated with decreased survival in glioblastoma (PMID: 29901201) and may be a marker for hormone therapy resistance in ER-positive breast cancer (PMID: 25044212).

AGO3, argonaute RISC catalytic component 3, is a regulator of RNA mediated gene silencing (RNAi) in cells (PMID: 18771919). AGO3 has been demonstrated to be downregulated in hepatocellular cancer (PMID: 23398123).

SEC61G, Sec61 translocon gamma subunit, is a component of the Sec61 complex that regulates protein translocation through ER membrane (PMID: 24497544). SEC61G fusion has been identified in pediatric ependymoma (PMID: 29092923).

NUMA1, nuclear mitotic apparatus protein 1, is a nuclear matrix component that regulates mitotic spindle dynamic and nuclei reassembly after mitosis (PMID: 20137953). NUMA1 fusions have been identified in inflammatory myofibroblastic tumor and myeloproliferative neoplasm (PMID: 29439172, PMID: 28449810), overexpression of Numa1 has been detected in epithelial ovarian cancer (PMID: 22719996).

GRIPAP1, GRIP1-associated protein 1, is a neuron-specific endosome protein that promotes endosome maturation recycling and regulates synaptic transmission and plasticity through AMPA receptor trafficking, and acts as a scaffold protein in the JNK signaling pathway (PMID: 28285821, PMID: 15897011, PMID: 17761173). A fusion of GRIPAP1 with NTRK1 has been observed in lung adenocarcinoma (PMID: 28235761).

BCR, BCR activator of RhoGEF and GTPase, is a serine-threonine protein kinase, which may be involved in cell regulation and signaling (PMID: 15494376). Fusion proteins of BCR-ABL1 result in constitutive kinase activity and have been reported in various cancers (PMID: 18851712).

RSPO1, R-spondin 1, encodes for one of the secreted proteins in the TSR1-containing protein family, which plays a role in canonical Wnt signaling and ovarian development (PMID: 27270435). RSPO1 amplification has been identified in ovarian cancer and loss of function mutations in squamous cell carcinoma (PMID: 27270435).

PTPRT, protein tyrosine phosphatase receptor type T, is a member of the type IIB receptor protein tyrosine phosphatase subfamily, and acts as a tumor suppressor by dephosphorylating proteins involved in cell proliferation, migration, growth, and survival (PMID: 17360477, PMID: 20133777, PMID: 21517784). PTPRT inactivating mutations are associated with colorectal, lung, and gastric cancers (PMID: 15155950).

TPM3, tropomyosin 3, is a member of the tropomyosin family of actin-interacting proteins, which regulates actin function and plays an essential role in embryonic development (PMID: 23904035, PMID: 26240174). TPM3-NTRK1 fusions are recurrent in colorectal cancer, and additional fusions have been identified in other tumor types (PMID: 24962792, PMID: 26773439, PMID: 26770062).

WEE1, WEE1 G2 checkpoint kinase, is a tyrosine kinase that phosphorylates and inactivates the Cdk1-cyclin B comples, resulting in cell cycle arrest which allows DNA repair (PMID: 27427153). Altered Wee1 expression level has been reported in various cancers (PMID: 27427153).

IRF2BP2, interferon regulatory factor 2 binding protein 2, is regulated by IRF2 to repress transcription (PMID: 12799427) and may function in B-cell differentiation (PMID: 27016798). IRF2BP2 fusions with NTRK1 have been reported in thyroid cancer (PMID: 29466156) and with RARA in acute promyelocytic leukemia (PMID: 27872498).
PYCR3, pyrroline-5-carboxylate reductase 3, is an cytoplasmic enzyme that plays a role in proline biosynthesis through conversion of ornithine to proline (PMID: 23024808).

XRCC5, X-ray repair cross complementing 5, is a family member of the XRCC genes that is involved in DNA non-homologous end joining (PMID: 15279796). XRCC5 polymorphism may be a risk factor in breast cancer (PMID: 23098447).

FEN1, flap endonuclease 1, belongs to the Rad2 structure-specific nuclease family (PMID: 20929870) and plays a role in DNA replication, DNA repair, telomere maintenance, and genomic stability (PMID: 28187440). Overexpression of Fen1 may be a marker of genomic instability and poor prognosis in pancreatic adenocarcinoma (PMID: 29735403) and NSCLC (PMID: 29037854).
ALOX12B, arachidonate 12-lipoxygenase, 12R type, encodes the 12R-LOX enzyme, which oxygenates arachidonic acid and is required for epidermal barrier function (PMID: 23954555, PMID: 24021977).

IL3RA, interleukin 3 receptor subunit alpha, also referred to as CD123, is the IL-3-specific subunit of the IL-3 receptor, which functions in proliferation and survival of hematopoietic cells (PMID: 24513123, PMID: 14671644). IL3RA (CD123) over expression is associated with several hematological tumor types, including B-cell acute lymphocytic leukemia and acute myeloid leukemia (PMID: 24513123).

CBLB, Cbl proto-oncogene B, is a ubiquitin ligase that negatively regulates receptor tyrosine kinase signaling through targeted degradation of active kinases, and is a key regulator of the immune system (PMID: 25477533). CBLB mutations have been observed in myeloid neoplasms, and loss of CBLB in mouse models results in increased anti-tumor immunity (PMID: 19901108, PMID: 25477533).

ATF7IP, activating transcription factor 7 interacting protein is a transcriptional cofactor that can act as an activator or repressor (PMID: 19106100). An ATF7IP-JAK2 fusion is observed in acute lymphoblastic leukemia (PMID: 25207766).

ARHGEF2, rho guanine nucleotide exchange factor 2, promotes the exchange of GDP for GTP to activate Rho-GTPases and plays a role in microtubule and actin cytoskeleton dynamics (PMID: 28453519, PMID: 29089450). ARHGEF2-NTRK1 fusions have been associated with glioblastoma and multiple myeloma (PMID: 25384085, PMID: 29654269) and altered expression of Arhgef2 could play a role in RAS driven pancreatic cancers (PMID: 28656876, PMID: 27835861).

EPCAM, epithelial cell adhesion molecule, is a glycoprotein that mediates cell-cell adhesion and regulates cell proliferation and differentiation (PMID: 23618806). Germline deletion of EPCAM is associated with Lynch syndrome and overexpression of EPCAM has been associated with poor prognosis in a variety of cancers (PMID: 23891921, PMID: 23618806).

FGFR1, fibroblast growth factor receptor 1, is a receptor tyrosine kinase activated upon binding of the FGF ligand, which activates RAS-MAPK and PI3K-AKT pathways (PMID: 22508544). Altered function of Fgfr1 may lead to increased cell proliferation and decreased apoptosis (PMID: 22508544) and amplification and/or overexpression has been identified in colorectal cancer (PMID: 30181810), gastric cancer (PMID: 29976636), and breast cancer (PMID: 30119151).

NR4A1, nuclear receptor subfamily 4 group A member 1, is an orphan nuclear receptor that functions as transcription factor to regulate genes involved in several cellular processes including cell migration, metabolism, and survival, and also binds to Bcl-2 to induce apoptosis (PMID: 25555471, PMID: 25376494, PMID: 30272297). NR4A1 overexpression has been identified in several tumor types including rhabdomyosarcoma (PMID: 27144436), breast cancer (PMID: 24584437), and colorectal cancer (PMID: 25064356).

GNAO1, G protein subunit alpha o1, is a subunit of the heterotrimeric G protein, which plays a role in transducing cellular signals (PMID: 24366063). Hypermethylation of GNAO1 and subsequent down regulation of expression may play a role in promoting tumorigenesis in hepatocellular carcinoma (PMID: 29709639, PMID: 23984917), however in gastric cancer, overexpression of Gnao1 may correlate with poor prognosis (PMID: 24366063).

KDM5B, lysine (K)-specific demethylase 5B, is a histone demethylase regulating gene transcription through chromatin modification to affect cell growth and proliferation. Abnormal KDM5B expression has been reported in multiple cancer types including breast, prostate, bladder and lung (PMID: 24937458).

H3-3B, H3 histone family member 3B, encodes the H3.3 histone variant, which is a component of the nucleosome, and plays a role in transcriptional regulation and genomic stability (PMID: 27894815, PMID: 25773741). H3-3B mutations are associated with chondroblastoma, and have been identified in clear-cell chondrosarcoma, and osteosarcoma (PMID: 24162739).

SOX6, SRY-box 6, is a member SRY superfamily of transcription factors and plays a role in regulation of cell proliferation and differentiation (PMID: 21495113, PMID: 23731550). Expression of SOX6 has been demonstrated to be altered in several tumor types, including glioma, esophageal squamous cell carcinoma, and hepatocellular carcinoma (PMID: 15696967, PMID: 21084391, PMID: 23731550).

MDS2, myelodysplastic syndrome 2 translocation associated, is expressed in peripheral  blood  leukocytes, spleen, thymus, kidney, pancreas, and lung (PMID: 12203785). A ETV6-MDS2 fusion has been identified in myelodysplastic syndrome (PMID: 12203785).

CDK1, cyclin dependent kinase 1, encodes for a protein necessary to carry out the process of cell division, specifically, driving the cells through the G2 phase and mitosis (PMID: 22355113). Overexpression of CDK1 has been associated with a poor prognosis in epithelial ovarian cancer (PMID: 25910705) while CDK1 loss has been linked to a poor prognosis and chemotherapeutic resistance in lung cancer (PMID: 21887332).

MDC1, mediator of DNA damage checkpoint 1, is an adaptor protein that regulates the assembly of DNA damage foci in response to DNA damage (PMID: 21326949). Mutations of MDC1 have been associated with poor prognosis in breast cancer patients (PMID: 28513990).

IL7R, interleukin 7 receptor, functions as part of the receptor complex for interleukin 7 and thymic stromal lymphopoietin, and is involved in development of T-cells (PMID: 21892159, PMID: 21536738). Mutations in IL7R are associated with acute leukemias (PMID: 21892159, PMID: 21536738).

SDHA, succinate dehydrogenase [ubiquinone] flavoprotein subunit, mitochondrial, is the major catalytic subunit in mitochondrial complex II that catalyzes electron transfer from succinate to ubiquinone (PMID: 21771581). SDHA loss of function mutations have been identified in paragangliomas (PMID: 24781757, PMID: 20484225) and gastrointestinal stromal tumors (PMID: 24781757, PMID: 23730622).

MGA, MAX dimerization protein MGA, is a transcription factor with dual specificity that can form a heterodimer with Max and regulate Myc target gene (PMID: 10601024, PMID: 16908182). MGA mutations have been identified in lung cancer (PMID: 24362264), and MGA-NUTM1 has been identified in sarcoma (PMID: 30723300, PMID: 30552129).

CXCL1, growth-regulated alpha protein, is a chemoattractive chemokine that binds the CXCR2 receptor (PMID: 28455419) to promote angiogenesis (PMID: 30479461) and recruitment of immune cells to the tumor microenvironment (PMID: 30319622). Overexpression of Cxcl1 has been observed in colorectal cancer (PMID: 30479461), in premetastatic liver where it recruits myeloid-derived suppressor cells (PMID: 28455419), and may be associated with decreased survival in oral squamous carcinoma (PMID: 30616781).

SPEN, spen family transcriptional repressor, acts acts as a negative transcriptional regulator of ESR1 (PMID: 26297734), plays a hormone independent role in primary cilia formation and cell migration (PMID: 28877752), and promotes beta-catenin pathway activity (PMID: 17234755). SPEN mutations and copy number loss have been identified in ER-positive breast cancer (PMID: 26297734), and increased expression levels have been reported in colorectal cancer (PMID: 17234755).

CCND1, G1/S-specific cyclin-D1, interacts with CDK4 and CDK6 to regulate the cell-cycle in transition from G1 to S phase (PMID: 28611330, PMID: 27695879). Amplification and/or overexpression of CCND1 has been associated with many tumor types, including breast, lung, liver, colorectal cancer, and mantle cell lymphoma (PMID: 28611330), where overexpression of Ccnd1 may promote tumorigenesis (PMID: 19917254).

ETFA, electron transfer flavoprotein alpha subunit, is an electron acceptor for a number of dehydrogenases (UniProt.org). An ETFA fusion with BRAF has been observed in colorectal cancer (PMID: 26314551).
FIP1L1, factor interacting with PAPOLA and CPSF1, contributes to poly(A) site processing (PMID: 14749727). FIP1L1 fusions play an important role in the pathogenesis of leukemia (PMID: 24763514).

IGFBP5, insulin like growth factor binding protein 5, is a member of the insulin-like growth factor-binding protein superfamily that binds to Igf1 and interferes with Igf signaling, affecting cell growth, survival, and motility (PMID: 10605625, PMID: 22313597). IGFBP5 expression has been identified in breast, ovarian, pituitary, cervical cancer and glioblastoma (PMID: 22313597).

AURKB, aurora B kinase, is a serine-threonine protein kinase, which plays a role in the separation of daughter chromatids during cell division (PMID: 28095398). During cytokinesis, AURKB dependent abscission checkpoint delays membrane abscission to avoid DNA damage and aneuploidy in cells with chromosome segregation defects (PMID: 24814515).  AURKB also functions in regulation of genomic stability (PMID: 28095398).

FGFR1, fibroblast growth factor receptor 1, is an oncogenic receptor tyrosine kinase (RTK) activated upon binding of the FGF ligand, which activates RAS-MAPK,  PI3K-AKT pathways and STAT-dependent pathways (PMID: 22508544; PMID: 28558758). Altered function of FGFR1 may lead to increased cell proliferation and decreased apoptosis (PMID: 22508544; PMID: 29858603).

GATA4, GATA binding protein 4, encodes a zinc-finger type transcription factor that plays a role in development of the heart (PMID: 29111206), and multiple endoderm derived organs including liver and pancreas (PMID: 19028990, PMID: 16079152). Gata4 hypermethylation has been identified in multiple tumor types including ovarian cancer (PMID: 28241454), gastric carcinoma (PMID: 20222162), and glioblastoma (PMID: 23320456), and overexpression has been identified in pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma (PMID: 19918328).

VEGFC, vascular endothelial growth factor C, is a secreted ligand that binds to Kdr (Vegfr2), Flt4 (Vegfr3), and the neuropilin family receptors (PMID: 25888649). Elevated Vegfc expression has been associated with lymphangiogenesis and lymph node metastasis in breast cancer (PMID: 25888649).

SF1, splicing factor 1, plays a role in spliceosome assembly and regulation of alternative splicing (PMID: 26420826, PMID: 21062807, PMID: 17383426). SF1 mutations have been observed in thyroid cancer (PMID: 27010584) and acute lymphoblastic leukemia (PMID: 28245838).

KLF4, Krueppel-like factor 4, is a transcription factor that regulates cell proliferation, metabolism, and maintenance of pluripotency (PMID: 31101597, PMID: 31141693) and acts as both an activator and repressor (PMID: 24551169). KLF4 expression has been associated with various tumor types (PMID: 25341045; PMID: 24551169; PMID: 23722653, PMID: 30540935) and may be oncogenic or a tumor suppressor, depending on the tumor type (PMID: 31101597), and KLF4 mutations have been observed in secretory meningiomas (PMID: 23404370).

OGA, O-GlcNAcase, is also known as meningioma expressed antigen 5 (MGEA5) and is a glycosidase that catalyzes the removal of the sugar moiety, O-GlcNAc, from proteins (PMID: 24769077). A FGFR2-MGEA5 fusion has been identified in intrahepatic cholangiocarcinoma (PMID: 24550739) and OGA rearrangements have been observed in myxoinflammatory fibroblastic sarcoma (PMID: 26980036, PMID: 24705316).

TMEM59, transmembrane protein 59, regulates glycosylation and secretion of the amyloid precursor protein (PMID: 20427278), promotes autophagy in response to bacteria infection (PMID: 23376921), and facilitates Wnt signaling through signalosome formation (PMID: 29632210). Loss of TMEM59 regulation has been associated with gastric cancer progression (PMID: 30778372).

MFSD5, major facilitator superfamily domain containing 5, is a membrane transporter involved in energy regulation (PMID: 27272503). MFSD5 is identified as a putative fusion partner of NUP98 in an acute myeloid leukemia patient (PMID: 19665072).

BCL6, BCL6 transcription repressor, functions as a transcriptional repressor in germinal center B cells, playing a role in B-lymphocyte development, and is critical for cell survival and proliferation (PMID: 20498019, PMID: 31788471). Increased expression of BCL6 has been associated with both solid and hematological malignancies including DLBCL, neuroblastoma, breast cancer (PMID: 24917186), and B-cell acute lymphoblastic leukemia (PMID: 31395741).

STAT5B, signal transducer and activator of transcription 5B, is a transcription factor that regulates hematopoietic proliferation, differentiation, and apoptosis (PMID: 24416653). STAT5B activation is associated with prostate and hematological cancers (PMID: 24416653, PMID: 24573384, PMID: 18508994).

HSF2, heat shock transcription factor 2, is a heat shock transcription factor family member that interacts with HSF1 to regulate cytoprotective gene expression in response to stress (PMID: 25202032) and regulates aerobic glycolysis (PMID: 31497345). HSF2 expression has been correlated with poor prognosis in hepatocellular carcinoma (PMID: 31497345).

AHCYL2, adenosylhomocysteinase like 2, regulates the activity of ionic transporter NBCe1-B, and may play a role in intracellular pH regulation and dendritic cell differentiation (PMID: 27382360, PMID: 11904675). AHCYL2 fusion with BRAF has been identified in cutaneous melanoma (PMID: 28512244).

PRDM9, PR/SET domain 9, is a histone methyltransferase that trimethylates H3K4 ((H3K4me3) during meiotic prophase and controls the activation of recombination hot spots (PMID: 24634223) and functions as an epigenetic regulator (PMID: 27153352). Allelic variants of PRDM9 are associated with childhood leukemias (PMID: 24754746; PMID: 23222848) and PRDM9 overexpression (PMID: 30341163) and mutations have been observed in head and neck squamous cell carcinoma (PMID: 31848333) and several other solid tumor types (PMID: 30347759).

CD28, T-cell-specific surface glycoprotein CD28, is a co-stimulatory molecule constitutively expressed on T-cells and competes with the co-inhibitory molecule, CTLA4, for binding to CD80 and CD86 (PMID: 28102259) and also promotes IL2 production and T-cell survival through upregulation of BCL2L1 (BCL-XL) (PMID: 30565239). Activation of CD28 is a currently under investigation for immunotherapy in cancer (PMID: 29783736).

PRDM2, PR domain zinc finger protein 2, is a histone methyltransferase that encodes two proteins Riz1 and Riz2 (PMID: 27983647). PRDM2 lies in a region of chromosome 1p that is often deleted in tumors and therefore, Prdm2/Riz may function as a tumor suppressor in various tumor types, including testicular germ cell tumors (PMID: 21369371; PMID: 20159667; PMID: 18712668; PMID: 27983647).

H3C7, H3 clustered histone 7, encodes a member of the canonical histone 3 family that may play a role in nucleosome assembly, and DNA replication and repair (PMID: 21263457). Mutations in H3C7 have been identified in acute myeloid leukemia (PMID: 31253791), and hypermethylation has been demonstrated in hepatocellular carcinoma (PMID: 28514750).

CDKN1A, cyclin-dependent kinase inhibitor 1, also known as p21, is activated by Tp53 and may be the mediator of Tp53 inhibition of cell proliferation and induction of apoptosis (PMID: 10090408) and functions in the DNA damage response (PMID: 20096807). Loss of Cdkn1a may enable cell proliferation and migration in gastric (PMID: 29602637), liver (PMID: 29408622), bladder (PMID: 29602637), and osteosarcoma cancers (PMID: 29115549).

REL, REL proto-oncogene, NF-kB subunit, encodes a part of the NF-kB dimer, which acts as a transcription factor to enable proliferation, growth, survival, and maturation of B and T-cells (PMID: 22207895), regulate fibrosis, wound healing, and inflammation, and, in some contexts, support transformation (PMID: 26757421, PMID: 31277415). Amplification of Rel is associated with both B-cell and T-cell malignancies (PMID: 22207895), and nuclear accumulation of Rel has been identified in breast cancer (PMID: 10713699).

WASF2, WAS protein family member 2, encodes for a member of the WASP, Wiskott-Aldrich syndrome protein, family of proteins and plays a role in cell migration, and cell proliferation, differentiation, and apoptosis via complex formation with PKA (PMID: 21119216). A fusion with WASF2 and FGR has been identified in melanoma, ovarian cancer, and lung squamous cell carcinoma (PMID: 25204415).

ATG7, ubiquitin-like modifier-activating enzyme ATG7, is an E1-like activating enzyme involved in autophagy, a process involved in lysosome degradation (PMID: 29311554). ATG7 fusions with BRAF and RAF1 have been identified in advanced solid tumors (PMID: 28512244) and pleomorphic xanthoastrocytoma (PMID: 27624885), respectively.

ZNRF3, E3 ubiquitin-protein ligase ZNRF3, is a E3 ubiquitin ligase that negatively regulates the Wnt receptor pathway by degrading frizzled and LRP6 (PMID: 22575959). ZNRF3 is a putative tumor suppressor that has been observed to have decreased expression in papillary thyroid carcinoma (PMID: 27448298) and mutations have been reported in colorectal cancer (PMID: 27661107).

NCOA2, nuclear receptor coactivator 2, interacts with nuclear receptors to coactivate downstream transcription, and plays a role in regulation of multiple biological processes including reproduction and homeostasis (PMID: 12805412, PMID: 24953190). NCOA2 amplification and overexpression has been demonstrated in prostate cancer (PMID: 25295534), and NCOA2 fusions have been observed in several tumor types, including rhabdomyosarcoma and mesenchymal chondrosarcoma (PMID: 23463663, PMID: 22034177).

CTNNB1, beta-catenin, is a member of the Wnt signaling pathway, component of cadherin-based adherens junctions, and is also a tumor antigen recognized by T-cells in melanoma (PMID: 29403496). CTNNB1 imbalance is implicated in cancer progression and metastasis (PMID: 22617422) and exon 3 mutations are common in endometrioid endometrial carcinoma and melanoma (PMID: 29435196).

PHOX2B, paired-like homeobox 2b, is a neuronal-specific transcription factor that regulates brain development and patterning (PMID: 12100889). PHOX2B mutations have been identified in neuroblastoma (PMID: 15516980, PMID: 16084642).
