Overexpression of Cdk14 has been observed to promote progression of breast, gastric, ovarian, esophageal (PMID: 31930082), and hepatocellular cancers (PMID: 29193658, PMID: 26772918).

ERBB4, erb-b2 receptor tyrosine kinase 4, encodes HER4, an ERBB family member that plays a role in cell survival and differentiation (PMID: 12648466). ERBB4 activating mutations are frequent in melanoma and have been demonstrated in lung adenocarcinoma (PMID: 19718025, PMID: 26050618).

STRN3, striatin 3, is a member of the striatin family of WD repeat proteins (PMID: 26022125), a subunit of the striatin-interacting phosphatase and kinase (STRIPAK) complex, and may function to maintain the endoplasmic reticulum (PMID: 28634818). STRN3 fusions with BRAF have been observed in unknown primary adenocarcinoma (PMID: 26314551), with NTRK3 in fibrosarcoma (PMID: 30520818), and with NTRK1 in lung adenocarcinoma (PMID: 32127185).

CLU, clusterin, is a stress-induced chaperone that prevents protein misfolding and functions in apoptosis, cell proliferation, cell-cycle regulation, DNA damage response (PMID: 19879421, PMID: 19903745, PMID: 30002194). Overexpression of Clu has been observed in hepatocellular carcinoma (PMID: 25609201, PMID: 32039450), esophageal cancer (PMID: 25574066), colorectal cancer (PMID: 31672651), and promotes cell growth and invasion in renal carcinoma cells (PMID: 29400663).

LZTR1, leucine zipper like transcription regulator 1, is a Golgi protein and member of the BTB/POZ superfamily that plays a role in protein degradation of RAS-GTPases (PMID: 31533111) and functions as an adaptor protein for Cullin3 (CUL3)-basedE3 ubiquitin ligase (PMID: 31337872). Germline mutations in LZTR1 have been reported in Noonan syndrome (PMID: 31825158) and schwannomatosis (PMID: 29409008, PMID: 27472264), while Lztr1 expression is downregulated or inactivated in several tumor types (PMID: 24362817, PMID: 23917401, PMID: 18686028).

TTC5, tetratricopeptide repeat domain 5, encodes Strap, which functions as a cofactor in the DNA damage response, acting to potentiate Tp53 activity and as a cofactor for HSF1 in the heat shock response, acting to prevent apoptosis (PMID: 18719389, PMID: 23559008), and also regulates of degradation of tubulin mRNAs (PMID: 31727855). Decreased expression of TTC5 has been observed in thyroid cancer (PMID: 31648166).

RAD51B, RAD51 paralog B, plays a role in homologous recombination repair of double-strand DNA breaks (PMID: 21821141, PMID: 32098697). RAD51B mutations are associated with susceptibility to breast cancer (PMID: 24139550, PMID: 29255180) and overexpression has been correlated with a favorable prognosis in non-small cell lung cancer (PMID: 29207658) and a poor prognosis in gastric cancer (PMID: 27651161).

TP73, tumor protein 73, is a p53 family transcription factor and is activated in response to DNA damage to regulate cell death and cell cycle arrest (PMID: 31852961). TP73 is dysregulated in several tumor types (PMID: 24488880, PMID: 23913810), including cervical cancer (PMID: 31332036), and is expressed as several isoforms, including some with opposing activities (PMID: 24488880, PMID: 23913810).

ZMIZ1, zinc finger MIZ-type containing 1, is regulator of DNA transcription factors (PMID: 26522984) and a cofactor for Notch1 in the process of early T-cell development (PMID: 30076146). Overexpression of Zmiz1 has been observed in acute T lymphoblastic leukemia (PMID: 23161489), ZMIZ1-ABL1 fusion has been identified in B-cell acute lymphoblastic leukemia (PMID: 18007576), and ZMIZ1 gene methylation may be prognostic in glioblastoma (PMID: 31373686).

AICDA, activation induced cytidine deaminase, is part of the cytidine deaminase family and regulates antigen receptor diversification and maturation of the humoral immune response through rearrangement of immunoglobuling genes by class-switching recombination and somatic hypermutation of immunoglobulin genes in B-cells (PMID: 32162335, PMID: 31127309, PMID: 31092637). Mutations in AICDA are associated with lymphoma, leukemia, and GIST (PMID: 23181381) and overexpression has been observed in chronic lymphocytic leukemia (PMID: 30814061, PMID: 28388279).

FH, fumarate hydratase, is an citric acid cycle enzyme that catalyzes the conversion of fumarate to malate (PMID: 25864878) and plays a role in mitochondria function (PMID: 31085323). Germline mutations in FH are associated with hereditary leiomyomatosis and renal cell carcinoma (HLRCC) (PMID: 25864878, PMID: 25105836, PMID: 32108620) and uterine leiomyomas (PMID: 31564060).

IFIT3, interferon induced protein with tetratricopeptide repeats 3, is a member of the IRF-inducible gene family that plays a role in the immune defense against RNA viruses and regulation of apoptosis (PMID: 30234477, PMID: 31921891). Overexpression of Ifit3 in pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma has been associated with decreased cell apoptosis, resistance to chemotherapy, and poor prognosis (PMID: 28210844) however, in hepatocellular carcinoma Ifit3 overexpression shows a better response to interferon-alpha (PMID: 28295457), and in head and neck squamous cell carcinoma (HNSCC) Ifit3 overexpression is associated with poor prognosis (PMID: 31977029).

PAK1, p21 protein (Cdc42/Rac)-activated kinase 1, is a Group I PAK family member that functions as an effector for Rac and Cdc42 signaling, and is involved in regulation of cell signaling, proliferation, migration, and survival (PMID: 23125950, PMID: 23162742). PAK1 amplification and overexpression have been observed in several tumor types (PMID: 23125950, PMID: 24529727).

TEAD4, TEA domain transcription factor 4, is a transcription factor which functions through the YAP1-Hippo pathway to regulate cell proliferation and apoptosis (PMID: 18579750, PMID:  29251924). Abnormal expression of Tead4 has been reported in breast cancer, testicular cancer, serous fallopian tube carcinoma  (PMID: 20945341) and bladder cancer (PMID: 31455378).

SDC1, syndecan 1, encodes CD138 and is a member of the syndecan family of heparan sulfate proteoglycans that interacts with several other molecules including cell matrix components, growth factors, and adhesion molecules, and plays a role in cell adhesion, cell signaling, and epithelial-to-mesenchymal transition (PMID: 26420915, PMID: 31810587). Altered SDC1 expression has been observed in several tumor types (PMID: 26420915, PMID: 31810587), including high SDC1 expression in breast cancer (PMID: 29666962, PMID: 30598194), and gallbladder cancer (PMID: 18544939), and decreased SDC1 expression in colorectal cancer (PMID: 31182980).

SHQ1, SHQ1, H/ACA ribonucleoprotein assembly factor, functions in the assembly of H/ACA ribonucleoproteins and plays a role in RNA splicing (PMID: 30323192, PMID: 19383767, PMID: 25553844). SHQ1 overexpression has been demonstrated in T-cell acute lymphoblastic leukemia (PMID: 30323192) and amplification of SHQ1 has been observed in prostate cancer (PMID: 27328849).

KDR (VEGFR2), kinase insert domain receptor, is also known as vascular endothelial growth factor receptor 2 and is an endothelial cell surface receptor tyrosine kinase and member of the vascular endothelial growth factor family of proteins that plays a role in angiogenesis and cell proliferation through activation of RAF-MEK-MAP and PI3K-AKT pathways (PMID: 25568876, PMID: 29093528, PMID: 26578684). KDR amplification and overexpression have been reported in a variety of tumor types (PMID: 21382095, PMID: 27218826, PMID: 25231439, PMID: 20606037, PMID: 30819137) and somatic mutations have been reported in sarcomas and head and neck squamous cell carcinomas (PMID: 22314185, PMID: 11801954).

TRIB2, tribbles pseudokinase 2, lacks kinase activity and plays a role in regulating protein stability through E3 ubiquitin ligases and also regulates AKT signaling (PMID: 30254057). Overexpression of Trib2 has been observed in malignant melanoma (PMID: 20208562), glioblastome (PMID: 31318172), colon cancer, and pancreatic cancer (PMID: 28276427), and may contribute to drug resistance to PIK3 inhibitors (PMID: 28276427) and cisplatin (PMID: 29312632).

MAGI3, membrane associated guanylate kinase, WW and PDZ domain containing 3, localizes to epithelial cell tight junctions to regulate AKT1 through PTEN (PMID: 10748157). A fusion of MAGI3 with AKT3 has been identified in breast cancer (PMID: 22722202) and altered polyadenylation of MAGI3 mRNA produces a potentially oncogenic isoform in breast cancer (PMID: 27205883).

TP53, tumor protein p53, is a tumor suppressor (PMID: 30562755) and oncogene (PMID: 30577483) involved in cell cycle arrest and apoptosis, and is the most frequently mutated gene in cancer (PMID: 10065147, PMID: 22713868). TP53 germline mutations are common in Li-Fraumeni syndrome (PMID: 30239254) and somatic missense mutations are frequent in almost all cancer types cancers (PMID: 30224644) and are also implicated  in chemoresistance (PMID: 9927204, PMID: 24065105, PMID: 27066457).

TTC28, tetratricopeptide repeat 28, plays a key role in the progression of cell cycle and cytokinesis, and mediates protein-protein interactions (PMID: 23036704, PMID: 10517866). Fusions involving TTC28 have been demonstrated to occur in lung (PMID: 22960745) and colorectal cancer (PMID: 22810696).

TSHR, thyroid stimulating hormone receptor, is the receptor for thyrotropin, which acts to promote thyroid cell proliferation and function (PMID: 21511239, PMID: 25333622, PMID: 28484426). TSHR mutations are frequently observed in thyroid cancer (PMID: 21511239, PMID: 25333622, PMID: 28351942) and have also been observed in hepatocellular carcinoma (PMID: 29715101).

SEPTIN7, septin 7, is a member of the septin family of GTP-binding proteins, plays a role in vesicle transport, and is an essential component of septin filaments (PMID: 28224124, PMID: 25690008, PMID: 21824007). SEPT7 down regulation has been observed in central nervous system tumors (PMID: 15915442) and a fusion of SEPT7 and BRAF has been identified in infantile fibrosarcoma (PMID: 28877062).

LYPD3 (C4.4A), LY6/PLAUR domain containing 3, is a glycoprotein that may play a role in cell adhesion (PMID: 25302166) and has limited expression in healthy tissues (PMID: 29048672). Overexpression of LYPD3 has been observed in a number of solid tumors including, hepatocellular (PMID: 29048672), gastric cancer (PMID: 24935570), non-small cell lung cancer (PMID: 25302166), and lung adenocarcinoma (PMID: 32040344).

CCNB3, cyclin B3, is a member of the cyclin family and a regulator of the cell-cycle (PMID: 12185076) that plays a role in oocyte meiosis I (PMID: 30770433). Recurrent fusions between CCNB3 and BCOR have been observed in sarcomas (PMID: 22387997, PMID: 29300189, PMID: 28877060, PMID: 28833375, PMID: 32048619), including clear cell sarcoma of the kidney (PMID: 31876361).

TYRO3, TYRO3 protein tyrosine kinase, is a member of the TAM family (Tyro3, Axl, and Mer) and plays a role in regulation of the immune system and cell survival, migration, and differentiation through activation of PI3K and AKT (PMID: 30322068, PMID: 20546121). Overexpression of Tyro3 has been observed in leukemia, thyroid cancer, metastatic colorectal cancer, and melanoma (PMID: 30322068), and is associated with metastasis and poor prognosis in gastric cancer (PMID: 32018224) and pancreatic cancer (PMID: 31765735).

MAML2, mastermind like transcriptional coactivator 2, encodes for a member of the Mastermind-like gene family and acts as a transcriptional co-activator for Notch receptors (PMID: 12370315). A fusion with CRTC1 and MAML2 has been found in salivary mucoepidermoid carcinoma (PMID: 26503699, PMID: 32129900, PMID: 31661572) and a fusion with CXCR4 and MAML2 has been identified in chronic lymphocytic leukemia (PMID: 24855209) and with YAP1 in metaplastic thymoma (PMID: 31641231).

UBC, ubiquitin C,  is a stress-responsive polyubiquitin that contributes to cellular ubiquitin pools and plays a role in liver development and cell proliferation (PMID: 23669039, PMID: 17491588, PMID: 30186748). UBC has been demonstrated to be overexpressed in renal cancer (PMID: 1660345) and melanoma (PMID: 31173190), and may play a role in gynecological cancers (PMID: 29130934).

MDM2, MDM2 proto-oncogene, is an E3 ubiquitin protein ligase that mediates Tp53 degradation and therefore, regulates apoptosis and cell-cycle (PMID: 27993876). Amplification and/or overexpression of MDM2 has been identified in several cancer types (PMID: 23303139, PMID: 31440117) and amplification is common in liposarcoma (PMID: 30237864) and has been observed with Mdm2 overexpression in anaplastic lymphoma kinase (ALK)-negative inflammatory myofibroblastic tumors (PMID: 32195970).

STING1, stimulator of interferon response cGAMP interactor 1, is an adapter protein that plays a role in innate immune response to pathogens (PMID: 29728611, PMID: 26603901, PMD: 28748479). STING1 dysregulation has been demonstrated in several tumor types (PMID: 28748479, PMID: 29728611), including decreased expression in melanoma (PMID: 27680683) and hepatocellular carcinoma (PMID: 27814372).

GRM3, glutamate metabotropic receptor 3, is a Group II G-coupled glutamate receptor that functions in regulation of glutamatergic signaling (PMID: 16417579, PMID: 22564439). Mutations in GRM3 are associated with melanoma (PMID: 21946352, PMID: 28646617) and may also be implicated in renal cell carcinoma (PMID: 30488581).

PAX5, paired box protein Pax-5, is a developmental transcription factor, which plays a role in B-cell development (PMID: 21970955). Pax5 fusions and mutations have been implicated in hematological malignancies (PMID: 22127921, PMID: 25428382), including B-lineage leukemia (PMID: 31381561, PMID: 30643249).

CIRBP, cold inducible RNA-binding protein, plays a protective role in the genotoxic stress response by stabilizing transcripts of genes involved in cell survival and may play a role in DNA double strand break repair (PMID: 29432179). Overexpression of Cirbp has been implicated in human cancers (PMID: 19277990, PMID: 12819390) and observed in bladder cancer (PMID: 30315244), while loss of expression has been observed in nasopharyngeal carcinoma patients with poor outcomes (PMID: 31413636).

AGGF1, angiogenic factor with G-patch and FHA domains 1, plays a significant role in the promotion of angiogenesis and the development of the vascular system (PMID: 29641288, PMID: 14961121). A fusion with AGGF1 and PDGFRB has been identified in acute lymphoblastic leukemia (PMID: 29434033), and over expression of AGGF1 has been observed in several tumor types including colorectal cancer (PMID: 31881864), gastric cancer (PMID: 28289272), and hepatocellular carcinoma (PMID: 29340079).

GPR161, G protein-coupled receptor 161, is a member of the class A rhodopsin family that regulates sonic hedgehog (Shh) signaling and plays a role in development (PMID: 24599592, PMID: 29438014). Germline GPR161 mutations may be a risk factor for pediatric medulloblastoma (PMID: 31609649, PMID: 31653770) and overexpression of Gpr161 has been observed to promote cell proliferation and migration in breast cancer (PMID: 24599592).

TRIM63, tripartite motif containing 63, is a E3 ubiquitin-protein ligase, specifically expressed in cardiac and skeletal muscles where it functions to degrade thick filament proteins (PMID: 22821932). A fusion of TRIM63 with NTRK1 has been observed in melanoma (PMID: 29683819, PMID: 28719467) and increased Trim63 expression has been observed in breast cancer (PMID: 31399258).

VEGFA, vascular endothelial growth factor A, is a growth factor, which binds Vegf receptors to promote cell proliferation and angiogenesis (PMID: 23216836), mostly through KDR (VEGFR2) on endothelial cells (PMID: 32001672). Vegfa may stimulate tumor angiogenesis in several tumor types (PMID: 23216836, PMID: 32116289) and is overexpressed in a number of tumor types including, intrahepatic cholangiocarcinoma (PMID: 32042099), lung adenocarcinoma (PMID: 31892982), pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma (PMID: 31552188), and brain metastases in breast cancer (PMID: 31527824).

STK3, serine/threonine kinase 3, is a serine/threonine protein kinase activated by caspases to promote DNA fragmentation in apoptosis and functions as a putative tumor suppressor within the HIPPO pathway through YAP1 to regulate cell proliferation and organ size (PMID: 15994916, PMID: 24336504, PMID: 29876001), but may also promote tumorigenesis in other tumor types (PMID: 29876001).

CCNO, cyclin O, is a cyclin-like protein (PMID: 30464498) that interacts with CDK2 (PMID: 25364462) and plays a role in ciliogenesis (PMID: 25712475) and apoptosis (PMID: 29245899). Increased expression of Ccno has been observed in gastric cancer (PMID: 30464498).

TTN, titin, is a large protein filament that is a major component of the sarcomere and plays mechanical, organizational, and signaling roles in cardiac and skeletal muscle (PMID: 21257761, PMID: 31849696). TTN has been demonstrated to be frequently mutated in several tumor types (PMID: 17344846, PMID: 18085994) and missense mutations have been associated with a better prognosis in lung squamous cell carcinoma (PMID: 30810839).

BRCA1, BRCA1 DNA repair associated, is a tumor suppressor (PMID: 30562755) involved in the DNA damage response and DNA repair (PMID: 21203981). BRCA1 germline mutations increase the risk of developing ovarian and/or breast cancer (PMID: 21285145) and somatic mutations are highest in NSCLC, pancreatic, and colon cancers (PMID: 27283171).

FYN, FYN proto-oncogene, Src family tyrosine kinase, is a non-receptor tyrosine kinase that plays a role in cell signaling, proliferation, differentiation, and migration, and has been implicated in metastasis and drug resistance (PMID: 26305432, PMID: 18991062). Overexpression of FYN has been demonstrated in prostate and breast cancers (PMID: 26305432, PMID: 18991062).

GABRA6, gamma-aminobutyric acid type A receptor alpha6 subunit, encodes a protein that plays a role in physiological stress response (PMID: 15197399, PMID: 20109491). GABRA6 mutations have been identified in ovarian carcinoma (PMID: 21720365) and gliomas (PMID: 24120142).

RAB35, RAB35, member RAS oncogene family, is a member of the Rab family of GTPases that is localized to the cell membrane and endosomes, and plays a role in several cellular processes including endosome trafficking, endocytosis, phagocytosis, and cell migration (PMID: 29781368, PMID: 27329675). RAB35 expression has been demonstrated in ovarian cancer (PMID: 19623182) and RAB35 mutations have been identified in human cancers (PMID: 26338797).

MYC, MYC proto-oncogene, bHLH transcription factor, is a transcription factor that regulates expression of genes involved in cell cycle progression, apoptosis, cellular transformation (PMID: 25038584, PMID: 32071436) and the immune system (PMID: 29514782). Amplification, overexpression, and rearrangement of MYC is commonly observed in solid and hematological tumors (PMID: 28587062), such as lung cancer (PMID: 32014901) and diffuse large B-Cell lymphoma (PMID: 32074595).

CCNY, cyclin Y, is a regulatory subunit of CDK14 (PMID: 19524571) and CDK16 (PMID: 22184064), and plays a role in the transition of the cell-cycle through the Wnt signaling pathway (PMID: 29557391). Overexpression of Ccny promotes proliferation, migration, and metastasis of hepatocellular carcinoma cells and may also promote proliferation of breast cancer cells (PMID: 27666310) and non-small cell lung cancer (PMID: 30774378).

NFIX, nuclear factor I X, is a transcription factor that belongs to the nuclear factor I family (PMID: 32219034) and plays a role in regulation of neural and muscle development, and in hematopoeisis (PMID: 28962832, PMID: 30287093). A fusion of NFIX and MAST1 has been identified in breast carcinoma (PMID: 22101766) and with PKN1 in secretory carcinoma of the skin (PMID: 31045890).

PDCD4, programmed cell death 4, regulates transcript translation through Cap-dependent initiation and may play a role in apoptosis and negative regulation of cell proliferation (PMID: 30518628, PMID: 29806708). Decreased expression of Pdcd4 has been observed in prostate cancer (PMID: 30518628), glioma (PMID: 29921407), may be diagnostic for colorectal cancer (PMID: 30243936), and is a putative tumor suppressor (PMID: 32195018).

ADORA2A, adenosine A2a receptor, is a G-protein coupled receptor that binds adenosine to regulate a number of physiological functions and is expressed by a variety of cells, including dendritic cells (DCs), T-cells and NK-cells (PMID: 23856527). ADORA2A in the tumor microenvironment evades immune surveillance by inhibiting T-cell receptor function (PMID: 23856527, PMID: 25377469) and therapeutic blockade may restore the anti-tumor response (PMID: 28174424).

MCL1, MCL1 apoptosis regulator, BCL2 family member, functions in inhibition of apoptosis to promote cell survival (PMID: 29061914). MCL1 overexpression and/or amplification has been reported in a variety of tumor types (PMID: 26556430, PMID: 23478333), including NSCLC (PMID: 29567880), cholangiocarcinoma (PMID: 17404574), hepatocellular carcinoma (PMID: 16289418), melanoma (PMID: 17384650), and hematologic malignancies (PMID: 29061914) and MCL1 is often involved in adaptive resistance to targeted therapies (PMID: 31988312).

CUX1, cut like homeobox 1, is a transcription factor required for cell motility (PMID: 22306263) and plays a role in cell cycle progression, cell proliferation, and DNA repair (PMID: 28147323). CUX1 fusions with BRAF have been observed in solid tumors (PMID: 25190083, PMID: 26314551), with FGFR1 in hematological tumors (PMID: 21330321), and with ALK in NSCLC (PMID: 30010043), and altered Cux1 expression may play a role in castrate resistant prostate cancer (PMID: 32180898).

TBL1XR1, TBL1X receptor 1, is an F-box-like protein which acts as a co-repressor of nuclear hormone transcription factors influencing gene expression (PMID: 16893456) and may play a role in regulating the Wnt signaling pathway (PMID: 28588275). Overexpression of Tbxlr1 has been observed in a variety of cancer types (PMID: 24667177, PMID: 22837180), including non-small cell lung cancer (PMID: 31243347), osteosarcoma (PMID: 30529193), cervical cancer (PMID: 30439646), colorectal cancer (PMID: 28295012), and gastric cancer (PMID: 27672238).

HNF4G, hepatocyte nuclear factor 4 gamma, encodes a transcription factor that is a member of the orphan nuclear receptor family and plays a role in regulating genes involved in development and metabolism (PMID: 8995295). A fusion with HNF4G and RSPO2 has been identified in gastric cancer (PMID: 30250044) and overexpression of HNF4G has been associated with lung cancer (PMID: 29719587) and bladder cancer (PMID: 23896584).

KANK2, KN motif and ankyrin repeat domains 2, is a member of the ankyrin repeat domain-containing protein family that regulates actin dynamics (PMID: 17996375, PMID: 27548916). A KANK2 fusion with ALK has been identified in leiomyosarcoma (PMID: 30518629).

HNRNPK, heterogeneous nuclear ribonucleoprotein K, plays a role in RNA metabolism by acting as a scaffolding protein, thereby allowing interaction with multiple proteins and subsequent mediation of various RNA-related processes, including transcription and processing of pre-mRNA (PMID: 11231586, PMID: 21693523). Overexpression of HNRNPK has been identified in renal cell carcinoma (PMID: 26713736), while decreased expression has been identified in acute myeloid leukemia (PMID: 26412324).

ARID1B, AT-rich interactive domain-containing protein 1B, is a member of the SWI/SNF chromatin remodeling complex and is involved in cell-cycle activation (PMID: 15170388) and plays a role in neurodevelopment (PMID: 25674384). ARID1B mutations have been identified in several tumor types including, melanoma, gastric, colorectal, liver, neuroblastoma (PMID: 28521285), and pancreatic (PMID: 27737960) and decreased expression has been observed in ovarian clear cell carcinoma (PMID: 29890703).

IKBKE, inhibitor of nuclear factor kappa B kinase subunit epsilon, is an I-kappaB family member and a serine/threonine protein kinase that regulates activation of NF-kappaB signaling in response to inflammation and infection (PMID: 15102433, PMID: 26025939, PMID: 31733040). IKBKE is overexpressed in several tumor types, including breast, glioma, pancreatic (PMID: 31733040), and non-small cell lung cancer (PMID: 31406474), and is amplified in triple-negative breast cancer (PMID: 26025939, PMID: 25365225).

AIM2, absent in melanoma 2, is an immune receptor that recognizes dsDNA shed during breakage (PMID: 31372985) to regulats assembly of the inflammasome, and induces apoptosis, and prevents proliferation of tumor cells (PMID: 21804607, PMID: 28243117). Loss of Aim2 expression has been shown in liver cancer (PMID: 27167192), results in Akt activation in colorectal cancer (PMID: 26107252, PMID: 28243117), may be prognostic for poor outcomes in renal cell carcinoma (PMID: 30031129), and is overexpressed in glioblastoma (PMID: 31280432).

NCOA4, nuclear receptor coactivator 4, is an androgen receptor coactivator (PMID: 15166229) and autophagy receptor that degrades ferritin complexes (PMID: 31061094) and plays a role in iron homeostasis (PMID: 30930742). NCOA4 fusions are frequently observed with RET in papillary thyroid carcinoma (also referred to as RET/PTC3) (PMID: 25731779) and have been reported in salivary intraductal carcinoma (PMID: 31162284), spindle cell tumors (PMID: 30938880), breast cancer (PMID: 30446652), colorectal cancer (PMID: 30210625), and lung cancer (PMID: 30038711).

JUN, Jun proto-oncogene, AP-1 transcription factor subunit, is a member of the AP-1 family of transcription factors, which regulates several biological processes, including cell proliferation and differentiation (PMID: 24315690, PMID: 20044606). JUN functions as a proto-oncogene, and dysregulation of JUN is associated with several tumor types (PMID: 24315690).

MAP3K13, mitogen-activated protein kinase kinase kinase 13, is a member of the mixed lineage kinase (MLK) protein family that is involved in JNK pathway signaling (PMID: 11726277). MAP3K13 mutations have been identified in breast cancer (PMID: 22722201) and amplification has been observed in head and neck squamous cell carcinoma (PMID: 28760853).

DEPTOR, DEP domain containing MTOR-interacting protein, is an mTOR binding protein that negatively regulates signaling by mTORC1 and mTORC2 (PMID: 19446321, PMID: 29897294). Aberrant expression of Deptor has been observed in a variety of tumor types, but a recent meta-analysis shows Deptor expression does not correlate with prognosis (PMID: 30174446), however, it may be invloved in chemoresistance (PMID: 28267437, PMID: 31710966) and is a putative tumor suppressor in prostate cancer (PMID: 31685947).

ZMYND19, zinc finger, MYND-type containing 19, is a zinc finger protein which binds to MCHR1and Tubulin, yet whose function remains unknown (PMID: 16039987). Overexpression of Zmynd19 may be implicated in hepatocellular carcinoma cell (PMID: 29522715).

SLC3A2, solute carrier family 3 member 2, encodes the heavy chain of the heterodimeric protein, CD98, and is a transmembrane type II protein that plays a role in the regulation of integrins and the modulation of amino acid transport, thereby contributing to various cell signaling mechanisms (PMID: 15625115, PMID: 17597067).  SLC3A2 overexpression has been observed in a variety of tumor types including renal cell cancer, triple-negative breast cancer, biliary tract cancer, head and neck squamous cell carcinoma, osteosarcoma, and non-small cell lung cancer (PMID: 19292886, PMID: 28350098), and a fusion with SLC3A2 and NRG1 has been identified in lung cancer (PMID: 29959202).

VEGFD, vascular endothelial growth factor D, is a member of the platelet-derived growth factor/vascular endothelial growth factor (PDGF/VEGF) family that regulates angiogenesis and lymphangiogenesis (PMID: 28087639). VEGFD has been associated with prognosis of colon, bladder, ovarian, breast and lung cancers (PMID: 27730400, PMID: 26241709, PMID: 23915006, PMID: 23054001, PMID: 21161269).

IGFBP5, insulin like growth factor binding protein 5, is a member of the insulin-like growth factor-binding protein superfamily that binds to Igf1 and interferes with Igf signaling, affecting cell growth, survival, and motility (PMID: 10605625, PMID: 22313597). IGFBP5 expression has been identified in breast, ovarian, pituitary, cervical cancer and glioblastoma (PMID: 22313597) and a fusion with ALK has been observed in leiomyosarcoma (PMID: 30518629) and inflammatory myofibroblastic tumors (PMID: 28490045).

RNF43, ring finger protein 43, is an E3 ubiquitin ligase that targets Frizzled receptors, resulting in lysosomal degradation of Frizzleds and negative regulation of Wnt signaling (PMID: 25460271) and may play a role in regulation of epithelial-mesenchymal transition (PMID: 31286874). RNF43 mutations are associated with several tumor types and are frequent in colorectal and endometrial cancer (PMID: 25460271, PMID: 25344691, PMID: 32092099, PMID: 32008206, PMID: 29756208).

PTPRD, protein tyrosine phosphatase receptor type D, is a transmembrane protein (PMID: 30208623) that plays a role in cell growth, adhesion, migration, survival (PMID: 25113440), and regulates neurodevelopment (PMID: 31914388). PTPRD is inactivated in a variety of solid tumors (PMID: 19478061), including advanced stage gastric cancer (PMID: 31805999, PMID: 31041642), laryngeal squamous cell carcinoma (PMID: 28345455), and copy number alterations have been reported in Ewing's sarcoma (PMID: 31072725).

IRF2BP2, interferon regulatory factor 2 binding protein 2, is regulated by IRF2 to repress transcription (PMID: 12799427) and may function in B-cell differentiation (PMID: 27016798) and cell homeostasis (PMID: 31022319). IRF2BP2 fusions with NTRK1 have been reported in thyroid cancer (PMID: 29466156), with RARA in acute promyelocytic leukemia (PMID: 27872498, PMID: 31447564), and with CDX1 in mesenchymal chondrosarcoma (PMID: 23185413).

MGA, MAX dimerization protein MGA, is a transcription factor with dual specificity that can form a heterodimer with Max and regulate Myc target gene (PMID: 10601024, PMID: 16908182). MGA mutations have been identified in lung cancer (PMID: 24362264) and an MGA-NUTM1 fusion has been identified in sarcoma (PMID: 30723300, PMID: 30552129).

FOLR1, folate receptor alpha, is a membrane-tethered receptor involved in transport of folate into the cell (PMID: 16453285). FOLR1 is overexpressed in several tumor types (PMID: 16453285), including ovarian cancer (PMID: 31049278) and high-grade triple-negative breast cancer (PMID: 30068707, PMID: 32044043).

MEF2D, myocyte enhancer factor 2D, is a member of the MEF2 (Myocyte Enhancer Factor-2) family of transcription factors, which may activate or repress gene transcription, depending on interaction with co-activators or co-repressors (PMID: 29879430). Fusions of Mef2d have been identified in pediatric precursor B-cell acute lymphoblastic leukemia and correlated with worse clinical outcomes (PMID: 30171027) and Mefd2 overexpression has been observed in cisplatin-resistant ovarian carcinoma (PMID: 31218100).

FEN1, flap structure-specific endonuclease 1, belongs to the Rad2 structure-specific nuclease family (PMID: 20929870) and plays a role in DNA replication, DNA repair, telomere maintenance, and genomic stability (PMID: 28187440). Overexpression of Fen1 may be a marker of genomic instability and poor prognosis in pancreatic adenocarcinoma (PMID: 29735403) and NSCLC (PMID: 29037854).

IL7R, interleukin 7 receptor, functions with IL2RG as part of the receptor complex for interleukin 7 and thymic stromal lymphopoietin and is involved in development of T-cells (PMID: 21892159, PMID: 21536738, PMID: 30670441). Mutations and overexpression of IL7R are associated with acute leukemias (PMID: 21892159, PMID: 21536738, PMID: 30154115).

OGA, O-GlcNAcase, is also known as meningioma expressed antigen 5 (MGEA5) and is a glycosidase that catalyzes the removal of the sugar moiety, O-GlcNAc, from proteins (PMID: 24769077). A FGFR2-OGA fusion has been identified in intrahepatic cholangiocarcinoma (PMID: 24550739) and OGA rearrangements have been observed in myxoinflammatory fibroblastic sarcoma (PMID: 26980036, PMID: 24705316).

REL, REL proto-oncogene, NF-kB subunit, encodes a part of the NF-kB dimer, which acts as a transcription factor to enable proliferation, growth, survival, and maturation of B and T-cells (PMID: 22207895), regulate fibrosis, wound healing, and inflammation, and, in some contexts, support transformation (PMID: 26757421, PMID: 31277415). Amplification of REL is associated with both B-cell and T-cell malignancies (PMID: 22207895) and nuclear accumulation of Rel has been identified in breast cancer (PMID: 10713699).

PLEKHA6, pleckstrin homology domain containing A6, may bind PtdIns3 and potentially function as an adaptor protein (PMID: 11001876). PLEKHA6 fusions have been observed with NTRK3 in langerhans cell histiocytosis (PMID: 30098202) and with NTRK1 (PMID: 29466156).

CCNL2, cyclin L2, interacts with CDK11 (PMID: 18216018) may play a role in mRNA processing and transcription of apoptotic genes, thereby having a putative role as a tumor suppressor (PMID: 14684736). A CCLN2 fusion with PCMTD1 (PCMTD1-CCNL2) has been observed more commonly in endometrioid ovarian carcinomas than in other ovarian cancer subtypes (PMID: 29633253) and altered Ccnl2 expression has been observed in melanoma (PMID: 30987032).

CD163, a member of the Scavenger Receptor Cystein-rich (SRCR) protein family, is involved in hemoglobin clearance, and a marker for monocytes and macrophages (PMID:11298324; PMID:28687956). CD163 expression on cancer cells has been associated with poor prognosis in numerous cancers such as breast, colorectal and bladder cancer (PMID:28687956 ; PMID:29725763)

CD4, CD4 molecule, is a glycoprotein that recognizes MHC class II peptides on antigen-presenting cells and is expressed on NK cells, macrophages, eosinophils, neutrophils, and CD8+ T cells (PMID: 16951326). CD4 regulates activation of T-lymphocytes leading to proliferation and differentiation of effector T-cells, and plays a key role in adaptive immune response (PMID: 22474485, PMID: 8057386).

CD86 is surface glycoprotein and a member of the immunoglobulin superfamily (IgSF) and is expressed on APCs (along with CD80) and functions as a ligand for CTLA-4 and CD28 (PMID: 23911524). The affinity for CTLA-4 is higher than CD28 leading to inhibiting co-stimulatory signals (PMID: 31102428; PMID:16920215)

AGO3, argonaute RISC catalytic component 3, is one of four argonaute (AGO) paralogs that regulate micro-RNA (miRNA) mediated gene silencing and RNA degradation (PMID: 18771919, PMID: 29040713, PMID: 28683311). AGO3 has been demonstrated to be downregulated in hepatocellular cancer (PMID: 23398123).

WASF2, WAS protein family member 2, encodes for a member of the Wiskott-Aldrich syndrome protein (WASP) family of proteins and plays a role in cell migration, and cell proliferation, differentiation, and apoptosis via complex formation with PKA (PMID: 21119216). A fusion with WASF2 and FGR has been identified in melanoma, ovarian cancer, and lung squamous cell carcinoma (PMID: 25204415).

GRIN2A, glutamate ionotropic receptor NMDA type subunit 2A, is a subunit of the NMDA receptor, glutamate-gated ion channel (PMID: 22291485, PMID: 30544257). Somatic mutations in GRIN2A are frequently observed in melanoma (PMID: 21499247, PMID: 27659111, PMID: 28986867, PMID:     24739903) and decreased expression has been observed in nasopharyngeal carcinoma (PMID: 26681223).

CDKN1A, cyclin dependent kinase inhibitor 1A, also known as p21, is activated by Tp53 and may be the mediator of Tp53 inhibition of cell proliferation and induction of apoptosis (PMID: 10090408) and functions in the DNA damage response (PMID: 20096807). Loss of Cdkn1a may enable cell proliferation and migration in gastric (PMID: 29602637), liver (PMID: 29408622), bladder (PMID: 29602637), and osteosarcoma cancers (PMID: 29115549) and decreased expression in chromophobe renal cell carcinoma is associated with decreased survival (PMID: 32079343).

AFAP1, actin filament associated protein 1, binds actin and regulates actin filament organization, plays a role in SRC activation, and may function as an adaptor protein for signaling molecules (PMID: 11607843, PMID: 21236256, PMID: 25043309). AFAP1 overexpression has been demonstrated in prostate cancer (PMID: 17885682) and a fusion between AFAP1 and NTRK2 has been demonstrated in low-grade glioma (PMID: 25204415).

WT1, WT1 transcription factor, encodes a transcription factor responsible for targeting genes related to cell growth and metabolism (PMID: 17361230), such as VEGF and BCL2 (PMID: 32152317). Germline mutations in WT1 are involved in the development of Wilms' tumor of the kidney and somatic mutations are observed in other cancers, including acute myeloid leukemia (PMID: 16987884, PMID: 17361230, PMID: 32122281), and normal karyotype acute myeloid leukemia, where mutations may predict a poor prognosis (PMID: 32019476).

BTLA, B and T lymphocyte attenuator, is a member of the immunoglobulin superfamily (PMID: 31774112) and inhibitory receptor belonging to the CD28 family (PMID: 27717503). BTLA expresison  on T-cells aids in the negative regulation of T-cells and leads to decreased T-lymphocytes (PMID: 31774112). The function of BTLA has been associated with damening immune responses and mediating immune memory and prosurvival effects (PMID: 27717503; PMID: 21220749)

PRLR, prolactin receptor, is a member of the type 1 cytokine receptor superfamily that binds the hormone, prolactin, to activate Jak2/Stat5, MAPK, and PI3K pathways for control of lactation (PMID: 28377489, PMID: 27107001). Overexpression of PRLR has been observed in multiple subtypes of breast cancer (PMID: 28377489) and was associated with increased survival in triple-ngeative breast cancer patients (PMID: 32199279).

SH2D1A, SH2 domain containing 1A, is an adaptor for signaling lymphocytic activation molecule (SLAM) receptor proteins, and plays a role in NK and T-cell activation (PMID: 26682762). Germline mutations in SH2D1A have been observed in X-linked lymphoproliferative syndrome (PMID: 28267077, PMID: 29649976).

CCL2, chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 2 , is a chemokine that is a potent chemoattractant for macrophages and T-cells (PMID: 15900302). CCL2 expression from tumor cells facilitates metastasis by activating CCR2 in the endothelium, increasing vascular permeability (PMID: 22789541). Expression leads to sustaining cancer cell proliferation and survival, stimulating cancer cell migration and invasion, and inducing deleterious inflammation and angiogenesis (PMID: 26885690)

FGF19, fibroblast growth factor 19, is an FGF family member (PMID: 26308386) that binds the receptor, FGFR4, to regulate several cellular processes, including proliferation, migration, metabolism, and differentiation (PMID: 32154250). FGF19 overexpression and amplification is associated with several tumor types (PMID: 26450751, PMID: 24728076, PMID: 25950492), including lung squamous cell carcinoma (PMID: 32111983) and hepatocellular carcinoma (PMID: 31718608, PMID: 31575540, PMID: 30815392).

TEAD1, TEA domain transcription factor 1, is a transcription factor which functions through the YAP1-Hippo pathway to regulate cell proliferation and apoptosis (PMID: 18579750, PMID: 26805820). Abnormal expression of Tead1 has been identified in several cancers including prostate, pancreatic, breast, and bladder (PMID: 23029054) and a fusion with NCOA2 has been observed in rhabdomyosarcoma (PMID: 31999033).

VISTA, V-domain Ig suppressor of T cell activation, encoded by the C10orf54 gene,  is a member of the B7-family that shares homolgy with PD-L1 and PD-L2 (PMID: 30382166).  VISTA is an immune checkpoint blockade that suppresses T-cell activation when expressed as a ligand on APCs or a receptor on T-cells (PMID: 31781843).  Higher denisty of VISTA has been associated with resistance to immune checkpoint blockade (PMID:  28776578)

PKN1, protein kinase N1, is a member of the protein kinase C superfamily that mediates Rho-dependent signaling pathways, thus regulates cell migration, invasion, and gene expression (PMID: 25504435, PMID: 28222172). Increased Pkn1 expression has been identified in glioma, kidney, ovarian, and prostate cancer, and pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma (PMID: 30206226) and a fusion with HTT has been observed in pigmented epithelioid melanocytoma (PMID: 31972666).

ACVR1, activin A receptor type 1, is a bone morphogenic protein (BMP) type 1 receptor involved in numerous signaling pathways including BMP signaling, and plays a critical role in chondrogenesis, osteogenesis, and angiogenesis (PMID: 28780023, PMID: 28232325).

PPP2R1A, protein phosphatase 2 scaffold subunit Aalpha, contains 15 Huntingtin-Elongation-A subunit-TOR (HEAT) repeats (PMID: 31214504) and is a scaffold subunit of the major serine-threonine phosphatase PP2A, which has roles in cell signaling, proliferation, differentiation, and apoptosis (PMID: 23454242). Additionally, PPP2R1A is required for proper chromosome segregation (PMID: 16580887)

ERBB3 encodes HER3, an EGFR receptor tyrosine kinase, which activates PI3K-AKT-mTOR and RAS-RAF-MEK-ERK pathways to promote cell survival and proliferation (PMID: 17471238). ERBB3 has been thought to have limited to no kinase activity (PMID: 25326665).

FOXM1, forkhead box M1, encodes a member of the Forkhead superfamily of transcription factors, which plays a significant role in early development and tissue repair and homeostasis via the regulation of a variety of biological functions including cell proliferation, differentiation, migration, and survival and DNA damage repair (PMID: 25287128, PMID: 25068996). FOXM1 overexpression has been demonstrated in a variety of tumor types including breast cancer (PMID: 31815181), pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma (PMID: 22249132), gastric cancer (PMID: 23054116), and non-small cell lung cancer (PMID: 24715097), and amplification has been observed in osteosarcoma (PMID: 30266815), and non-Hodgkin's lymphoma (PMID: 21305641).

CD27, CD27 molecule, encodes for a member of the tumor necrosis factor (TNF) receptor family, is located on NK cells, CD4+ and CD8+ T cells (PMID: 15886117). Upon ligation to CD70, CD27 activates NFkB and promotes cell survial, enhances T and B cells proliferative signals and increases effector functions (PMID: 15886117, PMID: 23264908).

CD3 chains make up the T-cell antigen receptor complex that transmits signals received from antigen-presenting cells (PMID: 26507128). CD3g plays a role in the regulation to TCR expression at the cell surface that is dependent on its  di-leucine-based (diL) receptor-sorting motif (PMID:8187769)

CD40LG, CD40 Ligand, is a type II transmembrane protein in which interaction with CD40 on B-cells triggers B-cell differentiation, maturation and apoptosis (PMID: 15067037). The CD40L-CD40 interaction is necessary for priming of Th1-T-cells by promiting cell matruation and cytokine production (PMID: 15067037; PMID: 8627184)

This gene encodes an autoimmunogenic tumor antigen that belongs to the ESO/LAGE family of cancer-testis antigens. This protein is expressed in a wide array of cancers including melanoma, breast cancer, bladder cancer and prostate cancer. This protein is also expressed in normal testis tissue. An alternative open reading frame product of this gene has been described in PMID:10399963. This alternate protein, termed CAMEL, is a tumor antigen that is recognized by melanoma-specific cytotoxic T-lymphocytes. Alternate splicing results in multiple transcript variants. [provided by RefSeq, Sep 2013].

CTAG2, cancer/testis antigen 2, encodes for a cancer testis antigen that is normally expressed on male germ cells and may play a role in the regulation of gene expression (PMID: 15715909). CTAG2 is expressed by many human tumors, not not normal tissues except for testis and placenta and is immunogenic inducing both natural cellular and humoral responses (PMID: 14559844)

CD274, CD274 molecule, encodes for an immunomodulatory ligand (PD-L1), that is expressed on natural killer cells, macrophages, myeloid dendritic cells, B-cells, epithelial cells, and vascular endotherlial cells (PMID: 24551119).  When PD-L1 binds to its receptor, PD-1, it results in inhibition of T-cell activation which contributes to T-cell exhaustion (PMID: 24551119; PMID: 25695955). Tumor cells have adapted this mechanism leading to over-expressed PD-L1 to avoid immunologic survelliance to facilitate cancer growth (PMID: 25695955)

CD38, ADP-ribosyl cyclase/cyclic ADP-ribose hydrolase 1, is a glycoprotein that binds CD31 and is also an ectoenzyme involved in the metabolism of nicotinamide (PMID: 29118010, PMID: 30546360). CD38 overexpression may contribute to resistance to PD-1 (PDCD1)/PD-L1 (CD274) therapies (PMID: 30012853).

CD68 is a type I transmembrane glycoprotein that belongs to the lysosomal-associated membrane protein (lamp) family (PMID: 18405323). It has widely been used as a macrophage marker, however non-myeloid cells can also express CD68. It's location within endosomes suggests a role in peptide transport and antigen processing (PMID:27869795 )

CD3 chains make up the T-cell antigen receptor complex that transmits signals received from antigen-presenting cells (PMID: 26507128). CD3e is required in both types of T-cell antigen receptor complexes and plays a central role in CD3 core assembly and full complex expression (PMID:8490660)

CD8 is encoded by two distinct genes, CD8alpha and CD8beta, and is expressed on the surface of T cells primarily as a CD8alphabeta heterodimer (PMID:17145893) CD8alpha enhances responses instigated through the TCR by binding MHC class I (PMID: 17678538). Binding to  human NK cells prevents activation induced apoptosis and enhances cytolytic activity (PMID:16236125)

CD244 belongs to the signaling lymphocytic activation molecule (SLAM) related receptors and is expressed on NK cells, monocytes, basophils, gammadelta T cells, dendritic cells, myeloid derived supressor cells and CD8+ T-cells (PMID: 15713798; PMID: 30546369). CD244, along with other inhibitory receptors like PD-1 shows increased expression on exhausted T-cells and TILs compared to peripheral blood (PMID:30546369; PMID: 26205583)

CD3 chains make up the T-cell antigen receptor complex that transmits signals received from antigen-presenting cells (PMID: 26507128). CD3d is not required for pre-TCR signalling (PMID: 12215456) but plays an essential role for promoting progression of early thymocytes towards double positive stage (PMID:15546002)

CD40, CD40 molecule, encodes for a member of the tumor necrosis factor receptor family, which is expressed in a variety of cell types such as B cells, dendritic cells, monocytes, and platelets, and its signaling plays a role in multiple immune processes (PMID: 19426221). CD40 binds to its ligand, CD40L, and its cross-talk is importantn for the development and proliferation of B-cells and Th17 cells (PMID: 30265161)

CCR2, chemokine (C-C motif) receptor 2, is expressed on dendritc cells, monocytes, and macrophages (PMID: 23938203). CCR2 is activated by its chemokine ligands (CCL2, CCL8, CCL7, and CCL13) and it stimulates monocyte migration from peripheral circulation to inflammed tissue through the vascular wall (PMID: 23408426; PMID: 15995708)

CD2, also knows as T-cell surface antigen 11 (T11), is expressed on mature T-cells with higher frequency on memory T-cells (PMID: 2951597, DOI:10.1101/589440) CD2 along with its ligand CD58 inhibit T-cell conjugation and kill alloreactive target cells (DOI: 10.1101/589440). Increased CD2 expression as been associated with decreased PD-L1 expression (PMID: 31383967) check that last sentence

CD28, T-cell-specific surface glycoprotein CD28, is a co-stimulatory molecule constitutively expressed on T-cells and competes with the co-inhibitory molecule, CTLA4, for binding to CD80 and CD86 (PMID: 28102259) and also promotes IL2 production and T-cell survival through upregulation of BCL2L1 (BCL-XL) (PMID: 30565239).

CD8 is encoded by two distinct genes, CD8alpha and CD8beta, and is expressed on the surface of T cells primarily as a CD8alphabeta heterodimer (PMID:17145893). Heterodimeric CD8alphabeta has consistently been shown to be a better coreceptor than homodimeric CD8alphaalpha and correlates with enhanced sensitivity to peptide antigen (PMID:17145893). In addition upregulation of CD8beta is a TIL marker (PMID: 30387832)

CD80 is surface glycoprotein and a member of the immunoglobulin superfamily (IgSF). CD80 and CD86 share their ligands on T-cells and are expressed on antigen presenting cells,  bind the T-cell receptors CD28 and CTLA-4, and trigger signals for optimal T-cell activation (PMID: 7545666; DOI: 10.1158/0008-5472)

CTLA4 (CD152), cytotoxic T-lymphocyte-associated protein 4, is a negative regulator of T-cell activation (PMID: 27249753) that is constitutively expressed on Tregs and upregulated upon T-cell receptor (TCR) signaling to compete with the co-stimulatory molecule, CD28, for binding to CD80 and CD86 (PMID: 30565239, PMID: 28102259). Immune checkpoint inhibitor blockade of CTLA4 is an important component of anti-tumor immunotherapies (PMID: 23748107, PMID: 26325034).

ENTPD1 (CD39), ectonucleoside triphosphate diphosphohydrolase 1, is expressed by B cells, innate cells, regulatory T-cells as well as activated CD4 and CD8 T-cells (PMID: 30006565). CD39 converts ATP to adenosine to regulate cellular homeostasis and functions as an immune checkpoint inhibitor and is a marker for exhausted T-cells in patients with chronic viral infections (PMID: 29914571; PMID: 30006565)

CSF1R, macrophage colony-stimulating factor 1 receptor, is a tyrosine kinase and receptor for CSF1 and IL34, which upon ligand binding activates PI3K-AKT-mTOR, RAS-RAF-MEK-ERK and STAT signaling pathways (PMID: 22186992). CSF1R is expressed by tumor-associated macrophages to induce tumor promotion (PMID: 30065206)

The protein encoded by this gene is a member of the G-protein-coupled receptor family. This protein is a receptor for interleukin 8 (IL8). It binds to IL8 with high affinity, and transduces the signal through a G-protein activated second messenger system. This receptor also binds to chemokine (C-X-C motif) ligand 1 (CXCL1/MGSA), a protein with melanoma growth stimulating activity, and has been shown to be a major component required for serum-dependent melanoma cell growth. This receptor mediates neutrophil migration to sites of inflammation. The angiogenic effects of IL8 in intestinal microvascular endothelial cells are found to be mediated by this receptor. Knockout studies in mice suggested that this receptor controls the positioning of oligodendrocyte precursors in developing spinal cord by arresting their migration. This gene, IL8RA, a gene encoding another high affinity IL8 receptor, as well as IL8RBP, a pseudogene of IL8RB, form a gene cluster in a region mapped to chromosome 2q33-q36. Alternatively spliced variants, encoding the same protein, have been identified. [provided by RefSeq, Nov 2009].

Receptor for interleukin-8 which is a powerful neutrophil chemotactic factor. Binding of IL-8 to the receptor causes activation of neutrophils. This response is mediated via a G-protein that activates a phosphatidylinositol-calcium second messenger system. Binds to IL-8 with high affinity. Also binds with high affinity to CXCL3, GRO/MGSA and NAP-2

CXCR2 is a chemokine and a membrane bound G-protein coupled receptor that is expressed on neutrophils, monocytes, lymphocytes and NK cells (PMID:22850671; PMID: 30319622). Activation of CXCR2 is important for the recruitment of neutrophils to a site of infection (PMID: 22850671 )

CXCR6 is a chemokine receptor that is expressed by a subset of memory/effector T-cells, NK cells and NKT cells, and plasma cells (PMID: 12914753). CXCR6 may play a role in facilitating immune responses via cell to cell contact and mediatiating inflammation (PMID: 12914753; PMID:11238560 )

ICOS, inducible co-stimulator, is a member of the CD28 family. ICOS enhances basic T-cell responses to foreign antigens such as proliferation, secretion of lymphokines, upregulation of molecules that mediate cell-cell interaction and effective help for antibody secretion by B-cells (PMID: 9930702; PMID:11169414)

LAG3, lymphocyte activation gene 3 protein, is expressed on activated T-cells and NK cells and binds MHC class II molecules to inhibit the immune response (PMID: 28258692). LAG3 inhibition in cancer therapy may relieve suppression of the anti-tumor immune response (PMID: 29900067, PMID: 29439955).

CD27, CD27 molecule, encodes for a member of the tumor necrosis factor (TNF) receptor family, is located on NK cells, CD4+ and CD8+ T cells (PMID: 15886117). Upon ligation to CD70, CD27 activates NFkB and promotes cell survial, enhances T and B cells proliferative signals and increases effector functions (PMID: 15886117, PMID: 23264908).

CD38, ADP-ribosyl cyclase/cyclic ADP-ribose hydrolase 1, is a glycoprotein that binds CD31 and is also an ectoenzyme involved in the metabolism of nicotinamide (PMID: 29118010, PMID: 30546360). CD38 overexpression may contribute to resistance to PD-1 (PDCD1)/PD-L1 (CD274) therapies (PMID: 30012853).

CSF1R, macrophage colony-stimulating factor 1 receptor, is a tyrosine kinase and receptor for CSF1 and IL34, which upon ligand binding activates PI3K-AKT-mTOR, RAS-RAF-MEK-ERK and STAT signaling pathways (PMID: 22186992). CSF1R is expressed by tumor-associated macrophages to induce tumor promotion (PMID: 30065206)

CXCL10, also known as IFNgamma- inducible protien 10 or IP10, is a chemokine that binds to the receptor CXCR3 and has a potent chemotactic effect on activated T-lymphocytes (PMID: 22652417). Upon binding, t-cells are activated towards sites of inflammation where they play a role in Th1-mediated immune respones (PMID:12750173).

IDO1, indoleamine 2,3-dioxygenase 1, is an enzyme that catalyzes the conversion of tryptophan to kynurenine, and plays an important role in the inflammatory response (PMID: 29413421, PMID: 26378585). IDO1 participates in a spectrum of immune responses during chronic infections, such as  immune-escape of cancer cells, and tissue inflammation (PMID: 25157255)

TGFB1, transforming growth factor beta 1, is a secreted cytokine that regulates cell growth, proliferation, differentiation, and apoptosis (PMID: 3861940). TGFB induces the epithelial mesenchymal transition (EMT) and of myofibroblast differentiation which is important for normal tissue repair (PMID: 30696809)

CXCL10, also known as IFNgamma- inducible protien 10 or IP10, is a chemokine that binds to the receptor CXCR3 and has a potent chemotactic effect on activated T-lymphocytes (PMID: 22652417). Upon binding, t-cells are activated towards sites of inflammation where they play a role in Th1-mediated immune respones (PMID:12750173).

GZMB, granzyme B,  is a granule associated serine protease that is induced when t-cells and NK cells acquire cytotoxic function (PMID: 8258716). GZMB plays a central role in killing human tumor cell lines, along with inducing cell death and apoptosis (PMID: 29669300)

IL10, interleukin 10, encodes for an anti-inflammatory cytokine that is involved in the regulation of the immune response (PMID: 18424693). IL10 expression has been linked to immune protection in cancer (PMID: 24076584).

This gene is a member of the MAGEA gene family. The members of this family encode proteins with 50 to 80% sequence identity to each other. The promoters and first exons of the MAGEA genes show considerable variability, suggesting that the existence of this gene family enables the same function to be expressed under different transcriptional controls. The MAGEA genes are clustered at chromosomal location Xq28. They have been implicated in some hereditary disorders, such as dyskeratosis congenita. [provided by RefSeq, Jul 2008].

Proposed to enhance ubiquitin ligase activity of RING-type zinc finger-containing E3 ubiquitin-protein ligases. May enhance ubiquitin ligase activity of TRIM28 and stimulate p53/TP53 ubiquitination by TRIM28. Proposed to act through recruitment and/or stabilization of the Ubl-conjugating enzyme (E2) at the E3:substrate complex. May play a role in embryonal development and tumor transformation or aspects of tumor progression. In vitro promotes cell viability in melanoma cell lines. Antigen recognized on a melanoma by autologous cytolytic T-lymphocytes

MAGEA3, melanoma-associated antigen 3, is a member of the cancer testis antigen (CTA) family that has normal, restricted expression in the testis (PMID: 30588194). MAGEA3 is often correlated with poor prognosis and resistance to immune checkpoint blockade (PMID: 29656892).
Neither

The protein encoded by this gene is an antigen that is overexpressed in many cancers but that is also expressed in normal testis. This gene is found in a duplicated region of the X-chromosome and therefore has a neighboring gene of identical sequence. [provided by RefSeq, Jan 2012].

CTAG1B, cancer/testis antigen 1B, encodes for a cancer testis antigen that is normally expressed on male germ cells and may play a role in the regulation of gene expression (PMID: 15715909, PMID: 22936067). CTAG1B plays a key role in tumor invasion and metastasis (PMID: 30122941)
Neither
CTAG1B

DDX58, also known as retinoic acid-inducible gene I (RIG-1), is a cytoplasmic Dex(D/H) box helicase that detects intracellular viral products to signal IFN-(alpha/beta) production in infected cells (PMID: 17942531). Upon viral recognition, DDX58 activates antiviral signaling pathways that lead to transcriptional up-regulation of type I and III interferons (IFN) (PMID:29534222).
Neither
CTAG2

GATA3, trans-acting T-cell-specific transcription factor, is a zinc-finger transcription factor that regulates development and differentiation (PMID: 7550312) and plays a vital role in immune function (PMID: 21924928; PMID: 28320875)

IDO1, indoleamine 2,3-dioxygenase 1, is an enzyme that catalyzes the conversion of tryptophan to kynurenine, and plays an important role in the inflammatory response (PMID: 29413421, PMID: 26378585). IDO1 participates in a spectrum of immune responses during chronic infections, such as  immune-escape of cancer cells, and tissue inflammation (PMID: 25157255)

The protein encoded by this gene is a transmembrane glycoprotein belonging to the immunoglobulin superfamily. The external domain mediates cell attachment to the extracellular matrix molecule vitronectin, while its intracellular domain interacts with the dynein light chain Tctex-1/DYNLT1. The gene is specific to the primate lineage, and serves as a cellular receptor for poliovirus in the first step of poliovirus replication. Multiple transcript variants encoding different isoforms have been found for this gene. [provided by RefSeq, Oct 2008].
Neither
CXCR2

FOXP3, forkhead family protein 3, acts as a repressor of transcription and is an essential regulator of the development and function of regulatory T-cells (PMID: 17360565; PMID: 30784578). T-cells expressing FOXP3 have a critical role in the maintenance of immune homeostatis and prevention of autoimmunity (PMID: 30784578)

ICOSLG, inducible T cell costimulator ligand, encodes a member of the B7 family of ligands, which triggers T cell proliferation and cytokine production upon binding to the T cell receptor, ICOS (PMID: 11973139, PMID: 10549624). Expression of ISOSLG is implicated in diesase progression due to regulation of antitumor adaptive immunity (PMID: 31634400)

IFNG, interferon-gamma is a  pleiotropic cytokine produced by a variety of immune cells including T-helper 1 (TH1) cells and natural killer cells (PMID: 16728393). IFNG is recognized for its role in antitumor host immuniity and activation of cytotoxic T-cells and dendritic cells, particularly through the activation of macrophages (PMID: 30336781; PMID: 30402328)

This gene is a member of the MAGEA gene family. The members of this family encode proteins with 50 to 80% sequence identity to each other. The promoters and first exons of the MAGEA genes show considerable variability, suggesting that the existence of this gene family enables the same function to be expressed under different transcriptional controls. The MAGEA genes are clustered at chromosomal location Xq28. They have been implicated in some hereditary disorders, such as dyskeratosis congenita. [provided by RefSeq, Jul 2008].

HAVCR2, also known as the Tim-3 protein, is a member of the T-cell immunoglobilin and mucin domain (Tim) family and expressed on  differentiated TH1 cells (PMID: 24825777). TIM3 has possible role in dampening the immune response and in contributing to a tumor's ability to acquire resistance to the immune checkpoint blockade (PMID: 31733828)

IL1B, interleukin 1 beta, is a member of the interleukin 1 cytokine family. ProIL-1B is produced by monocytes and macrophages but requires cleavage by capase to produce its active form (PMID:15188375). IL1B induces T-cells to proliferate and produce IFN-g without TCR engagement (PMID:10653850).

TGFB1, transforming growth factor beta 1, is a secreted cytokine that regulates cell growth, proliferation, differentiation, and apoptosis (PMID: 3861940). TGFB induces the epithelial mesenchymal transition (EMT) and of myofibroblast differentiation which is important for normal tissue repair (PMID: 30696809)

TNF, tumor necrosis factor, is a cytokine member of the TNF superfamily (PMID: 29484738) and is mainly produced by macrophages in response to inflammation (PMID: 30585274). TNF is released rapidly after injury with short kinetics, however prolonged TNF production is associated with pathology (PMID: 27726761)

CCND3, cyclin D3, encodes for the D3-type cyclin protein, which regulates the CDK kinases in order to promote the transition phases of the cell cycle (PMID: 23079656). unique functions in lymphocyte development

KLRD1 (CD94),  Killer Cell Lectin Like Recepter D1, is a is a type II transmembrane glycoprotein that is a heterodimer paired with the NKG2 family (PMID: 18083576; PMID: 10023772). KLRD1/NKG2 receptors are expressed on the surface of NK cells  allowing for immunosurveillance of class I MHC molecules (PMID: 18083576; PMID: 10023772)

This gene is a member of the MAGEA gene family. The members of this family encode proteins with 50 to 80% sequence identity to each other. The promoters and first exons of the MAGEA genes show considerable variability, suggesting that the existence of this gene family enables the same function to be expressed under different transcriptional controls. The MAGEA genes are clustered at chromosomal location Xq28. They have been implicated in some hereditary disorders, such as dyskeratosis congenita. At least four variants encoding the same protein have been found for this gene. [provided by RefSeq, Jul 2008].
Not known, though may play a role in embryonal development and tumor transformation or aspects of tumor progression

MAGEA4, melanoma-associated antigen 4, is a member of the cancer testis antigen (CTA) family (PMID: 28300603), and regulates cell growth (PMID: 22842486). MAGEA4 may provide a marker for immunotherapy due to its severe prognosis in numerous cancers (PMID: 12209610)

May be involved in transcriptional regulation through interaction with SNW1 and recruiting histone deactelyase HDAC1. May inhibit notch intracellular domain (NICD) transactivation. May play a role in embryonal development and tumor transformation or aspects of tumor progression. Antigen recognized on a melanoma by autologous cytolytic T-lymphocytes

MAGEA1, melanoma-associated antigen 1, is a member of the cancer testis antigen (CTA) family (PMID: 30498011, PMID: 28300603) that is normally expressed in male germ line cells and placenta (PMID: 28459460) and may play a role in increased cell motility, cell proliferation, and inflammation (PMID: 29763778).
Neither
MAGEA1

This gene encodes a single-pass type I membrane glycoprotein with two Ig-like C2-type domains and an Ig-like V-type domain. This protein is one of the plasma membrane components of adherens junctions. It also serves as an entry for certain mutant strains of herpes simplex virus and pseudorabies virus, and it is involved in cell to cell spreading of these viruses. Variations in this gene have been associated with differences in the severity of multiple sclerosis. Alternate transcriptional splice variants, encoding different isoforms, have been characterized. [provided by RefSeq, Jul 2008].

Modulator of T-cell signaling. Can be either a costimulator of T-cell function, or a coinhibitor, depending on the receptor it binds to. Upon binding to CD226, stimulates T-cell proliferation and cytokine production, including that of IL2, IL5, IL10, IL13, and IFNG. Upon interaction with PVRIG, inhibits T-cell proliferation. These interactions are competitive (PubMed:26755705). Probable cell adhesion protein (PubMed:9657005)

NECTIN 2 (CD112), Nectin cell adhesion molecule 2, is a single pass type I membrane glycoprotein that binds to CD28 family member TIGIT (PMID: 29855615). NECTIN2 costimulates T-cells when bound to CD226, and also inhibits T-cell response through the coinhibitory receptor TIGIT (PMID: 26755705)
MAGEA3

MS4A1, membrane spanning 4-domains A1, is a cell surface marker for mature B-cells that potentially regulates B-cell activation and growth (PMID: 11225995). MS4A1 is expressed in B-cell originated tumors and is a therapeutic target (PMID: 6609729, PMID: 19687518).

The product of this gene belongs to the family of highly homologous synovial sarcoma X (SSX) breakpoint proteins. These proteins may function as transcriptional repressors. They are also capable of eliciting spontaneous humoral and cellular immune responses in cancer patients, and are potentially useful targets in cancer vaccine-based immunotherapy. This gene, and also the SSX1 and SSX4 family members, have been involved in t(X;18)(p11.2;q11.2) translocations that are characteristically found in all synovial sarcomas. This translocation results in the fusion of the synovial sarcoma translocation gene on chromosome 18 to one of the SSX genes on chromosome X. The encoded hybrid proteins are likely responsible for transforming activity. Alternative splicing of this gene results in multiple transcript variants. This gene also has an identical duplicate, GeneID: 727837, located about 45 kb downstream in the opposite orientation on chromosome X. [provided by RefSeq, Jul 2013].
Could act as a modulator of transcription

SSX2, SSX family member 2, is a putative transcriptional repressor (PMID: 27276714) and a known cancer testis antigen (CTA) (PMID: 30186454, PMID: 25363656). SSX proteins are associated with epithelial to mesenchymal transition (EMT), which has been known to initiate metastases formation (PMID: 27276714)
Neither
SSX2

TNFRSF18, (GITR) TNF Receptor Superfamily Member 18, is upregulated after T-cell receptor stimulation. TNFRSF18 is involved in the inhibition of T-cell receptor induced apoptosis and upregulation of inducible nitric oxide synthase (iNOS) (PMID: 15326137; PMID: 9177197). GITR also plays a pivotal role in regulating the suppressive function of CD4+CD25+ regulatory T cells (PMID: 15326137)
Neither
MAGEA4

MX1 (MxA), MX Dynamin Like GTPase 1, belongs to the dynamin superfamily of large GTPases which are involved in intracellular transport processes (PMID: 15047845). MX1 is a in iduced by IFN and plays a role in IFN type-I mediated response in cells infected with a variety of viruses (PMID: 15047845; PMID: 21992152)
Neither
NECTIN2

This gene encodes a member of the PVR (poliovirus receptor) family of immunoglobin proteins. The product of this gene is expressed on several classes of T cells including follicular B helper T cells (TFH). The protein has been shown to bind PVR with high affinity; this binding is thought to assist interactions between TFH and dendritic cells to regulate T cell dependent B cell responses.[provided by RefSeq, Sep 2009].

PDCD1LG2, programmed cell death 1 ligand 2, encodes PD-L2, a ligand for PD-1, which upon interaction exert an inhibitory effect on immune response (PMID: 11224527, PMID: 26432723, PMID: 28018338). When PD-L2 engages PD-1, T-cell receptor mediated proiferation and cytokine production by CD4+ T-cells is inhibited (PMID: 11224527)

TBX21 (T-bet), T-box transcription factor 21 ,  is a transcription factor that directs Th1 cell differentiation (PMID:27292648). TBX21 transactivates the IFNgamma gene, induces IFNgamma production in retrovirally transduced primary T-cells and redirects polarized Th2 cells into the Th1 pathway (PMID: 10761931: PMID:27292648)

The protein encoded by this gene is a member of the Toll-like receptor (TLR) family which plays a fundamental role in pathogen recognition and activation of innate immunity. TLRs are highly conserved from Drosophila to humans and share structural and functional similarities. They recognize pathogen-associated molecular patterns (PAMPs) that are expressed on infectious agents, and mediate the production of cytokines necessary for the development of effective immunity. The various TLRs exhibit different patterns of expression. This gene is predominantly expressed in lung and peripheral blood leukocytes, and lies in close proximity to another family member, TLR7, on chromosome X. [provided by RefSeq, Jul 2008].

Endosomal receptor that plays a key role in innate and adaptive immunity (PubMed:25297876). Controls host immune response against pathogens through recognition of RNA degradation products specific to microorganisms that are initially processed by RNASET2 (PubMed:31778653). Upon binding to agonists, undergoes dimerization that brings TIR domains from the two molecules into direct contact, leading to the recruitment of TIR-containing downstream adapter MYD88 through homotypic interaction (PubMed:23520111, PubMed:25599397, PubMed:26929371). In turn, the Myddosome signaling complex is formed involving IRAK4, IRAK1, TRAF6, TRAF3 leading to activation of downstream transcription factors NF-kappa-B and IRF7 to induce proinflammatory cytokines and interferons, respectively (PubMed:16737960, PubMed:17932028, PubMed:29155428)

Mediates NK cell adhesion and triggers NK cell effector functions. Binds two different NK cell receptors: CD96 and CD226. These interactions accumulates at the cell-cell contact site, leading to the formation of a mature immunological synapse between NK cell and target cell. This may trigger adhesion and secretion of lytic granules and IFN-gamma and activate cytotoxicity of activated NK cells. May also promote NK cell-target cell modular exchange, and PVR transfer to the NK cell. This transfer is more important in some tumor cells expressing a lot of PVR, and may trigger fratricide NK cell activation, providing tumors with a mechanism of immunoevasion. Plays a role in mediating tumor cell invasion and migration

PVR (CD155), poliovirus receptor, is an immunoglobulin-like molecule with three Ig-like domains and localizes in cell-matrix adhesions and cell-cell junctions (PMID: 15194502).  PVR overexpresison promotes cell migration, cell proliferation, and enhances growth factor-induced cell proliferation (PMID: 28730595).
Neither
PVR

The protein encoded by this gene is a member of the Toll-like receptor (TLR) family, which plays a fundamental role in pathogen recognition and activation of innate immunity. TLRs are highly conserved from Drosophila to humans and share structural and functional similarities. They recognize pathogen-associated molecular patterns (PAMPs) that are expressed on infectious agents, and mediate the production of cytokines necessary for the development of effective immunity. Studies in mice and human indicate that this receptor mediates cellular response to unmethylated CpG dinucleotides in bacterial DNA to mount an innate immune response. [provided by RefSeq, Aug 2017].

Key component of innate and adaptive immunity. TLRs (Toll-like receptors) control host immune response against pathogens through recognition of molecular patterns specific to microorganisms. TLR9 is a nucleotide-sensing TLR which is activated by unmethylated cytidine-phosphate-guanosine (CpG) dinucleotides. Acts via MYD88 and TRAF6, leading to NF-kappa-B activation, cytokine secretion and the inflammatory response (PubMed:11564765, PubMed:17932028). Controls lymphocyte response to Helicobacter infection (By similarity). Upon CpG stimulation, induces B-cell proliferation, activation, survival and antibody production (PubMed:23857366)

Binds with high affinity to the poliovirus receptor (PVR) which causes increased secretion of IL10 and decreased secretion of IL12B and suppresses T-cell activation by promoting the generation of mature immunoregulatory dendritic cells

TIGIT, T cell immunoglobulin and ITIM domain, is a T cell- and NK cell-specific gene that encodes a protein containing an immunoglobulin variable (IgV) domain, a transmembrane domain and an immunoreceptor tyrosine-based inhibitory motif (ITIM) (PMID: 19011627). TIGIT is a cohibitory receptor that limits antitumor and other CD8+ T-cell dependent chronic immune responses (PMID: 25465800) by inducing IL-10 production by DCs (PMID:19011627)
Neither
TIGIT

TNFRSF4 (OX40), tumor necrosis factor receptor superfamily member 4, is expressed on activated lymphocytes and predominately CD4+ T-cells (PMID: 26215166). OX40  plays a role in immune co-stimulation through enhanced cell proliferation and survival of T-cells (PMID: 28092803).

TIGIT, T cell immunoglobulin and ITIM domain, is a T cell- and NK cell-specific gene that encodes a protein containing an immunoglobulin variable (IgV) domain, a transmembrane domain and an immunoreceptor tyrosine-based inhibitory motif (ITIM) (PMID: 19011627). TIGIT is a cohibitory receptor that limits antitumor and other CD8+ T-cell dependent chronic immune responses (PMID: 25465800) by inducing IL-10 production by DCs (PMID:19011627)

TLR9, toll like receptor 9, is part of a family of receptors in innate immunity that play an important role in the initiation of host defense. TLR9 recognizes CpG motifs that exist in both viral and bacterial DNA (PMID: 17932028), along with stimualation of immune cells to confer defense against pathogens (PMID:31054156)

TERT, telomerase reverse transcriptase, encodes for one of the subunits of telomerase, is repressed in most human somatic cells and thereby plays a major role in the maintenance of telomere length via reverse transcriptase activity (PMID: 16756500). Loss-of-function TERT alterations causes hematopoietic stem cell exhaustion and bone marrow (BM) failure, as well as premature aging (PMID: 31284662).

MYD88, myeloid differentiation primary response protein, is an adapter protein involved in Toll-like receptor and IL-1 signaling in the immune response, cytokine secretion, and inflammatory response (PMID: 19506249, PMID: 30086464).

PAX8, paired-box 8, is a transcription factor, which is involved in the differentiation of multiple cell types including thyroid, kidney, and neural tube (PMID: 23868062). Additionally, PAX8 functions both to directly increase transcription and to remodel the chromatin landscape (PMID: 30096791).

POLD1, polymerase (DNA directed), delta 1, catalytic subunit, is the catalytic subunit of DNA polymerase delta (Polδ), which mediates DNA replication, nucleotide excision repair, double strand break repair, base excision repair, and mismatch repair (PMID: 27320729).

TLR7, toll like receptor 7, is an endosomal receptor that recognizes single-stranded RNA and located primarily in plasmacytoid dendritic cells and B cells (PMID:18250417) TLR7 has functions in activation of the inflammatory response (PMID: 28620298, PMID: 28374903).
Neither
TLR7

TNFRSF14, TNF receptor superfamily member 14, encodes a transmembrane glycoprotein that acts as a receptor in the tumor necrosis factor signaling pathway, coordinating pro- and anti-inflammatory signaling, and plays a role in T-cell activation and maintece (PMID: 22017438, PMID: 21920726).

TNFSF4 (OX40L), tumor necrosis factor ligand superfamily member 4, is expressed on antigen presenting cells and co-stimulates T-cells through binding of TNFRSF4 (OX40) to induce cell proliferation and survival of T-cells in autoimmunity responses (PMID: 28092803, PMID: 26215166).

BTLA, B and T lymphocyte attenuator, is a member of the immunoglobulin superfamily (PMID: 31774112) and inhibitory receptor belonging to the CD28 family (PMID: 27717503). BTLA expresison  on T-cells aids in the negative regulation of T-cells and leads to decreased T-lymphocytes (PMID: 31774112). The function of BTLA has been associated with damening immune responses and mediating immune memory and prosurvival effects (PMID: 27717503; PMID: 21220749)

TLR8, toll like receptor 8, is part of a family of receptors in innate immunity that play an important role in the initiation of host defense. TLR8 recognizes single stranded RNA and self RNA from dead or dying cells (PMID: 23520111: PMID: 17932028)
Neither
TLR8

VISTA, V-domain Ig suppressor of T cell activation, encoded by the C10orf54 gene,  is a member of the B7-family that shares homolgy with PD-L1 and PD-L2 (PMID: 30382166).  VISTA is an immune checkpoint blockade that suppresses T-cell activation when expressed as a ligand on APCs or a receptor on T-cells (PMID: 31781843).  Higher denisty of VISTA has been associated with resistance to immune checkpoint blockade (PMID:  28776578)

CD244 belongs to the signaling lymphocytic activation molecule (SLAM) related receptors and is expressed on NK cells, monocytes, basophils, gammadelta T cells, dendritic cells, myeloid derived supressor cells and CD8+ T-cells (PMID: 15713798; PMID: 30546369). CD244, along with other inhibitory receptors like PD-1 shows increased expression on exhausted T-cells and TILs compared to peripheral blood (PMID:30546369; PMID: 26205583)

TLR9, toll like receptor 9, is part of a family of receptors in innate immunity that play an important role in the initiation of host defense. TLR9 recognizes CpG motifs that exist in both viral and bacterial DNA (PMID: 17932028), along with stimualation of immune cells to confer defense against pathogens (PMID:31054156)
Neither
TLR9

TNFRSF9 (4-1BB/CD137), TNF Receptor Superfamily Member 9, is a costimulatory receptor expressed on activated T-cells (PMID:22406983). CD137 promotes cellular proliferation, survival, cytokine production and plays a role in the differentiation of effector memory CTLs (PMID:22406983; PMID: 12384425)

CD163, a member of the Scavenger Receptor Cystein-rich (SRCR) protein family, is involved in hemoglobin clearance, and a marker for monocytes and macrophages (PMID:11298324; PMID:28687956). CD163 expression on cancer cells has been associated with poor prognosis in numerous cancers such as breast, colorectal and bladder cancer (PMID:28687956 ; PMID:29725763)

CD28, T-cell-specific surface glycoprotein CD28, is a co-stimulatory molecule constitutively expressed on T-cells and competes with the co-inhibitory molecule, CTLA4, for binding to CD80 and CD86 (PMID: 28102259) and also promotes IL2 production and T-cell survival through upregulation of BCL2L1 (BCL-XL) (PMID: 30565239).
