CD3 chains make up the T-cell antigen receptor complex that transmits signals received from antigen-presenting cells (PMID: 26507128). CD3g plays a role in the regulation to TCR expression at the cell surface that is dependent on its  di-leucine-based (diL) receptor-sorting motif (PMID:8187769)

CD80 is surface glycoprotein and a member of the immunoglobulin superfamily (IgSF). CD80 and CD86 share their ligands on T-cells and are expressed on antigen presenting cells,  bind the T-cell receptors CD28 and CTLA-4, and trigger signals for optimal T-cell activation (PMID: 7545666; DOI: 10.1158/0008-5472)

CCL2, chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 2 , is a chemokine that is a potent chemoattractant for macrophages and T-cells (PMID: 15900302). CCL2 expression from tumor cells facilitates metastasis by activating CCR2 in the endothelium, increasing vascular permeability (PMID: 22789541). Expression leads to sustaining cancer cell proliferation and survival, stimulating cancer cell migration and invasion, and inducing deleterious inflammation and angiogenesis (PMID: 26885690)

CD274, CD274 molecule, encodes for an immunomodulatory ligand (PD-L1), that is expressed on natural killer cells, macrophages, myeloid dendritic cells, B-cells, epithelial cells, and vascular endotherlial cells (PMID: 24551119).  When PD-L1 binds to its receptor, PD-1, it results in inhibition of T-cell activation which contributes to T-cell exhaustion (PMID: 24551119; PMID: 25695955). Tumor cells have adapted this mechanism leading to over-expressed PD-L1 to avoid immunologic survelliance to facilitate cancer growth (PMID: 25695955)

CD68 is a type I transmembrane glycoprotein that belongs to the lysosomal-associated membrane protein (lamp) family (PMID: 18405323). It has widely been used as a macrophage marker, however non-myeloid cells can also express CD68. It's location within endosomes suggests a role in peptide transport and antigen processing (PMID:27869795 )

CTAG1B, cancer/testis antigen 1B, encodes for a cancer testis antigen that is normally expressed on male germ cells and may play a role in the regulation of gene expression (PMID: 15715909, PMID: 22936067). CTAG1B plays a key role in tumor invasion and metastasis (PMID: 30122941)

CXCR6 is a chemokine receptor that is expressed by a subset of memory/effector T-cells, NK cells and NKT cells, and plasma cells (PMID: 12914753). CXCR6 may play a role in facilitating immune responses via cell to cell contact and mediatiating inflammation (PMID: 12914753; PMID:11238560 )

FOXP3, forkhead family protein 3, acts as a repressor of transcription and is an essential regulator of the development and function of regulatory T-cells (PMID: 17360565; PMID: 30784578). T-cells expressing FOXP3 have a critical role in the maintenance of immune homeostatis and prevention of autoimmunity (PMID: 30784578)

NECTIN 2 (CD112), Nectin cell adhesion molecule 2, is a single pass type I membrane glycoprotein that binds to CD28 family member TIGIT (PMID: 29855615). NECTIN2 costimulates T-cells when bound to CD226, and also inhibits T-cell response through the coinhibitory receptor TIGIT (PMID: 26755705)

AKT1, RAC-alpha serine/threonine-protein kinase, is a ubquitously expressed serine-threonine protein kinase, which regulates a variety of cell functions including, metabolism, growth, angiogenesis, cell proliferation and survival through PI3K signaling in response to extracellular signals (PMID: 23297823, PMID: 26698230).

ANKRD11, ankyrin repeat domain 11, is a transcriptional regulator that plays a role in histone acetylation, inhibits ligand-dependent transactivation, and enhances Tp53 transcriptional activity (PMID: 29258554, PMID: 17521611, PMID: 15184363, PMID: 18840648).

ANKRD26, ankyrin repeat domain 26, encodes a protein found within the inner part of the cell membrane that plays a role in pathway signaling, in particular the MAPK/ERK pathway, and is required for appropriate platelet formation and adipogenesis (PMID: 29545013, PMID: 21669876, PMID: 24430186).

CD2, also knows as T-cell surface antigen 11 (T11), is expressed on mature T-cells with higher frequency on memory T-cells (PMID: 2951597, DOI:10.1101/589440) CD2 along with its ligand CD58 inhibit T-cell conjugation and kill alloreactive target cells (DOI: 10.1101/589440). Increased CD2 expression as been associated with decreased PD-L1 expression (PMID: 31383967) check that last sentence

CD4, CD4 molecule, is a glycoprotein that recognizes MHC class II peptides on antigen-presenting cells and is expressed on NK cells, macrophages, eosinophils, neutrophils, and CD8+ T cells (PMID: 16951326). CD4 regulates activation of T-lymphocytes leading to proliferation and differentiation of effector T-cells, and plays a key role in adaptive immune response (PMID: 22474485, PMID: 8057386).

CD8 is encoded by two distinct genes, CD8alpha and CD8beta, and is expressed on the surface of T cells primarily as a CD8alphabeta heterodimer (PMID:17145893). Heterodimeric CD8alphabeta has consistently been shown to be a better coreceptor than homodimeric CD8alphaalpha and correlates with enhanced sensitivity to peptide antigen (PMID:17145893). In addition upregulation of CD8beta is a TIL marker (PMID: 30387832)

DDX58, also known as retinoic acid-inducible gene I (RIG-1), is a cytoplasmic Dex(D/H) box helicase that detects intracellular viral products to signal IFN-(alpha/beta) production in infected cells (PMID: 17942531). Upon viral recognition, DDX58 activates antiviral signaling pathways that lead to transcriptional up-regulation of type I and III interferons (IFN) (PMID:29534222).

KLRD1 (CD94),  Killer Cell Lectin Like Recepter D1, is a is a type II transmembrane glycoprotein that is a heterodimer paired with the NKG2 family (PMID: 18083576; PMID: 10023772). KLRD1/NKG2 receptors are expressed on the surface of NK cells  allowing for immunosurveillance of class I MHC molecules (PMID: 18083576; PMID: 10023772)

MAGEA1, melanoma-associated antigen 1, is a member of the cancer testis antigen (CTA) family (PMID: 30498011, PMID: 28300603) that is normally expressed in male germ line cells and placenta (PMID: 28459460) and may play a role in increased cell motility, cell proliferation, and inflammation (PMID: 29763778).

MX1 (MxA), MX Dynamin Like GTPase 1, belongs to the dynamin superfamily of large GTPases which are involved in intracellular transport processes (PMID: 15047845). MX1 is a in iduced by IFN and plays a role in IFN type-I mediated response in cells infected with a variety of viruses (PMID: 15047845; PMID: 21992152)

PDCD1LG2, programmed cell death 1 ligand 2, encodes PD-L2, a ligand for PD-1, which upon interaction exert an inhibitory effect on immune response (PMID: 11224527, PMID: 26432723, PMID: 28018338). When PD-L2 engages PD-1, T-cell receptor mediated proiferation and cytokine production by CD4+ T-cells is inhibited (PMID: 11224527)

SSX2, SSX family member 2, is a putative transcriptional repressor (PMID: 27276714) and a known cancer testis antigen (CTA) (PMID: 30186454, PMID: 25363656). SSX proteins are associated with epithelial to mesenchymal transition (EMT), which has been known to initiate metastases formation (PMID: 27276714)

TLR7, toll like receptor 7, is an endosomal receptor that recognizes single-stranded RNA and located primarily in plasmacytoid dendritic cells and B cells (PMID:18250417) TLR7 has functions in activation of the inflammatory response (PMID: 28620298, PMID: 28374903).

TNFRSF14, TNF receptor superfamily member 14, encodes a transmembrane glycoprotein that acts as a receptor in the tumor necrosis factor signaling pathway, coordinating pro- and anti-inflammatory signaling, and plays a role in T-cell activation and maintece (PMID: 22017438, PMID: 21920726).

TNFRSF4 (OX40), tumor necrosis factor receptor superfamily member 4, is expressed on activated lymphocytes and predominately CD4+ T-cells (PMID: 26215166). OX40  plays a role in immune co-stimulation through enhanced cell proliferation and survival of T-cells (PMID: 28092803).

HIST1H2BD is a member of the H2B histone family which plays important roles in the processes on chromatin that allow for transcription, DNA replication and DNA repair (PMID: 29184082). Polyadenylated mRNA HIST1H2BD transcripts are transported to the cytoplasm which increase following hte induction of double-strand DNA breaks via gamma-irradiation (PMID: 23717473).

CD3 chains make up the T-cell antigen receptor complex that transmits signals received from antigen-presenting cells (PMID: 26507128). CD3d is not required for pre-TCR signalling (PMID: 12215456) but plays an essential role for promoting progression of early thymocytes towards double positive stage (PMID:15546002)

CD40, CD40 molecule, encodes for a member of the tumor necrosis factor receptor family, which is expressed in a variety of cell types such as B cells, dendritic cells, monocytes, and platelets, and its signaling plays a role in multiple immune processes (PMID: 19426221). CD40 binds to its ligand, CD40L, and its cross-talk is importantn for the development and proliferation of B-cells and Th17 cells (PMID: 30265161)

CD8 is encoded by two distinct genes, CD8alpha and CD8beta, and is expressed on the surface of T cells primarily as a CD8alphabeta heterodimer (PMID:17145893) CD8alpha enhances responses instigated through the TCR by binding MHC class I (PMID: 17678538). Binding to  human NK cells prevents activation induced apoptosis and enhances cytolytic activity (PMID:16236125)

CTLA4 (CD152), cytotoxic T-lymphocyte-associated protein 4, is a negative regulator of T-cell activation (PMID: 27249753) that is constitutively expressed on Tregs and upregulated upon T-cell receptor (TCR) signaling to compete with the co-stimulatory molecule, CD28, for binding to CD80 and CD86 (PMID: 30565239, PMID: 28102259). Immune checkpoint inhibitor blockade of CTLA4 is an important component of anti-tumor immunotherapies (PMID: 23748107, PMID: 26325034).

ENTPD1 (CD39), ectonucleoside triphosphate diphosphohydrolase 1, is expressed by B cells, innate cells, regulatory T-cells as well as activated CD4 and CD8 T-cells (PMID: 30006565). CD39 converts ATP to adenosine to regulate cellular homeostasis and functions as an immune checkpoint inhibitor and is a marker for exhausted T-cells in patients with chronic viral infections (PMID: 29914571; PMID: 30006565)

HAVCR2, also known as the Tim-3 protein, is a member of the T-cell immunoglobilin and mucin domain (Tim) family and expressed on  differentiated TH1 cells (PMID: 24825777). TIM3 has possible role in dampening the immune response and in contributing to a tumor's ability to acquire resistance to the immune checkpoint blockade (PMID: 31733828)

IL1B, interleukin 1 beta, is a member of the interleukin 1 cytokine family. ProIL-1B is produced by monocytes and macrophages but requires cleavage by capase to produce its active form (PMID:15188375). IL1B induces T-cells to proliferate and produce IFN-g without TCR engagement (PMID:10653850).

MAGEA4, melanoma-associated antigen 4, is a member of the cancer testis antigen (CTA) family (PMID: 28300603), and regulates cell growth (PMID: 22842486). MAGEA4 may provide a marker for immunotherapy due to its severe prognosis in numerous cancers (PMID: 12209610)

PVR (CD155), poliovirus receptor, is an immunoglobulin-like molecule with three Ig-like domains and localizes in cell-matrix adhesions and cell-cell junctions (PMID: 15194502).  PVR overexpresison promotes cell migration, cell proliferation, and enhances growth factor-induced cell proliferation (PMID: 28730595).

TNFSF4 (OX40L), tumor necrosis factor ligand superfamily member 4, is expressed on antigen presenting cells and co-stimulates T-cells through binding of TNFRSF4 (OX40) to induce cell proliferation and survival of T-cells in autoimmunity responses (PMID: 28092803, PMID: 26215166).

ABL2, ABL proto-oncogene 2, non-receptor tyrosine kinase, serves as a liaison between upstream receptors and regulates biological processes ssuch as cell survival, apoptosis, response to genotoxic stress and cell motility (PMID: 28086240; PMID: 23842646). In addition knockdown of ABL2 can decrease cancer cell invasion and intravasation (PMID: 26729027)

ARAF, A-Raf proto-oncogene, serine/threonine kinase, is a member of the RAF family of serine/threonine protein kinases, which plays a role in cell proliferation and growth (PMID: 17535970). ARAF transduces MAP kinase pathway signals from Ras to MEK and ERK (PMID: 24569458)

KNSTRN, kinastrin, is a kinetochore-associated protein that is broadly expressed in various tissues and regulates the cell cycle (PMID: 19667759), and plays a role in cellular apoptosis (PMID: 24718257). Additionally, KNSTRN regulates chromosomal stability as it is an essential component of the mitotic spindle required for progression to anaphase (PMID: 25194279; PMID: 19667759).

CHEK2, checkpoint kinase 2, is a serine-threonine protein kinase and a putative tumor suppressor (PMID: 30562755). CHEK2 is required for checkpoint-mediated cell cycle arrest in the G1 phase and activation of DNA repair and apoptosis in response to DNA damage (PMID: 28553140).

RHOA, ras homolog family member A, is a member of the Rho small GTPase family. RHOA is involved in regulation of actin cytoskeleton dynamics, cell migration, cell adhesion and cell-cycle progression (PMID: 19327386, PMID: 24467208, PMID: 26103434).

ROS1, ROS proto-oncogene 1, receptor tyrosine kinase (RTK), is an orphan receptor tyrosine kinase related to the anaplastic lymphoma kinase (ALK) family (PMID: 25264305). ROS1 may activate multiple pathways involved in cell survival and transformation (PMID: 23719267).

CXCR2 is a chemokine and a membrane bound G-protein coupled receptor that is expressed on neutrophils, monocytes, lymphocytes and NK cells (PMID:22850671; PMID: 30319622). Activation of CXCR2 is important for the recruitment of neutrophils to a site of infection (PMID: 22850671 )

GZMB, granzyme B,  is a granule associated serine protease that is induced when t-cells and NK cells acquire cytotoxic function (PMID: 8258716). GZMB plays a central role in killing human tumor cell lines, along with inducing cell death and apoptosis (PMID: 29669300)

ICOS, inducible co-stimulator, is a member of the CD28 family. ICOS enhances basic T-cell responses to foreign antigens such as proliferation, secretion of lymphokines, upregulation of molecules that mediate cell-cell interaction and effective help for antibody secretion by B-cells (PMID: 9930702; PMID:11169414)

IL10, interleukin 10, encodes for an anti-inflammatory cytokine that is involved in the regulation of the immune response (PMID: 18424693). IL10 expression has been linked to immune protection in cancer (PMID: 24076584).

LAG3, lymphocyte activation gene 3 protein, is expressed on activated T-cells and NK cells and binds MHC class II molecules to inhibit the immune response (PMID: 28258692). LAG3 inhibition in cancer therapy may relieve suppression of the anti-tumor immune response (PMID: 29900067, PMID: 29439955).

MAGEA3, melanoma-associated antigen 3, is a member of the cancer testis antigen (CTA) family that has normal, restricted expression in the testis (PMID: 30588194). MAGEA3 is often correlated with poor prognosis and resistance to immune checkpoint blockade (PMID: 29656892).

MS4A1, membrane spanning 4-domains A1, is a cell surface marker for mature B-cells that potentially regulates B-cell activation and growth (PMID: 11225995). MS4A1 is expressed in B-cell originated tumors and is a therapeutic target (PMID: 6609729, PMID: 19687518).

TBX21 (T-bet), T-box transcription factor 21 ,  is a transcription factor that directs Th1 cell differentiation (PMID:27292648). TBX21 transactivates the IFNgamma gene, induces IFNgamma production in retrovirally transduced primary T-cells and redirects polarized Th2 cells into the Th1 pathway (PMID: 10761931: PMID:27292648)

TNF, tumor necrosis factor, is a cytokine member of the TNF superfamily (PMID: 29484738) and is mainly produced by macrophages in response to inflammation (PMID: 30585274). TNF is released rapidly after injury with short kinetics, however prolonged TNF production is associated with pathology (PMID: 27726761)

TNFRSF9 (4-1BB/CD137), TNF Receptor Superfamily Member 9, is a costimulatory receptor expressed on activated T-cells (PMID:22406983). CD137 promotes cellular proliferation, survival, cytokine production and plays a role in the differentiation of effector memory CTLs (PMID:22406983; PMID: 12384425)

CEBPA, CCAAT enhancer binding protein alpha, is a transcription factor that regulates the expression of genes and myleopoiesis through cell differentiation and proliferation of myeloid progenitors  (PMID: 26601784). Additionally, CEBPA inhibits cell proliferation by activating transcription of p21/WAF1, by stabilizing p21 and inhibiting CDK2 and CDK4 (PMID: 15674366).

TNFRSF18, (GITR) TNF Receptor Superfamily Member 18, is upregulated after T-cell receptor stimulation. TNFRSF18 is involved in the inhibition of T-cell receptor induced apoptosis and upregulation of inducible nitric oxide synthase (iNOS) (PMID: 15326137; PMID: 9177197). GITR also plays a pivotal role in regulating the suppressive function of CD4+CD25+ regulatory T cells (PMID: 15326137)

MAP3K13, mitogen-activated protein kinase kinase kinase 13, is a member of the mixed lineage kinase (MLK) protein family that regulates NF-ĸB, JNK, and mutant p53 pathways, all of which play vital roles in oncogenesis (PMID: 11726277; PMID: 31186535).

POLE, DNA polymerase epsilon catalytic subunit, mediates proofreading activity during DNA repair, replication and plays a role in genomic stability (PMID: 26822575; PMID: 29604063; PMID: 31747945). Additionally, POLE has been implicated in cell cycle checkpoint regulation and propagation of chromatin modification states (PMID: 26822575).

ABL1, ABL proto-oncogene 1, non-receptor tyrosine kinase, plays a role in regulation of cell growth through ERK5, Rac/JNK, and Stat1/3 pathways (PMID: 10373409). A number of Abl1 mutations in the context of BCR-ABL1 have been demonstrated to confer drug resistance (PMID: 24456693).

RB1, retinoblastoma-associated protein, is a key negative regulator of the G1 to S transition during cell division (PMID: 15084261) and also plays a role in cell differentiation, survival, senescence, epigenetic regulation, and genome stability (PMID: 21295686, PMID: 23359405, PMID: 22293180).

FAM175A, Abraxas 1, BRCA1 A Complex Subunit that binds BRCA1 forming a complex with with BACH1 and CTIP. Abraxas recruits ibiquitin interacting motif (UIM) containing Rap80 , both of which are required for DNA damage resistance (PMID: 17525340; PMID: 17643122).

VSIR, V-domain Ig suppressor of T cell activation, encoded by the C10orf54 gene, is a member of the B7-family that shares homology with PD-L1 and PD-L2 (PMID: 30382166). VSIR is an immune checkpoint blockade that suppresses T-cell activation when expressed as a ligand on APCs or a receptor on T-cells (PMID: 31781843).  Higher density of VSIR has been associated with resistance to immune checkpoint blockade (PMID: 28776578).

BMPR1A, bone morphogenetic protein receptor type IA, is a serine/threonine kinase receptor that activates SMAD signaling pathways, thus regulating transcription of genes involved in growth, adipogenic differentiation, and development (PMID: 16246179; PMID: 31827527).

BRD4, bromodomain containing protein 4, is a member of the bromodomain and extraterminal (BET) protein family and functions in chromatin remodeling and regulation of c-MYC (PMID: 24736545). BRD4 is enriched on active enhancers and promoters, and a known epigenetic reader and transcriptional regulator (PMID: 23317504; PMID: 29263365).

DNMT1, DNA methyltransferase 1, is a epigenetic modifier that methylates DNA during replication to preserve parental methylation patterns and is regulated by both transcriptional and post-transcriptional mechanisms (PMID: 20234167, PMID: 30544982). Additionally, DNMT1 interacts with histone proteins to influence chromatin structure (PMID: 20234167).

EP300, E1A binding protein p300, is highly homologous to CREBBP and is a transcriptional co-activator (PMID: 25111821). EP300 functions in acetylation of histones thereby affecting protein turnover, as well as heamatopoesis (PMID: 25111821, PMID: 24622842).

C11orf30, EMSY Transcriptional Repressor, BRCA2 Interacting gene,  plays a role in transciptional regulation resulting in silencing (PMID: 24582497). EMSY silences BRCA2 by binding BRCA2 within exon 3 deleted in cancer (PMID: 24582497; PMID: 14651845)

FAM46C, or Terminal Nucleotidyltransferase 5C (TENT5C) is a member of the nucleotidyltransferase superfamily (PMID: 28619709). FAM46C enhances the replication of certain viruses and is related to the regulation of translation (PMID: 27060136)

GNA11, G protein subunit alpha 11, is a guanine nucleotide-binding protein (G protein) subunit, which is activated following ligand binding to G-protein coupled receptors and functions in cell signaling (PMID: 27148356). GNA11 hotspot mutations impair intrinsic Gna11 GTPase activity, resulting in constitutive pathway activation (PMID: 23640210, PMID: 27148356, PMID: 29209985).

GPR124, or Adhesion G Protein-Couple Receptor A2 (ADGRA2), is an orphan adhesion GPCR and plays an essential role in blood brain barrier formation (PMID: 31058365). GPR forms a multiprotein complex with Reck that enhances Wnt signating in the CNS endothelial cells leading to cell migration and differentiation (PMID: 31534530; PMID: 31058365)

H3F3B is an H3.3 variant histone that is expressed throughout the cell cycle (PMID: 15776021). H3.3 interacts with the HIRA histone chaperone that is necessary to mediate DNA-synthesis independet nuclosome assembly respectively (PMID: 14718166; PMID: 15776021)

FGFR3, fibroblast growth factor receptor 3, is a receptor tyrosine kinase (RTK) activated upon binding of the FGF ligand, which activates RAS-MAPK and PI3K-AKT pathways (PMID: 22508544). FGFR3 regulates chondrocyte proliferation and differentiation in the growth plate, and mutations within FGFR3 increased signalling, and enhanced tyrosine kinase activity (PMID: 27987249)

CCNE1, cyclin E1, predominately interacts with CKD2 to regulate the cell-cycle in transition from G1 to S phase (PMID: 14965268, PMID: 27461360). Decreased CCNE1 expression may inhibit cell proliferation (PMID: 31072916)

MYCL, v-myc avian myelocytomatosis viral oncogene lung carcinoma derived homolog, is a member of the MYC family (PMID: 31025404) and  is a transcription factor that plays a role in cell cycle progression, apoptosis, and cellular transformation (PMID: 25038584).

FAM123B, APC Membrane Recruitment Protein 1 (AMER1), or WTX,  is an X-chromosome gene that recruits APC (a tumor suppressor protein) to the plasma membrane (PMID: 21498506; PMID: 17925383). AMER1 is a regulatory of the WNT signalling pathway by forming a complex with β- catenin (PMID: 17510365)

FAM175A, Abraxas 1, BRCA1 A Complex Subunit that binds BRCA1 forming a complex with with BACH1 and CTIP. Abraxas recruits ibiquitin interacting motif (UIM) containing Rap80 , both of which are required for DNA damage resistance (PMID: 17525340; PMID:17643122)

ARID1A, AT rich interactive domain 1A (SWI1-like), is a member of the SWI/SNF chromatin remodeling complex and is involved in regulating cellular processes such as proliferation and differentiation and tumorigenesis (PMID: 29136504; PMID: 31731647). ARID1A contributes to tumorigenesis by several cellular functions such as proliferation, differentiation, mitosis, DNA damage repair and apoptosis (PMID: 31731647)

SMAD4, mothers against decapentaplegic homolog 4, is a tumor suppressor (PMID: 30562755) that translocates to the nucleus upon TGF-beta signaling to form a protein complex that regulates gene transcription and cell growth (PMID: 28452926).

SMO, smoothened, frizzled class receptor, is a G-protein coupled receptor and member of the Hedgehog signaling pathway, which is involved in cell fate, proliferation, and survival (PMID: 16881963). Missense mutations in SMO are associated with resistance to Hedgehog pathway inhibitors (PMID: 29175550, PMID: 25306392).

MLH1, mutL homolog 1, is a tumor suppressor (PMID: 30562755) that dimerizes with Pms2 to form a component of the DNA mismatch repair (MMR) system (PMID: 16873062). MLH1 is associated with microsatellite instability (MSI) (PMID: 30121009) and genomic stability (PMID: 31747945).

CSNK1A1, casein kinase 1 alpha 1, encodes a member of the CK1 protein family that functions as a signaling molecule involved in multiple cellular processes. CSNK1A1 regulates proliferation, autophagy, cell survival, and immune response, and plays a role in the regulation of the Wnt and Hedgehog signaling pathways, TP53, and Nf-kappaB (PMID: 29793495, PMID: 28969692).

CDK12, cyclin dependent kinase 12, is a key regulator of transcription elongation, regulates the expression of genes involved in DNA repair, and is required for the maintenance of genomic stability (PMID: 24554720; PMID: 22012619).

KEL, Kell metallo-endopeptidase (Kell blood group), encodes a type II transmembrane glycoprotein, the polymorphic Kell blood group antigen, which plays a role in the conversion of endothelin-3 to its bioactive form (PMID: 23581578, PMID: 16423827).
MAPK3,ERK-1,ERK1

NEGR1, neuronal growth regulator 1, encodes a cell adhesion molecule that is a member of the immunoglobulin LON family and plays a role in neuronal growth and connectivity. Additionally NEGR1 engages in cell recognition, adhesion, and interaction (PMID: 29479305, PMID: 25057311; PMID: PMID: 30059965).

PGR, progesterone receptor, is a member of the steroid nuclear receptor superfamily, which is activated by progesterone binding and mediates downstream signaling (PMID: 24287036). PGR has two main isoforms, PGRA and PGRB which different roles in the cell (PMID: 24287036).

PHF6, PHD finger protein 6, is involved in chromatin organization, interacts with several factors that regulate transcription, and plays a role in cell-cycle regulation via suppression of ribosomal RNA transcription (PMID: 23229552, PMID: 28607179, PMID: 26103525).

PIK3R3, phosphoinositide-3-kinase regulatory subunit 3, is a class 1A PI3K regulatory subunit that is associated with the important cell cycle regulator, retinoblastoma protein (Rb). Additionally PIK3R3 plays a role in cell proliferation, differentiation, and migration (PMID: 24837077, PMID: 22722333).

FGFR2, fibroblast growth factor receptor 2, is a receptor tyrosine kinase activated upon binding of the FGF ligand, which activates RAS-MAPK and PI3K-AKT pathways (PMID: 22508544).  Altered function of FGFR2 through activating mutations, fusions, and amplification increases cell proliferation and tumorigenesis (PMID: 22508544).

SMAD4, mothers against decapentaplegic homolog 4, is a tumor suppressor gene (PMID: 30562755) that translocates to the nucleus upon TGF-beta signaling to form a protein complex that regulates gene transcription and cell growth (PMID: 28452926; PMID: 11074002).

PREX2, phosphatidylinositol-3,4,5-trisphosphate dependent Rac exchange factor 2, is a Rho/Rac guanine-nucleotide exchange factor that activates RAC1, resulting in cell migration and invasion. Additionally, PREX2 facilitates PI3K/AKT pathway signaling in a Rac independent manner by inhibiting PTEN, thereby promoting cell proliferation (PMID: 23753921, PMID: 21925199).
PRKAR1A, protein kinase cAMP-dependent type I regulatory subunit alpha, is a major component of PKa which mediates cAMP-dependent signaling (PMID: 26042218).

GNAQ, G protein subunit alpha q, is a guanine-binding protein (G protein) subunit, which is activated following ligand binding to G-protein coupled receptors and functions in cell signaling (PMID: 27148356). GNAQ hotspot mutations impair intrinsic GTPase activity, resulting in constitutive pathway activation (PMID: 23640210, PMID: 27148356)
H3F3C is a histsone variant that is highly expressed in the human testis. H3.5 nucleosome is unstable, and it accumulates around transcription start sites (PMID: 29179259)

AKT1, protein kinase B alpha, or PKBa, is one of three closely related serine/threonine-protein kinases. AKT1 has a wide tissue distribution and  is implicated in metabolism, proliferation, cell growth, survival and angiogenesis (PMID: 21620960; PMID: 11882383).

AXIN1, axis inhibition protein 1, is a scaffold protein that regulates the Wnt signaling pathway and also p53, Myc, TGF-beta, and Jun pathways (PMID: 30166345). Loss of AXIN1 function leads to increased cellular beta-catenin (CTNNB1), potentially promoting cell proliferation, cytoplasmic accumulation and nuclear translocation (PMID: 10700176; PMID: 31611869).

AXIN2, axin 2, is a homologue of Axin that has a restricted developmental and cell-type specific expression pattern. AXIN2 is a transcriptional target of beta-catenin dependent Wnt signaling and negatively regulates beta-catenin degradation (PMID: 9554852; PMID: 25236910).

CDKN2A, cyclin-dependent kinase inhibitor 2A, is a tumor suppressor (PMID: 30562755) that encodes p16 and p14ARF from alternate reading frames, which function to inhibit Cdk4 and Cdk6 and regulate Tp53 activity to promote cell-cycle arrest (PMID: 23875803, PMID: 17055429, PMID: 27428416).

CCND1, G1/S-specific cyclin-D1,encodes cyclin D1 and  interacts with CDK4 and CDK6 to regulate the cell-cycle in transition from G1 to S phase (PMID: 28611330, PMID: 27695879). The stability of cyclin D1 is regulated through Wnt (PMID: 27695879).

ESR1, estrogen receptor alpha, encodes estrogen receptor α (ER) which is a ligand dependent transctription factor (PMID: 26122181). ESR1 modulates response to estrogen and is used as a marker to predict response to endocrine therapy (PMID: 23542176, PMID: 26183887).

ESR1, estrogen receptor alpha (ER),  is a ligand dependent transcription factor (PMID: 26122181). ESR1 modulates response to estrogen and is used as a marker to predict response to endocrine therapy (PMID: 23542176, PMID: 26183887).

GSK3B, glycogen synthase kinase 3 beta, is a serine-threonine kinase that is involved in glycogen synthesis, regulates proteosomal degradation of signaling molecules including beta-catenin, Ccnd1, Myc, and Jun (PMID: 11563964, PMID: 29379583), and also promotes cell survival through activation of NF-kappaB signaling (PMID: 28053024).

H3F3A is an H3.3 variant histone that is expressed throughout the cell cycle (PMID: 15776021). H3.3 interacts with the HIRA histone chaperone that is necessary to mediate DNA-synthesis independet nuclosome assembly respectively (PMID: 14718166; PMID: 15776021)
ABL1,ABL,BCR-ABL,bcr/abl,c-ABL,c-ABL1,CHDSKM,JTK7,p150,v-abl

SMARCB1, SWI/SNF related, matrix associated, actin dependent regulator of chromatin, subfamily b, member 1, is a member of the SWI/SNF chromatin remodeling complex (PMID: 23095836). SMARCB1 regulates transcription of several genes involved in cell proliferation, can induce the accumulation of cells in the G0/G1 phase and in some cases, induce cell senescence or apoptosis (PMID: 23095836; PMID: 28109176

VHL, von Hippel-Lindau tumor suppressor, is part of an E3 ubiquitin protein ligase complex, which promotes degradation of HIF-alpha and other protein targets required for cellular growth and angiogenesis (PMID: 24583008, PMID: 30194449). Additionally, VHL plays a role in genomic stability (PMID: 31747945).

BIRC3, baculoviral IAP repeat containing 3, is a member of the inhibitors of apoptotic protein (IAP) family that regulates apoptosis and other cellular processes such as TNF-receptor (TNFR) signaling complexes through ubiquitination of targeting proteins (PMID: 23790005). Through the TNFR signalling, BIRC3 can modulate inflammatory signalling and immunity (PMID: 21817100).

JAK1, janus kinase 1, is a non-receptor protein tyrosine kinase involved in the interferon-alpha/beta/gamma pathway, is ubiquitously expressed, and is a member of the JAK/STAT signaling pathway (PMID: 15575979). Frameshift mutations in JAK1 are associated with high mutational burden and microsatellite instability (PMID: 29121062).

MAX, MYC associated factor X, is ubiquitously expressed and a member of the helix-loop-helix leucine zipper transcription factor family. MAX acts as a transcriptional cofactor for MYC family members, playing a role in regulation of cell growth, proliferation and apoptosis (PMID: 16908182; PMID: 11031250; PMID: 26070438).
H3C14, H3 clustered histone 14, encodes a member of the histone H3 family that may play a role in nucleosome assembly during DNA replication (PMID: 30165676).

HOXB13, homeobox B13, encodes a member of the HOX gene family and is a transcription factor involved in vertebrate embryonic development, particularly in the modulation of prostate differentiation and function by regulating the response to androgens (PMID: 12668621, PMID: 31137568).

WISP3, Cellular Communication Network Factor 6 (CCN6), can function both intracellularly and extracellularly (PMID: 27252383). It has been shown to modulate both IGF-1 and cartilage hypertropy markers such as reactive oxygen species along with regulating mitochondrial function (PMID: 27252383; PMID: 23424195).

CDKN2A, cyclin-dependent kinase inhibitor 2A, is a tumor suppressor (PMID: 30562755) that encodes p16 and p14ARF from alternate reading frames, which function to inhibit Cdk4 and Cdk6 and regulate Tp53 activity to promote cell-cycle arrest (PMID: 23875803, PMID: 17055429, PMID: 27428416). CDKN2A germline mutations are associated with familial atypical multiple mole melanoma and somatic mutations are highest in pancreatic, HNSCC, NSCLC, and melanoma (PMID: 27283171).

BRCA2, breast cancer type 2 susceptibility protein, is a tumor suppressor that is central to maintaining genome stability through DNA replication, telomere homeostasis and cell cycle progression (PMID: 27530658). BRCA2 regulates DNA repair following carboxy-terminal phosphorylation through the checkpoint kinases, Chk1 and Chk2. Phosphorylation regulates BRCA2's interaction with RAD51 leading to the recruitment of the BRCA-RAD51 complex to sites of DNA damage (PMID: 18317453)

TSC1, TSC complex subunit 1 or hamartin, is a tumor suppressor (PMID: 30562755) that forms a complex with TSC2 (also known as tuberin). The TSC complex inhibits mTOR pathway signaling, thus regulating cell growth, proliferation, and metabolism (PMID: 27226234).

CIC, capicua transcriptional repressor, is a member of the HMG-box superfamily of transcriptional repressors that while unstimulated represses gene activation downstream of EGFR/Ras/ERK signaling (PMID: 32029440, PMID: 30737375, PMID: 29578365). CIC targets such as ETV1, ETV4, and ETV55 mediate cell proliferation, motility and invasion downstream of Ras (PMID: 30737375).

CYLD, ubiquitin carboxyl-terminal hydrolase, acts as a tumor suppressor through enzymatic removal of ubiquitin chains on target substrates. CYLD activity influences NF-KB, WNT, MAPK, HDAC6, and EGFR along with each pathway's molecular functions (PMID: 20347313, PMID: 25342597, PMID: 28572092).

DIS3, DIS3 homolog, exosome endoribonuclease and 3'-5' exoribonuclease, encodes a catalytic subunit of the endosome, which is involved in the processing of both nuclear and cytoplasmic RNAs (PMID: 26193331). DIS3 is involved in the regulation of gene expression, and RNA processing pathways such as mRNA quality control and small RNA processing (PMID: 26193331; PMID: 11030620).

FANCA, Fanconi anemia complementation group A, is a member of the Fanconi anemia (FA) nuclear complex, which plays a role in interstrand crosslink repair and DSB repair through the canonical FA pathway via FANCD2 monoubiquitination (PMID: 11673408, PMID: 12509764).

IRS1, insulin receptor substrate 1, encodes an adaptor protein that acts as a substrate for a variety of receptors including the insulin and insulin-like growth factor receptors, thereby mediating insulin signaling and subsequent PI3K signaling, and cytokine receptors, leading to JAK/STAT pathway signaling (PMID: 8384986, PMID: 15157524).

MGA, MAX dimerization protein MGA, is a transcription factor with dual specificity that can form a heterodimer with MAX, regulate MYC target gene and regulate T-box family target genes (PMID: 10601024, PMID: 16908182).

NOTCH2 is a member of the NOTCH family and a transmembrane receptor, that is both a tumor supressor and oncogene depending on the tumor type (PMID: 22891276). NOTCH2 plays a role in cell fate determination, differentiation, and controls B-lymphocyte specification into cells of marginal zone lineage (PMID: 22891276; PMID: 22891276).

ACVRL1, activin receptor like kinase 1 encodes ALK1 and is a type I cell-surface receptor for the TGF-beta superfamily (PMID: 8640225; PMID: 26176610). ACVRL1 is involved in the regulation of cell proliferation, differentiation, migration and extracellular matrix formation and plays a role in the development of blood vessels (PMID: 26176610)

TP53, tumor protein p53, is a tumor suppressor and oncogene (PMID: 30562755; PMID: 30577483). TP53 responds to various stresses to regulate expression of target genes by inducing cell cycle arrest, senescence, DNA repair, cell metabolism and apoptosis (PMID: 10065147; PMID: 22713868; PMID: 29786075). In addition TP53 is the most frequently mutated gene in cancer (PMID: 30577483).
NF1, neurofibromin, is a tumor suppressor (PMID: 30562755), which activates Ras GTPase activity leading to increased cell proliferation and malignant transformation (PMID: 19380279).
C10orf54,VISTA

BLM, Bloom syndrome RecQ like helicase, is a member of RecQ family and a DNA helicase that plays important roles in maintaining genomic integrity (PMID: 28232778). Non-functional BLM leads to chromosome instability, homologous recombination, and an increase number of sister chromatid exchanges (PMID: 28232778; PMID: 30496191).

MLLT3, myeloid/lymphoid or mixed-lineage leukemia; translocated to, 3, is also referred to as AF9 and is a component of the super elongation complex (PMID: 18371451). Additionally MLLT3 is a hematopoietic stem cell maintenance factor that links histone reader and modifying activities to modulate HSC gene expression (PMID: 31776511).
MLLT3,AF9

PIK3C3, phosphatidylinositol 3-kinase catalytic subunit type 3, also known as Vps34, is the class III PI3K catalytic subunit and plays a role in endosomal trafficking and autophagy (PMID: 29222162, PMID: 24587488).

PIM1, Pim-1 proto-oncogene, serine/threonine kinase, is a member of the constitutively active PIM kinase family and involved in the regulation of B lymphocytes (PMID: 23495171). PIM1 is expressed with other proteins such as c-MYC and it exerts effects on cells such as proliferation and survival (PMID: 20919829).

PLCG2, phospholipase C gamma 2, is an enzyme important in immune-receptor signaling transduction and is a key component of the B-cell receptor signalosome (PMID: 27542411, PMID: 25456276, PMID: 16204312). The upstream signalling components of PLCG2 can promote B cell proliferation and/or survival (PMID: 27542411).

ARID1B, AT-rich interactive domain-containing protein 1B, is a member of the SWI/SNF chromatin remodeling complex and is involved in cell-cycle activation (PMID: 15170388) and plays a role in neurodevelopment (PMID: 25674384).

PPP2R1A, protein phosphatase 2 scaffold subunit Aalpha, contains 15 Huntingtin-Elongation-A subunit-TOR (HEAT) repeats (PMID: 31214504) and is a scaffold subunit of the major serine-threonine phosphatase PP2A, which has roles in cell signaling, proliferation, differentiation, and apoptosis (PMID: 23454242). Additionally, PPP2R1A is required for proper chromosome segregation (PMID: 16580887).

HNF1A, HNF1 homeobox A, is a transcription factor that demonstrates tumor suppressor activity and plays a role in hepatocyte differentiation and glucose transport (PMID: 25233928, PMID: 26855178, PMID: 25076298). HNF1A functions in maintaining the stem cell state and controls the activity of normal stem cells (PMID: 30074477).

MAP2K2 (MEK2), mitogen-activated protein kinase kinase 2, is a serine-threonine kinase, which activates that RAS-RAF-MEK-ERK pathway to regulate, the cell cycle, cell proliferation, and cell differentiation (PMID: 22753777; PMID: 29706623).

B2M, beta-2-microglobulin, forms the light chain of the class I major histocompatibility complex (MHC) (PMID: 3312414) and is required for antigen presentation during the immune response (PMID: 27433843).

CDKN1A, cyclin dependent kinase inhibitor 1A, also known as p21, is both a tumor supressor and oncogene with dual behavior in different cellular processes (PMID: 31311187). CDK1A is activated by TP53 and is involved in many cellular processes such as cell cycle regulation, DNA repair, differentiation, and apoptosis (PMID: 15735718; PMID: 10090408).
DCUN1D1,SCCRO

FGF9, fibroblast growth factor 9, encodes for a member of the fibroblast growth factor family, is expressed in the CNS and is  reported to be a mitogen for glial cells, to promote neuronal survival (PMID: 19267409). Additionally FGF9 plays a role in the cell development processes including proliferation (PMID: 16982695).

ARID5B, AT-rich interaction domain 5B, encodes a member of the ARID DNA-binding protein family, which plays a role in gene transcription by forming a complex with Phf2 to facilitate the demethylation of H3K9me2 (PMID: 21890642, PMID: 11959810, PMID: 21532585).

ARID5B, AT-rich interaction domain 5B, encodes a member of the ARID DNA-binding protein family, which plays a role in gene transcription by forming a complex with PHF2 (PHD Finger Protein 2) to facilitate the demethylation of H3K9me2 (PMID: 21890642, PMID: 11959810, PMID: 21532585).

EGFR (HER1), epidermal growth factor receptor, is a tyrosine kinase receptor oncogene, which activates RAS/RAF/MEK and PI3K/AKT/mTOR pathways. Upon activation cell growth and  proliferation increase, and inhibition leads to proliferation arrest and apoptosis (PMID: 24312144; PMID: 24651011).

MSH2, mutS homolog 2, is a tumor suppressor (PMID: 30562755) that functions as part of the DNA mismatch repair system (PMID: 9024626, PMID: 18157157) and is associated with microsatellite instability (MSI) (PMID: 30121009) and genomic stability (PMID: 31747945).

NTRK1, high affinity nerve growth factor receptor, is a receptor tyrosine kinase involved in maturation and development of the nervous system. Fusions involving NTRK1 produce constitutively active NTRK1 kinase activity have been demonstrated to be oncogenic (PMID: 25054037; PMID: 24162815).

ETV5, ETS variant 5, is a member of the ETS family of transcription factors (PMID: 18781147), and belongs to the PEA3 subfamily (PMID: 21520040). PEA3 family members are central to tumor invasion and angiogenesis through the activation or proteases (PMID: 21520040).

RHEB, Ras homolog, mTORC1 binding, is a member of the Ras superfamily of small GTPase that regulates cell growth through activation of mTORC1 (PMID: 25429186, PMID: 26234902). Increase in RHEB activity results in cells becoming more resistant to apoptotic inducers (PMID: 20048149).

ASXL2, additional sex combs like 2, transcriptional regulator, plays a role in the differentiation of adipocytes and is necessary for hematopoiesis, specifically the self-renewal of stem cells (PMID: 21047783, PMID: 28516957). ASXL2 also acts as a haploinsufficent tumor suppressor (PMID:  28516957)

BCL2L1, BCL2 like 1, is a member of the Bcl2 family of programmed cell death regulators that are involved in the regulation of the mitochondrial pathways and inhibits apoptosis (PMID: 8358789; PMID: 22009326).

ATRX, transcriptional regulator ATRX, is in the SWI/SNF family of chromatin remodeling proteins and plays a role in DNA repair and telomere length (PMID: 22391447). Additionally, ATRX has the ability to remodel chromatin and displays ATP-dependent translocase activity (PMID:  18227278).

AURKA, Aurora kinase A, is part of the aurora serine-threonine kinase family and is essential for centrosome maturation, mitotic entry, spindle assembly, and anaphase microtubule function in mitosis (PMID: 22864622; PMID: 26246606). AURKA has also been implicated in a number of oncogenic signaling pathways as well (PMID: 28218735)

PIK3R1, phosphoinositide-3-kinase regulatory subunit 1, is the alpha subunit of PI3K that stabilizes and inhibits the catalytic subunit (PIK3CA) until ligand stimulation activates PI3K (PMID: 26807692) for subsequent AKT and mTOR signaling to promote cell growth and survival (PMID: 19629070).

U2AF1, U2 small nuclear RNA auxiliary factor 1, is a 35 kDa subunit splicing factor, that functions in 3' splice site recognition to regulate expression of genes involved in hematological and solid tumor development (PMID: 2963698; PMID: 28986033).

ZNF217, zinc finger protein 217, is a member of the Kruppel-like family of transcription factors. ZNF217 is a transcription repressor that regulates the expression of genes involved in cell proliferation, survival, and epithelial mesenchymal transition (PMID: 26431164).

TP53, tumor protein p53, is a tumor suppressor (PMID: 30562755) and oncogene (PMID: 30577483). TP53's primary roles includes cell cycle progression, senescence, DNA repair, cell metabolism and apoptosis and is the most frequently mutated gene in cancer (PMID: 30577483; PMID: 10065147; PMID: 22713868).

KDR (VEGFR2), kinase insert domain receptor, is also known as vascular endothelial growth factor receptor 2 and is an endothelial cell surface receptor tyrosine kinase. KDR is a member of the vascular endothelial growth factor family of proteins that plays a role in angiogenesis and cell proliferation through activation of RAF-MEK-MAP and PI3K-AKT pathways (PMID: 25568876, PMID: 29093528, PMID: 26578684).

BCL6, BCL6 transcription repressor, functions as a transcriptional repressor in germinal center B cells, playing a role in B-lymphocyte development, and is critical for cell survival and proliferation (PMID: 20498019, PMID: 31788471).
C10orf54,VISTA,VSIR

CARD11, caspase recruitment domain family, member 11, is requried for B-cell and T-cell receptor mediated activation of the IκB kinase complex. Activation of IκB kinase complex allows NF-κB to accumulate in the nucleus to regulate target genes PMID: 23149938; PMID: 18323416).

CASP8 (caspase 8) is the initial protease in the death receptor induced apoptosis pathway, where procaspase-8 is recruited to death-inducing signaling complex (DISC) to initiate a cascade of caspases (PMID: 22683265). CASP8 mutations may promote carcinogenesis due to loss of the proapoptotic function of CASP8 or by activating NF-kb signaling (PMID: 23659359) and depending on the context, CASP8 may promote tumor progression (PMID: 20817393).

CTNNA1, catenin alpha 1, encodes a protein that forms part of the E-cadherin-catenin complex and functions to bind and bundle actin filaments, thereby playing a critical role in E-cadherin-mediated cell-cell adhesion (PMID: 7568023, PMID: 14570569, PMID: 17945508).

FGF2, fibroblast growth factor 2, encodes for a member of the fibroblast growth factors (FGF) family, playing a role in cellular growth and differentiation via activation of signal transduction pathways through binding of FGF receptors (PMID: 16216232). Additionally FGF2 is involved in mitogenesis, survival, stem cell self-renewal and oncogenesis (PMID: 28899582).

GREM1, gremlin 1, DAN family BMP antagonist, regulates limb and kidney development through antagonizing Bone morphogenetic protein (BMP) signaling (PMID: 25592806). Additionally GREM1 is involved in cell proliferation and epithelial-mesenchymal transition (PMID: 23394397; PMID: 23548835).

KDM5C, llysine demethylase 5C, is a histone demethylase, broadly expressed in key areas for cognitive function regulating gene transcription through chromatin remodeling to regulate cell growth and differentiation (PMID: 25016185; PMID: 29670509).

MAP3K1, mitogen-activated protein kinase kinase kinase 1, is a E3 ubiquitin protein ligase and serine/threonine kinase that regulates JNK and ERK signaling. MAP3K1 protein functions in cell migration and cell survival, while the caspase-cleaved C-terminal MAP3K1 fragment acts to promote apoptosis (PMID: 24386504).

MAPK3, mitogen-activated protein kinase 3, is a serine/threonine kinase involved in the MAPK pathway, thus, playing a role in cellular processes including proliferation, survival, migration, differentiation, and transcription (PMID: 22569528).

PIK3R1, phosphoinositide-3-kinase regulatory subunit 1, is the alpha subunit of PI3K that stabilizes and inhibits the catalytic subunit (Pik3ca) until ligand stimulation activates PI3K (PMID: 26807692) for subsequent AKT and mTOR signaling to promote cell growth and survival (PMID: 19629070).
chromosome: 14 from 38065052 to 38510647
(Insert Gene Description)
Neither
TTC6

This gene encodes a spectrin repeat containing protein expressed in skeletal and smooth muscle, and peripheral blood lymphocytes, that localizes to the nuclear membrane. Mutations in this gene have been associated with autosomal recessive spinocerebellar ataxia 8, also referred to as autosomal recessive cerebellar ataxia type 1 or recessive ataxia of Beauce. Alternatively spliced transcript variants encoding different isoforms have been described. [provided by RefSeq, Jul 2008].

Multi-isomeric modular protein which forms a linking network between organelles and the actin cytoskeleton to maintain the subcellular spatial organization. As a component of the LINC (LInker of Nucleoskeleton and Cytoskeleton) complex involved in the connection between the nuclear lamina and the cytoskeleton. The nucleocytoplasmic interactions established by the LINC complex play an important role in the transmission of mechanical forces across the nuclear envelope and in nuclear movement and positioning. May be involved in nucleus-centrosome attachment and nuclear migration in neural progenitors implicating LINC complex association with SUN1/2 and probably association with cytoplasmic dynein-dynactin motor complexes; SYNE1 and SYNE2 may act redundantly. Required for centrosome migration to the apical cell surface during early ciliogenesis. May be involved in nuclear remodeling during sperm head formation in spermatogenenis; a probable SUN3:SYNE1/KASH1 LINC complex may tether spermatid nuclei to posterior cytoskeletal structures such as the manchette
(Insert Gene Description)
Neither
SYNE1

MYCN, MYCN proto-oncogene, bHLH transcription factor, is a transcription factor that is closely related to MYC, however is only found during early developmental stages (PMID: 24086065) MYCN plays a role in cell cycle progression, apoptosis, and cellular transformation (PMID: 25038584).

STK11, serine/threonine kinase 11, is a tumor suppressor (PMID: 30562755) involved in cell metabolism, growth, polarity, and tumor suppression through the regulation of AMPK family members (PMID: 26398719).

CDH1, cadherin 1, type 1, encodes E-Cadherin and is a tumor suppressor (PMID: 30562755). Cadherin's assist in calcium dependent epithelial cell-cell adhesion (PMID: 31853199), and are involved in cell signaling, differentiation, and polarity (PMID: 18726070, PMID: 26674224).

NRAS, NRAS proto-oncogene, GTPase, is one of the three main isoforms of the RAS family, a family of small GTPases (PMID: 30712867). NRAS, when activated by growth factors, stimulates multiple effector pathways such as RAF and PI3K to promote cell proliferation and survival (PMID: 29524560).

DDR2, discoidin domain-containing receptor 2, is a tyrosine kinase receptor (RTK), but it is unlike other RTKs ue to its ligand being a structural protein rather than a growth factor or cytokine (PMID: 31144616). DDR2 is activated by collagen, promoting cell migration, proliferation, and survival (PMID: 22328973, PMID: 27398168).

MAP2K1 (MEK1), mitogen-activated protein kinase kinase 1, is a serine-threonine kinase, which activates that RAS-RAF-MEK-ERK pathway (PMID: 22753777). MEK1 activating mutants enhance cell proliferation, differentiation, and promote transformation, whereas negative MEK1 mutants can prevent cellular proliferation (PMID: 25351745).

FLT3, FMS-like tyrosine kinase 3, activates AKT, RAS, and ERK pathways to regulate differentiation, proliferation, and survival of hematopoietic progenitor cells (PMID: 29316714, PMID: 28538663).  The ligand of FLT3, Fms-like tyrosine kinase 3 ligand (FL), is an important regulator of hematopoiesis (PMID: 28538663).

DNMT3A, DNA methyltransferase 3 alpha, mediates DNA methylation and functions in modification of gene expression of de novo genomic sequences, and plays a role in hematopoietic differentiation (PMID: 28286768, PMID: 25693834).
(Insert Gene Description)
Neither
STT3A

NKX2-1, NK2 homeobox 1, is a transcription factor that is a tumor supressor or oncogene depending on the cellular context (PMID: 23763999, PMID: 29237428). NKX2-1 is involved in thyroid, lung, and brain development, and a series of peripheral lung cells defined as the terminal respiratory unit (TRU) is under the control of NKX2-1 (PMID: 23763999).

IDH2, isocitrate dehydrogenase (NADP(+)) 2, mitochondrial, is an enzyme that catalyzes the conversion of isocitrate to alpha-ketoglutarate (alpha-KG), and is involved in the tricarboxylic acid cycle (PMID: 28711227, PMID: 28980701). Mutations in IDH2 are associated with aberrant conversion of alpha-KG to 2-HG, which is an oncogenic metabolite, and are recurrent in acute myeloid leukemia and subtypes of glioma (PMID: 27621679, PMID: 19228619, PMID: 23999441).

CCND2, cyclin D2, encodes for the D2-type cyclin protein, which regulates CDK kinases, specifically CDK4, and CDK6, in order to promote the G1-S transition phase of the cell cycle (PMID: 10416984; PMID: 30308939).

CCND3, cyclin D3, encodes for the D3-type cyclin protein, which regulates CDK kinases, specifically CDK4, and CDK6, in order to promote the G1-S transition phase of the cell cycle (PMID: 10416984; PMID: 23079656). Additionally, CCND3 has unique functions in lymphocyte development (PMID: 23079656).

CUX1, cut like homeobox 1, is a transcription factor required for cell motility and plays a role in cell cycle progression, cell proliferation, and DNA repair; with higher CUX1 expression leading to genetic instability (PMID: 22306263; PMID: 28147323). During proliferation CUX1 regulates several genes involved in DNA replication, progression to the S-phase of the cell cycle and spindle assembly through mitosis (PMID: 22306263).

NFE2L2, nuclear factor erythroid 2 like 2, encodes NRF2 and is a member of the Cap 'N' Collar family of transcription factors that functions to regulate antioxidant gene expression in response to stress. (PMID: 25408701, PMID: 24142871) NFE2L2 is regulated by KEAP1 which plays a critical role in oxidative stress response (PMID: 29615460). Additionally, NFE2L2 gain of function mutations are commonly associated with chemoresistance (PMID: 29615460).

BCOR, BCL6 corepressor, functions with B-cell CLL/lymphoma 6 (BCL6) as a transcriptional silencer (PMID: 10898795, PMID: 16943429) and also suppresses MLLT3 (AF9) transcriptional activity (PMID: 12776190). BCOR transciptional silencing is mediated through epigenetic modifications and is involved in the specification of cell differentiation and body structure development (PMID: 31150281, PMID: 16943429).
BCORL1,BCoR-L1

BCORL1, BCL6 corepressor-like 1, is a transcription corepressor and is involved in histone deacetylase activity (PMID: 17379597). BCORL1 is located on the E-cadherin promoter, and represses E-cadherin promoter activity (PMID: 26879601, PMID: 17379597).

CBFB, core-binding factor beta subunit, is a transcription factor of the non DNA-binding regulatory subunit that complexes primarily with RUNX1 to regulate diverse signaling pathways to maintain the homeostasis of a wide range of cell types and tissues including hematopoiesis (PMID: 31061501). Additionally CBFB binds to RUNX2 to regulate osteogenesis (PMID: 28299652).

DHX15, DEAH-box helicase 15, encodes an RNA helicase, which plays a key role in mRNA splicing and ribosome biogenesis, and has been demonstrated to indirectly activate Nf-KB signaling in response to viral RNA and bind to CMTR1 to inhibit methyltransferase activity (PMID: 25692149; PMID: 30079402).

EPHB1, EPH receptor B1, is a receptor tyrosine kinase that is involved in diverse biological processes including adhesion, migration, and survival (PMID: 26790531). Additionally, EPHB1 signalling plays a role in the regulation of synapse formation and maturation, migration of neural progenitors, establishment of tissue patterns, and the development of immune organs (PMID: 28194092).

ERCC2, ERCC excision repair 2 TFIIH core complex helicase subunit, is an ATP-dependent 5-3' DNA helicase that plays a role in nucleotide excision repair, RNA transcription, and chromosome segregation (PMID: 20797633). ERCC2 is important in identifying the irrelevant DNA lesions, such as large adducts and thymidine dimmers (PMID: 30123346).

MPL, thrombopoietin receptor, binds the cytokine, thrombopoietin, to induce signaling of JAK2 and TYK2 to activate several signal transduction pathways to control blood cell development (PMID: 16834459, PMID: 28408900). MPL also supports cell proliferation, cell-cell adhesion and megakaryocyte differentiation (PMID: 28408900).

DICER1, endoribonuclease Dicer, is a member of the ribonuclease III family and plays a role in synthesis of micro-RNA's, cell proliferation, and protein translational control (PMID: 26033159; PMID: 29762508). Additionally, DICER plays a role in DNA processing and apoptosis, where upon apoptosis DICER initiates the breakdown of chromosomal DNA (PMID: 29762508; PMID: 18289125).

FGF1, fibroblast growth factor 1, is a member of the heparin-binding growth factor family and plays a role in mitogenesis, muscle regeneration, cell proliferation, survival, growth, and morphogenesis (PMID: 19561198; PMID: 26840910). FGF1 binds and activates the FGFR receptors which leads to stimulation of intracellular signalling  pathways such as PI3K/Akt, and RAS/MAPK cascades (PMID: 26840910).

FGF14, fibroblast growth factor 14, is a fibroblast growth factor that shares sequence structure with other FGFs but does not act through the tyrosine kinase receptors (TRK) (PMID: 26687232). FGF14 plays a role in neural development and an accessory-regulatory protein of the voltage-gated sodium channels, as a scaffold for kinases (PMID: 19621416, PMID: 26687232).

GLI1, GLI family zinc finger 1, is a transcription factor acting in the Sonic Hedgehog signaling pathway of developmental regulation and forms a positive feed-back look which leads to oncogenesis (PMID: 11001584; PMID: 31085420).

IGF1, insulin like growth factor 1, encodes for a growth factor protein involved in mediating growth regulatory processes that occur during embryonic development and adult life typically via the IGF-1 receptor (PMID: 9032050). IGF1 works in in conjunction with insulin to inform cells of adequate nutrient stores to support protein accretion, cell growth and proliferation (PMID: 29743295).

IKBKE, inhibitor of nuclear factor kappa B kinase subunit epsilon, is an I-kappaB family member and a serine/threonine protein kinase that regulates activation of NF-kappaB signaling in response to inflammation and infection (PMID: 15102433, PMID: 26025939, PMID: 31733040). In addition to regulation of inflammatory reactions, IKBKE plays an important role in the activation and proliferation of immune cells, and metabolic diseases (PMID: 31733040).

MAP3K1, mitogen-activated protein kinase kinase kinase 1, is a E3 ubiquitin protein ligase and serine/threonine kinase that regulates JNK and ERK signaling. MAP3K1 protein functions in cell migration and cell survival, while the caspase-cleaved C-terminal MAP3K1 fragment acts to promote apoptosis (PMID: 24386504; PMID: 29765551).

MSH6, mutS homolog 6, binds with Msh2 to form the MutS-alpha complex, which functions in initiation of the DNA mismatch repair system and is associated with microsatellite instability (MSI) (PMID: 23391514; PMID: 30121009). After mismatch binding, MSH6 forms a ternary complex which results in downstream mismatch repair events such as strand discrimination, excision, and resynthesis (PMID: 23391514).

MTOR, mechanistic target of rapamycin, is a serine/threonine protein kinase, which forms two distinct complexes, mTORC1 and mTORC2. mTORC1 plays a pivotal role in regulating protein and nucleotide synthesis whereas mTORC2 regulates cell survival, metabolism, and cytoskeletal organization  (PMID: 24764656; PMID: 22129599).

NUTM1, NUT family member 1 (nuclear protein in testis), is a nuclear protein only expressed in testis. NUTM1 shuttles between the nucleus and cytoplasm and possesses a highly conserved acidic domain (AD1) that is capable of binding and activating the histone acetyltransferase (HAT) p300 (PMID: 32060986).

ERBB4, erb-b2 receptor tyrosine kinase 4, encodes HER4, an ERBB family member that plays a role in cell survival and differentiation (PMID: 12648466). ERBB4 can function not only as a homodimer, but as a heterodimer with another ERBB family member resulting in activation and autophosphorylation triggering signal transduction pathways (PMID: 21811097)

MYC, MYC proto-oncogene, bHLH transcription factor, is a transcription factor that regulates expression of genes involved in cell cycle progression, apoptosis, cellular transformation (PMID: 25038584, PMID: 32071436) and the immune system (PMID: 29514782). MYC contributes to oncogenesis by promoting uncontrolled cell proliferation, growth and genomic instability (PMID: 25038584).

PTPN11, tyrosine-protein phosphatase non-receptor type 11, is a member of the PTP Src homology-2 (SH2) domain-containing phosphatases. PTPN11 induces the MAPK signal transduction pathway to regulate growth factor signaling and has been characterized as both an oncogene and tumor suppressor (PMID: 20337577, PMID: 28074573).

CD44, CD44 molecule (Indian blood group), is a cell surface adhesion molecule ubiquitously expressed that plays a vital role in the regulation of hyaluronic metabolism, activation of lymphocytes, and release of cytokines (PMID: 28326306). Loss of function in CD44 leads to disruption in would healing and keratinocyte proliferation (PMID: 9887098).

MCL1, MCL1 apoptosis regulator, BCL2 family member, is expressed in particular stages of cell differentiation in response to specific signals and functions in inhibition of apoptosis to promote cell survival (PMID: 29061914; PMID: 10766760). Additionally, MCL1 maintains cell viability but not proliferation (PMID: 11960321).

STAT3, signal transducer and activator of transcription 3, is a transcription factor and component of the interleukin-6 (IL-6) acute phase response factor (APRF) complex (PMID: 26478441; 27185365). STAT3 is an important transcriptional regulator and has important roles in cellular respiration, metabolism, autophagy and cancer (PMID: 27185365).

ETV1, ETS variant transcription factor 1, encodes a member of the ETS family of transcription factors, which plays a role in multiple cellular processes including cell growth, migration, differentiation, and angiogenesis (PMID: 21298110, PMID: 30629294).

FOXP1, forkhead box P1, is a member of the Fox family of transcription factors that functions as a transcriptional repressor, regulating genes involved in several cellular processes, including B-cell development, cell proliferation, migration, immune response and differentiation (PMID: 17614763, PMID: 26654944; PMID: 16819554).

KMT2C, lysine methyltransferase 2C, is a H3K4 histone methyltransferase that is involved in transcriptional coactivation and functions in chromatin modification and epigenetic gene regulation (PMID: 31128216; PMID: 31337554; PMID: 31128216).

LATS2, serine/threonine-protein kinase LATS2, is a negative regulator of YAP1 in the Hippo signaling pathway, which plays a role in organ size control and tumor suppression by restricting proliferation, promoting apoptosis, maintenance of mitotic fidelity and genomic stability (PMID: 24026096; PMID: 15343267).

LRP1B, LDL receptor related protein 1B, is a  tumor repressor and a cell surface receptor that may negatively regulate urokinase plasminogen activator receptor regeneration and cell migration (PMID: 20095042; PMID: 11384978; PMID: 12194987).

PIK3C2G, phosphatidylinositol-4-phosphate 3-kinase catalytic subunit type 2 gamma, is a class II PI3K that plays a role in metabolism and regulation of insulin-dependent signaling (PMID: 30691999, PMID: 30884740).
PIK3CB, phosphatidylinositol 4,5-bisphosphate 3-kinase catalytic subunit beta isoform, activates AKT/mTOR signaling to promote cell proliferation (PMID: 23411347).

ERG, ETS transcription factor ERG, is a potent oncogene encodes for a transcription factor that is a member of the ETS family (PMID: 18500345).  ERG plays a role in developmental processes, apoptosis, cell proliferation, angiogenesis and differentiation in endothelial and hematopoietic cells (PMID: 22279422; PMID: 18500345).

GNAS, GNAS complex locus, is a GTPase that is activated upon ligand binding of a G-protein coupled receptor, and is involved in mediating hormone response (PMID: 23640210, PMID: 25851935). Hotspot mutations impair GNAS GTPase activity, resulting in constitutive pathway activation (PMID: 23640210).
H3C8, H3 clustered histone 8, encodes a member of the histone H3 family that plays a role in DNA repair and replication, and differentiation (PMID: 25003966).
H3C12, H3 clustered histone 12, encodes a member of the canonical histone 3 family that plays a role in DNA replication, repair and cell differentiation (PMID: 21263457; PMID: 25003966).

KMT2D, histone-lysine N-methyltransferase 2D, is a histone methyltransferase which methylates H3K4me and is involved in transcriptional activation, mostly during development, cell differentiation and metabolism (PMID: 28669924, PMID: 24240169).

MDC1, mediator of DNA damage checkpoint 1, is an adaptor protein that regulates the assembly of DNA damage foci and required for recruitment of BRCA1 and 53BP1 in response to DNA damage, and during mitosis (PMID: 21326949; PMID: 30898438).

NFKBIA, NFKB inhibitor alpha, encodes IKappa B alpha, a member of the nuclear factor kappa B inhibitor family, which is responsible for inactivation of NF-kappa B via inhibition of nuclear localization signals and EGFR pathways (PMID: 24578542; PMID: 21175304).

HRAS, HRas proto-oncogene, GTPase, is a member of the small GTPase family that upon activation by growth factors stimulates multiple downstream pathways such as RAF and PI3K. Activation of the pathways is essential for control of cell proliferation, differentiation, and survival (PMID: 21779504).

SRC, SRC proto-oncogene, non-receptor tyrosine kinase, is a member of the Src family kinases (SFKs). SRC plays a role in a variety of cellular processes including proliferation, differentiation, survival, motility, and angiogenesis (PMID: 19581523; PMID: 24788409).

GNA11, G protein subunit alpha 11, is a guanine nucleotide-binding protein (G protein) subunit, which is activated following ligand binding to G-protein coupled receptors and functions in cell signaling (PMID: 27148356). GNA11 hotspot mutations impair intrinsic GNA11 GTPase activity, resulting in constitutive pathway activation (PMID: 23640210, PMID: 27148356, PMID: 29209985).

CDK6, cyclin-dependent kinase 6, is regulated by cyclin D to moderate the cell-cycle transition from G1 to S phase (PMID: 26658964) through phosphorylation of RB1 and subsequent activation of E2F transcription factors (PMID: 26315616). Additionally, CDK6 plays a key role in mammalian cell proliferation (PMID: 26658964).

PPARG, peroxisome proliferator-activated receptor gamma, is a transcription factor and member of the proliferator-activated receptor family of nuclear receptors. PPARG regulates glucose homeostasis and differentiation in several tissues, primarily adipocytes (PMID: 9209705, PMID: 30651555).

CREBBP, CREB-binding protein, is an acetyltransferasethat plays a key role in transcription regulation for a number of different genes involved in a variety of cellular processes including proliferation, differentiation, transcriptional regulations, apoptosis, and DNA repair (PMID: 30181244; PMID: 27380996; PMID: 20435671).

RAC1, ras-related C3 botulinum toxin substrate 1 (rho family, small GTP binding protein Rac1), is a member of the Rho-family small GTPases that involves in diverse cellular activities through regulating actin dynamics for normal development (PMID: 14744429). RAC1 has critical functions in phagocytosis, mesenchymal-like migration, neuronal polarization, axonal growth, adhesion, and differentiation of multiple cell types (PMID: 28886345).

GATA2, GATA binding protein 2, is a zinc-finger transcription factor that predominantly expressed within adult and developing hematopoietic stem cells (HSCs), myeloid progenitors and mast cells. GATA2 plays a central role in regulating the proliferation and survival of hematopoietic stem cells (PMID: 22192845; PMID: 29156497).

PALB2, partner and localizer of BRCA2, functions in a network of proteins encoded by tumor supressors such as RAP80, ABRAXAS, and BRCA1. PALB2 recruits BRCA2 and RAD51 to repair DNA through homologous recombination (PMID: 24998779, PMID: 30638972).

PDK1, pyruvate dehydrogenase kinase 1, plays a role in metabolism regulation through phosphorylation of pyruvate dehydrogenase, resulting in inhibition of the pyruvate dehydrogenase complex, which functions in conversion of pyruvate to acetyl-CoA (PMID: 18541534, PMID: 24904893, PMID: 25868605).
PDPK1, 3-phosphoinositide dependent protein kinase 1, encodes for a serine/threonine kinase that is responsible for phosphorylating the activation domain of the AGC protein kinases (PMID: 24039447).

IDH2, isocitrate dehydrogenase (NADP(+)) 2, mitochondrial, is an enzyme that catalyzes the conversion of isocitrate to alpha-ketoglutarate (alpha-KG), and is involved in the tricarboxylic acid cycle (PMID: 28711227, PMID: 28980701). IDH2 produces the reduced form of nicotinamide adenine dinucleotide phosphate (NADPH) which may help protect the cell from reactive oxygen species (ROS) and DNA damage (PMID: 28980701).

CEBPA, CCAAT enhancer binding protein alpha, is a transcription factor that regulates the expression of genes and myleopoiesis involved in cell differentiation and proliferation of myeloid progenitors  (PMID: 26601784). Additionally CEBPA inhibits cell proliferation by activating transcription of p21/WAF1, by stabilizing p21 and inhibiting CDK2 and CDK4 (PMID: 15674366).

CEBPA, CCAAT enhancer binding protein alpha, is a transcription factor that regulates the expression of genes and myleopoiesis through cell differentiation and proliferation of myeloid progenitors  (PMID: 26601784). Additionally CEBPA inhibits cell proliferation by activating transcription of p21/WAF1, by stabilizing p21 and inhibiting CDK2 and CDK4 (PMID: 15674366).

CHEK1, checkpoint kinase 1, is a serine/threonine kinase activated in response to DNA damage that is responsible for mediating checkpoint signaling from ATM and ATR (PMID: 23613359; PMID: 12781359). Unlike CHEK2, CHEK1 recognizes a wide range of DNA abnormalities from DNA replication inhibition, UV light, virus infection and double strand break end resection (PMID: 23613359).

CXCR4 (Cd184) chemokine (C-X-C motif) receptor 4, acts as a receptor for both cytokines and ubiquitin, regulating cellular calcium levels and signaling pathways which include PI3K, RAS, and MAPK (PMID: 20228059, PMID: 15339043). CXCR4 is a receptor for CXCL12 and CXCL12/CXCR4 signaling is involved in various biological processes, such as immune response, hematopoiesis, cardiogenesis, angiogenesis, and neurogenesis (PMID: 28717168).

ETS1, ETS proto-oncogene 1, transcription factor, encodes for an ETS family transcription factor involved in positive regulation of cytokines and chemokines. Additionally, ETS1 in involved in the promotion of angiogenic and extracellular matrix degradation, and is implicated in tumor invasiveness (PMID: 20378371; PMID: 15574387; PMID: 22366814).

FGF3, fibroblast growth factor 3, is an FGF family member involved in inner ear development, regulation of cell proliferation and induction of mitogenic cell response (PMID: 17601531, PMID: 16263090).

FLT1 (VEGFR1), fms related tyrosine kinase 1, encodes VEGFR1, a receptor tyrosine kinase involved in angiogenesis. FLT1 binds to VEGF-A and regulates endothelial cell proliferation, migration, vascular permeability, secretion and other endothelial functions  (PMID: 23172303).

GATA1, GATA binding protein 1, is both a transcriptional activator and tumor suppressor, and is expressed within hematopoietic cells at multiple levels (PMID: 29400094). GATA1 is essential for erythroid development, and induces megakaryocyte proliferation while delaying maturation (PMID: 29400094; PMID: 9233806).

MRE11, MRE11 homolog, double strand break repair nuclease, functions as part of a complex involved in DNA double strand break repair, plays a role in regulation of telomerase activity and regulates T-cell longevity and tissue inflammation (PMID: 22914783: PMID: 31327667).

DNMT3B, DNA methyltransferase 3 beta, is a de novo DNA methyltransferase involved in establishing methylation state during development (PMID: 24822169). Additionally, DNMT3B plays a key role in the control of sense-antisense gene expression and the splicing of alternative exons (PMID: 30406101).

CHD4, chromodomain helicase DNA binding protein 4, is a subunit of the nucleosome remodeling and histone deacetylase (NuRD) complex, acting as a transcriptional regulator (PMID: 23697937). Additionaly, CHD4 can act outside of the NuRD complex and play roles in other cellular processes as well as promoting DNA double strand break repair and cell cycle progression (PMID: 23697937, PMID: 23954449).

FANCC, Fanconi anemia, complementation group C, is a member of the Fanconi anemia core complex, and acts in signaling events following cellular stress including DNA damage and oxidative stress (PMID: 22675617, PMID: 30213274).
H3C13, H3 clustered histone 13, encodes a member of the histone H3 family that may play a role in nucleosome assembly during DNA replication (PMID: 30165676).

H3-4, H3.4 histone, encodes a member of the histone H3 family that is highly expressed in testis, plays a role in chromatin reorganization during meiosis and/or spermatogenesis, and potentially plays a role in nucleosome assembly in germ cells (PMID: 8986613; PMID: 25003966).
BCL2L2,BCL-W

DAXX, death-domain associated protein 6, is a transcriptional co-regulator that represses activity of transcriptional factors including C/EBPB, c-Met, PAX3, ETS1, p53, AR, and SMAD4 (PMID: 23539629). DAXX interacts with histones and epigenetic modifiers to regulate DNA repair, viral infection, apoptosis and cell signalling in addition to transcription (PMID: 23539629).

DNAJB1, DnaJ heat shock protein family (Hsp40) member B1, encodes a molecular chaperone of the DnaJ/Hsp40 family, which stimulates the ATPase activity of Hsp70 proteins (PMID: 20651708). By stimulating the ATPase activity DNAJB1 is involved in protein folding/unfolding, translation, translocation and degradation (PMID: 16952052, PMID: 20651708).

ETV4, ETS variant transcription factor 4, is an ETS transcription factor that plays a role in cellular proliferation, migration, differentiation, and tissue morphogenesis (PMID: 22425584; PMID: 31670855).

FANCA, Fanconi anemia complementation group A, is a member of the Fanconi anemia (FA) nuclear complex, which plays a role in interstrand crosslink repair and DSB repair through the canonical FA pathway via FANCD2 monoubiquitination (PMID: 11673408, PMID: 12509764; PMID: 30057198).

FANCD2, Fanconi anemia, complementation group D2, is activated by monoubiquitination by the Fanconi anemia core complex, and functions in DNA repair (PMID: 24905007, PMID: 27145721). Ubiquitinated FANCD2 is a platform for the recruitment of additional proteins that coordinate DNA repair.ANCD2, have crucial roles in replication fork protection and cytokinesis.

FGF23, fibroblast growth factor 23, is an endocrine FGF that activates FGFR signaling in conjunction with an alpha-Klotho cofactor (PMID: 25772309). FGF23 and plays a role in regulation of mineral and vitamin D metabolism and participates in inter-organ endocrine signalling axes that are critical for maintaining whole-body homeostasis (PMID: 26567701, PMID: 26483756, PMID: 25772309).

FGFR4 is a receptor tyrosine kinase activated upon binding of the FGF ligand, which activates RAS-MAPK, PI3K-AKT, and STAT pathways.  FGFR4 is involved in lipid metabolism, muscle regeneration, cell proliferation, differentiation, glucose uptake and myogenesis (PMID: 31167419).

FLI1, friend leukemia integration 1 transcription factor, is a member of the Ets transcription family and is involved in embryogenesis and hematopoiesis (PMID: 11175359). Additionally, FLI1 is key to the maturation of the megakaryocyte lineage and differentiation (PMID: 28432223; PMID: 11175359).

FLT1 (VEGFR1), fms related tyrosine kinase 1, encodes VEGFR1, a receptor tyrosine kinase involved in angiogenesis (PMID: 23172303). FLT1 binds to VEGF-A and regulates endothelial cell proliferation, migration, vascular permeability, secretion and other endothelial functions  (PMID: 23172303).

CRLF2, cytokine receptor-like factor 2, acts as a cell membrane receptor for thymic stromal lymphopoietin (TSLP), resulting in downstream activation of the JAK/STAT, Ras/MAPK, and PI3K/Akt/mTOR pathways (PMID: 22685175; PMID: 31318944).

CSF3R, colony stimulating factor 3 receptor, encodes a cytokine receptor regulating proliferation and differentiation of myeloid progenitor cells via its ligand granulocyte-colony-stimulating factor (G-CSF) (PMID: 27789332; PMID: 23896413). CSF3R signals downstream through the JAK and SRC tyrosine kinase pathways (PMID: 23896413).

ERCC3, TFIIH basal transcription factor complex helicase XPB subunit, is an ATP-dependent 5-3 DNA helicase that plays a role in nucleotide excision repair and RNA transcription (PMID: 8157004; PMID: 30894545). Additionally, the ATP-dependent helicase activity of ERCC3 is required for promoter opening and promoter escape (PMID: 8157004).

CD276, CD276 molecule, is also known ad B7-H3 and is a member of the B7 family of immune checkpoint regulators expressed on immune cells with inhibitory roles on T-cells (PMID: 30035102; PMID: 23583036). Additionally, CD276 is linked to the decrease in secretion of cytokines such as IFN-γ and TNF-α which allows for immune escape (PMID: 28695059).

CDK12, cyclin dependent kinase 12, is a key regulator of transcription elongation, regulates the expression of genes involved in DNA repair, and is required for the maintenance of genomic stability and mRNA processing (PMID: 30988284; PMID: 22012619).

EML4, echinoderm microtubule associated protein like 4, plays a role in microtubule formation (PMID: 16890222). EML4 fuses with ALK can upregulate PD-L1 by activating PI3K-AKT and MEK-ERK signaling pathways (PMID: 26019170).

EPCAM, epithelial cell adhesion molecule, is a glycoprotein that mediates cell-cell adhesion, tissue plasticity, and regulates cell proliferation and differentiation (PMID: 23618806; PMID: 30389218). Additionally, EPCAM can rapidly upregulate the proto-oncogene c-MYC and cyclin A/E (PMID: 15195135).
